1.content:
I will get better with women.

That is my goal. I will stop at nothing until I achieve it.

Or so I keep telling myself.

Today, I'm walking down the ever-trendy Seventh Street, which is full of eclectic shops that women just seem to love. I figure I should have plenty of options here.

So I'm going to spot a pretty girl, and I'm going to go up to her and start flirting.

Okay...gather courage...

Ah. Standing at the corner there...She is hot. That is a body there. Probably like 23 or so. She's got long blonde hair, pretty face...nice chest...ass has such a presence...Can't see her legs under those jeans, but I'm guessing those are nice, too.

She could stand to smile. Maybe I'll make her smile...and maybe she'll like me...

I walk up to her and say, not as smoothly as I'd like, "Hi. You are just, uh, stunning..."

She turns to me and scowls. "You came to the wrong girl."

"Um..." Wasn't expecting that...

"I can sense what you're all about. You just want to get laid. You don't want to admit it to anyone, certainly not yourself, but that's all you care about."

"No, no..."

She continues, "You see women as sexual objects. But I'll make you see them in a whole different way." The woman snaps her fingers. "Right now, until I leave this spot, no one can see us. No one can see what I'm going to do to you."

As she talks, she starts growing...

But then I realize, no, I'm shrinking. I stop at her waist, the size of a small child. I look up at her relatively giant form.

Damn, she's tall now...

She bends down to look me in the eye. "No. Not small enough."

I start shrinking again, and this time I don't stop until she looks incredibly huge. Everything looks enormous. I must be about the size of an ant.

She's a bit beyond tall now...

The woman squats over me and explains, "Here's the deal, big guy. Your size may be miniscule, but your voice is almost as strong as it is at full size. Flirt with ten women, but only if you find something attractive about them beyond their body. Just get their attention at least. With each passing woman, you'll regain some of your size. After the last one, you'll be back to normal. And then I think you'll have learned something."

She stands up to her full, towering height.

"So long, tiny."

I watch as she walks away.

From this angle, she really does have a nice--And that's what got me in this in the first, so stop!

And do not panic.

Omigod, I'm really really really small...What do I do?

No panicking! I'm just the size of an ant in a busy part of town! Nothing to be afraid of, no!

And then everything grows dark...Oh, damn, someone's about to step on me!

I dive out of the way, just barely having avoided being squashed by a second giant woman.

But no, neither her nor the witch girl were actually giants. I really am teeny tiny...and my only hope of returning to normal is playing her stupid game. I certainly can't stay like this forev--

AH! More giant shoes! Lots of them! A whole bunch of people are crossing the street toward me!

I instinctively jump up...and find myself looking at people's knees before I go crashing back down to the ground, my fall slower than I would expect.

A few more jumps like that, and I'm along the side of the nearest building, out of harm's way for now.

So it seems I have some modest leaping ability. I can leap ankles in a single bound. I suppose that can't hurt.

Okay, so...Calm...Stay calm...Just focus on finding an attractive woman...preferably one that won't think I'm a bug and try to squish me...

Where to go first?
1.title: The Challenge

choices: Find another cool toy to play with.
Just start following the pretty girl around.
Once again, a person is about to step on you...
11.content:
I'm obviously going into the closest store first...

The gag store. Or toy store. Or whatever. I don't remember what it's called, and the sign is so high up, it's really not worth the effort. And a bunch of really big heads are blocking it anyway...

I slip in right after a middle-aged couple.

They're greeted by a pretty young girl who's obviously working here.

Wait. How old is she? I can never tell how old anyone is anymore...

I'm pretty sure she's like 21 or 22. Yeah, I'm going with that. And she's hot...a petite brunette with a nice body...

No...Remember the crazy magical witch...

I need to find out more about this girl, and it won't exactly be hard to spy on her a bit at this size. How will she even see me when I try to talk to her, though?

There might be magnifying glasses in the store...It's full of all random sorts of stuff. Like that bucket of bouncy rubber balls over there...OOH! That might be fun to jump in like this.

If I gotta be tiny for a while, I might as well have some fun with it.

There's a model train up there! And anyone small enough to ride it would still be a whole lot bigger than me.

What else is here? The pretty girl probably isn't going anywhere anytime soon...I can play around, right?
11.title: Store of mirth

choices: A dog has run into the store, and wants a ball to play with
A customer reaches for a ball
The shop assistant reaches for a ball
111.content:
Sure, I can jump pretty high at my ant-size, but imagine how much higher I could manage if I launched myself from a bouncy ball!

So, leaving the couple to chat with the pretty store girl, I approach the bucket. It's garish, covered in vered in improbably-coloured flowers that gleam with a high-gloss finish. It's some sixty feet to the lip, where the stack of balls is visible, but that's child's play to a man such as I!

Rubbing my hands together, I ready myself. Who knows what the sudden acceleration may be like, but it's sure to be exhilerating! A deep breath, and I'm off..!

Up, up, and away! I reach the height of my arc long before I near the top of the pile of balls, but that's fine; once I land on one, climbing to the top will be a piece of cake!

Ouch! I hit the object, the vast red sphere, but I simply land hard, knocking the wind out of my lungs. I'm scrambling desperately to cling on to the smooth surface and maintain the height I've gained, my mind wondering what the Hell happened all the while. My weight. I'm too light to impact the ball and ricochet myself away. Well,at least I'm too small for anyone to notice my embarrassment...

I hope...
111.title: Orbs

choices: Jump off the ball, but stick with the woman to meet someone else
1112.content:
"How about this?" a mature female voice enquires, and the surface of the rubber ball around me distorts, immense fingers pressing gently into the sides and hefting the great mass heavenward.

I scramble for purchase, but the ball is as smooth as it is round; I roll away, coming to rest head over heels against the knuckle of this woman's forefinger.

It's a hard surface, but there is warmth from it as well, and as I examine the intricate pattern formed on its surface by the skin cells, I breathe easier.

It may not be how I wanted it to happen, but here I am, getting close to a woman! I struggle to sit upright as the hand continues to ascend, and gaze up into the face of my deliverer.

She must be into her forties or fifties at least, with jagged canyons displaying her age quite obviously to one of my diminished stature. I've always feared the ravages of age, and now they are quite literally writ large before me.

Can I compliment someone whose very visage evokes fear and loathing in me? I steady myself against her digit, and prepare the next stage of my journey. Even if she's not to my taste, she may have some friends or relatives nearer my speed...
1112.title: Oh... Balls

1113.content:
Why’d it get dark?

Oh! Shadow! From a hand! Damn, that’s a big hand...

That pretty store worker reaches down and picks up a ball, and thanks to my incredible dumb luck, she snatches the rubber ball I’m barely hanging onto.

She’s still talking to that middle-aged couple. “Kids love these balls,” she tells them, her feminine, girlish voice sounding like it’s filtered through several megaphones. “They’re extra bouncy.”

I see where this is going...dammit...

She holds the ball still for a second, allowing me a quick glance at her face--which truly is gorgeous, I must say, no matter what its size. She wears a pleasant smile, and she’s so very oblivious to my delicate predicament.

Here we go...

She releases the ball--with me on top--and my surface and I plunge hundreds and hundreds and hundreds of feet toward the floor. But the ball falls much faster than me, due my significant lack of mass, so I’m just kind of in my own freefall, which is actually fun. I’m skydiving right in the middle of three people...without a parachute, come to think of it...

The ball strikes the floor with a BAM!

Oh, fiddlesticks.

The ball zooms back up, right toward me, and there’s no time to get out of the--

CRASH!

I black out, and when I come to, I find myself on an article of clothing, but whose?
1113.title: Bouncy fun

11132.content:
I wake up and find thick blonde vines surrounding and entangling me...Blonde vines that are the exact same color of that middle-aged woman’s hair in the toy store.

I had landed on her shoulder, on top of her white shirt, and I can feel that my new surface isn’t stationary. She’s walking somewhere...Don’t know where...Can’t see where through this thick hair...

Nevermind...She’s stopped...

Whoa! My world capsizes, throwing me forward. This giant lady must be leaning over. (Of course, I must remind myself that she is not a giant. I am pitifully teeny tiny. At least I won’t be getting big-headed at any point during this ordeal...)

Anyway, I save myself from falling into oblivion by grabbing hold of her hair and swinging like Tarzan. And it’s actually really fun! I could do this all day. Actually, if I jump from vine to vine--I mean, strand of hair to strand of hair--I can reach the outer layer and figure out just where in the world I am. I have no idea how long I was out. That bouncy ball packed a wallop.

It’s no trouble swinging through this dense forest, and soon I learn that I’m in...
11132.title: Jungle of hair

choices: Stick around to listen to this woman
111321.content:
I haul my way through the woman's hair, and am greeted by the face of God.

Smiling benevolently through his white beard, it's almost as if he's looking straight at me. A moment to think about the situation and I realise that this is not God, but rather the husband of the woman I'm currently climbing on. Lit from beneath by the raging fire of a candle, it's clear that the two are in a restaurant somewhere, titanic cutlery so far below me in their hands.

Well, time to move on. I can leap from here to a passing waiter, and be on my way to find a woman to talk to.

Wait! This is a woman I'm on right now! She may be middle-aged, but the witch did stipulate that I need to find something attractive beyond looks - since those won't be an issue, it should be easy to find something to compliment her on while listening in on conversation with her husband!

Sometimes my genius surprises myself.
111321.title: Out to Lunch

1113211.content:
Yeah, I’m going to be mature about this and find something nice about this mature lady. I’m going to bide my time and listen and do this right...

OH, MY GOD! That young hostess is gorgeous! Thousands of feet tall, sure, but absolutely stunning! She’s handing menus to this couple. Look at that radiant smile. And that fun laugh. And that long black hair. And those perky breasts--Okay, not supposed to look there...

Dammit, she’s turning away! (Cute butt, too! And I need to stop that!)

Forget the middle-aged lady. I’m sure she’s nice and all, but I can not lose that hostess! I have not seen such a living definition of beauty in...I don’t know...at least a week or so! Time to put my insect-like leaping ability to the ultimate test.

I sprint down the length of this lady’s shoulder, and I dive into the air, pointing myself at the back of the departing hostess.

I almost feel like Superman. Except I’m not nearly flying. I hope I reach her before I crash...

I think I can, I think I can, I think I can...

...Can I?
1113211.title: Big beauty

choices: The waitress stows you away for now
11132111.content:
All right. I'm clinging to the back of this gorgeous waitress's uniform black shirt. To get her to notice me, I'll need to be on the other side.

It's no mean feat, clambering across the unsteady wall of cloth while the woman walks about her business, but the thought of the delight in her gorgeous eyes when she first sees me drives me on.

When I can look up and see her face, and look down to see her prodigious bosom (it's of high enough quality to warrant that flowery description) I call out to her. "You're gorgeous."

"Huh?" I imagine her moving her head side to side, looking for the source of my voice. I help her out a little. "Down here, if you'd just lower your eyes, beautiful."

She obliges me, and it only takes a couple of seconds for her to focus properly on my tiny form. Her jaw stops working over the gum in her mouth long enough to allow her to slur: "Well, when you're right you're right, little bug dude. Maybe I should keep you around to tell me more about me later."

I don't quite follow, but I smile up as her perfectly manicured fingers reach up to pry a shapeless mass of pink gum from between her teeth. Only as she lowers it onto me, its surface adhering to me totally, do I realise that she's got me trapped.

"Then again," she says, more brightly with her mouth empty, "perhaps I should just skip out on serving those two smelly old people and just have you praise me over and over."

Great. With only half an eye free of the gum to look over my shoulder at her smirking, beautiful face as she looks me over, I realise that she doesn't seem to have any redeeming qualities. This woman is rotten to the core, and there's no way I'll find something to flatter her with that's going to get me out of this situation. Damn.
11132111.title: Skin Depth

11132112.content:
Noooo...!!!!

I get a nice look at her perfectly shaped butt, and then I’m aware of nothing but the hard floor rapidly approaching. At least I had that nice look...

So this is it. This is how I go. A four-foot fall is what does me in.

Wait, down below...There’s something...the remnant of some food. I have no idea what it is, but it’s my best bet.

Maybe I should have taken a skydiving class somewhere along the way. Would certainly have come in handy now. Thankfully, the smaller they are, the lighter they fall...right?

SPLAT!

Ow. Not a smooth landing, but I made it. I’m in this sticky substance, whatever it is. Ew, it is sticky. Must be some kind of dessert some careless slob dropped on the floor. I owe that careless slob my life.

Now I just need to...Wait a sec. Maybe that thanks is premature. I appear to be..Yep. Yeah, I’m stuck. I’m so small that I’m no match for the sheer stickiness of this pastry, or whatever it is.

Dagnabit. This is gonna be a workout to free myself.

Thoom, Thoom, Thoom...

If I have enough time, that is. Uh-oh.

A giant waitress approaches me, but she doesn’t realize she’s approaching me, not when I’m so small and she’s so huge. She’s not as hot as that hostess, but she’s got a pleasant girl-next-door thing going for her.

THOOM. THOOM. THOOM.

What am I doing? This is no time to be judging a girl’s looks!

THOOM! THOOM! THOOM!

Think fast. I can either try shouting at her, or put all my energy into breaking free. One or the other.

THOOM!
11132112.title: Crash

111321122.content:
I should shout--no, I have to try to free myself. Look at the size of her--I can’t talk to her!

C’mon! Push! Pull! Whatever it takes!

THOOM! THOOM!

I’m too late!

THOOM!

I’m still alive? Nearly deaf, but alive? Her colossal sneaker is right next to me? It’s next to me! Not on me! Whew!

But why has she stopped walking? She’s taking a step back? What?

I gaze straight up the stretch of her long black pants, up her white shirt, and I see her looking down at me. She’s seen me? At this size? That girl must have some terrific eagle eyes.

No, stupid. She’s spotted the crumb I’m stuck to.

She pulls a cloth napkin from her apron and bends down, her fingers pinching around that napkin.

I’ve had my problems with girls, sure, but I’ve never found any of them to be truly frightening. But when one of them is a giant standing thousands of feet tall and is reaching right towards me...yeah...I’m scared. So scared I’m only now realizing I can still yell at her.

“H--”

Too late. White cloth envelopes me and becomes a death trap. Her huge fingers squeeze.

This is what I get for not having the guts to talk to her. This is my end: A girl’s fingers crush me beneath a napkin, all because I couldn’t control myself.

SQUISH!
111321122.title: Thoom

11133.content:
I’ve got a king-sized headache here. Ow. Bouncy balls sure do pack a wallop. Feels like I’m still moving...

Oh. I am moving. Seems I landed on somebody’s belt, wedged in a spot near the buckle. A glance up confirms it’s a woman’s belt. Nice chest there...but it does block her face.

She’s talking to somebody. “The three-day weekend’s been nice, but it’ll also be nice to get back to school.”

Her voice sounds young-ish, but she could be anywhere from 16 to 30, for all I can tell right now. So when she talks about school, does she mean she goes to high school, college, or works as a teacher?

I look to both sides and find enormous cans of food on shelves going all the way down to the floor and up way high. In front of me, I see she’s pushing a shopping cart. Seems the lady is food shopping. (How long did that bouncy ball knock me out?)

A grocery store’s a nice place to meet women, right? I mean, everyone needs to buy food every once in a while, especially on the weekend.

But should I stick with this student-or-teacher girl? Or hop onto a shelf and start the search on my own terms?
11133.title: Belted

111331.content:
Come to think of it, it is really loud in this store. Weekend’s always a busy time to shop, it seems. I fear if I try to talk to any woman here--given my size and this environment--the result would only be confusion.

Or maybe I’m just procrastinating, given how huge and intimidating everyone is.

Yeah, I’ll just hang out here and wait until I’ve got a moment alone with this colossal lady. The more I listen to her talk, it becomes clear she is indeed a teacher, and a rather dedicated one at that. Though she keeps referring to her students as “the girls.” Does that mean she teaches at the all-girls high school?

The temperature plummets. We must be in the refrigerated aisle. Yeah, it’s absolutely freezing. Seems my tiny body doesn’t handle the cold well.

Hey, her purse is right in front of me in the shopping cart. She’s got it placed on that little seat for small children. I’ve already realized what an excellent jumper I am. I can hop from her belt into her purse easily. Should be warmer in there.

Here we go...I push off of the woman and propel myself toward the purse. I initially aim a little high, but correct myself by grabbing hold of a shoulder strap and maneuvering my descent into the bag, albeit face-first, but like there’d be anything hard in--

OW!

******

I wake up, no idea how much later. Seems I bumped my noggin on...a lipstick cap? Oy. I’m lucky as hell nothing crushed me while I was out.

Light’s above me. I leap out and discover I’m in the woman’s...
111331.title: Cold

choices: Find a way out of there.
1113311.content:
I’m in the largest classroom ever. More specifically, I’m standing on the largest desk ever. Although I suppose pretty much everything will seem like the “largest ever” until I get my size back.

So wait, I must’ve been out all night. And yet I’m not hungry. Is this a side-effect of that curse? Don’t know, but it’s one less thing to worry about, especially after two consecutive bouts of unconsciousness. Hope I don’t have brain damage...

Anyway, this is the teacher’s desk. Those huge student desks out there are all empty, but the young teacher is seated here, typing away at her computer. Good Lord, it looks like the sort of giant clunky computer they must have built back in 1970...at least to me.

Damn, I’m puny, and her breasts really are not...They’re quite shapely, and her face is stunningly pretty.

I remember at the grocery store, she was talking so fondly of her work, which is kind of cool for her to do something she loves. So if I just start talking to her...

Thunder interrupts my thoughts.

Or rather, twenty-some pairs of youthful feet pouring through the door and toward their desks, the twenty-some most titanic teenage girls I’ve ever seen.

It’s a mostly good-looking group of girls, but of course they’re too young for me. It’s a shame, really. This situation, shrunk to micro size in an all-girls school, it would’ve been heaven when I was 14...

Wait a minute...Wait...I think I’m having an idea. A couple of bumps on the head, and suddenly I’m having a brilliant idea. Or maybe I only think it’s brilliant because I just had a couple of bumps on the head...

These teenagers will someday grow up into the type of beautiful, confident young women I’m attracted to. These are those women in their formative years. Just think of all I can learn by hanging around them for a day.

I’m not going to spy on them in the locker room or anything like that--nothing perverted, because that would be sick at my age in this place. They’re kids, essentially, which frees me up to learn about the opposite gender in a totally asexual environment.

That teacher really is hot...

Okay, nearly asexual environment. But close enough.

Ooh, look at that giant stapler. Looks like some crazy military super-weapon from this perspective...

I really am distracted by shiny objects, aren’t I? And everything’s a shiny object in this brave new world.

Alright, decision time: Do I spend the day eavesdropping on these young ladies in hopes of better understanding them? (I’d have to make sure I keep my mostly normal-sounding mouth shut. If I’m spotted, I’m dead meat...not a lot of dead meat, of course, but still dead.)

Or should I just find my way out of here ASAP and get to somewhere with more adults? After all, I’ve lost a lot of time already, and I do have something resembling a life I need to get back to eventually.
1113311.title: School's in

11133111.content:
Settling on a plan and carrying it out are two different things. Those informative women-to-be are sitting right before me, yet given the vast gulf dropping away between the edge of the teacher's desk and the nearest student's, I have no idea how I'm going to breach that gap. I could try my superjump, but I'm not sure if a three-feet drop is the best condition to test its horizontal limits, not to mention the danger of being seen as a flying insect and swatted.

Not that the alternative is much better. At the precipice I look down... The climb should be do-able, if risky, and I'd be swapping death by errant hand for being trampled underfoot. Hardly a delicious alternative.

Still, the rewards of learning what women want will be worth the worry, I reckon, so I get to it!
11133111.title: Ant Among the Schoolgirls

choices: Stay long enough to compliment your first woman
Leave before things get too dangerous
11133112.content:
Of course, to cut out now would be to waste all the effort I've already put into getting here. This woman certainly matches the criteria that form each of the ten steps to my weight gain plan, so why shouldn't I compliment her on her care for her pupils before bugging out? My voice should carry far enough for her to hear it, and then I can escape at a much bigger and sturdier size!

Of course, the power of my voice is as much a drawback as it is a boon; the schoolgirls will almost certainly overhear as well, and being in the open here it's far from a sure thing that I'll be able to get away before one of them grabs me. Perhaps I should just jump down to the floor and head doorward while the lesson begins...
11133112.title: Not Yet

111331121.content:
Oh, what the hell, why not? The lesson hasn’t started, and those girls are still chit-chatting away. And oh my, a classroom full of giant chattering teenage girls is getting to be a loud place indeed, and more so by the second. But that could just be my tiny ears.

The teacher’s still focused on her computer work, but probably not for long, so I don’t have much time to think of something clever, which is good, because that’s also less time to dwell on being intimidated by the fact that she makes a thousand-foot-tall giant look short.

Since this is a school, I should keep it sounding innocent and squeaky-clean.

I approach her keyboard as I say, “Hello there! I just wanted to say I think you’re a swell lady!”

Her eyes shift from her computer screen down toward my direction. As they land on me, I grow, all the way up to something like a half-inch tall (I’m guessing, though there’s probably a ruler handy somewhere nearby to confirm...)

But before I get too excited about my relatively towering new height, there is the little matter of her reaction to consider...
111331121.title: "Hello, giant teacher."

1113311212.content:
So apparently there’s some psychological term for when your brain fills in certain gaps or helps you perceive things in a way that’s more palatable to you.

Whatever it is, the teacher’s experiencing it.

“Ew! Bug!” she says as she grabs a bundle of papers to use as a makeshift swatter.

BAM! She slams the papers down onto the desk, but I manage to leap out of the way in time.

Given that this is my first “super-jump” at my new, larger size, I don’t exactly have it down to a science. Though I keep the height sufficiently low, I overshoot the length and speed of the jump.

I touch down at the edge of the desk, but my momentum carries me over the edge. I’m falling! Can I survive this? That floor looks so hard. Probably can’t survive this...

But I do, thanks to giant hands.

“Don’t hurt the bug, Miss Morrison,” says a girl--my new best friend, apparently, as she has both hands gently cupped around me. “It probably doesn’t want to be in here anyway. Can I take it outside?”

“Sure, Brittany,” the teacher says. “You’re right. Just hurry back.”

I don’t see anything but darkness, but I hear the steady thunder of this giant girl’s footsteps as she carries me down the hall and presumably toward an exit.

She could probably hear me if I spoke up, but what’s the point? Odds are, she’s under 18...

But maybe not. There is a slight chance she might “count” in my bizarre challenge. But do I want to jeopardize this free ride I’m getting out of this place?
1113311212.title: Chaos to kindness

choices: "You wouldn't happen to have a big sister, would you?"
11133112121.content:
I figure, hey, I’ve got to talk to nine more girls before this freakish nightmare ends, so I might as well try one who’s already proven she’s kind to tiny creatures.

I’m fully enclosed in her hands, so I’ll have to speak up. “Um, hello there!”

The gentle swaying ceases, and the thunderous footsteps come to a halt, but the hands don’t open. I can only imagine her looking around, searching for the mysterious speaker.

“I’m in your hands!”

Slowly, my “ceiling” spreads apart, revealing a girl’s face -- pretty, blonde, young, gigantic, and shocked. Her mouth drops open, becoming more than wide enough to jump into, were I a lunatic.

She’s definitely seen me all right, and I’m definitely not growing. She’s obviously a nice soul, so this must mean she’s under 18. It’s hard to tell by looking at her, given her enormous size.

A few seconds later, she’s still staring at me, the itty bitty stranger in the palms of her hands.

I hate awkward silence, so I open my big mouth.
11133112121.title: Big shock

choices: Ask her to release me near the school gates
Ask her to release me near the teachers' lounge / staff room
Ask her to let you observe her and her friends' attitudes, as planned
111331121211.content:
"How... how old am I?" Brittany rumbles, taking a step backward. I roll slightly in her hands, and that brings a giggle to her lips. "How about I ask who the heck you are, buddy? I thought you were a bug! You could've been crushed!"

"Yeah, thanks for the save, kid. Would it be too much trouble for asking a little more help..?"

Brittany raises an eyebrow, draws me closer. "Dude. I was going to help you when I thought you were a bug. Of course I'm going to help you. What do you need?"
111331121211.title: Dumb Question

choices: Run away into the long grass
111331121212.content:
She doesn't know how to respond to such a query coming from a half inch-tall man, as she merely blinks at me a few times before speaking.

"You're tiny. Um. How did you get so small?"

Looks like the cares of a half inch-tall man don't amount to much in this world. Every time I try to answer she speaks over be, barraging me with questions. I snap, and shout.

"Brittany, shut up!"

That stuns her even more than my initial revelation, and she drops her hands. I plummet to the ground, my safe landing on springy grass lessening my terror not one bit. On my back now, I look up at the gigantic girl and await her response. She'd be well within her rights to stamp on me now, to crush me underheel like the bug that I am.

Instead, she calmly crouches over me and speaks. "It's just me. I'm all the big sister you'll be getting. Now, i can leave you crawling in the grass if you're a rude little insect, and I wouldn't think of stepping on you, but I can't promise that anyone else will be as kind. Or, you can crawl back onto my hand, you can tell me about yourself and we can be friends."

Her palm returns, flattening the grass to my left beneath it and waiting for my response.
111331121212.title: Upwardly Mobile

1113311212122.content:
What choice do I have? This lawn is really big and probably full of all sorts of monstrous critters. She’s my only hope to getting somewhere safer -- not that there are many safe places at my size.

I climb onto her hand, and I even have the decency to apologize. “I’m sorry about my little outburst there. Being less than inch tall is kind of stressful. Again, I’m sorry.”

Brittany lifts me into the air. It takes me a second to realize she hasn’t even stood up. The elevation feels so...so high. Yet it’s still low to her.

“Yeah,” she says. “I’d be a little freaked out if I were that tiny. You ready to tell me how?”

“Um, it’s weird. I ran into this feminist witch -- not a witch because she’s a feminist. I mean an actual witch. She’s out to teach guys a lesson, so she shrank me to the size of an ant and challenged me to meet ten women who are attractive on the inside. I get a little bigger with each one I meet. Adult women, which is why I asked if you had a big sister. Your teacher was the first. So, nine to go.” Oh, dammit. Nine to go.

She snickers. “You think Miss Morrison’s attractive?” The snicker grows into laughter. “You should ask her out on a date. That’s an image. Miss Morrison and teeny tiny you having a romantic candlelit dinner. Ha! She must look gigantic to you. I guess I look gigantic to you.”

“You’re not small.” I quickly add, “To me. Though I’m sure you are. Small. To normal people.”

“I know what you mean.”

We hear a new voice. “Brittany? What are you doing there? Who are you talking to?”

The speaker is...
1113311212122.title: Chatting with Brittany

choices: Head back to class with Brittany
11133112121221.content:
“Oh!” Brittany stammers, her eyes moving from me to take in the approaching figure. I look myself, seeing between the fingers of the hand holding me the terrifying form of Miss Morrison, the woman that almost crushed me like a bug.

“I was just saying goodbye to that bug, Miss Morrison!”

“Well, you've taken long enough about it. Time to get back to class: it's your turn to read.”

Those powerful fingers begin closing as Brittany forms a fist around me, this time wanting to enclose me fully in one hand as she takes me with her. Thing is, do I want to go with this girl? Miss Morrison is a woman (and what a woman!), and once she hears me speak she'll surely want to help me more than crush me. The innocent investigation of the emotions of youth was a nice idea, but an experienced, single woman can teach me so much more...
11133112121221.title: The Return of Miss Morrison

choices: Settle for being carried in a bag
111331121212211.content:
I allow the cage of flesh to carry me away, the conversation outside muffled by the pulse of this girl and the steady rhythm of her steps, carrying through even here. Warmth and noise aplenty, yet time enough to collect my thoughts.

Brittany is friendly, a solid, dependable fact. Miss Morrison is still an unknown, and being so vulnerable at the moment I shouldn't risk everything for a small shot with a great pair of tits.

Whaddaya know? I'm learning my lesson already, witchy-poos. I'm growing as a person.

A quick check shows that I'm not literally growing, and with a sigh I relax in the loose grip of this gigantic teenager and await release.

The hand opens to deposit me on a table-top, one from the classroom, with Brittany a wall ahead of me, behind me the upturned pages of an immense paperback book. The words are massive, but to read a line would require turning my head quite considerably.

Brittany smiles down at me, but her eyes flick upward again as Miss Morrison announces that it's her turn to read from the book.

She clears her throat, a rumble passing through the cliff-face of her body, and her hands settle their tree-trunk fingers on the pages. A loud, clear voice reads out the beginning of the chapter.

“'My Mistress had a Daughter of nine Years old, a Child of towardly Parts for her Age, very dextrous at her Needle, and skilful in dressing her Baby.'”

Oh, great. It's eerily appropriate reading material. I settle down behind the book, alternately glancing up at my own Glumdalclitch and peering past her arms at her classmates. None are even glancing in my direction, so I'm safe for the rest of the lesson.

Following the recitations, Miss Morrison leads a discussion on the themes raised, and I have to admit that I zone out for that. Great work of literature or not, there's not too much thinking to do with regards to what it's about! Still, I close my eyes and bask in the teacher's voice, imagining her speaking just to me with those delicious syllables...

Brittany's hand lies palm uppermost beside me as the class is dismissed, the book still propped up to shade me. Time to go, it seems. Being carried in hand or bag doesn't seem very appealing though, being cut off from all sensory perception of the outside world. If I'm to be stuck in an outsize world for the immediate future, I want to enjoy what I can of it! Maybe I'll whisper a suggestion to the sweet girl...
111331121212211.title: Swift Learning

1113311212122111.content:
As I climb up Brittany's hand, my half-inch tall form finding purchase in the thick grooves of her fingertips, I whisper to her, hoping none of her class-mates hear:

“Could you put me on your shoulder, please? I'd like to be in the open air, if possible.”

Her face is bemused, but still she raises her hand up high, and I scamper onto the thick cloth covering her, nestling down far away from the thick hair that could easily whip me from my place with an ill-considered head turn. “Thank you.”

She rises from her seat, and I'm surprised how easily I keep my balance. I remember not to look down, and instead turn my gaze upward, but her not-inconsiderable neck blocks a lot of my view. Instead I can scan the other teen giantesses, ambulatory skyscrapers that stride about with a terrifying grace and speed. Beyond them all, Miss Morrison...

No, I shan't look at her again. I'll just sit her on a shoulder, think small thoughts, and hope no one sees me...

We pass through immense corridors, familiar in theory yet alien in reality, so outsize. Monstrous forms pass by so quickly that I can barely register them, and beneath me my platform rises and falls in time with a thunderous tread...

Brittany steps out into sunlight, and the wider world rises some small amount of agoraphobia, I admit. A vast landscape, with distant figures of giants and their vehicles.

The girl's hand comes up toward me again, and I start from my place. But it carries on past, sweeping aside her hair (I knew it was a good idea to keep clear of that safety hazard) to display a cave of an ear. The hand drops again, then rises with a cellphone, clamping it to the ear.

“How's that?” Brittany says brightly. “Now we can talk without me looking crazy!”

“I still have to whisper, though,” I whisper, as amazed as ever that my tiny voice can carry to the behemoth beneath me.

“That's fine! Anyway, I'm gonna walk home now, and once we get there we can decide how we'll go about curing you.”

“Thank you again for doing this. You didn't have to save me.”

“Ha, it's not as if it's a lot of effort to carry you about, bug-boy! Just make sure you hold on tight down there!”

I do. If she's walking home from school, I know that the journey can't be too far, but I still dig myself in for the long haul. The fibres of her top are like cables, and I almost begin crying when I discover how feeble I am now, unable to lift or bend a thread. It's almost enough to make me forget to watch the world around me, and I'm distracted by my own thoughts.

Thoughts about Brittany's quick exit. She is walking home alone, and didn't pause to say goodbye to anyone at the school gates. Does she have no friends?

I open my mouth to ask about that, but then see the oncoming woman. I can glimpse her far enough away that I can see more of her body, loose top and shorts perfect for jogging, sunglasses and headband keeping her dark hair swept back. A light sheen covers what skin I can see, and that only highlights her perfectly shaped musculature...

She approaches even faster than the walkers, and as she grows in my vision I am reminded how pathetic I am now in comparison to these beautiful women. Utterly pathetic...

Brittany's smaller too, as I'm left with a magnificent view of a giant chest as the jogger stops before the girl, who similarly ceases her movement.

“Alone again, Brittany? If you want, I could keep you company?”

“Oh no, that's okay, Miss Dunlow...”

“How many times have I got to tell you that's it's just Mel? I'm not an old woman!”

They know each other! And this Mel seems like a nice, friendly person (with a fantastic rack, although I'm not thinking about it as I watch its movement from every utterance form her mouth ohGodIcan't lookaway...). Maybe I should give her a compliment, see if I grow?

But that may complicate matters, giving my position away this early, before Brittany's even gotten home...
1113311212122111.title: Shoulder Mount

11133112121221111.content:
“Thank for your concern, Miss Dunlow,” I say, standing up on Brittany's shoulder and waving. “It's all too hard to find helpful neighbours these days.”

Those gigantic tits take a step back and rise with the gasp coming from their owner. They shrink as well, as my size doubles, taking me to a mighty inch tall! I'm sure that Mel is going to speak, but then I'm knocked from my feet as Brittany speeds up, moving to a jog this time. She's faster and I've got a lot more mass to care for, so I'm sprawling, clutching for any support I can on her tough outer garment.

“Sorry Miss – Mel! Gotta go!” the girl says as she takes off. Despite the tremendous velocity she's managing, she still finds the breath to add “What was that all about?” once we're out of the woman's earshot.

“I'm sorry,” I reply, finally hooking myself down securely, and looking up to see strands of hair whipping out past me. “I've got to get myself back to normal, and I'll take any help I can get!”

“Yes, I understand that,” she says, slowing after a little while, “but you can't just go blurting this out to anyone! Everything's crazy enough as it is..!”

“I said I'm sorry -”

Brittany turns to look at me, her Rushmore face effortlessly pivoting into view and her eyes glancing down a long nose at my tiny self. “Next time, check with me first.”

“Y- yes,” I manage, embarrassed as much as terrified by the teenage girl.

We enter her house after not too long, Brittany opening the immense front door with her own key, and sparing only a quick “Mom, Dad, I'm home!” before dashing up the stairs to her room. It's another bumpy ride, and she slides her door closed behind her not a moment too soon.

The girl crouches before what I take to be her desk, and I jump to its wooden surface when it sinks level. Leaning against a pencil-pot for balance, I catch my breath.

“Stay here, okay?” she says, looming over me and reaching past for a light switch. “I'll bring some food up when I get the chance, but you've got to stay out of sight! Mom and Dad can't see you, okay?”

She doesn't wait for an answer before striding across to the door and wrenching it open again. Then she's gone, leaving me standing in a spotlight from her desk-lamp, the rest of the cavernous room in darkness.

Staying here is the safe choice. But if she has a mother, and that woman is as kind as the daughter she's raised, that would be another step on my recovery plan. I reckon it shouldn't be too difficult to jump down from the desk, and I can get out into the house proper through that crack under the door. What could possibly go wrong?
11133112121221111.title: Jog On, Baby

choices: No, I have a better idea!
111331121212211111.content:
Brittany sounded rather sure that she didn't want me exploring when she left, and almost offended when I chatted to Mel in the street. I'm lucky to have found someone like her, and shouldn't waste that goodwill going off on a half-baked expedition that will just end up with me being stepped on.

I'll rest for now; it's been a hectic day all told, and there's comfort here, as I compare my size to the various objects scattered across the desk. All these gigantic artifacts, each wondrous in its own way yet beneath the notice of any regular person. I admire the wood graining in a pencil, drag a foot through a patch of dust at the very back of the desk, and practice jumping up toward the lamp light, as if trying to catch the moon.

There are pluses to my condition, but I'll still be happy to look down on all of this again.

It must have been hours that passed before the door opens again, Brittany silhouetted against the landing light. She casually strikes on the main light before walking across to me, opening a fist to reveal a meagre spread of food.

Meagre to her maybe, a feast to little ol' me. There's a biscuit, a bottlecap of water – more a bath to me than a drink! - and some objects that it takes me a while to recognise as scraps of meat, potato, some greenery...

I tuck in as Brittany beams down at me from above, but the texture of the meat fibres is too tough for my miniscule teeth to chew, the liquid clogs my throat in great drops as I try to swallow it...

As she sees this, the girl lifts the biscuit in one hand and crushes it, a mighty show of strength that reduces it to crumbs, raining down before me like boulders. Then the palm slams down to grind them down even further, and soon the dust is small enough for even me to bite and chew.

She brushes her hand off casually, as if it wasn't a great feat to annihilate something bigger than a car. I'm too absorbed in sating my hunger to watch what she's doing, but that hand returns with a cloud clutched.

The cotton wool soaks up the water, and I can comfortably suck from it to quench my thirst. I took a while, but we got there.

“Thank you,” I gasp up at the giant, and she smiles.

“Friday tomorrow,” she says. “I'll take you to school with me – can't have you running around here on your own – and then we'll take you out to meet some ladies on Saturday. Sound like a plan?”

Oh, she's waiting for my answer!
111331121212211111.title: Why Risk It?

1113311212122111111.content:
“Great,” she says. “I'll bet you can't wait to get back to normal.”

Brittany's hand swoops down at me again, and she offers me her thumb, nail up. I'm unsure what she wants, but then she pushes the tip of the nail against my hand, and I lay both my palms upon it.

“So tiny,” she says, inspecting my own digits against the edge of hers, “your fingers are like spider-legs.” For my part, I'm impressed by how solid the nail is, like a concrete block. When she takes it away, I almost fall forward in its wake.

“Better get some sleep,” she announces, standing up to her full height. “It'll be a long day tomorrow.”

“Is that it? Aren't you more interested in my condition? Why did you save me?”

“I don't like seeing little things suffer, that's all. Is that so strange?” She has her back turned now, and is presumably about to prepare herself for bed. Suddenly self-conscious, I look away, taking cover behind a stapler.

“The others can be so cruel. It's nice to save someone from them sometimes...”

“My own personal Glumdalclitch...”

“You could think of it like that, I guess. It's just nice to have someone to talk to, that I can ignore if I wish. Someone that I can just walk away from.”

“You wouldn't -”

“Oh! No, I'd never abandon you! It's just... liberating to have the ability to do so, to have the power in my hands for a change. No pressure, no imposition. Thank you.”

“What is it you'd like to talk about?”

“Well, we really should discuss how we'll help you out a at some point," she says, blowing air from her mouth to gust stray hair from her eyes. "I can't show you to my parents - I get enough trouble from my art."

There are pictures coating her walls, but in the dim light I can't make out much besides the fact that they're hand painted, almost garish.

"Look, it's Thursday tomorrow - you can wait until the weekend, right? You just stay here in my room, and come Saturday we'll head out to find some women for you, get you back to normal."

It's a sound enough plan, and less than a day in my condition has already seen me almost die so many times... "Good night," I agree.

The light goes out, and I'm left all alone, with a giant teenager wrapped up soundly in her city-sized bed across the room. Despite her odd speech, I do feel safe here. What I don't feel is tired. I could still jump down and explore this room – or even the larger area of the house – to get myself a little worn out, and come back to her once I'm more sleepy.
1113311212122111111.title: Course Set

11133112121221111112.content:
Actually dropping off to sleep takes me a while, and once Brittany's snoring commences I am disturbed from it several times. It's a fretful night all in all, wondering how long I'll be in this state, and chased through my dreams by a hundred giant witches, tearing apart the city to find and devour me.

Clearly, Brittany lets me oversleep, as I awaken to daytime to find her already fully dressed, offering her hand to me.

“You were out like a light. I guess you've tired yourself out quite a bit at that size.”

“Well, my appetite has gone down quite a lot recently,” I quip.

"It's breakfast time. Hop on, and you can have some of my crumbs."

Once aboard that mighty appendage, I settle in to the slightly swaying motion as the giant girl takes me downstairs, the blurred, outsize world passing me by swiftly. The light is blocked out suddenly by a looming figure, a male voice speaking.

"Have a good day at school, hon - see you tonight!"

Looking up, I see the man crouch slightly to kiss Brittany's forehead before withdrawing. "Thanks, Dad! Bye!"

The giant strides away, effortlessly opening the front door and walking out into the day. Brittany continues her journey, and I see the vastness of a dinner table before us, bowls and cutlery spread out across it like a city of the future.

Impressive, but my attention is grabbed more by the girl sitting at that table, looming over the building bowls like a looming god. She bears a passing resemblance to Brittany, but is a good few years younger, beaming at her sister.

Brittany sits, and lays her hand on the table long enough for me to jump off and shelter behind her bowl. "Nice of you to join us," an older woman's voice says, and I'm going to go out on a limb and guess that it's the mother. A woman, not a girl. Brittany has a plan, but I could always jump out and talk right now and get some size!
11133112121221111112.title: Breakfast Time

choices: Go through with the plan to talk to Brittany's mother
111331121212211111121.content:
While Brittany warned me against talking with her mother, I can't see any harm in it! Any woman that raised as caring a girl as the one that saved me from falling to my death must be one worthy of admiration! She has done a marvellous job raising her daughter, and should be congratulated for such!

Taking a moment to compose my inch-tall self, I step out from behind the bowl, and take in the solid vista of Brittany's mother, seated at the head of the table like a dominant god.

She shares similar features as Brittany, but enhanced with wrinkles that make her head even more mountainous. Blonde curls frame her face, which is itself set into a frown of concentration as she fusses around spreading a thick layer of butter across her toast with a knife longer than an articulated lorry.

An imposing sight, to be sure, but as I said earlier, she must be a nice woman to have raised such a nice girl! No need to fear her just because I'm the size of a bug on her breakfast table!
111331121212211111121.title: A Family Affair

choices: Brittany and her sister's argument draw her mother's attention
1113311212122111111212.content:
No, no, best to heed Brittany's advice! She knows her mother best! So, with nothing more than a respectful and unnoticed nod in the giantess' direction, I set off back toward my guardian.

My inch-tall form is flattened to the table surface as an immense weight falls upon me, soft and warm but utterly irresistible. For a terrifying moment I fear that I am to be crushed, yet my ragged breathing still echoes in this new cave whose ceiling presses against my front. What's gong on here? I have half a mind to cry out before the walls around me constrict and rush off, dragging me painfully across the table and into space.

I tumble into the void, a brief moment allowing me to see the face of Brittany's sister looking down at me before I land again in the palm of her second hand, whose fingers constrict around me, muffling all vision, all sound, all air! Only now to I spring to life, but the pressure of all that skin, muscle and flesh around me absorbs all the energy of my blows, deadens the strength of my voice!

Brittany will find me, I tell myself, she'll look for me and take me from her sister and I'll be safe again!
1113311212122111111212.title: Snagged

choices: I spend my time just sitting here
Kill the hours about the house
111331121212211111122.content:
No, let's stay the course. I remain where I am, letting the wash of domestic chit-chat pass by around me. My peace is sundered as white liquid splashes down around me, along with a few large boulders of cereal! I must confess to a squeal of surprise, but it's covered totally by the shout of Brittany's mother.

"What are you doing? How could you be so clumsy? Do you think I've got nothing better to do than clean up after you?"

"No, no, it's my fault, I'll clear it!"

I have time to look up just as Brittany's palm sweeps me from the table into her other hand, where I am clasped tight with the milk and cereal, and eat and drink with relish. The cereal is tough to my tiny jaw and teeth, but once it soaks a little in the milk, I can work away at it well enough.

It's far from enjoyable, clenched tight in the fist of a teenage girl, but any sustenance is delicious right now.

Brittany opens her hand back in her room, and I brush the last food from me as I stand. "Thank you," I say, "but there must have been an easier way to go about that."

"Maybe," she admits, placing me on her bedside table. "But I had to improvise! Now, you stay put, and I'll be back this evening."

One air kiss is blown my way, then she sweeps from the room majestically. I've left alone, with hours to kill.

Like I'm going to spend my time just sitting here!
111331121212211111122.title: Left All Alone

1113311212122111111222.content:
Yeah, as much as I'd love to hang out in a teenager's bedroom, with the wall plastered in photos of unrecognisable celebrities and her own morbid drawings and paintings - there's a whole zombie theme going on there - I'd much rather explore. There was no sign of a household pet earlier, so it should be quite safe, and seeing a world from a new perspective is a very exciting opportunity that I hopefully won't have long to enjoy.

Make the best of it while I can.

With my incredible leaping skills, it's a hop to the chair - the size of the ass that sits in this! - and another to the floor. Brittany's about as tidy as I imagine any teenage girl must be, and I navigate my way through discarded shoes like crowded streets. So many pencils and art supplies, as well! One notebook lies open in my path, and while I cross it, I examine the linework.

The subject matter is horrifying, great gushes of red splashed liberally across the scene. It's bigger than a billboard, and quite a sprawling scene, but there's a savage beauty there, even at such a close inspection. Probably best not to think on what psyche devises such images, though.

I'm an inch tall, but not too wide or deep; that gap beneath the door is manageable, and I'm out in the open, at the top of the stairs. Bannisters like skyscrapers above, springy carpet strands thicker than my legs beneath me. Where to begin the tour? Upstairs or down?
1113311212122111111222.title: Outsize Exploration

11133112121221111112222.content:
Imagine the difficulty I would have had climbing down these stairs without the ability to super-jump! I'd've had to climb, or something! Instead, I fairly bounce downwards, rolling and launching in smooth motions. Glorious!

I get my breath back in great gasps. I haven't leaped so much in such a short time before, and my body's still getting used to it. Maybe a little time before I'm open to such exhileration again...

The front door opens. Before me, an immense structure creaks open, pushed forward by an impossible strength. My breath catches again as Brittany's mother stands revealed in the doorway, pausing for a moment before she strides over the threshold.

And in that moment, as I struggle for breath, my eyes struggle to comprehend all that stands before them.

The woman's feet are armoured in high-heel pumps, well-shined enough for me to make out my own reflection. Her powerful legs ascend upwards into a smart skirt, with what looks like the beginning of some blouse and suit jacket, but the angle is too steep for me to see much detail.

Those are killer legs, and I sure hope they don't become literally killer legs any time soon. What I'm saying is, she's not bad shape for a woman that has a teenage daughter. Brittany didn't want me speaking to her mother earlier, but now she's not here to dissuade me. The mother of such a delightful girl must have some characteristics worthy of praise - perhaps I should just speak up and get myself one step further toward full size?
11133112121221111112222.title: Housewife

choices: Maybe jump onto the toe of her pump and call up to her.
111331121212211111122221.content:
Talking to Brittany's mother breaks the rule, but maybe she can help me get something to eat (my stomach has been growling lately) or I can offer her a friendly compliment and get some growth back...but how do I start the conversation? She is setting down her keys, the mail in her hands, her mind is on what to cook for dinner. I need to think of something.

I start with something simple: "Hello."

The shiny black high heel pumps start forward, then they stop. "Whose there?" Her left pump side-steps, a thunderous footstep (to me--but a simple "tap" from her heel to her ears) causing me to retreat to the table where she placed her keys.

I try again: "Hello, I know your daughter Brittany. She has been taking care of me. She is very kind."

I feel a small growth, not much but it helped.

The mother side-steps again, then begins to impatiently tap her pump. "Honey...I'm not in the mood for games--it was a long day at work." Then she begins walking toward the living room, away from the table.

What should I do?
111331121212211111122221.title: Everytime you talk, the shoe moves

choices: Let the woman call the police
Jump up and down in front of her
1113311212122111111222211.content:
I'm not a man to be dissuaded easily - as my original plan to try pick-up lines continuously until I succeeded should prove. I'm three inches tall now, and this towering woman is not as scary as she originally was. I stride purposefully after her as she rumbles into the living room, finding her outdistancing me easily.

My voice will catch her though! And I no longer need to compliment her to get a size increase, I can say whatever I want! Tell her that I'm scared and hungry, and just need a little care from a massive milf!

But as I'm pursuing those shiny, shiny pumps, what pops out of my mouth is:

"Those are very nice shoes you're wearing! Such good taste!"

Those words do succeed in letting me catch up, as Brittany's mother stops in place, uncertainly shifting from foot to foot with bone-crushing power.

"Okay, whoever it is that's in here, I'm going to call the cops! Get out of here right now or there'll be trouble!"

I don't get a good look as so far above me, but it does look like the woman is fishing out her mobile phone to follow through on her threat. Do I let her go through with this? The attention of a group of diligent public servants should be a great boon to my efforts.

Or, since shouting is only getting her more worried, perhaps I should take advantage of her stillness to run ahead of her and jump into her line of sight? She can't ignore what's plain in front of her face!
1113311212122111111222211.title: Maybe The Giantess'll Hear A Shout from Her Feet?

choices: She barely utters the question: "Who are you?"
Her pumps come close to me, then head to the kitchen (she needs a glass of wine)
11133112121221111112222112.content:
Police involved...yeah, I can already see that will have disaster written all over it--Well, officer, you see...a witch shrunk me....as soon as they would hear the word "witch," I would see padded walls in no time---dollhouse size perhaps.


Brittany's mother begins to turn around so she can get the phone on the end table by the couch. I need to act fast because if she starts talking into the receiver, I won't be able to get her attention--moreover, she may even scream and faint if I start talking again (too many crazy voices in her head so to speak)

I take a deep breath and begin to jump up and down. Since I have grown some in height, the living room carpet isn't hiding me from sight--to Brittany's mother, I may look like a jumping bean of some kind.

Sure enough, it works--especially when I start talking and screaming: "Please, ma'am, don't call the police. Look down by the coffee table!"

Brittany's mother puts the portable phone down--she hasn't dialed yet--she is staring directly at me.

What does she do next?
11133112121221111112222112.title: Hey! I'm Jumping Here!

choices: Keep trying to get through to the giantess
111331121212211111122221122.content:
Those massive feet pace closer to me, crushing down errant carpet strands so casually, and I have to fight to keep my eyes focussed on them instead of craning upward to see the face of this woman. What thoughts are running through her head? Is she just going to step on me, or is she just coming here for a closer look?

I fight to stay in place, to ignore the shouting from my head to run from this hundreds-of-feet-tall woman as each of her steps brings her closer to me. She pauses a mere step away, swaying in place, weight shifting from one pump to the other, ankle veins pumping away furiously.

Then she turns, spinning in place and sweeping my off my feet in her backwash as she walks over toward the kitchen again. I pick myself up onto my hands and knees, and from a greater distance can make out more of her form and actions: that looks suspiciously like a wine glass in her hand, the other perusing a shelf...

Oh no. If she gets sloshed now, there's little hope of getting any coherent help from her! I should get over there and press my case, stop her from getting too inebriated!

Or I should just cut my losses. I've violated Brittany's trust with my actions, so maybe I should haul my skimpy ass out of here and head elsewhere.
111331121212211111122221122.title: The Cause Of And Solution To

choices: The glass landed upside down, trapping me
Her high heel pump stepped on the glass, breaking it, causing a mess.
1113311212122111111222211221.content:
I have to try to get this woman's attention. If I strike up a good conversation, with a compliment or two, I may be back to normal in no time. Besides, she may even offer me a glass (or thimble) of wine. But how do I get her attention--if I talk, the threat of the police might return.

Then I notice it--a small pushpin--maybe when Brittany was working on a school project, she unknowingly dropped it. I can poke her mother's ankle with it.

Brittany's mother turns toward where I am standing, she'll start walking soon, I might as well try.

Using my somewhat Javelin skills, I throw the pushpin--success! It hits her ankle, piercing it!

Brittany's mother lets out a low (but loud to me) "Ouch!" And suddenly drops her wine glass!

It spills next to me...worse of all...
1113311212122111111222211221.title: Aw, stop whining over spilled wine

choices: Wait for the woman's decision, whether it be save or crush
Escape from the bleeding, pissed-off woman
11133112121221111112222112212.content:
I dodge back, but that glass bounces as it lands, rolling slightly and a tide of wine flows out across the carpet. A near miss. But then the woman, still stunned perhaps, takes a step forward. Her immense foot descends upon the glass, forcing what little liquid remains out as it is crushed beneath her weight. Shards slash out in all directions, and there can be no escape.

The bigger pieces miss me, but near-invisible flechettes catch my skin, opening it easily. I slump down, screaming. And I look up, seeing a similar crimson flow emerging from the ankle of that giantess. A similar quantity, but where mine flows in streams, hers has beaded in a single drop which slowly rolls down a curved arc of flesh.

She heard me. Brittany's mother must be looking down at me now, and I'm at her mercy. I can't think of any compliment I can gasp out right now ("You know what they say about people that drink alone?"), but maybe I can stagger away while she's reeling from the shock.
11133112121221111112222112212.title: Blood Will Flow

choices: Brittany's mother extends her high heel shoe out.  Climb onto the shoe.
Brittany's mother brings her hand down; she'll bandage the cut & listen to you.
111331121212211111122221122121.content:
Stagger away...no, I have gotten this far in getting Brittany's mother's attention. Even though it's lead to a small cut on her ankle, maybe I can make it up to her by healing it. Besides, at my small height, I can patch up the wound with a small tissue (barely seen by the human eye).

Meanwhile, Brittany's mother begins to stare at me...maybe because she thinks I'm a "bug" attacking her and now it is time to fight. Or maybe she is in shock because I caused a way for her to spill her good glass of wine...let alone...it broke by the shift in her foot.

"Okay, you little...whatever you are...why are you causing me so much trouble!?" Brittany's mother shouts out (the way it looks, it appears as though she's talking to the carpet, when in reality, I'm standing within the strands).

I attempt to speak up, though a compliment is far from my statement: "Listen, I'm sorry about breaking your wine glass, but I was trying to get your attention," I call out to the standing giantess; she returns by adjusting her feet--suddenly she gasps "Ow" (looks like the cut is starting to hurt).

I call up to her: "It looks like there's some glass pieces in your cut on your ankle; please, let me get the fragments out for you; at my height, I can see them" Brittany's mother hears my request...how does she respond to it?
111331121212211111122221122121.title: Be a hero

111331121212211111122222.content:
No, I'll just keep out from underfoot for the time being. One step, two steps, and the giantess enters, the door slamming behind her with incredible force. She pauses then, the sound of keys dropped into a bowl carrying down to me as I, recovered from my exertions, scuttle across the floor away from her.

She can't be looking down, otherwise she'd spot my inch-tall form for sure; for that I can count myself lucky. I'm running flat-out, but once she gets moving again she outpaces me pretty quickly; it's just a pace or two and she's stepping over me, the carpet before me pierced by that heel before the rest of the foot comes crashing down to complete the scariest image of my life to that point.

I stumble and fall, the woman crunching past me toward the kitchen, and I sit. I sit, and I gaze around at the world.

Furniture towering around is pretty much all I can see, this floor far too clean to have any clutter at worms'-eye level. Potted plants are about as exciting as it gets, vegetation bigger than the world's largest tree. I can't really appreciate any of the pictures hanging from walls so far above, and the furniture is similarly oblique. My hopes of enjoying a new perspective at my size is laughable, it turns out. There isn't much for an insect to see.

How long do I spend just gazing, puzzling out the shapes and colours that loom over and above me? I'm unsure, but I know that the calm is only broken by a monstrous roar, accompanied by the plodding footsteps of the woman.

She holds a dragon by her side, a hungry vacuum that desires nothing more than to devour me and all else at my level. It's a methodical approach that she takes, ensuring that no corner of her country carpet goes unscoured, and that gives me time to think. I'm far from trapped; I can always head back to the stairs and leap up if I ever really got into danger!

Thus, calm and collected, I turn my attention to watching the magnificent sight of a woman pushing a titanic machine back and forth. Here's the encounter to enjoy! Not dull, immobile scenery, but an otherwise mundane act seen as an act of God, on a scale impossible for a normal man to see. Humility, awe and excitement, all at once.

She's covered half the room before I think to back off, a leisurely pace afforded by her slow sweep of the area. Methodical. That's a praiseworthy trait, right?

Then comes a ring of the doorbell, and the vacuum ceases its ravenous drone. I duck for cover beneath the overhang of the immense sofa as the woman scurries to the front of the house, smashing through the area where I was standing but moments before. I think better of stepping out after she's passed, just in case.

There's a buzz of conversation after the door is wrenched open, one voice familiar as it apologises for being late. "Oh, I just caught up on a little cleaning, no bother really," Brittany's mother says. "Just be careful to remove your shoes before entering, if you please."

Gee, what a pompous way to phrase that! And it's not as if she removed her own footwear before stepping in! Curiosity betters me, and I peer out just enough to make out the immense trainers deposited in the doorway, socked feet striding into the living room. Oh, so much more hygenic!

"Tea will be fine, thank you," the newcomer continues, and as she plops her several-tonne self into the seat above me - straining the ceiling, it seems to the little man beneath her - I put my finger on who it is.

Mel Dunlow, that jogger that Brittany met on the way home from school yesterday. She gifted me my second growth spurt, the kind soul! Judging from the stench her socks are even now spreading into the under-sofa area, she's been jogging again this morning.

The two converse, and hearing the talk gets me a better picture of Brittany's mother. I can't hear very much, of course; my own voice speaks at normal volume, without deafening me, so I reckon that witch must have dulled my hearing as much as she amplified my vocal chords. So through the sofa those voices are very muffled, even though they come from towering giants.

But anyway, Brittany's mother: very uptight, it seems. Set in her prim and proper ways, and very suspicious of any odd activity that her daughter may be getting up to. Mel almost mentions her encounter with me, but swerves aside at the last moment, no doubt worried over how crazy that might sound. She grows in my estimation, even as I watch her immense heels slide every now and then, gently crushing carpet fibres with casual motion.

I could crawl out from under here to get a better handle on what exactly's being said, although sitting out in the open offers more opportunity of me being spotted, which carries obvious risk. There's little point to sticking around otherwise, as once the mumbled talking is over, it'll be straight back to avoiding a vacuum cleaner. Perhaps I should just head back upstairs, take another peek around?
111331121212211111122222.title: A Guest

1113311212122111111222222.content:
I exit by the side, far from Mel's unpredictable feet. No looking back, as that's just asking for trouble; either I'll be noticed or I won't, where I've set my gaze will make no difference to that.

It's a nice surprise to make it to the foot of the stairs unmolested, and I look up at the mountain. Did I really descend those fearsome steps? Each one is taller than a two-storey house!

A run up, then. A few inches and a leap, and even then I hit solidly against the wall of the first stair, driving the breath from me. I scrabble at the lip, pulling myself up with only a minimum of pain.

And I have to do that several more times, with less of a run up...

I don't know how long that took, and I don't count the bruises, neither. My super-jump has limits, but it's pure triumph that flows through me after having made it back up to the landing. Heh, when Brittany gets home, she'll never know that I ever left her room!

Voices pass into earshot, and I cast an eye downward to see Mel and Brittany's mother walk into view, approaching the front door as the former looks ready to leave. She kneels to put her shoes back on, and I can marvel again at her simple beauty.

It wasn't a good look I got yesterday, but from a higher, more distant vantage point I can take in the whole package. Mel's face is as beautiful as I remember it, and matched to an equally attractive body. Her breasts are modest, but that's only to be expected on such a perfectly athletic frame; all that jogging must be paying off.

The witch said that I should pay more attention to a woman's personality than her appearance, but Mel has both. That easy smile, that casual politeness! Why, when I'm full size again, I should definitely find this area, meet her on a jog, get to talking and maybe something more...

Once she's tied her laces and risen to leave, her every movement a delight, I turn my attention to Brittany's mother. For someone with a teenage daughter, she's not too hard on the eyes. How much of that is down to cosmetics I couldn't say, but with her carefully coiffeured blonde hair and immaculate blue suit dress I'd wager on it being quite a bit. She's all smiles and friendliness to her guest, but as soon as that door is closed her expression sours, and I'm glad I'm not an insect near her ready to be crushed. No good heart, her.

The woman strides away, and not too long after the vacuum cleaner starts up again. Well, time to explore again. Should I try a mystery room, or - since time is of the essence - return to Brittany's bedroom?
1113311212122111111222222.title: Atop the Stairway to Heaven

11133112121221111112222222.content:
One risky encounter is enough for the day - best I not push my luck. Staying safe, that's the ticket. So I squeeze under Brittany's door, back among the familiar clutter.

Her clothes are of no interest - the dried sweat smell clinging to some of it is enough to compel me to keep my distance - so I head on over to examining a selection of artwork. What would otherwise be little doodles are blown up to art gallery billboards, so a greater appreciation is possible for one of my shrunken stature.

There's gruesome subject matter, with zombies featured prominently in the figures depicted. Yet for all their horror, they stand amidst scenes of tranquility, landscapes painted with delicate care, brushstrokes that I myself find fiddly. A casual glance would see only the monster, and not the art around it; these are pictures that reward attention, and careful viewing.

And view them I do, even if it is quite the feat to turn the pages of a sketchbook five times as wide as I am tall. So it takes time. I lose track of it, panicking as the door opens. Is Brittany back already?

But no, the towering frame crossing into the room is her mother, delicately stomping her way around the mess.

"Disgusting," she says. "Why can that girl never tidy up after herself in a lady-like fashion?"

A half-hearted attempt is made to pick up some pieces of clothing, elegantly manicured fingers that could peel a car open pinching up discarded socks and t-shirts.

Then she happens upon the book.

I've already distanced myself by this point, scurrying for the bed rather than remain in the open. The book is held at arm's length, and I can imagine the nose wrinkling in disgust as the words escape: "This is what she spends her time with? I'm going to have to have words with that girl..."

Seems that this discovery has turned the woman's mind away from tidying her daughter's room, and she turns on her heel to leave, the door closing behind her with a neat 'click'.

I wait minutes more, just to be safe, before stepping into the light once more. The landscape has changed, even the few alterations made by that woman rendering the room's floor a whole new world. Getting my bearings back again takes a little more time - how dependant on the whims of the overworld is the life of an inch-tall man!

Leaping up the chair to the desk-top is more exerting even than the stair-climb, and I sit panting, knowing that is my life were a movie, Brittany would walk in at exactly this moment.
11133112121221111112222222.title: Disapproval

111331121212211111122222221.content:
Okay, it's not immediate, but the girl does stride in majestically some few minutes after I sit down, waist upwards above the desk. One motion of her powerful arm casts her school bag across the room, its unthinkable weight crashing down onto her bed. "Miss me?" she grins, sitting on her chair.

She beams down, and I gladly skip into her palm as she offers it, lifting me to her face for a closer view. "My day was very exciting, thank you, and tomorrow you can share in my good fortune! I hope things weren't too boring around here!"

She giggles, perhaps too loudly, and the reply comes from the doorway, in the voice of her mother: "No, things weren't boring around here at all. I found some very interesting items."

Brittany stands bolt upright, myself rolling in her palm as her arm lowers and she faces her mother. I stare up at the gulf between the two giants, realising that with her heels, the older woman only just matches her daughter's height. She's still hundreds of feet taller than myself, of course, but the height disparity may account for some of the vehemence she shows as she waves that sketch-book before Brittany's face.

"Is this what you spend your time doing?" she thunders. "Drawing such obscene images as these! What are you thinking? No lady of quality would come up with such horrors! Are you doing this to embarrass me, is that it?"

Brittany stands strong in the face of such words, but the hand on which I'm standing trembles at the indignity. The angle I've got isn't the best, but I swear I can see the malicious glee in the mother's eye, an expression that I'd just love to wipe off her smug, giant face...
111331121212211111122222221.title: Don't You Dare

choices: Relent to a life in darkness
1113311212122111111222222211.content:
"How dare you speak to your daughter like that?" I fume, pointing and wagging my tiny finger up at the giant woman as if it could have effect. She just blinks, no doubt surprised at this sudden dissenting voice.

"She's your child! Your responsibility! You should support her in what she chooses to do, not judge her!" I'm getting into the swing of this now, but a thrill of fear courses down me as the woman tilts her head, my view of her chin's underside replaced with a massive, gaping mouth as she reels under my tirade.

"You... should be ashamed!" I lamely finish, awaiting punishment.

It doesn't come. Instead, the woman almost instantly turns from me, her own voice shrieking. "Really? You take her side over this?"

A man's voice - Brittany's father, if I recall this morning well enough - replies. "Um, no? Or yes? It'd help if you caught me up with what it is you two are talking about. This isn;t exactly how I best like to be greeted after a hard day at work, you know..."

There is more discussion from the parents as they leave the room - "this isn't over, young lady!" the mother leaves as parting words - and I'm brought back before Brittany's face. There are tears in those big eyes of hers, but teeth show in a smile directed at me.

"That was the bravest thing I've ever seen! She could have killed you just then, you know!"

"It doesn't matter. No way anyone gets to go around saying things like that! And I've got to build up my confidence for talking to the larger ladies..."

Brittany giggles. "Well, I guess that I almost owe you one now! Shame you didn't have anything nice to say about Mom..."

"Yeah, sorry about that... Anyway, what was that news you wanted to tell me?"

"Oh, my friend Scarlett is back in school again, and invited me for a sleepover tomorrow night! It's an excuse to get out of this prison for a night, and after I told her about you, she was thrilled to help! We can both take you out on the weekend to find some women, get you back to normal in no time!"

"Sounds great! Does that mean I'll be tagging along with you to school tomorrow!"

"Yeah, so be prepared for another exciting day in the bag!" Brittany smiles.

The evening passes in quiet conversation, Brittany's father making a brief appearance to offer a plate of food apologetically, explaining that maybe her mother will have calmed down by the next day, and it may be for the best if the girl stay in her room. As I listen from behind a gigantic stuffed platypus, I think over how much more reasonable this parent seems! He comforts his daughter, encourages her upon being shown her artwork, and is all around pretty cool. I tell Brittany as much once he's gone and she reclines next to me on her bed.

"Yeah, I guess one out of two ain't bad. Now, you rest up," she says, plucking me from my perch and placing me back on the desk, "because it's a big day tomorrow. Scarlett can be... a little intense."

I settle down to sleep with my imagination going wild about what sort of person this other teenage girl is, the thoughts enough to distract me from the noises of the giant night world and bring me a restful sleep.
