The little girl spots the narrator
The narrator plays a Cunning Ruse to move attention away from him
1151.content:
"You're setting a fine example for your daughter, ma'am," I shout up, figuring that politeness couldn't hurt any.

As my body doubles in stature - making me what, half an inch now? - I realise the mistake I've made. There was no need to shout, since I have a regular-volumed voice. Now absolutely everyone in the store heard me, and is probably looking around for the source of that disembodied speech.

For one thing, the feet of that eight-year-old have ceased dancing around. It's as if something entirely new has absorbed all of her attention...
1151.title: Parenting Skillz

11511.content:
But then a tremendous converse moves into my view, impacting before you as its twin does so behind. Atop denim legs the staff member I espied earlier addresses the crowd that has gathered.

"I'm sorry about that folks, but there must have been a problem with our PA system! It'll be fixed in no time!"

Incredible how the human mind can rationalise the bizarre. Almost as incredible as the calm, reassuring way in which this woman takes command of the situation. She really is something. In fact, she could be my ticket to growing further than my half-inch - if I compliment her now!

Of course, speaking again in the opne will draw attention, but if I'm prepared I should ebe able to get away before anyone spots me.

The safest option (!) would be to grab onto her denim and let her carry you somewhere more private before speaking, but then who knows how long that may take...
11511.title: A store staff member approaches the scene

choices: “Hi, I’m Mr. Right. I hear you’ve been looking for me?”
“Where have you been all my life?”
“Help me! A crazy lady shrank me!”
12.content:
The bookstore’s right here, so that’ll do. Plus, every time I go in there, I see at least a few hot girls. Of course, those same girls would now appear to be a thousand feet tall...like all these people walking past me.

Fortunately, I’m huddled against the store’s brick wall, so it’s unlikely any of these giants will step on me as they make their way down the sidewalk. So, for the first time, I have a chance to take in just how humongous they all are.

Humongous is an understatement. Look at these people! All of them--women, men, kids, teens, adults, seniors, the occasional dog--I’m nothing compared to a single one of them. But to me, their casual footsteps cause minor tremors. It’s quite a humbling experience.

But it’s temporary, as long as I follow through with this ridiculous game...So into the bookstore I--

--I cannot open that huge door. And it’s such a tight fit to the wall that even I can’t squeeze through.

I can’t open a door. Now that’s humbling.

“I got the door, Mom!” a young girl’s voice booms above me.

I look up and see the largest-ever 10-or-so-year-old girl reach for the door handle. She opens the door, and I have my way inside.

Yeah, I needed a child to open the door for me. And she didn’t even realize she was helping me out, because I’m too small for even her to notice easily. Shoot me now.

I’m going to set a world record for the greatest number of humbling experiences in the shortest amount of time. Why did that witch have to shrink me? Why not shrink a rapist or a wife beater? And leave them at the mercy of their intended victims. Those bastards would deserve it. That would be justice. I’m just a guy who enjoys looking at pretty women.

Speaking of which--that little girl’s mother--quite a nice-looking lady, I must say, even if she is a skyscraper. But she’s a bit above my age range.

Okay, now that I’m inside the bookstore, it’s time to find a pretty young adult lady. I stand against the door and survey the land of giants before me. I see several young women browsing the shelves and tables. They look pleasant enough, but no one’s really standing out...

Oh, wait. She does--a girl in her early 20s, I think. She’s wearing high heels, and her legs stretch up forever and ever. Ohhh, those are nice legs, and they reach up into tight shorts. Above that, a tight shirt, and finally, a gorgeous face with long brown hair. Her butt and breasts stick out, demanding my attention. They’ve got it.

But the witch said I’m supposed to find something attractive aside from her body...But that’s all I know about her so far...

I must talk to her, and since the witch left my voice close to normal, I can. I’ll walk up to her, and I’ll say...
12.title: Entering the bookstore.

choices: "Oh, I like that author as well!"
"Sorry about the line; just turn around, please.  It's important."
121.content:
"Shyeah, right," the woman says, not even looking over her shoulder, continuing her perusal of a particularly interesting book.

Huh. Looks like pick-up lines aren't going to cut it in the high-excitement world of the public bookshop. I'm afraid to go any closer, given how easily a singly mis-step could crush me, so I stand where I am and think on a better opening line.
121.title: How You Doing

choices: Hop into her line of sight.
124.content:
I dodge titanic sneakers as I hop up and down across the carpet, seeking out my first target. Damn, she’s hot, even as she just stands there browsing through a book.

Good thing that book’s interesting. No way could I keep up with those long legs, even with my little hopping ability here...

I stop beside her high heels and look straight up at the giant young lady. She’s just so...impressive. This angle really accentuates the shapeliness of those legs. Oh, those smooth legs...

All I can think is, ‘Wow.’

And all I can think to say is, “Hi. How’s it going?”

She hears something. She turns around and looks from side to side. Seeing no one, her eyes return to the book.

I try again: “So is that a good book?”

She holds her page with her finger. “Okay, who--are...you?”

This time, she takes a step as she turns around--and that step almost lands right on top of me. I’m paralyzed with fright as the underside of a red shoe consumes my entire vision. I breathe a sigh of relief as the flat of the shoe touches down behind me, and the heel grinds into the carpet in front of me. Never have I so appreciated high heels.

But good Lord, I don’t think I could even wrap my arms around that heel. Like I needed a reminder of my stature.

Again, she returns to her book, and lifts her shoe away from me.

Time for another tactic. “I’m down here! On the floor.”

Her confused eyes travel from her page to the floor...but it’s the floor space beyond me. She still doesn’t see me.
124.title: "Hi. How's it going?"

choices: "...I discovered I have the power to shrink things."
1241.content:
I hop back, and I land where her eyes have landed. Her giant eyes become even more gigantic when she spots me. She sets her hands (with book) on her knees as she bends down for a better view.

Then she says the last thing I’d expect: “Oh, no, she’s done it again.”

She quickly drops to her knees, the force of which knocks me onto my back.

“Oh, I’m sorry!” she whispers, extending her finger toward me. “My name’s Kara. Let’s talk in private, before anyone sees.”

Well, I wanted to talk to her...

I climb onto her nail, and she lifts me high into the sky. Now that the initial surprise has worn off, she remembers to be gentle, like she’s handling the most precious china. I’m flattered.

Moments later, she sets me down on a porcelain surface with two enormous craters, which I soon realize are sinks. We’re in the ladies’ room.

“No one else is here,” she says. “Was it a very pretty woman, about my age? Who shrunk you, I mean? Kind of so tall?” she adds, holding her hand flat a little above her own head.

“Yeah, sounds right so far.”

“And let me guess--This is all to teach you some lesson about women? She’s put you through a contest kind of thing?”

“Yes and yes. So I’m not her first victim?”

“Ohhh, no. You see, she and I went to college together last year. We were in this Wicca group, and she--Courtney’s her name--she was really into it. Really into it. I got involved just as a fun spiritual sort of thing, but she somehow gained access to real magic.”

“That part I figured out.”

Kara bends lower toward me, attempting to meet me at eye-level. “Right. Sorry. Anyway, Courtney’s the craziest feminist there ever was. Guys offend her so easily. One day, I learned that she was shrinking guys as some kind of twisted punishment for the great crime of finding her attractive,” she says with a sarcastic edge. “I called her out on it, and she told me everything. And then to make sure I never told another soul, she shrank me.”

“You don’t look shrunk to me,” I say, looking into her pores.

“I got better, but it was an experience. She shrank me in my dorm room. Left me maybe a little bigger than you are now, but still like a tiny insect. But unlike with you, she didn’t leave me with my normal voice. My roommate returned soon and thought I was a bug, and that girl really hated bugs, found them to be the ickiest, nastiest things ever. So she wouldn’t even try to get a decent look at me. She just went in for the kill. I spent several minutes avoiding her attempts to squash me. And her bug spray. I was never so scared. And I had never realized how dirty we left that place.”

“Yeah, you kind of notice new things from this perspective.”

“Tell me about it. My roommate, a sweet girl, was suddenly this huge giant--which made her ass look really, really fat, by the way. It wasn’t usually, but that size was not flattering for her. Do I look fat to you?”

“No, no, no,” I say at once. Like hell I’d say anything else. “I mean, to me you’re big, yeah, but so was a ten-year-old girl I saw right before you. Gives a whole new meaning to ‘girl power.’”

“Yeah, I guess so,” she says with a cute little laugh. “Anyway, after my giant roommate left over an hour later--which seemed to last forever--Courtney returned to grow me back, warning me to keep things to myself. So I did. But...”
1241.title: Not the first victim.

choices: It's someone else, and she sees you.
12412.content:
“...I after that, started learning spells myself, so I could undo some of her damage,” Kara finishes.

Hope swells within me. “So you can grow me back!”

She hesitates. “With my supplies in my apartment, I should be able to. I’m not nearly as powerful as her. I need tools and a spell book to help me channel the magic properly. But I will take you right there, and we’ll set this right.”

What a cool girl. And as I think it, my world becomes just a little smaller--though not nearly small.

“Hey!” she says. “You’re like maybe a half-inch tall now. I can actually just about see your face now.”

“Yeah, the contest thing is that once I find a girl attractive for some reason other than her looks, I get some of my height back.” I don’t know why I said all of that. I just feel comfortable with her, despite the fact that she could squish me with her thumb alone.

“Oh, so I’m attractive, am I?”

“Well, yeah, and you’re clearly a better person than your old friend.”

“That’s not hard to do.”

The door creaks. Someone’s entering...
12412.title: Some growth

124121.content:
“Yes, Kara, I suppose you are the bigger person than me.”

It’s her! The witch. Has she been keeping tabs on me? Figures.

Kara stands up for me. “You have no right to do this to people, Courtney. You could have gotten him killed.”

Courtney says, “Well, that is the fate that befell all the others.” She thinks for a moment. “Yes, I do believe that’s right. No one has ever survived this contest. So many, many men have ended up squished underfoot, sat on, swallowed, thrown into the garbage, suffocated in the dryer, and more, all by the oblivious objects of their desires.” Walking up to Kara, she continues, “But this one is actually a teensy bit different. This time, Kara, I was actually testing you. Shrinking a guy nearby you was a deliberate decision on my part. And I knew he’d try to talk to you sooner or later because, well, could that outfit be any tighter?”

“Why test me?” Kara says, genuinely confused. “Test me for what?”

“To see if you’d break our deal from last year. And you did. You revealed that you knew about my power.”

“Well clearly he’s already keenly aware.”

“I can’t have people causing trouble for me.” Courtney throws a smirk my way. “You want to see a girl fight, little man?”

I kind of do, but I don’t want Kara getting hurt. It’s not worth it. “Don’t you touch her!” I shout.

Courtney bends over to patronize me. “Aww, do you like her, squirt? Don’t worry, though. I don’t need to touch her.”

There’s a burst of light, and the sky is once again above me. But flesh is below me. I’m standing in the palm of Courtney’s hand, outside. She looks down at me like I’m her favorite snack.

But where’s...? Oh.

Oh, my.

Kara’s standing in the street, and she’s...
124121.title: Witch with a capital B

choices: She doesn't fall. (Switch to Kara POV)
1241211.content:
“I made her precisely 100 feet tall, on the dot,” Courtney tells me.

As huge as Courtney looks to me, Kara now is huge to everyone--especially me, but everyone. And everyone screams.

The truly giant Kara stands in the street, scared and confused. One moment, she was in the restroom talking with me, and now she’s living a remake of an old B-movie, but with twice that height.

Some people flee in terror, preferring not to stick around to learn the giant’s intentions. Others can’t help but stare at this unique spectacle. Aside from me and Courtney’s past victims, who has ever seen a giant girl?

I turn to Courtney. “Shrink her back. Right now.”

Courtney smirks. “You know, the others didn’t get to keep their voices. I only let you have yours because I wanted Kara to find you. But now that you’ve served that purpose...” She waves her fingers.

“Hey, hey, no--!”

“And now you have a voice more suitable for your stature. Should I call you Alvin, Simon or Theodore? No point in answering. I wouldn’t be able to make it out anyway.”

“DON’T BE AFRAID!” Kara’s titanic voice calls down to the little people scurrying at her feet. “I DON’T WANT TO HURT ANYONE!” She bends down and attempts to soften her voice, but it’s really too enormous to soften.

Courtney calls up to her, “Having fun, fat ass?”

Somehow, she made herself heard to Kara. Kara rises back to her full height and glances at her figure, becoming self-conscious of the numerous people who have stuck around to stare at her.

“PLEASE...THERE’S A WOMAN WHO MADE ME THIS WAY...I DIDN’T ASK FOR THIS...”

Unconsciously, Kara takes a step forward, and her heel punctures a car parked along the street. She starts to totter...
1241211.title: She's a real giant now

12412111.content:
BOOOOM!

Kara crashes onto her enormous back, and several cars are the sorrier for it. Luckily, a lot of people were prompt about getting the heck away from the giant ASAP, so I think all the cars were empty.

“OWWW...”

But even with her thicker skin, that had to hurt her back, just like falling onto a hard floor full of some kids’ Hotwheels. She’s in pain.

I turn up toward the first “giant” I ever saw--the cause of all this craziness. She’s enjoying the show that clumsy giant Kara is putting on for her.

“Courtney! Don’t you see what you’re doing? Kara told me you’re a feminist. What kind of feminist would want to embarrass and hurt another woman like this, and just because you don’t like her? You’re humiliating her! And think--Her fall could’ve hurt other women you’ve never even met. Good women could die because of what you’ve done here.”

Courtney breaks away from her entertainment to look down at me. She laughs. “I’m sorry, did you say something? All I heard were squeaks.”

Dammit! Almost forgot--I’ve got a tiny person’s tiny voice. I can’t communicate with anyone, not unless I grow back some more.

But assuming the rest of her spell still holds, I do have a way to grow back. And if I’m bigger, maybe I can at least try to reason with Courtney, or find some other help.

Several pedestrians run past us, not wanting to be anywhere nearby the next time Kara takes a tumble. Can’t blame them. But most of these people are of the female variety. Seems many of the guys are willing to risk their safety to stick around for the eye candy. And I would probably be among them, gawking shamelessly, not caring about how it would make Kara feel. And she wouldn’t have been Kara to me. I wouldn’t have given any thought to little matters like her name.

Better stop this train of thought. It’d only make me feel smaller, and I’m done shrinking. Time to take action and grow.

At a half-inch tall, I’m nowhere near as light as I was at ant-size, but I should be able to manage a jump onto one of these ladies, and then...Hell, I don’t know...One thing at a time.

I jump and land on...
12412111.title: Boom!

124121112.content:
I latch onto the upper back of a white t-shirt. No idea whose it is, but that’s some long, dark girlish hair beside me.

So maybe if I can climb up to her ear, I might be able to get this lady’s attention and restore a little bit more of my stature.

Then I hear another woman’s voice: “Hurry up, Nikki! Get in the car!”

And then my “ride” speaks: “God, Mom, will you relax? I’m 13! I have a brain!”

Oh, dear. I’ve hitched a ride on a 13-year-old girl, meaning she’s going to be useless to me. Damn kids...

I manage a quick glance at her mother, a beautiful Hispanic woman, like Hollywood’s version of a mom. But she’s still got to be somewhere around 40, given her kid’s age. Not sure if that will work for me either.

These two reach their car, and this Nikki girl plops herself inside, and her upper back is about to slam against the seat, which means I’m about to slam against the seat.

(Knew this girl would be useless...)

“Hey! Stop! Don’t lean back!” I shout.

Nikki stops. “Mom, did you hear something?”

“We’re going to be stuck in traffic forever,” the mother mutters. “Hear what?”

“I’m not sure...”

Can the kid hear me? Can my tiny voice be heard by children? Is this kid actually going to be useful? I try again: “Don’t be alarmed, but I’m a tiny guy on your back. Yes, yours, Nikki.”

“I definitely heard something that time.“ Nikki turns and asks her mother, “Is there something on my back?”

I look away from Nikki and see the woman’s humongous, stunning and absolutely stunned face. She’s seen me all right. She can’t hear me, but she can see me, a tiny guy clinging to her daughter. Oh, dear. I think I have about two seconds before the lady totally freaks out, meaning I have one second to tell the kid something useful.
124121112.title: Big kid

choices: "Tell your mother we've got to go back!  My friend is in danger!"
"Tell your mother to step on it!  She's trying to catch me!"
1241211122.content:
It's a confusing enough sentence to hear at the best of times, but having those words spoken to you from behind by the voice of Jiminy Cricket must be a whole new level of weird. Even as I wait for the mother's reaction, eyebrows rising almost in slow motion, Nikki's fingers come clawing in from the left, immense digits tipped with well-chewed nails spotted with old polish.

I make a leap as soon as I can see an opening, my hands digging fast into the thick ridges of the skin. The girl must have felt me, as I am instantly whisked to her front, Brown eyes bulging at me from behind wide glasses. "A tiny guy!" is her first, predictable response.

Her mother has seemingly lost interest in whatever bug it was bothering Nikki, saying only: "Buckle up! We've got to get going before that giant comes after us!"

Kara! She's still a giant somewhere out there, and that witch Courtney could be doing anything! As I do my best to stand tall on the fingertip of a thirteen-year old girl, I look up at her and decide how I should approach the rest of this conversation.
1241211122.title: "Yes, I'm here! Pick me up!"

Just tell Nikki that she needs to get me to a phone
Ask Nikki to take me to the authorities
Abandon Nikki, and try to get to her mother
Talk to Nikki about HER problems
12412111222.content:
"You shouldn't have abandoned Kara, Billy."

Is that my conscience talking to me? When did my conscience start talking to me? When did my conscience start talking to me in a sexy voice?

"No, look to your left, dumbass."

Perched on my shoulder is a tiny little woman that is still clearly the witch, Courtney. I grab for her, but find my fingers passing through where she should be standing.

"I'm not really here. This is me, projecting a message to you, you big, stupid man. I'm here to tell you that I gave you yet another chance, and once again you decided - of your own free will - to abandon a woman. So now I get to punish you again."

"What more can you do to me?"

"Glad you asked! You may have noticed the delightful young thing upon whose finger you sit. Her name's Nikki, and she's someone you could have met had you made better choices in the past. Being as generous a soul as I am, I thought I'd give you one more chance - there's magic in the number three, after all.

"So, in addition to elaving you half an inch tall, I've turned back time, to give you another chance! So, welcome to seven, maybe eight years ago. Definitely less than ten, anyway. Think that's enough time to plan ahead and prevent your future stupidity?"

"We're back in time? But Nikki's mother, she said she was driving away from the giant!"

"Did she? No, that was me, just putting on a voice to make you think that. You'd gone back in time the moment before you hit Nikki."

"What? So you sent me back even before I toom your stupid test? That's cheating!"

"I make the rules. And I'll leave you now, toodles..."

She's gone. I look up at Nikki, now my only hope in a world set in the past. Where was I, this far back? How can I possibly get in contact with myself? In leaving me here, Courtney has passed a death sentence!

Nikki repeats her impassioned plea for her mother to look at me, and now I hear the woman speak for the first time, over her shoulder without taking her eyes from the road:

"Now Nikki, you know what we've told you about the things you think you see. Did you remember to take your medication this morning?"

"Yes, Mom! That's how I know that he's REAL!"

Great, not only am I in the possession of a thirteen-year-old girl an indeterminate number of years in the past, but she's also on some medication and people aren;t going to beleive her crazy stories.

That's fine, I can work with this. I just need to find an angle...
12412111222.title: Little Nikki

12412112.content:
(*****Kara’s POV******)

Whoa--! Almost fell, and that would’ve--I’m so big...Could’ve crushed...Like I crushed that car...

Courtney actually turned me into a giant? How messed up is she? And that poor guy (I never even thought to ask his name,) he’s all alone with her now. And he was so tiny and helpless...I don’t think he’s even visible to me anymore...

They’re all so little at my feet...I’m scaring many of them just by standing here. Crushing that car probably didn’t help matters. Do I have to pay for that? All I hear are screams...and some cat-calls, too. Ugh. Where’s Courtney? I heard her voice--she’s here somewhere, but she’d look as small as everyone else, like she’s just a few inches high.

Ew, those guys are staring at me. They can’t take their eyes off me. Sometimes that can be fun, but not like this...I’m a huge freak. Of all the days for me to wear these tight clothes...And I can’t even move without hurting something or someone. This is so awkward. This is worse than when Courtney made me tiny with a giant roommate set on killing me. But she wasn't a real giant. I am.

Sirens. Police cars, several of them, ride down the street toward me. They get out of their cars, and one of them uses a megaphone to speak with me. The rest aim their guns at me. Would that still hurt?

“Ma’am, please remain still,” he says. “You’re making a lot of people nervous...”

“I don’t mean to!” I say, squatting down to reduce the space between us. “Someone did this to me.”

“Is she nearby? Do you know where she is?”

“I’ve looked, but there are so many people here, and everyone’s so little...”

“We may be little to you, but we’re all still human beings, ma’am, so don’t get any ideas.”

“Of course not! No, never! I want this to be over as much as anyone.”

“And, ma’am, whatever you do, do not lean back. There’s a crowd behind you.” To stare at me, I’m sure. The officer turns his attention to my gawkers. “Everyone, please step away from the, uh, giant lady. We need to give her space.” Back to me, he asks, “Ma’am, you said you know who did this to you. Do you know her name?”

If I reveal Courtney to the world, there’s no telling what she’ll do in retaliation. I say...
12412112.title: Feeling awkward

124121121.content:
(******still Kara’s POV******)

“Her name is Courtney Grey,” I say. “She’s a young pretty blonde girl, average height...”

I have to take the risk, draw her out into the open. This needs to be over like now--before I step on anyone. It’s bad enough being a giant, but I couldn’t live with myself if I actually hurt anyone...

Before the police can act on my information, she appears before them, in a puff of overly-theatrical smoke.

“I hear people are looking for me,” she says. I don’t see the tiny guy with her. Maybe I just can’t see him because he’s too small...or he’s stuffed in a pocket or something...I hope he’s okay, poor little guy...

And she laughs again. “Right, so you can kill me and spend the rest of your life larger than a parade balloon.”

A policeman tells her, “Miss, if you don’t correct this situation, there will be legal consequences. However you do it, it’s time to start with the shrinking.”

She mocks them. “Oh, legal consequences, well, in that case, okay, I’ll do some shrinking.”

I don’t like that tone...

Hey...Hey! I am shrinking. I’m on my way back to my normal size...but...oh, no...
124121121.title: She's back

1241211211.content:
Oh, no, no, no! I’m back to normal, but all the cops are getting smaller...except for that female one. But the men...

“You witch!” a shrinking cop curses. “What have you done to us?” He looks up to his now-giant young woman colleague and flinches. She must be starting to feel like I just did a moment ago.

I look around and see that it’s not just the police. All men--and boys, for that matter--are gradually shrinking tinier and tinier. A teenage girl is staring down at her incredibly shrinking boyfriend over there, and a mother sees her sons diminishing away. A woman picks up her dwindling husband before he can flee from her in terror, closer in size to a flea than to her...

Courtney laughs, like some archetypal cartoon villain.

“Courtney! What’s the point of this? Are you crazy?” I shout at her, but she’s having too much fun to care.

The men stop shrinking at...
1241211211.title: The Incredible Shrinking Men

choices: Grab hold of the woman's clothes to stay with her when she leaves
Shout out to the gathered crowd
1242.content:
"Who's saying that?" she says, taking another step, even further from me. "Is there a hidden camera here, what? Why are you bothering me?"

"No, I -" my words come too suddenly, from an unexpected direction, and the woman twirls around, too quickly. She loses her balance.

It would be bad enough were the sole problem to be a skyscraper-sized woman falling near me, but no sooner has she hit the ground, knocking me off my feet and almost deafening me, than almost everyone else in the bookshop has come running over, wondering at why this woman has fallen over (and perhaps why she was shouting out such strange things).

Feet are smashing down everywhere, and raised voices of concern create a hubbub above me. Looking around, it appears that I lie in the shdow of the woman's armpit, blue cloth like a hill. What should I do now? This plan is rapidly going down the drain...
1242.title: Accident

12421.content:
It’s too crazy here for me to do anything, but I’m not letting this titanic beauty out of my sight. So I do what any guy would do in my situation. I grab hold the fabric beneath her arm and wait for her to leave.

I’m not actually right in her armpit. That could get disgusting real fast, no matter how gorgeous the girl is. No, I’m a bit below, just chilling on the side of her shirt like a...well, like a creepy little bug stalker, I guess. Why did this seem like a good idea?

She’s leaving the store. Despite her gargantuan size, the motion isn’t too rough at all. I could say something to her at any time. But then she’d know I was being a creepy little bug stalker. I really need to learn to think these things through...

How about this...I’ll see where she’s going and what she’s doing, and then maybe I can plan out something interesting to talk about. Yeah, that sounds good. I’ll just continue hanging out here, in the not-armpit area. This fabric is really comfortable...

She soon arrives...
12421.title: Hitching a ride

124212.content:
She walks into a colorful place with windows for walls. Once my eyes adjust for my strange perspective, I realize she’s taken me (unwittingly) into that greenhouse flower shop on the corner.

Oh, dammit. Dammit, dammit, dammit...A greenhouse is really not the best place for someone of my current stature, given how plants and soil tend to attract bugs...and there are bugs that are bigger than me right now.

No reason to panic just yet. I’m still hanging onto the hottie’s shirt here. I doubt she’s going to stay here forever, so...

Uh-oh. Her enormous hand--particularly a giant fingernail--is coming right at me. Am I causing an itch? I couldn’t possibly be causing an itch. I’m not touching any skin. But she’s having an itch right nearby me...

The fingernail might as well be an enormous razor that could chop me in half. I’ve only got time for one thing: Jump!

I kick off of her body and soar through the air (which is really, really exhilarating, incidentally, but not worth being this tiny in a greenhouse).

Now the question is: Where the hell am I going to land?

I soar toward something high and green--must be a leaf of some kind. I hit it, and roll downward onto another huge leaf before dropping onto another, and...yeah...this part is less fun.

“Oof!” I crash into soil, very rich and textured soil. I don’t know if it’s the softness of the ground or my lack of weight or the leaves breaking my fall, but I’m uninjured after what felt like a massive fall.

I take in my new surroundings. I’m in a jungle, or it might as well be. Soil stretches in every direction as far as I can see, and there are so many plants and even grass blades that they’re blocking my view.

I look up and see the back of that giant girl’s head traveling away from me. Another second, and she’s out of sight. Dammit. She was really hot, too...

But in reality, she’s not too far away, and we’re still in the same room, believe it or not.

Did she really have to scratch that itch right at that moment? Does she realize what an inconvenience that was for me? Doubtful, but it’s still frustrating.

Now how do I get out of this jungle? And what do I do if a bug finds me before I find an exit?

I can still jump high, so I could try that, but there’s no telling where I’d land that time, or what I’d land on. With my luck, I’d jump right into a Venus Fly Trap.

I could also just start walking in the direction I saw that girl walking.

Either way is fraught with peril. If this experience doesn’t make a man out of me, I don’t know what will...
124212.title: The Greenhouse

choices: Stay still and hope it leaves.
1242121.content:
I’m gonna play it safe and walk for now. I figure I’ve eventually got to run out of soil, and then I’ll have a better view of this greenhouse.

Feels like I’m on a whole other world. I look up through the gaps in the leaves and see another woman walking by, and it looks like her head is up in outer space where the sun or moon should be.

I approach the base of a green stem belonging to some towering flower. The stem is thicker than I am tall. It’s as if I’m looking at it through a microscope. This would make a great field trip for a biology class. Maybe when that witch gets tired of shrinking guys, she can start a new career as a science teacher.

I continue trudging through the thick soil as a buzzing sound reaches my ears. It’s getting louder. Is that some machine, or...?

I maneuver around a fallen leaf and find myself looking up at...oh, dear...a bumblebee that’s bigger than I am.
1242121.title: Walk through the jungle

12421211.content:
Ah! Giant monster bumblebee! Can it eat me? It can probably eat me. It can definitely kill me. I’m outta here!

I race across the thick soil, almost tripping several times--it’s such uneven terrain for a little guy like me. But on the other hand, I’m so small that even the more dense parts of this jungle have plenty of gaps I can fit through.

I still hear the buzzing sound, so I’m not stopping yet. Did it even notice me? That would be something, if I was beneath the notice of an insect, but I guess I shouldn’t complain...

Anyway: Keep running!

Oh, my...Out of breath...I need to be in better shape. Okay, I need a rest. The buzzing sound is softer, so I’ve at least put some distance between us for now.

I sit down and lean against the stem of a flower. It might as well be an old tree trunk to me. As I rest, I hear a sound, but it’s not the bee this time. That buzzing still is in the background, but no, this is something else.

It’s a woman singing.

I look up, and sure enough, a woman’s pretty face hangs in the sky above my jungle. She’s singing softly, just to herself for her own amusement, sounds like, although at my size, even a soft voice booms like a stadium announcer. The voice is as pretty as the face.

For a moment, something huge and metallic blocks part of my view, and then a leaf crashes onto the ground nearby. I put the pieces together...She must work in this greenhouse, and she’s tending to this very flower bed or whatever it’s called that I’m lost in.

And she’s singing to herself in the sweetest voice, which is marred only by the buzzing of that bee in the distance.

I was beginning to feel so isolated in this jungle, I nearly forgot: I still have a mostly normal voice. I can talk to her. I don't know if she'll be able to see me, but I can talk to her.

I can, right?
12421211.title: Flee the bee

choices: Play a trick on the gardener
124212111.content:
"These flowers must love that you sing to them," I say, "I know that I do."

The gardener naturally looks up rather than down at the sound of my voice, and I revel in the experience of growth as my height shoots up like a weed. Soon I'm much nearer half an inch tall which - while still pathetic - is enough to chance being spotted by a suitably caring woman.

And who better than this gardener? She must know that certain insects need to be encouraged for the good of a plant. I'm, like, a poster boy for that belief! With her to help me, I'll be able to meet other women a lot easier!

Of course, she herself can't help me grow any further. I could just mess with her a little while waiting for the next female to show. Maybe by pretending to be a talking flower, just to weird her out a little..? I could do with a laugh.
124212111.title: Sometimes Flowers Talk Back

12421212.content:
There is absolutely nothing to be afraid of. That monster, all fluff and eyes, is not going to attack me without reason. A bee is only going to sting if provoked, and if I resist the temptation to break out into a encore production of sudden moves, I'll be fine.

I smile, and nod politely to the bee before me. Its expressionless face does not respond, and with a buffet of displaced air it takes to the skies again.

Laughing at the brief moment of panic I suffered, I resume my journey, only to be suddenly beset by a true source of terror. The bee, at most, was five times my mass. The mound of flesh that digs deep furrows into the soil before me could annihilate me with but a glancing blow. Five appendages, fingers...

"You'll never catch a bug," a voice echoes from above, "you're just too slow."

I hope that the owner of this hand doesn't see me and go for another grab...
12421212.title: Busy

12423.content:
There are too many giant feet around me, but that means there are fewer giant feet elsewhere in the store right now, so this is an opportunity I’m not wasting.

While customers and employees alike check on the hot giant young woman who nearly crushed me, I hop like a flea between their legs and across the carpet, trying to get as much distance as I can from the crowd before they disperse.

I’m hopping so quickly, I’m surprised when I hit a hard tiled floor rather than carpet. I look up and see I’m in this bookstore’s café area. Hmm...This might not be so bad. The people here are likely to be more stationary than out there, at least some of them...

But what’s that thunder I hear? It’s causing minor tremors in the floor...

I turn around and find a gigantic barista walking toward an empty table--not directly in my path, thank goodness. She’s a pretty young woman, from the glance I got at her face.

Soon, she’s leaning over that table and wiping it clean, and I can’t help but notice, she’s got a great butt. It’s quite large compared to her thin waist, but I can’t stop looking at it. Why is it that women have so much pressure to be small in some ways, but in others, they’re encouraged to be big (to a certain extent, anyway)?

But I need to remember...There’s more to her than mesmerizing looks. That’s what I need to focus on if I want to get out of this bizarre remake of The Incredible Shrinking Man. Maybe that’s what the crazy witch was getting at...If I ignore her hot body now and focus on the person, maybe I’ll not only get to experience that hot body later on, but I might also get to experience a rewarding relationship with a cool girl.

If she is a cool girl. I don’t know yet...

Two ways I can approach this: Spy on her a bit to learn about what sort of person she is, or I can take a big gamble and reveal myself to see if she has any interest in helping out people smaller than herself. That would be a good way to test her character...
12423.title: Getting out of the way

124232.content:
I clear my throat quietly, then shout up to the barista the first thing to enter my head: "Nice work."

Stupid. Stupid stupid stupid. She swings around to see if she can make out where that mysterious voice came from, but not once does she look down to where I'm standing. My rather generic comment wasn't enough to count as a compliment either, as I stubbornly remain at the same tiny size. Fine. Conversation it is.

"Look down! The floor behind you!"

That catches her gaze. Her gargantuan eyes focus upon me, but from the expression on her face I don't think that she's recognised me as the speaker; far more likely seems that she's seen me as some missed dirt on the floor, pointed out to her by some jerk hiding somewhere. Her brows lower as she drags out a cloth and takes a floor-trembling step toward me.

I can still talk at a volume she can hear. I could talk to her as she approaches, persuade her that there's an ant-sized man amongst the debris of the floor. Or i could just use my super-jumping abilities to get away from her and find someone less caught up in their work.
124232.title: Timid Reveal

1242321.content:
An earthquake almost topples me, but it’s merely the giant barista taking another step in my direction, carrying a giant cloth that could wipe me away to oblivion. I have to convince her I’m not a speck of dirt!

“No, no,” I say, “I’m a man, a tiny man on the floor. If you’ll just look more closely...”

As I speak, she sighs and shakes her head. She says nothing out loud, but her attitude clearly communicates a “How gullible do you think I am?” sort of message.

Another of her steps does topple me. I crash onto my back, which kind of hurts. I need just a moment to gather myself. But in that moment, she’s leaning down, and that cloth is coming my way...

“No, look at me! I’m a man!” I shout.

Can’t see anything but cloth above me...Oh, dammit, no, no, no...! I can’t die this way!

In my panic, I lose it.

“Are you blind, you stupid fat-ass?!?!? I’m a man!”

The cloth stops and moves aside, revealing her huge, shocked face. She sees me, truly sees me now.

With glances to both sides, I learn she’s not the only one. A couple of teenage girls have heard and spotted me, too, and so did a 20-something professional-looking woman and another young barista. And that’s just what I can see.

These girls and women all heard me insult this innocent barista, and they all see how tiny I am compared to them.

Oh, dammit.

Me and my big mouth.
1242321.title: Oops

choices: Shout out that I'm sorry, and beg to be released
Claim to have a bomb, and threaten to blow it if not released
12423211.content:
I jump. Moving as quickly as I can, and being as tiny as I am, there's no way they'll be able to catch me or even notice where I am. I flash past the face of the barista as if bungee-jumping the statue of liberty, and then I'm away and clear, bouncing a few more times to get clear from the second barista, the teens, the professional...

It's rather tiring. I admit to grunting with effort as I hit the floor next time, panting to get my breath back. I may be able to achieve superhuman jumps (for a being of my size), yet it still takes muscle use, and I will admit that I'm not the fittest man on the planet.

Then a hand closes fast around me, snuffing my insect-size body in walls of hot, clammy flesh. How? How did they find me?

Of course - my legs aren't the only thing that are amplified! My voice - my damned big mouth, that got me into this trouble - can carry as far as if I was normal size. And not only when I'm speaking, it would seem. The women heard my exhausted panting! And now one of them has me, but who? I should count myself lucky that I haven't already been crushed, but already I'm thinking of a way to extricate myself from this situation...
12423211.title: Get the hell away, now!

124232111.content:
Her hands are cupped around me, and when I look up, I see only giant breasts. Not the worst fate, mind you, but probably merely the calm before the storm.

I still don’t know who this is, but I figure I can’t go wrong with apologies. “I’m sorry. I’m so, so sorry. Please put me down--”

“Be quiet,” she says, lowering her face into view. It’s the barista! The hot one with the huge ass I just insulted! Oh, God, the girl I insulted has me in the palm of her hand...

She carries me...somewhere. Her hand lowers and deposits me on...let’s see here...a counter? Near as I can tell, I’m in some employees-only area. No one else seems to be around. I’m alone with a giant woman I insulted...

She stands before me. I’m roughly at waist level, and she looks down, down, down on me.

I resume my apologizing. “Again, I am so sorry for what I said. I don’t know what came over me. I--”

She interrupts me. “If I was mad at you, I’d be trying to sit on your lap. No, don’t worry about that. I almost crushed you, for God’s sake. You had every right to be mad.”

Well, that’s...unexpectedly rational. “Thank you,” I say.

She kneels down so I’m looking straight ahead at her face. A pretty face indeed.

“I don’t understand why you are like you are, but I understand it has to be scary. Thinking about it from your point of view, I must have seemed like this huge monster. I don’t know what I’d do if I was the one who was shrunk down to...Wait, you are shrunk, right? This isn’t your normal height?”

“Not even close.”

“It’s weird either way. Anyway, I know if I was tiny, I’d want a big person willing to give me a hand, so that’s what I’ll do. I don’t know how I can help you, but I’ll at least try to keep you safe until we figure something out. Sorry I don’t know how to make tiny guys grow--”

I start growing. I stop at, I don’t know, maybe a half-inch tall or so? I definitely just grew, though, as I realized how lucky I am to have been snatched up by a nice girl like her.

“How did that just happen?” she asks.

“Well, a witch shrank me and said I need to meet ten nice girls. Each one will cause me to grow a little until I’m back to normal.” No need for all the details.

“Oh, that’s so easy! I’ll just introduce you to...”
124232111.title: Sorry!

choices: I ask the woman what books she likes reading
I tell the woman the truth about my situation
I break the ice with a joke
I ask her if she hurt herself falling from heaven
I bow, and allow her to speak first
1242321112.content:
"I'll serve customers, and every time an attractive young lady comes by, I'll give you an introduction. How's that sound?"

"Thank you," I gush, looking up at her name tag. "Thank you, Michelle."

"All part of the service," she says with a wink, holding her palm out level with the counter. I step onto it and allow her to carry me back to the customer-facing area. The bustle and noise of the giant world washes back across me, and while I'm now a mighty half-inch in height, it's still pretty overwhelming.

Michelle strides across to the counter, and nods to the giant standing at the post. "Take a break, Gary. I got this."

Gary moves aside, and Michelle lets me scamper onto the top of the cash register. From here, I get a decent view of the book store customers that have stopped off for a coffee. They come from all walks of life, all ages and genders, and I may have to sit through a few annoyances between each potential grower.

But no! Straight toward me comes a vision from heaven, long brown hair hanging onto a white blouse, unassuming face smiling in welcome as she orders her drink. Michelle gives a cost, and I drink in the smooth, flawless features of this beauty. But I need to find something beyond her stunning physical appearance to comment on, and maybe a little moment of study would -

"Before you go, have you seen my little friend here?" Michelle says, and suddenly the woman's eyes are fixed on me, and I feel smaller than ever, trapped under a spotlight that will decide everything.
1242321112.title: Customer Service

1242322.content:
When there’s an oblivious thousand-or-more-foot-tall young woman heading my way, there’s really only one sensible course of action. I’m getting the hell away. I can always come back to her later.

The fastest way to escape possible doom-by-foot is to do use my super-hop, so a-hopping away I go, instinctively seeking out higher ground where giant feet can’t possible squish me.

I land on the seat of a chair by one of the nearby tables, safely out of harm’s way. I take a moment to watch the giant barista as she cleans that part of the floor. Absolutely gorgeous girl from head to toe. Now if only I get myself closer to the head portion than the toe portion...

Before I can scheme, an earthquake strikes, one far worse than those that were caused by the barista’s footsteps. I look up and find that someone’s pulling out the chair. It’s a girl, early 20s or so. While she’s utterly gigantic to me, I can tell she’s actually very petite and scrawny compared to most other people.

But that’s to other people. I’m not other people right now. And right now, her scrawny butt is coming straight down toward me. Others may consider it tiny, but it’s huge enough to end my existence.
1242322.title: Higher ground

choices: Jump away to find another woman
Allow the woman to pick you up
12423222.content:
"Hey! Hey! Careful where you sit, gorgeous!"

The woman straightens again and,to her credit, looks directly down at me. "Oh, hello," she says.

"Thanks, lady!" I say. "It's good to see that there are still people willing to wait their turn!"

At that I grow. It's a sudden explosion to maybe half an inch, and I barely notice as the woman above me is still gargantuan before I anything I could have imagined yesterday. The witch did not lie.

The woman is reaching for me with a hand, to seize hold of me now that I'm not so delicate as to be annihilated with a touch. Of course, I've had enough from her to get my first taste of growth, so there's no real need for me to stick around here. Is there..?
12423222.title: Be Seated

choices: She takes you to her home...
124232222.content:
I figure she was nice enough not to sit her big-only-to-me butt down right on top of me, so I don’t really want to be rude to the giant petite girl.

She scoops me up in her hand and gently raises me to her face.

“Wow, you are just so cute and teensy!” she squeaks.

“Uh, thanks,” I say, wondering why she doesn’t seem the least bit surprised to find a guy of my stature hanging around a random chair in a random café in a random bookstore.

“Thanks for letting me pick you up,” she says. “All the other guys just ran away, like they were afraid of me or something.” She giggles. “It’s kind of fun being the tall one for a change.”

Wait...Others? “Other little guys, did you say?”

“Yeah, five, I think. All your size or smaller. Really weird.”

I’m not the witch’s only victim. So maybe her butt isn’t big only to me...

She grins. “But you’re the first one I caught.”

Umm...I hope she meant that innocently...
124232222.title: Picked up

choices: Ask to be taken to Courtney
Ask if she knows where Courtney gets the tiny men from
Ask how long this has been going on for
Ask her to let you make a phone call
1242322222.content:
"I can't believe that I'll finally be able to tell Courtney that I caught one of you!" the girl continues, striding along with half-inch me clenched in a fist, head poking free. "Maybe I might be able to win this crazy game after all!"

"Game?" I shout. "This is my life! Look at me, I'm a bug! Everything in the world could kill me, and to you it's all just a game?"

She stops walking and looks directly down at me with her huge, brown eyes. "Of course it is. Stop being so selfish, little man; not everything's about you."

Pausing only to blow a breath into my face, she resumes her stride. "She said you'd be difficult, but I never thought you'd be whiny. The last one was more willing to be crushed than caught, and you just presented yourself to me! You do want this, don't you? That's why you're offering yourself up to me. Too late to change your mind now, doll."

Ugh. Somehow I have to talk some sense into this woman...
1242322222.title: First Score on the Board

choices: Approach the woman at the entrance
Try to jump high enough to see some art
Loiter by the doorway, waiting for the woman to greet someone
13.content:
I'll admit, I've never been to an art gallery. I can't offer any special excuse; they've just never held any interest to me. So why am I dragging my ant-sized butt over there? Well, the way I figure it, a woman that has an appreciation of art must have some beauty beyond her appearance, right? A poetic soul, or somesuch.

Anyway, the traffic around the building is a little lighter than the other buildings, and so there are fewer titanic feet to dodge, and the thunderous drone of conversation from far above is dulled by the humble quiet that all the artists have.

In through the door, and I'm once again floored by my size. The gallery is constructed around a single, big room; the walls pass out so far, and the ceiling rises so high, I somehow feel more specklike than when I was in the great outdoors.

I can't read the signs, placed for the reading of more regularly-sized people, so I have no idea who's displaying what on this fine day. One woman, her feet shod in sandals, legs covered by a rainbow-hued skirt, stands more or less still to the left of the entrance. Perhaps she's the artist, standing to proudly survey the guests that want to browse her wares. Or maybe she's just the owner or an employee, here to greet newcomers and accept donations. Either way, she pays no attention to you, shuffling absently from one foot to the other and putting me in terror for my own life.

Well, I'm here now. Should I introduce yourself to my hostess? I haven't yet found anything to compliment her on though, so perhaps I should endeavour to catch a glimpse of at least some of the pieces on display here first. Then again, maybe I should just browse, waiting for a likely target to reveal herself to me. In this serene, open place, it feels as if I have all the time in the world...
13.title: Culture

choices: Shout something else to create a distraction
131.content:
Those sandal-clad feet smash down so heavily, and at such random intervals, that I'm unsure as to when would be a safe moment to break through the crowd and approach this artisticly-souled giant. Then it strikes me; I don't have to get close.

With my amplified voice, li'l ant-sized me can compliment here from way down here, without having to risk being stepped on!

Of course, I have nothing to base a compliment on, so I'll go for a slightly different approach:

"There's no need to be nervous - I'm sure people will love your art!"

Reassurance and comfort seem to be just as positive emotions, as I find my height increasing. Now I'm slightly more visible, and I've attracted attention with my outburst. The visitors pay it no heed, assuming it's merely someone within the crowd, but my target has zeroed straight in on me, I'm sure.

Her shufflings have ceased. And that skyscraper-sheathing mass of rainbow skirt is crumpling, as the immense legs underpinning it bend. She's coming to get me...
131.title: Nervous, Much?

choices: She leaves early for a restaurant date with a friend
132.content:
With quick thinking, you huddled against the store’s wall, so it’s gonna be hard for any of these giants to accidentally step on you as they make their way over to one of the many art pieces. But speaking of art, though it didnt interest you much, there was one particular painting on the other side of the room that kind of interested you.

But how could you get there with so many stomping feet? You survey the room for a possible safe route to get to a position that will give you a good view. But instead of a route, you find a potential ride in the form of a gorgous woman going from painting to painting, if she continued this pattern, then she would be able to take you to over there... but more than that, she was gorgeous. Maybe this was an opportunity to kill two birds with one stone.

The woman --a girl in her 20s, early, you think. She’s wearing open toed slingbacked heels, and her toned legs stretch up a couple of miles before they reach up into tight denim cutoff shorts. Above that, an oversized long sleeve grey shirt with sunglasses clipped to the collar and a cord necklace with a small gold fang shaped pendant on the end, a beautiful face with long blonde hair, with a straw sun hat rested on her head. And finally, with an ass and chest that demanded attention, they’ve certainly got yours.

But, the witch said im supposed to find someone i find attractive other than their looks, but at this point in time thats all i know about her. Perhaps when she gives me a lift to that painting, I can strike up a conversation on it. Alright then, enough time wasting, time to get moving.

I jog towards the woman in a straight line for a couple minutes and I reach her foot. I look up and see from the looks of her posture (cocked hip and crossed arms) that she was getting a good look at this painting and would likely not be moving soon. You hop onto a small statue near her, jumping from part to part until you reached the peak of its height. The statue was almost as tall as the woman so with the brim of her hat targeted as your landing zone, you take a mighty leap across the open air. You find yourself flying and your not gonna lie, it was fun. But then you land with a thud on the womans hat, then walk to the front just as she starts to move to the next painting.
132.title: Art Admirers

choices: "So bold, to defy conventional opinions on realism."
"Ah, such a moody display of pure emotion."
"Never before have I beheld such a touching tribute."
"What a piece of shit.  Total trash."
"..."  Remain silent and safe.  And also really teeny-tiny.
1321.content:
The hat stays steady as the woman considers the painting before her. You examine it yourself, wondering what it depicts. To call it abstract would be generous, as you cannot even make out what it's meant to be depicting. Maybe a sailboat?

Certainly, an interesting intersection of lines and smeared colour, applied with vigour if not direction. Your host remains silent, considering it, but if you were to offer your opinion, with your regular-size voice, it could impress the behemoth beneath you; she might share her own thoughts, and in finding common artistic interest you could find your first spurt of growth.

Or, you could annoy her and find yourself swatted like an insect, but them's the risks!
1321.title: Art Critique

choices: You're interupted by her grabbing you off her nose
With a shriek, she bats you away!
13211.content:
Choosing to begin your interaction with her on an intellectual level (despite the words coming out of your mouth belonging to a base of horseshit rather than actual knowledge of art), you believe that her invested stance she was currently holding showed the body language of an invested art conessuire, so perhaps giving off the impression that this is shared between you and her would do the trick of breaking the ice... and maybe put her at ease when she realizes your an ant sized man ontop of her hat.

However, hearing the voice of a young man so close to her, proved to have the opposite effect on Jen. Rolling her eyes, she expected this disembodied voice to belong to some asshole standing close behind her and pretending to be looking at the art over her shoulder. Though it was strange, aside from the voice, she had no inkling of a sense that someone had invaded her personal space even though it sounded like he was right on top of her.

"Wow, thats a clever way of looking at it.", she said dryly. "Too bad its..."

Jen turned her head and saw no one. At least, none around her immediate person. Then who said that? Did they drop that crappy line then just take off?

"You were saying something?"

'Again! Who's doing that?!', she thought to herself as she scanned around her, even tilting her head to look up.

"Whoa! Wait Agh!... Oof!"

They sudden change of angle sent you tumbling down from the brim of her hat to the crown, colliding your face against the tough bristles of straw.

The distressed noises startled Jen enough for her body to jump, which once again caused havoc for the tiny admirer on board her hat, launching him into the air not very high, but high enough to knock the wind out of him when he once again landed back on the brim of the hat.

"Oh god... (cough, cough), stop moving please! Just... hold on, stay still."

Well, this backfired. You figured you better reveal yourself before you break something. Judging by how still the womans head is right now, she seems to have accepted your plea's for her to keep still, so you drag your carcass to the edge of the brim, grip your hands tightly on to it and delicately lower your body over the edge. Now you were hanging above eye level to this womans confused bright blue eyes. Her brows furrowed as she looked left and right for you, unaware that you were right under her nose the while time, or in this case, dangling above it.

"Okay, this is just annoying. Why dont you quit playing hide and seek or just get lost.", said Jennifer.

"Well, if its fine with you, I'd like to hang around a bit longer."

This time, Jen listened to the voice come from directly in front of her, at first seeing nothing, until she caught the sight of a small shape in her peripheral dangling from the brim of her hat. She looked up and focused on it, watching as its fuzzy shape took clear form as a incredibly tiny man hanging by his hands in front of her! Her head recoils for an instant in shock of whats so close to her face, launching you right against her forehead! Jen winces and tenses up, raising her hands in palms open to chest level in an attempt to keep herself from screaming, though a gasp does escape her. Thankfully, she doesnt cause a scene. The art gallery was currently experiencing a slow flow of customers due to it being the middle of a week day.

You clung to the womans forehead with as much might as you could manage, but you knew you couldnt hold a conversation here, so you carefully descended down her face until you came atop the bridge of her nose. Jen crossed her wide eyes and kept them locked on you as you approached the tip of her nose and turned around to face those beautiful blue orbs.

The two of you remained still, unsure of what move to make next.

You clear your throat.

"So, uh... hi there. I'm..."
13211.title: "So bold, to defy conventional opinions on realism

choices: You fly out of the door, into the street
You splat down in a tray of snacks being offered to patrons
Great, you land in the waste bin
132113.content:
No further words from you as another mass of skin and bone smashes into to from the right, spinning you off into the abyss. Jen may have seen you on her nose, but she can't see you clearly enough to distinguish you from a bug!

You scream as you fall, and your voice, normal as it is, carries throughout the gallery. Were you not in fear for your life, you could have tried talking to one of the women around here, but you have definitely gotten the attention of all these massive artists, critics and tourists.

Jen has smacked you a good distance from herself, so where you come down is anyone's guess!
132113.title: The Power of Crticism

choices: They take their seats on a patio table
A bird attacks Jens head looking to snag you
1322.content:
The woman begins to move out of the building with you up on her hat as her little stowaway. The momentum caused by her strides was reminiscent to the feeling of being on a roller coaster, each titanic step that brought her forward caused your stomach to drop, not to the extent of a monster roller coaster, but each stomach drop after the other was taking its toll on you nonetheless.

You counted your blessings when this woman finally reached her high end car and with the worst drop of all, as her head tilted downward and she entered her vehicle. You had to cling hard to the straw floor you stood on and suffered a massive wave of nausea before she finally settled in her seat and drove off to god knows where. You took this opportunity of calm and stillness to lay on your back and clutch your throbbing head in your hands. The migraine was seeping away slowly from your cranium, that is until this big beautiful bitch decided to flick on her radio and blast some screechy pop song, then started singing along to the lyrics herself!

"THANK YOU, NEXT! THANK YOU, NEXT! IM SO FUCKIN GRATEFUL FOR MY EX!"

Perhaps if you were regular sized, you would enjoy this woman's singing voice, but at this moment it wasn't doing your head any favors.

You suffered through an entire car ride of this until finally, she stopped the car and turned the volume down to an acceptable level before pulling out her phone and calling someone on her cars bluetooth. Once again, the heavenly respite was slashed in half when the ringing phone tone screeched out the car speakers. You had just about enough at this point, if this person didn't pick up in the next couple seconds you were gonna reveal yourself in the most blunt, impolite, frightening way possible. An idea you had was perhaps you should make your way off the hat and enter this woman's ear canal then travel deep into her head until you reached her eardrum and from there, proceed to punch and yell your heart out at it! It was a precious thought, dealing out some punishment to this unaware tormentor. However, though you were suffering now, this could be one of the women that could put you a step forward in your height problem.

The ringtone abruptly ceased and was replaced by the sound of another womans voice. A young woman, probably in the same age range of your gracious host here. She must be picking up a friend! Great! Another contestant to give you a helping hand.

"Hey Jen. You outside?", the voice said.

Jen huh? Pretty name for a pretty girl.

"Yes maam. Get that big beautiful bum down here babe."

The woman laughed and told her she was on her way before Jen confirmed and hung up. It wasnt long before you saw her exit the building the car was parked outside of and walk with a cheerful strut towards you... well actually, towards Jen. This woman... you had hit the jackpot... two gorgeous young women were gonna be spending time together and you got to tag along for the ride.

She was white and blonde like Jen, except her hair was a slightly darker shade than her friends. You figured it would be a good plan to try and keep yourself hidden until you learned a little more about them, just to up your chances of hitting things off well.

The woman was holding a small duffel bag over her shoulder. Why? Beats you. Perhaps they wanted to work out or something. Noting that Jen also had a bag in her back seat.

The passenger door opened up and the women greeted each other lovingly, with Jen leaning over and embracing her friend in a hug that took you off guard and threatened to send you tripping over straws and falling off her hat, but with sharp tuned reflexes, you managed to hold your ground and stay put on the hat.

You had no desire to fall off of your perch yet, so you secured yourself to the hat by slipping your arm beneath a single strand and wrapping your elbow around it. It did secure you extremely well and kept you safe from falling out, so you sat for the next couple minutes, listening to these women chat. This was a great place to eavesdrop on conversation, and you learned all about these fine women. They had been friends for years, and you learned that Jens full name was Jennifer (obviously) and this friend of hers was named Genie. Aside from that it was mostly just a lot of chitter chatter about people you didn't know and inside jokes that had them bursting out with laughter.

"Sheesh.", you quietly said to yourself. "These chicks can ramble."

It was another few minutes of listening in until you learned the plans for the day. They were on their way to a restaurant and afterwards would go to the gym and then spend the night at a party at Genies apartment suite. Obviously, these girls were financially secure to say the least. This could be your way of living the life of a one percenter vicariously through them.

Finally, the car pulled into the parking lot of a bay side restaurant and came to stop.

Genie:
https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&source=i...

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/cb/ff/58/...
1322.title: Jen and Genie Meet Up

choices: Jens hat is knocked off her head along with you!
13223.content:
You recognized the established bay side restaurant as the place know appropriately as... "Bayside". Thats it. Whoever they got to handle the name of the restaurant must have been a few D.N.A strands shy of a chimp. But, despite its lazy name, the place got stellar business day in and day out. From your perch ontop of Jens hat, you could see most of the outdoor tables were occupied as she and Genie walked across the parking lot.

It escaped your mind unfortunately, that this was a waterfront food establishment, and the most frequent customers of such a place besides paying humans, are thieving seabirds! A fact you were unaware of even as the passing shadow of a flying seagull rolled over Jen and you. You were of course, aware of the birds presence overhead, but you weren't used to some retarded bird actually being capable of eating you alive like a bug, so you chose to instead of get your guard, you were going to walk over the brim of the hat and rest against the crown for awhile as if you were without a care in the world.

Jen and Genie had almost made it to the front entrance when suddenly, a mad seagull dive bombed at Jen and began attacking, aiming for the "bug" that rested on her hat! You, along with the two girls began screaming for the bird to fuck off. In all the chaos, the girls werent even fully aware that a seemingly disembodied voice of a man seemed to be coming from right on top of them when there was no one else with them, but for them, there were more pressing matters at hand than that at the moment. Jen was swinging wildly around her ducked head while you hanged by one hand off the brim of her hat above her face, trying desperately to hold on as your body was violently swayed back and forth!

Genie did her best to help her friend by employing the same tactic Jen was... mainly screaming and flailing at the hungry sky scavenger as it pecked away as accurately as it could at you, narrowly avoiding its orange beak by a hair at some points!

You couldn't keep this up! So many things were threatening to end you right now! This damn giant bird, Jens panicked swats that could flatten you thin as paper, her head movements that could send you flying to the pavement where you would grind into paste!
Something had to happen now or it was over for you!
13223.title: They call me Mr.Bird-bastic

choices: Climb out of the bag to watch them eat, get some clues
Use your voice to shout out to them right now
Relax among this clothing until the gym, and get out there
Endeavour to hide here until the danger of exercising giants is passed
Stay here until Genie puts the bag aside
132232.content:
Finally, Jen decides to take an obvious, yet deadly, action. Almost in slow motion, you witness her gargantuan thumb grip the very brim of her straw hat. Then she lifts it off her head, to bat at the seagull.

Her initial motion is enough to propel you through the air, arcing up to briefly look down upon the hungry sky-scavenger before plunging down, down, down to smash into the bare skin of Genie's shoulder.

It's like smashing into solid concrete - this girl must be almost pure muscle! Her immeasurable arm still swings at the bird above her, and you are moving once more, falling into the depths of her gym bag. A softer landing, and one where you feel quite, quite safe from that demon bird. Soon the girls will get back on to their meal, and then to the gym; when is it that you should make your move?
132232.title: Cast Aside

135.content:
It does feel like I’ve got all the time in the world, which means I’ve got time to be a little mischievous...and I have an idea.

Hey, I’ve got to make the most out of what life throws at me. So if I must be shrunk down to the size of an ant, then dammit, I’m going to have some fun with it.

My idea’s inspired by the painting across the room. It depicts a surreal human face with a wide open mouth. I can’t tell if he’s supposed to be screaming in pain or chattering obnoxiously, or maybe something else entirely. But I can work with it.

I hop across wide open floor space, unnoticed by the giants around me. Side note: That woman I just passed by has some great legs. I almost stop to stare, but the impending arrival of another pair of feet reminds me I should continue.

I reach the base of the wall below the painting. It’s waaaaay up high there. Fortunately, there’s a tall and oddly shaped sculpture on the floor beside it.

Several hops later (good Lord, that was exhilarating), I’m standing on the bottom edge of the painting’s frame. Above me looms the strange open-mouthed face. Time for fun.

“Aaahhh! I’m trapped in a painting! Trapped, I say! Help me! Help meeeeeee!” I say in the most ridiculous voice I can muster.

I draw a small crowd of observers.

“Did that painting just talk?” someone asks.

I continue, “The painting ate me! No one’s safe! Hide the women and children! Oh, the humanity!”

Some anachronistic hippie-type person says, “Woah, art isn’t just imitating life. The art is, like, coming to life. Far out.”

“Heavens, what a neat trick,” some stuffy person comments, as several others throw in their own two cents.

I keep it up: “It won’t stop with just me! The painting will eat you all! It will stop at nothing! Nothing!”

I glance at the bottom corner of the painting right next to me and notice how cool magnified giant paint looks. The detail’s incredible. I may turn into an art lover yet.

I turn back toward the crowd and find that my entire view has been taken over by giant breasts. I look up and see that it’s the hostess woman. (Really nice giant breasts she has. Wow.) She’s examining the painting, trying to figure this prank out.

Should I let her in on my little secret?
135.title: Prankster

choices: You don't get a chance to figure it out.
14.content:
The bench is closest, and there's a lone woman sitting on it. So, the bench wins the prize. That's my first destination as a micro-dude.

I can't see much of this woman, not with the rows of wood blocking much of her. What I can see is her long black hair and black t-shirt--Both contrast sharply against her pale skin. She seems to have a nice body, as far as I can tell. This lady is no stick figure...But at my size, I suspect even a stick figure girl would appear full-figured. Yeah, that's a nice body. I'm curious about her face, and why did a shadow just fall over me...?

Ah! Giant shoe!

I leap out of the way, narrowly avoiding death-by-sneaker. Bouncing up and down like the flea-man I've become, I make my way toward the bench and rest beneath it.

Heh, flea-man. I could just stay at this size and become a super-hero--Flea-Man! Scourge of--! Scourge of...Um, not really much I can be a scourge of, is there?

All right, never mind. I need to focus on becoming Flea-Man No More!

I glance up and see a gigantic skirt-clad rear still glued to the bench. Or I see parts of it, anyway. Shame this bench isn't made of clear material--aaaaaand I really need to stop thinking like that. Not here for voyeurism. I'm here to grow.

From under here, I've got no chance at establishing eye contact, and my odds are slim to begin with, given how much bigger her eye is than my entire body. Which is a humbling thought...

I rush over to her heel. Only one is on the ground, as she's sitting cross-legged. I reach an angle where I'm able to get a glimpse of her face as she leans forward, glancing from side to side. Is she waiting for someone?

Her face comes into view for a quick second, and--Hey! Is that--? I think I know her. That looked like Miss Grey! She taught me English senior year of high school. She was a first-year teacher then, and all of us guys were amazed how hot she was, you know, for a teacher.

I need another look to confirm...

Wait, I might be wrong...That might be another black-haired beauty I know...Amy. I was friends with her in high school but haven't seen too much of her since then.

So which one is it?
14.title: Go to the bench

choices: Hide under the bench and wait for another woman to come by
Leave the area and venture to a shop
Try to get Miss Grey's attention
141.content:
Easy. I just tell the teacher that I spent a whole year fantasising about that she had a great influence on me, that I learnt so much about English under her tutelage... while I'm the size of an ant.

At a respectful distance (all too aware of how easily Miss Grey could obliterate me under her foot) I move from under the bench, staring up at the woman's vastness, her crossed leg idly moving in a disconcerting manner so far above.

I clear my throat, and try to enunciate my words clearly, as Miss Grey herself taught me, so many years ago: "On behalf of the senior year of West Hamilton High School, thank you for teaching us the English language so well."

I'm not entirely sure that my grammar is correct, but that doesn't seem to matter; before me, the gigantic foot becomes marginally less gigantic, shrinking out of focus as my growing eyes take time to adjust. Maybe I'm what, half an inch tall now? Excellent start.

Then a second foot slams down beside me as Miss Grey uncrosses her legs, no doubt wondering where that sudden compliment came from. I may be bigger, but that random chance of being stepped on still exists! I should get out of here, right now!

Although... Maybe I could get this beautiful titan to aid me in some way? She was always gentle and kind, as well as learned, so maybe, if I could gain her attention, she could help me reach more women?
141.title: Miss Grey

142.content:
It is Amy. Never realized how much those two look alike, but that’s a compliment to both ladies.

None of us guys could ever take our eyes off Amy back in school, and she certainly seems to have grown up nicely. Emphasis on grown. Good Lord, she looks like something mythological from this perspective. I feel like I should bow down before her or something, but I’m pretty sure that’s not quite the sort of appreciation of women that feminist witch wanted me to develop. Or then again...

But dammit! I used to be taller than her! Now she’s thousands of feet taller than me and could kill me with the tiniest motion of her foot here.

Backing away now...

This is humiliating. If I did talk to her, would I even grow? I already know her. What are the rules of this thing? I don’t know if I could stand Amy seeing me like this. But she would hardly be seeing me. You know, I’m so small, she might not even recognize me. I’d just have to disguise my voice a little.

Or, to hell with it. I could just mess around with her and have some fun.
142.title: Amy

1423.content:
Seeing how impossibly huge Amy is, it reminds me that this is no time for games. I just need to bite the bullet and get this over with.

I step forward. It’s an inconsequential distance to her, but I do so anyway. It gives me a second to gather my courage.

“Uh, hi, Amy,” I squeak out, hating how shaky my voice sounds. I can’t even blame it on my size -- it’s pure nervousness.

Amy looks from side to side. She seems to have heard something, yet can’t pinpoint the source. The sidewalk doesn’t occur to her as an option.

I take another step forward. “Amy,” I say, no less tentative. “I’m--”

She uncrosses her legs, and I see the bottom of her boot coming my way. She’s going to step on me, unless I do something really fast.

I employ my super-hopping ability. I jump up--

SMACK!

I hit the bottom of her boot, and it shoves me right back to the ground. She squishes me dead, and I’m so tiny, she’ll never know.

Somewhere, a giant witch is having a big old laugh at my expense.
1423.title: Epic fail

choices: She casually looks over and notices an "ant"
144.content:
As much as you wanted to get to know the girl on the bench, you didn't have any time to do so. A huge bus hurtled to the left of the sidewalk, and a bunch of people rushed to get on it. The black-haired woman was one of them; she got off the bench so quickly that she almost stepped on you. You dove out of the way in time, fortunately. But oh well, there went your chance of growing a little more.

This time you took advantage of the absence of people on the bench. You went to one of the legs and began to climb. Since you were ant-sized, it took a very long time, but it also allowed you to grab on to certain parts more easily. When you finally reached the seat of the bench, you had a better vantage point of things: you could see people's faces more easily.

Not long after, another woman came to sit on the bench. You went to the far side to avoid getting squished, then came out again to see her. This was someone you did not recognize her. She looked about 21, and was African-American. She had curly black hair, an attractive figure, and a fair body. She wore jeans, a black coat, and knee-high boots. She was reading a book.

What should you do?
144.title: You don't get a chance to figure it out.

15.content: (Let's make sure there are plenty of options...)
15.title: Place to go...

151.content:
