I seek refuge from the hazardous sidewalk by ducking into the nearest store. Thankfully, the doors are propped open, so my little flea-like self can hop right in.

What store is this? I look left, right and forward and see nothing but clothing. I think it’s all women’s clothing. A couple of teenaged girls straighten and fold the merchandise, so they’re clearly the employees on duty. And now that I have a moment to catch my breath, it dawns on me just how humungous those girls are. They’re only teenagers, and look at the size of them! They’re like a million feet tall! Well, not that big, but I’ve seen skyscrapers in New York that were shorter than these young ladies.

I have to talk to a girl that big or stay this tiny forever. How can I do that when even those teens look so intimidating?

And why do I hear thunder? And why’d it get darker...?

Agh! Shoe!

I hope out of the way, barely avoiding being crushed by some middle-aged woman who’s even bigger than the two teenagers.

I don’t know if I can survive this. Anyone, even a kid, can accidentally crush me and never even realize. I need to think. I need a moment to think without any danger of being stepped on.

The store’s not too big, thankfully, (well, to most people) so I’m able to run to a corner soon enough and hide below a shelf of folded jeans. No one can step on me down here, but there could be insects. The dust is kind of thick, too. I don’t think it’s healthy to linger here for too long. Don’t they ever vacuum? Actually, I hope they don’t vacuum, not anytime soon...

My phone! I have my cell on me, but does it work? It would defy the laws of science if it still did, but since it was magically shrunk and magic destroys the rules of science anyway, it’s worth a shot.

Who to call? I’ve got it. My roommate, Lana. I know she was home finishing up that paper for her grad school course, and home isn’t too far away. She’s a good friend, one of the best I’ve got. She can be my wing-girl--my giant-sized wing-girl. It’s going to be weird seeing her like this, but I have to admit: I need help.

I hit her number. The phone rings. Good sign. She just better pick up.

“Hello?” she says. Her voice plus some strange static almost blows my ear out, but it’s bearable.

“Hey, Lana, it’s me. I need your help.”

“Is something wrong with your phone? It sounds funny.”

“That doesn’t surprise me,” I say, holding the phone at arm’s length. “But look, I’m in a bit of a situation, and I need your help. I’ll owe you big time for this.”

“What kind of situation?”

“You won’t believe me until you see for yourself. Can you meet me in the clothing store at the corner of Seventh and Central streets?”

“The women’s clothing store?”

“Yeah.”

“Oh, I see. You’re buying something for a girl and need my expertise, right?”

“Something like that. Now, when you walk in, you probably won’t see me right away, but I promise I’m here. I’ll come to you. Just, uh, watch your step.”

“What am I going to step on?”

“It will all make sense when you see me. Just keep an ear out for my voice.”

“So look at the ground, listen for you, and is there something my nose should be doing, too?”

“Just please come right away.”

“You’re lucky I can use a break right about now. All right. I’ll be there in a few.”

“You’re my hero.”

Great. Just need to hang out for a few minutes. But what do I do in the meantime?
151.title: Gimme shelter

1511.content:
I’m not taking any chances. The world out there has grown so huge, I’d be asking for trouble if I stepped away from my makeshift shelter here. I’ve got a clear line of sight to the door, so I’ll see Lana when she enters.

Or at least, I had a clear line of sight for a few minutes before that giant girl stepped right in front of me. It’s one of the employees, come to straighten the jeans above me, or something like that. Look at the detail of her sneakers, all those wrinkles...I can see every step she’s taken.

I poke my head out to look straight up at her, and wow...I’m so damn tiny. A leg of khaki stretches up, up and away, and she doesn’t even end there. It’s a shame she’s too young. I could maybe have started talking to her and gotten at least one of the ten out of the way before Lana shows up. Oh, well.

THOOM! THOOM! THOOM!

Hey! Footsteps! New footsteps! I’m feeling lucky, so I run out between the sneakers and hop toward the door, and OH MY GOD!

It’s Lana all right, and sh-sh-she’s just so big! Lana’s like two-thousand feet tall! Yikes.

She walks across the carpet, her eyes scanning from side to side. She’s already passed me, as I was too stunned to say anything. Look at her! Wow. She has a great body--Stop that, she’s my roommate and dear friend! And she’s a goddamn giant.

Wait, no, don’t get scared. This isn’t a huge store (not to her, anyway) and if she doesn’t see me in another few seconds, she’ll be out of here, and she’ll be pissed at me for wasting her time. And no way in hell am I pissing off a girl who’s that effing BIG.

Using my special hopping ability, I gather up speed and bounce my way toward her, calling out, “Hey, Lana! Down here!”

Lana stops short, but I don’t. My momentum sends me crashing into the back of her jeans-clad ankle. I ricochet onto the floor, falling flat on my back. But I’m mostly unhurt, just slightly bruised maybe.

Above, the giant Lana fills my entire view, as she turns around and is about to walk...toward me.

“No, Lana! Don’t step on me!”

She stops again, and looks from side to side, curiously. She heard me, but she doesn’t see me, and she realizes that no one else has reacted to my frightened outburst. Good thing my voice only carries so far.

“Lana! Down! Here!” I say, getting off my back and rising to my full (such as it is).

Now she’s found me. “Billy?” she whispers, astonished, as she puts her hands on her knees and bends down--way down--to get a better look at my tiny body waving at her. “You’re--you’re little?”

I hope she’s able to handle this shock.
1511.title: That's Lana?!?!

15111.content:
“What--? I mean, how--?”

This is a visual I’ll take with me to my grave. My roommate Lana at two-thousand feet tall, bent double-over, her eyes and mouth hanging wide open.

“Lana, quick, before anyone else sees me, please take me home.”

“Yeah, okay,” she whispers, lowering her purse to the floor. “How do I pick you up? Don’t want to smoosh you.”

“I got it,” I say, leaping into the cavernous black purse.

I have the misfortune of landing in her hair brush, but I manage to untangle myself from Lana’s orange strands by the time I feel the swaying stop, which means--

“We’re home,” she says. “I set you on the kitchen table. Do you need help?”

I hop out and land on the smooth, wood surface.

“So that’s a no,” she says, again bending over. Now I’m looking straight into her massive green eyes. “I can’t believe this. I have a teeny tiny, itsy bitsy, teensy weensy, bug-sized shrunken roommate. I can barely see you.” She stands up and paces back and forth. “How is this possible? How can you be shrunk? How can you breath? How do you hop like that?”

I watch her mighty hips swivel as she paces. It’s hypnotic. And her butt sticks out forever, it’s just so big from my current point of view. Nothing like being shrunken to make you realize how much you appreciate a full-sized backside. And why am I checking out my roommate? She’s my roommate! Don’t cross that line! She’s off-limits.

She takes the temptation away by lowering her head back down.

“Billy, tell me, please, what happened to you?” she asks.
15111.title: Confused roommate

151111.content:
She’ll be the most helpful to me if I just tell her the truth. Besides, how much more humiliating can this get? She’s already seeing me the size of an ant...She sees that my current, actual size is ant-size, with no way to grow back, except...

“I started talking to a girl,” I begin.

“You were trying to pick up a random chick, weren’t you?”

I hesitate, then say, “Yeah, okay? I was. But, uh, she didn’t take it so well. And it turns out she knows magic, of all the luck...”

Lana sits down in the chair in front of me. The old chair creaks under her weight. I don’t normally hear creaks from these chairs, especially from someone as thin as Lana, but I guess I’m perceiving all sorts of things I wouldn’t otherwise. Incidentally, is that an amoeba I see slithering away from my feet? It’s something a person shouldn’t be able to see with the naked eye, whatever it is.

“You hit on a witch? That what you’re telling me?” Lana says, resting her arms on the table and her head on her arms. Her sideways face still towers over me, of course. My God, I could get lost in those eyes. Never really looked into them before--well I have, but not like this. And those lips, even closer to me...Okay, stop that.

“Yeah, and she thinks I need to learn a lesson about appreciating women, so she wants me to meet ten girls that I find attractive for reasons other than looks. With each girl I talk to, I’ll grow a little bit. After number ten, I’ll be back to normal.”

Lana smirks. The smirk turns into a chuckle, which bursts into a great huge, “HAH!”

Her explosive laughter literally knocks me over, flat on my back. And she continues laughing. It’s pretty damn loud.

Covering my ears, I call up, “Lana, you’re a little too big to be laughing so loudly...”

She sees me knocked over and lowers her head to me, apologetic. “Oh, I’m so sorry!” she whispers. “It was just the thought of tiny you trying to flirt with a normal-sized woman, plus the whole thing is just so ridiculous.” She almost starts laughing again, but restrains herself to a big, kind smile. “Are you okay? We’ll figure a way out of this. We’ll get you back to normal.”

Looking up at her over-sized face, full of genuine concern for my well-being, right after that giddy playfulness, I can’t help but think it: She’s an adorable person, inside and out.

With that thought, Lana becomes the Incredible Shrinking Woman, at least to my eyes. I grow until I’m about a half-inch tall or so. Still puny, but a mountain of a man compared to what I was.

Lana’s smaller to me, but still hundreds of feet tall, and quite confused.

“You grew. But didn’t you say you only grow if you talk to a girl you’re attracted to?”

Yeah. I can’t lie to myself anymore. I do have some feelings for her. But she’s my roommate! We share an apartment! We’re good friends! And she’s a giant!

So do I confess my feelings, or tell her something like talking to any girl who's a good person will make me grow, even just a friend?
151111.title: A new perspective

1511111.content:
“Yes, Lana, I do find you attractive. You’re such a fun person, a good person. Yes, I have feelings for you. I think I...I know I want to be more than friends with you.”

There. It’s out. But how will she take it?

Lana turns her head away. She stands up, filling my entire view with over-sized ass. But it’s difficult to enjoy the sight when she’s not saying a damn thing and I’m dying to know...How does she feel about me?

Say something! Anything! Preferably what I want to hear, of course, but just turn that giant butt around and say something! It's only been two seconds, and already the suspense is keeping me in agony.
1511111.title: Torture

15111112.content:
Lana turns around and stares straight down at me. I know how this is going to go. If I wasn’t already half an inch tall, I’d feel it, the way she’s looking at me, looking down at me, like I’m somehow beneath her. Aside from the fact that I am indeed literally on a lower level than her face.

Actually, I only know part of this outcome. She’s going to shoot me down, but is she going to let me down gently, or is she going to freak out and feel like I’ve betrayed her somehow? Oh, God, please don’t feel betrayed. I never should have opened my big mouth.

She begins, “Billy...”
15111112.title: Impending rejection

151111122.content:
“...How could you?” she says, raising her voice. “How can you say that? We’re friends. We live together. We can’t--Is this why you suggested sharing an apartment? Has this all been some ploy to get into my pants? I--” She turns away and takes a breath. “I’m sorry. I know you’re having trouble, weird trouble, but I just...I need a moment alone...”

She storms into her bedroom and slams the door shut.

So that didn’t go well.

“Aw, poor baby...” What the hell? The witch! She’s here, sitting down on the table beside me, but still gigantic (or normal sized, most people would say).

“How did you get here? Where’d you come from?”

“Magical teleportation. And stop looking at my butt.”

“You set it down right in front of me.”

“Learn self control, pipsqueak.”

“What do you want? Or what else do you want? You want to see me suffer? You just missed a great show.”

“Oh, I was watching as a fly on the wall. Literally. So I did see. And now I can’t resist....”

“What?”

“I’m going to make your roommate forget that you’re tiny, but I’ll let her remember that you just awkwardly confessed your true feelings.”

“Why the hell would you do that?”

“I want to see what you make of the situation.”

The witch stands up and reaches toward me. Before I can run away, her fingers snatch me up and set me down on the carpet.

She waves down to me. “Bye! Have fun with your ‘giant’ crush.”

She vanishes.

Great. So now I’m alone with a giant girl who no longer realizes how gigantic she seems to me right now, and she’s not the least bit happy with me.

Lana’s door opens...
151111122.title: She's upset

1511111221.content:
She'll kill me. Lana will literally kill me. With her foot.

She stomps back into the room, and I peg it quickly underneath the tabel before I can get stepped on. The giantess moves with incredible speed, putting the strides of my half-inch form to shame. She's screaming the whole time, calling me all sorts of names and stuffing items into a large cardboard box carried in her massive arms.

Guess we won't be room-mates for much longer.

Hands snatch items from the floor before I can breathe,stuffing them away into a darkness beyond my reach. If I want to avoid this clearly angry woman, hiding isn't going to cut it at the moment. I'll be grabbed, or stomped,and that's if she doesn't recognise me!

Well, I've gotten my microns of growth from the girl,so there's no reason not to vamoose. But the dash across to the door is across a vast (coupla feet) plain with no cover. Lana could spot me easily, and kill me like an insect.

Perhaps trying to avoid her is the wrong way to go about this. Maybe if I appraoch her colossal form and stow away somewhere, I can sneak off at an opportune moment. There's no time limit here,so why should I take risks?
1511111221.title: Hide!

15111112211.content:
She’s too angry. And too big. Not a great combo there. I’ve just gotta get out of this place, and I’ll catch up with her sometime when she doesn’t look like she’s 750 feet tall.

So here goes...Not gonna over-think this one. There’s the door. I’m going for it.

As I make my mad dash across the floor, I try out my hopping ability to see if that will speed things along, but of course, I’m a little bigger and heavier now, so my super-jump is a little less super. I can jump high for my height, but not as high as when I was ant size. But it’s still something, I suppose.

I’m about halfway to the door when it dawns on me...How am I going to open that colossal thing? I could probably have squeezed through at ant size, but not at a full half-inch.

But I apparently have a more immediate problem, when I hear a deafening, “EW!”

I turn around and see gigantic Lana striding toward me, seeming more gigantic with each approaching step, cursing and complaining about my sloppiness as she looks right at me. But her eyes are waaaaayyy up there, and I’m reeeeeaaaallllyyy small, so naturally...

THOOM!

Her sneaker-clad foot slams down onto the hard floor. I barely dive away in time.

“Stupid bug!” she mutters, as she stomps down again. THOOM!

I evade, but I can’t keep this up forever. Maybe I can slip under the coat closet and she’ll lose interest. Or maybe I can summon enough courage to open my big mouth, but if she finds out who I am, then she might really want to stomp me.
15111112211.title: Attack of the 750-foot Lana!

151111122111.content:
The decision becomes easy, as Lana raises her foot high into the air. I have an almost-literally worm’s-eye view of her as she positions herself for a powerful stomp. She’s like a movie monster, only a lot prettier and a lot more real.

I dash for the closet door. Her foot slams onto the hard floor, causing tremors that almost topple me. I’ve lucky I’m not deaf from the thunder. She means business.

In a moment, I’m safe in the dark, cluttered closet (we really need to straighten this place up), until I realize...she may have seen me. Maybe not well enough to recognize me, but she probably saw her target scurry away to shelter.

Come to think of it, when her last boyfriend broke up with her, she got really mad about it. Then, when she saw a spider had gotten into our apartment, she was determined to squash it. The little critter was fast and slippery, and she was moving furniture and scouring the place until she finally killed it. She later told me she had pretended the spider was her ex-boyfriend.

I hope she’s not that mad at me. Could she really be...? And would she really vent her frustrations on some little “insect” by pretending that it’s me when in reality the “insect” actually is me shrunk to half an inch tall?

Take note, fellas: If you ever find yourself shrunk to tiny size, that is not the time to piss off a woman.

I guess I’ll know in a second just how mad she is. Nothing I can do about it at this point, even though I caused it.
151111122111.title: Safe?

choices: It's your neighbor Felicia, and her cat.
1511111221112.content:
I wait in darkness. I hear Lana’s thundering footsteps fade in and out, several times, and I see her shoes passing back and forth. But the closet door never opens. I am safe in here.

But I can’t just hide out in a closet forever. What will that accomplish?

I swallow my pride and slip out, back into the light of our foyer area, and I see Lana walking toward my direction. I’m reminded of the grandeur she’s acquired since my...reduction.

Then I notice she’s carrying a suitcase, and she’s headed toward the door, with her keys in her other hand.

I can’t let her go. “Lana!” I shout up. “It’s me! Please, don’t go! We can work this out!”

Something isn’t right. My voice, it’s...squeaky. I now have a tiny voice to match my tiny stature.

But I keep trying, at the absolutely top of my little lung, as Lana continues walking away, oblivious to my presence. “Lana! Laaaannnnaaaa! Noooo!”

She’s at the door. I’m going to lose her unless I use my little leaping ability.

But I find that’s gone, too. Is all this temporary? If not, I’m screwed.

I don’t even bother running anymore. I’d never catch up with those long legs. I can only watch her open the door and go. She walks away, potentially for good, for all I know.

She shuts the door behind her, and I’m all alone in my oversized apartment.

I call out to the witch, “You happy? You got what you wanted? Was that fun for you, stealing my voice like that? On top of everything else!”

No response. Guess she’s had her fun, and she’s done.

But I’m still tiny. I lean against the base of the wall, and I let myself crumple into a sitting position. And I just stay there, nearly motionless, lost in my thoughts for who knows how long.

I look to the door. There’s a big whole world out there. I never truly realized how big, and scary. So many people can hurt you without even meaning to, with the smallest, most casual actions. Like I must have hurt Lana.

More time passes, as I mull over what to make of my situation.

Then, the door opens.
1511111221112.title: Exit

15111112211121.content:
I just wanted to be closer to Lana, but I scared her off. Just as I’m wishing for a chance to make amends, the door opens, and in walks Lana.

She’s still gigantic, in case you were wondering, but at least I haven’t gotten any smaller.

“Billy? You here?” she calls out.

Maybe she wants to patch things up, too. Maybe! I hope so!

I run toward her, shouting, “I’m here, Lana! Look down here!” As I jump up and down, waving my arms, I wonder how ridiculous this would look to a third-party observer. “Down here, Lana! I got shrunk, remember? Please remember, Lana!”

She doesn’t look down, but she listens. After giving it a moment, she shakes her head and mutters, “Thank God.”

She’s happy not to see me? “No, Lana, don’t hate me! Please don’t hate me! I just wanted us to be closer!” Of course, my shouts are wasted on the oblivious giant.

Lana steps forward, and her sneaker almost comes crashing down on. Thankfully, I’ve gotten good at avoiding humongous shoes.

“No, Lana, don’t step on me!” Why am I even bothering? I guess I need to feel like I’m making an effort.

Lana approaches a box she left behind. She must have forgotten it in her anger-fueled haste.

I notice the box has rope hanging down its side, just about touching the floor. Or more like a piece of yarn. Her knitting materials must be in there.

I need a way out. Lana may want nothing to do with me, but I’ll never have anything to do with anybody ever again if I don’t get a ride out of here.

She’s kneeling in front of the box, inspecting its contents. I start running toward her, debating whether to grab on to the yarn or climb onto her shoe.
15111112211121.title: Lana's back

151111122111211.content:
I remember how loud she sounds when walking, and I really don’t want that headache. Too chaotic. So, no to the shoe and yes to the yarn.

I dash over there. A small hop (sadly, still no more super-hop) barely gets me to the bottom of the yarn. I grab a hold and climb up just a little. It feels secure. Good thing I’m a lightweight.

The floor abruptly drops out from under me, as Lana lifts the box up to her level. My stomach sinks the whole way, and the yarn begins to sway. I bump against her stomach a couple of times, but I’m too minute to make much of an impact.

We go outside, and the hard tiled floor becomes a harder concrete ground. If this yarn gets loose, I’m dead. I watch her shoes swinging back and forth, and I wonder if one of them might have been the better option after all.

That aside, this is kind of a fun ride. I wouldn’t mind it going through a thorough safety inspection first, but in a way, I feel more alive than I have in ages. This is the stuff of action movies, just on a much smaller scale.

Lana leans into her car through the driver’s side to set the box on the passenger’s seat. She bumps the front of the box against something, and the sudden jolt slams me head-first against the cardboard.

I lose my grip, and I fall, fearing the worst, dreading the unforgiving union of concrete and gravity.

But my fall is soft. I bounce a couple of times, sure, but I don’t land on concrete. I land on the driver’s seat -- a huge, expansive driver’s seat.

I laugh at my good fortune, and my bad fortune. Really, I have to laugh at my whole ridiculous situation at this point.

Then I look up and notice something that fills me with horror. Never in a billion years would I have expected this to be cause for mortal terror, but it is.

Lana is about to sit down.

No time for laughing now. That would get in the way of my panicking.

“No, Lana! Don’t sit on me! Don’t sit down!” Once again, futile.

Her jeans become my ceiling, and her butt swiftly balloons as it drops toward me.

I dive toward the rear of the seat. I barely manage to hide in the crevice where the seat meets the backrest, right as she comes down and shifts backs.

She presses me tight against the seat. The chair’s crevice affords me just enough room to breathe and for my blood to keep flowing, but this is not a comfortable position right here.

For I second, I get nostalgic about my time at ant-size, but if I was still that small, I never would have made it to even this small measure of safety in the safety. I’d have been flattened, under...that. Only it would be remarkably even bigger.

Now I have quality time with Lana’s gigantic ass. This is not what I meant when I said I wanted to be closer to her. This is nowhere near as fulfilling as what I had in mind.
151111122111211.title: Closer

choices: Run toward the rear of the couch.
Run toward the edge of the couch.
1511111221112112.content:
The ride feels surreally long. After a while, it gets easier to forget that my “wall” is actually a small part of Lana herself.

Eventually, it does end, and I had plenty of time to plot my next move: I grab on as she stands up. What else could I do? Hang out here and wait for her to come sit on me again? And that would be assuming I didn’t suffocate in a closed car before then.

I hang on to the back of her jeans as she walks. I can’t see where, but I hear a familiar voice. I look up and see huge arms hugging her.

“Hey, sweetie. Come on in. It’s okay.”

“Thanks, Lace.”

I was right. It’s her big sister Lacy. By “big,” I mean maybe two years older, although she is just a bit bigger in certain attention-getting ways. I’ve met her a few times briefly, and there is no denying she’s a beautiful woman, maybe even more beautiful than Lana.

But I never really got to know Lacy. My only recollections of her are polite hello’s and discreetly checking her out. One time, I was afraid she caught me looking, but she never said anything, thankfully.

Lacy says, “Have a seat and tell me everything.”

You’d think I’d be afraid, given my precarious position here, but I had time to plan this, too.

Lana goes for the center of a long couch, and I abandon ship to beat her to the cushion. I hop off and enjoy a bouncy landing. Then, I bolt. I sprint across the soft landscape, getting plenty of distance from the descending Lana...but apparently not as much as I hoped.

Her weight distorts the landscape enough to send me falling backward, but, pro that I am, I quickly regain my footing and resume my sprint. I leap from one cushion to the next, claiming victory.

I did it! Lana’s sitting way over there, and here I am way over here. Whew. Now to--

Oh, dammit.

“No, Lana!” I shout, with characteristic futility. “Don’t lie down on me! Don’t lie down!”

She starts to lie down. Her mid-back is coming straight for me.
1511111221112112.title: Elsewhere...

15111112211121122.content:
I do my best to outrace her, but I soon run out of couch.

There I am, standing on the very edge, with a steep drop ahead of me, as Lana crashes down. She casually drops all her weight at once -- a good hard plop.

Some scientific mechanics come into play here. She depresses part of the couch cushion, causing my part to spring up, like a lever effect, more or less. Given my pitiful lack of weight, I go flying up several times my height...

...And I crash down into...water? I’m in an enormous pool that appeared out of nowhere, and it’s all deep end.

“Have a drink,” Lacy says, passing a nice cold glass to her sister.

Now Lana sits up. Of course.

The glass is in her hands. I am literally right under her nose. But she’s not drinking yet, and she’s not looking down. She’s listening to Lacy.

“I have some questions. Don’t yell at me until I’m done. Just answer,” Lacy says. “This guy, did he ever harass you in any way?”

“No, I guess not.”

“Was he ever a jerk to you?”

“No, he’s nice, I suppose..."

“Does he try to control you, tell you what to do -- you know, do this, don’t do that, anything along those obnoxious lines?”

Lana tilts the glass and brings it closer to her widening mouth. Those are some big teeth she has. Scary big. That’s not a cavern I need to go spelunking in.

I shout, with as little effect as usual, “No, Lana! Don’t drink me! Don’t drink!”

“No, he doesn’t,” Lana says, reconsidering the drink for now.

“So maybe the guy acted a little foolishly, but try to see it from his point of view. Maybe he was just feeling lonely, and there you were. Like you said, he didn’t cross any lines. He just had a moment of being human. People need people, and let’s face it, you’re lovely. Why wouldn’t he be interested after all this time getting to know you better? I’m not saying you need to date him, but do you think there’s a possibility that you might be over-reacting?”

I stare up at Lana’s face, or more like up her face, as she considers her sister’s words.

She lowers her glass (and me) toward the coffee table, and...
15111112211121122.title: Getting out of trouble, getting into trouble...

151111122111211222.content:
I get to practice swimming for a while.

Lana and Lacy continue chatting. Lana changes the subject away from me and onto school matters, family matters, etc. Basically, stuff that’s none of my business.

All that time, there I am, floating about in a giant glass of water. Eventually, Lana’s going to get thirsty, and it won’t be pleasant. In any case, this water is rather cold, and I’m no polar bear.

So, rather than eavesdrop on the sisters’ conversation, I do whatever I can to get either one’s attention. Preferable Lacy’s, since she seems to be firmly on the side of not hating me. But who am I to be picky?

“Lana! Lacy! I’m down here! In the cup! Listen to me! I’m in the water!”

Yeah, that doesn’t work. I need to make more of scene. What do I have to work with? Water.

I splash around as much as possible, shoving armfuls of water against the glass, making whatever waves I can. I create minor chaos in my environment, but I’m not sure if it’s enough for “big” people to notice.

Eventually, finally, I see Lana glance down into the glass, but it’s only a glance, which means...

“Ick. There’s a huge bug in there,” Lana says, picking up the glass.

She walks me into the kitchen and goes to the sink. I see where this is going...

“No, Lana! Don’t pour me down the drain! Don’t pour!” I shout, splashing again in hopes of receiving another glance from those big, apparently unperceptive eyes.

She tilts the glass over the sink. I try to swim against the current, but that effort fails in half a second. I ride the waterfall into the sink, my submerged screams muffled.

I notice the sink if full of dirty dishes and silverware. Can I grab onto something before the drain claims me?
151111122111211222.title: Pour you

1511111221112112221.content:
My waterfall runs right through a fork. If I don’t catch hold of it, then I’m as good as dead.

Yes, this is what my life has come to. Depending on a giant fork for survival because my giant (ex?) roommate poured me out of a giant cup and into a giant sink. My education did not prepare me for this. I feel let down.

I’m prepared to reach out and grab the prongs, but there’s no need. That’s where the current is taking me anyway. My stomach crashes against the stainless steel, knocking the wind out of me. But that’s okay. The water clears in a second, and I can catch my breath.

That is, until I hear Lana call out, “Lacy, how long have these dishes been in here? This is disgusting.”

With that, she starts reaching into the sink to pick up dirty dishes and put them, presumably, in a dishwasher.

Soon, she targets my fork. She doesn’t bother to look at it, and course not. Who wants to study dirty silverware? I can’t fault her for that.

But she is placing me in the dishwasher. That, I can fault her.

“No, Lana! Don’t put me in the dishwasher!” One of these times, I swear, she’s bound to hear me.

She deposits the fork into the silverware basket, which fortunately is pulled out over the open dishwasher door.

I slip down onto the white surface and run toward Lana. As long as she doesn’t close the dishwasher quite yet, I have a chance. Her ankles are right at the edge. Maybe I can grab hold of one. Of course, I’m starting from the far side, darn my luck.

She bends down to throw in a couple more dishes. The rack above me slides back into position, under her power, and now she’s putting the detergent in.

“No, Lana! Don’t wash the dishes! Don’t wash me!” I even try the whole arm-flailing thing, but she seems to have enough of her mind that she’s not paying attention to much of anything.

Alright, I’m at the edge. I just need to jump...aaaaand her leg takes a step back. Dammit!

She lifts the dishwasher door, with me still on top.

“No, Lana! Don’t close the dishwasher! Don’t close it!”

As my surface rises, I realize I have a slight chance to reach her arm. I might be able to leap onto her sleeve. But if I miss...But if I don’t even try...

Do I dare chance it?
1511111221112112221.title: Billy vs. The Dishwasher

15111112211121122212.content:
I can’t. The door flies up, sending me flying into the dishwasher itself. In my last moment of light, I’m able to grab hold of the upper rack. My arms are wrapped around a hard blue bar right next to an upside-down cup. Directly below are the tips of several huge knives.

Darkness consumes the place, and I hear Lana locking the dishwasher shut. The mighty machine starts.

This is it, isn’t it? I’m going to die in a dishwasher. How does the inside of a dishwasher even work? Will I drown or suffocate in the steam? Or will I fall onto one of those knives?

I wonder what would have happened if I didn’t come on to Lana like that. What was I thinking? Did my brains shrink with the rest of me? Well, they did literally. What happened?

I was lonely and I tried to plug Lana into that hole. She doesn’t exactly fit, but my imagination manipulated her until I was convinced she would. The ironic thing is, she’s such a good friend, how could I possibly feel lonely with her in my life in any capacity?

Yeah, she overreacted a bit when I pathetically admitted the feelings I was so sure I had, but I’m also guilty for expecting her to make me happy. It was unfair of me.

Before I surrender to the dishwasher, I have one more thing to try. “Okay, witch, I learned some kind of lesson here. Do you really think I deserve this? Are you there?”

Light blinds me for a second, and I see the witch appear before me. She sits on the same bar, roughly twice my size.

“I had no idea you were going to be so entertaining. Honestly, I just thought you’d try to hit on some random girl, and she would accidentally step on you and I’d have a good chuckle. But this whole soap opera and death-defying escapes--”

“Could you hurry it up? There’s going to be some really hot water splashing around any second now.”

She snaps her fingers, and we’re outside the dishwasher and on the kitchen floor. I look up, and there’s Lana, still large as large can be. She turns to walk toward the living room.

“Lana! Wait! Don’t leave!” I shout, but it’s even more futile this time. I’m competing with a giant dishwasher.

“I’ve got it,” the witch says, with a sadistic smile.

Uh-oh.
15111112211121122212.title: Deus ex machina

151111122111211222121.content:
The witch snaps her fingers again, and...oh, no...Lana’s shrinking!

“Can you be a hero?” the witch says. “I wonder. Let’s find out.” And she’s gone. And she immediately returns. “Oh, real quick -- new twist. You’re now both continually shrinking, real slowly, like a millimeter a day to start. You better satisfy me before you’re less than dust. Or just plain dead.” She leaves and returns just as quickly. “And the sister has forgotten Lana ever stopped by today. Yes. That’s all.”

Now she’s gone, and I can turn my full attention to Lana, who appears to be my size now, more or less. She’s some distance away on the tiled floor, and she hasn’t spotted me yet. She’s too busy gazing at her newly giant surroundings.

Before either of us can take any action, Lacy enters. This is my first good look at her at this size. She’s as beautiful as I remember -- basically thin, but certain attributes are, shall we say, expansive, and this perspective definitely accentuates all that curviness.

Wow, I could just watch her all day...

But then I remember this is Lana’s first look at any giant, and the shock has effectively paralyzed her in place. And Lacy’s walking right toward her!
151111122111211222121.title: Shrinking Lana

choices: Stragetically position yourselves in another room.
1511111221112112221211.content:
I sprint across the floor, faster than I’ve ever run, as Lacy’s thundering footfalls grow in immensity.

Lana just stares up at her towering sister, still trying to comprehend what happened.

I charge into her, shoving her clear of Lacy’s path. But I’m still in it, with no more time to move. So this is it. I die a hero, saving my tiny friend from a giant foot.

Lacy’s sock-clad foot crashes down just beyond me. I’m safe! Whew! After I pull myself up from the floor, I start breathing again and check on Lana.

“Lana! Are you okay?”

She looks at me, and I can almost see the memories flooding back. I also now realize that she’s half a head taller than me now. The witch likes to keep the ladies dominant, doesn’t she? “I remember -- all of it, about the witch and everything. And why are you so short?”

“You’re--”

“I know! But why? Why am I tiny, too now?”

“Because that witch was having too much fun watching my torment, I guess she wanted you to join in.”

“Billy, be honest. How much trouble are we in?”

“Well, when you were big and unaware of me, you tried to stomp on me, then almost accidentally stepped on me, sat on me, lied down on me, drank me, poured me down the drain, and washed me in the dishwasher.”

That all takes a moment to sink in. “Wow, that’s all very, well, embarrassing. And I’m sorry. I had no idea--”

“I know. I’m sorry, too. I shouldn’t have put you on the spot like that. I was being selfish.”

“Forget about that for now,” Lana says, staring up at her giant sister, who’s gathering some dinner for herself. “Let’s think this through. Oh! We have an advantage! Lacy should realize I’ve disappeared and--”

“No. Her memory of your visit was wiped clean, just like what happened to you. She’s as oblivious as you were when--”

“--I nearly killed you in several ridiculous ways. Oh boy."

“But there is one advantage we do have. I started out even smaller and on a busy sidewalk. I survived. We only have to worry about one giant person. Like Jack and the Beanstalk, kind of.” Only the one giant is a beautiful woman I find very difficult to take my eyes off of, though I won’t tell the little sister that part.

“I guess that’s something,” she says.

We both watch Lacy for another moment, both at a total loss of what to do.

“So how does it feel to be tiny?” I ask.

“Lacy has a really fat butt,” Lana says.

“Now’s the time to make all those ‘big sister’ puns.”

She turns to me. “You’re the experienced tiny person. So tell me. What do we do?”
1511111221112112221211.title: Escaping the giant foot!

choices: Run out of range of the broom.
Stay put and try to catch Lacy's eye.
15111112211121122212111.content:
"We have to get closer to her level," I calmly tell my new companion in miniaturization, as if I know what I'm talking about. "Then we'll have a shot at her hearing us."

Lana nods, looking around at the enormous kitchen -- the table, chairs, cabinets, fridge -- and she asks a very good question. "How?"

My confidence falters. "Well, we find something to climb, and we, uh, climb."

"Like what?"

"Like...Oh, those chair legs might be at enough of an angle that we could scoot up and..."

"I am not getting on any giant chairs at this size."

There really aren't any good climbing surfaces around here, are there? Except...those giant jeans Lacy's wearing might be something we could grab a hold of.

"We could grab a hold of her pants--"

And Lacy smacks my arm. "You do not get to grab my sister."

"I mean climb up her. The higher we get, the better the odds she'd hear us, and we wouldn't have to worry about her walking away, now would we?"

"What if we slip and fall?"

"Well, we just...wouldn't."

"Do we have super-tiny-person-endurance?"

"...I'm guessing we might not..."

"Then we're not climbing my sister!" Lana marches toward Lacy, who's reaching up into a cabinet. The little sister starts waving her arms and shouting, "Lacy! I'm down here! Hey, Lacy!"

I rush after her. "Is that any less futile than my ideas?"

"It comes with the plus side of zero chance of us plunging to our dea--"

CRASH! A cereal box plummets from the cabinet due to a bit of clumsiness on Lacy's part. The top flies open, and boulders come tumbling at us -- thankfully not very heavy boulders, but Lana and I find ourselves in the middle of a sea of cereal.

Lacy curses her own clumsiness as she grabs a broom from beside the fridge.
15111112211121122212111.title: The man with the plan?

choices: Find a moment to talk to Lacy alone.
151111122111211222122.content:
I dread whatever’s about to happen.

The witch snaps her fingers, and...absolutely nothing seems to happen.

“You have your voice back,” she tells me. “You want to talk to her? Fine. Talk to her.” And the witch vanishes.

I look up to watch Lana walking away. She’s still ridiculously huge, but I can feel it in my throat. If I talk, she’ll be able to hear me this time.

But she’s not about to step on me, sit on me, drink me, etc., right this second. However, she is both mad at me and considerably larger than me.

Her sister Lacy, on the other hand, is merely considerably larger than me.
151111122111211222122.title: The Voice

choices: Resume the challenge,; go see Lacy
Explore the giant world with Lana.
1511111221112112221221.content:
No. It's time to man up, even if there's very little man physically remaining.

"Lana!" I say, loud enough to overcome the dishwasher, but not so loud as to startle her. Never startle a giant -- good life advice there.

She stops and turns back, reacting to the voice she thought she heard...but it makes no sense to hear my voice in her sister's home.

"I'm down here, Lana!"

I wave my arms as her gaze drops. Her eyes pop wide open as she sees me. She first bends, then descends to her hands and knees and lowers her head to floor-level for a better look at me. Her movements are slow and cautious, which spares me from more severe tremors, but it's not less nerve-wracking to see someone that huge advancing, almost as if she's growing larger still as the distance closes, especially if she's still mad at me...

"It's coming back to me," she says, no sign of anger at all. "How could I have forgotten? Oh, God, I'm so sorry. I can't believe I was so caught up in myself while you were--"

"No, Lana. Don't take the blame. It's all mine. I was caught up in myself. My insecurities were trying to force you to be something you're not, to fill I role I feel I desperately need filled. I wasn't respecting you as a person, just as a means to my own selfish ends. But you are a wonderful person, and I am lucky I get to call you my friend. So, I'm sorry."

Her huge face softens, touched by my words. "Aww, honey." She sets her flat hand onto the floor, and I accept the unspoken invitation to climb aboard. Gently, she lifts me as she stands, and holds me close to her face, her expression warm. "I shouldn't blame you for feeling lonely. I've been where you are...well, not tiny, but...We're all a little lost at our age, aren't we?" She extends a finger toward me. "Friends?"

I touch the digit, and we "shake."

"Thank you, Lana. I couldn't ask for a better friend."

"Likewise, little buddy. Now what do we do about getting you back to normal size?"

My first thought is to go say hello to her nice sister to resume the "challenge." Or maybe I could put it on hold, and Lana and I could just hang out like we used to, just with a ridiculous size disparity, but it would be a unique bonding experience, the sort of experience in which unbreakable friendships are forged.

I mean, I'm not likely to ever experience the world from this perspective again, right? Now that all imminent danger has passed and I've got a "giant" ally watching out for me, why not take time to really soak it in?
1511111221112112221221.title: A tiny apology

choices: All right, let's talk to Lacy.
15111112211121122212212.content:
"Actually," I start, hesitating briefly. Am I sure about this? Yeah, it feels right. "I want to stay small for a little while longer."

Her enormous relative size seems to heighten her confusion, or maybe I am being that ridiculous. "You...what? You like being an itty bitty person?" she says.

"Well, not forever, obviously," I say from the palm of her hand. "It's just an amazing opportunity to see the world from a unique perspective. I haven't had a chance to really take it all in yet. And look, that witch shrank me as punishment, so instead, I want to own this. What's the best revenge? Being happy and content, right? So how about you go wherever you want to go, do whatever you want to do, and I just tag along and explore the giant world? And I'll tell you all about it."

"You're very brave," Lana says. "I'd be scared to move if I were tiny."

"I was for a second. Then someone was about to step on me."

Her face contorted as she imagined that scenario. "You sure about this, little buddy?"

I am, even if I'm not sure why. Does some strange part of me like the idea of Lana being a powerful giant? Or do I want to make sure the lesson really sticks, that Lana is her own person with her own agency and independent life that goes far, far beyond me? As long as she's over seven hundred feet tall, relatively speaking, I can only view her with an incredible sense of grandeur. I can get to know her in a way I never could as a normal-sized roommate who was just crushing on her.

For the first time since this began, I'm excited about the idea of Lana being gigantic. This is going to be amazing.

"I'm sure. I want to enjoy being shrunken, and then I'll work on growing back."

"Okay, well, it's your size, I guess. But you are soooo tiny right now. You're like not even an inch. How about you just talk to Lacy for now so you can be just a pinch bigger and I'd have an easier time seeing you?" She pinches her fingers together to assure me I couldn't possibly grow too much by talking to girl #2 of 10.
15111112211121122212212.title: I want to stay small!

151111122111211222122121.content:
Never argue with a giant. And Lana is correct...A little boost in size will be safer, but I'll still be tiny enough to have the experience I'm aiming for.

Only problem is Lacy is so stunningly hot, she's kind of intimidating. And that was at normal size. She's a voluptuous woman who draws men's eyes before they even realize they're staring.

I notice Lana staring at me. A smile has spread across her face. A sly, mischievous one. I recognize the look -- it usually precedes something fun. It's nice to have my friend back.

She puts a finger over her lips, shushing me, and then walks out to the living room, holding me in her loosely closed hand behind her back.

"Hey, Lace, I think I saw something leaking out of your dishwasher. You might want to take a look."

Lacy mutters something about how it was just fixed as she goes off to take a look.

Lana holds me to her face. She's so amused with herself. "Just to make sure you really want to do this whole 'staying small' thing, I want to give you this friendly reminder of how crazy you're being."

She gently deposits me in the center of the comfy leather chair Lacy was sitting in. It's still warm...hot, actually. Lana stands tall, smirks down at me, and returns to her previous seat on the couch.

Lacy returns. "It's not leaking. Don't scare me like that. Your jokes aren't always funny, you know?"

The gigantic big sister stands in front of me as she talks. I hadn't really gotten a good look at giant Lacy before now. This perspective really enhances the voluptuousness. I'm basically frozen in place staring, and I lack the willpower to do anything else. Then she turns, and an ass that was already large at normal size slowly descends.
151111122111211222122121.title: Mischievous

1511111221112112221221212.content:
I'm about to shout at Lacy not to sit on me, which is what I'm sure Lana was counting on. She knows I'm in no real danger with my normal-ish voice, and my sudden shout from her seat would give Lacy quite the startle. The result: lots of fun for Lana.

But two can play at the mischievous game, Lana. Oh, yes.

Instead of issuing an alarmed shout as Lana intended, I hustle to the back of the seat, safely out of range. Lacy's depression causes me to roll back and collide with her mountainous butt. It's a rough ride but a much better fate than if I were beneath her...which Lana thinks I am.

"No!" Lana shouts. "Get up! You're sitting on him!"

"What?" Lacy says, not getting up.

I pull myself back up the depressed cushion. I am gentleman enough not to cling to Lacy's ass, although it does keep yanking my gaze back. Sorry! It's huge! What is it about a fairly thin waist and a very large ass? Why is that programmed in my head as a draw? Evolution, what are you trying to tell me?

Never mind that now. Lacy is standing up to humor the anxious Lana, and I'm wondering...should I put her mind at ease, or should I draw this out a little longer to mess with her?
1511111221112112221221212.title: Two can play

choices: Lacy speaks up with an idea.
15111112211121122212212121.content:
Nah, drawing it out would be cruel.

"I'm right here, Lana! I'm okay!" I shout from the back of the chair.

Lana's face swoops down as she bends, hands on knees, for a closer inspection. Once she finds me not squashed, her relief immediately gives way to gentle scolding.

"You! You scared the bejesus out of me!" she says, pointing a finger right in front of me. If I were bigger, I'd have gotten a playful shove.

"You set me on a chair. To scare me."

"Scare you straight!"

"Um, Lana?" Lacy says, now bending beside Lana and staring at me. "Why is there a tiny dude on my chair?" She leans closer, squinting. "Is that your roommate?"

"Hi, Lacy!" I call up. "I just want to thank you for consoling Lana while I was being stupid. You're a good big sister to her."

Those magic words cause me to more than double in size. I was half an inch or so, so there's not much to add on, but I must be somewhere between an inch or two tall. Lana and Lacy remain massive, though -- easily a couple hundred feet apiece, bare minimum.

Lana explains everything to Lacy -- the witch, the challenge, the memory loss, our making amends, and my wanting to stay tiny for a bit.

"So magically shrinking guys is a real thing?" Lacy says, still taking it all in. "And conditions can be placed on your growth?"

"That's about the size of it," I say.

"Another pun like that, and I'll set you somewhere worse than a chair seat," Lana says.

Lacy lowers her face a bit more, almost blushing. "I do apologize for the enormity of my ass. How huge does it look to you?"

I shake my head. "I have no idea how to respond to that. I'm just going to not say anything."

Lacy looks at her sister. "He's smart. Can we keep him?"

"Someone's got to keep him out of trouble," Lana says.

"And not put me in trouble!" I interject.

Lana continues, "So what now, little buddy?"
15111112211121122212212121.title: Don't be cruel

151111122111211222122121212.content:
"Hey, I know of a good use for you size," Lacy says. "You could be like a little spy. I supervise cashiers at Target, and I think this girl has been shoplifting during her breaks. She's been smart about it -- haven't been able to catch her on camera yet, but I know she's up to something. You could be my extra set of eyes. And just think, you'd have more opportunities to stare at my chest."

Oh. Am I that obvious?

"Sorry," I say sheepishly.

"You get a pass for being too small to actually do anything," Lacy says. "But when you grow up again, remember where my eyes are."

"Yes, ma'am."

"So, wanna be my little spy?"

Lana shakes her head. "That sounds really dangerous. He could get stepped on. What if this girl shoplifts him?"

Lacy looks down on me. "He seems like a brave boy."

"I'm a man," I say, and the two giant women laugh.

"The world needs more tiny boys," Lacy says, smiling. "You are the cutest little thing."

I wanted to spend more time with Lana, but I can't lie...Time with gorgeous Lacy would not be a bad thing, except for the fact that it involves work.

Do I want to be Lacy's spy?
151111122111211222122121212.title: Should you choose to accept...

choices: Listen to Lacy - you don't need back-up
Lana loves me?  She should stay close
1511111221112112221221212121.content:
"Flattery will get you everywhere, Lacy," I smile, not that either woman can see the expression on an inch-tall man. "I'll do it."

"Good boy," she smirks in reply, winking. "Perhaps I should explain the situation over dinner."

And she does. The evening passes in a blur, as I am alternately passed between the sisters as one and then the other takes a turn at the cooker, sharing the duties of preparing the food as they share the duty of ensuring my safety. The quantities of food dished up are impressive, steaming mounds that terrify and tantalise in equal measure.

My own portion is a tiny dab from the edge of a plate, off-cuts of meat and vegetable that would barely be enough to get stuck between the teeth of one of these humungous women. Yet I'm still full before I can finish, not only of food but the information that Lacy doles out in between filling her cavernous mouth, chewing over morsels dozens of times my size.

"Her name's Claire, and she's a colossal pain in my ass. So cocky, she rubs my face in the fact that things seem to go missing on her shifts. Never so much as to admit it, of course, but she knows that I know and knows that I can't prove a damn thing. I can't be everywhere at once, and in front of the other employees she's sweet as pie. No one believes me."

A silence, and not one filled with that cacophonous chewing. I look back up at those darling eyes. "Um, I believe you."

"We both do," Lana rallies, giving her sister a squeezing hug.

"Anyway, with you being just an inch tall, I don't think she'll notice you watching her. Just give a shout when she's in the act, and we'll be able to prove her guilt!"

"I look forward to being crushed by her shortly thereafter."

"Oh, we'll take precautions! And I'm not convinced this'll be all done on the first day. We may have to play the long game. You've no objections to working at Target for the forseeable, I hope?"

"I'm going too," Lana says. "Like you said, you're too busy to keep a proper eye on everything, so I want to be present, just in case anything goes wrong. I couldn't bear it if-"

She pauses, looking down at me with - could it be? - the barest hint of a blush blossoming across the sky of her cheeks.

"No," Lacy says firmly. "If my sister is hanging around the place, Claire will get suspicious. You can trust me to look after the little fella."

"Oh sure, sure. But I'd like to hear the little fella's word on this."

Both look to me, and if anything I feel even smaller than I actually am. My room-mate's protectiveness is touching, but her sister is right, it might give the whole game away! Which sister should I side with?
1511111221112112221221212121.title: Putting Tininess to Good Use

15111112211121122212212121211.content:
As much as I like having Lana around, Lacy's logic is sound. Besides, if Lana starts missing me a bit, that could work in my favor! But I really shouldn't think so selfishly.

Lana and I spend the night at Lacy's. They're nice enough to fashion me a bed beneath a piece of Tupperware punctured with air holes, and I'm on the coffee table while Lana sleeps on the couch. The Tupperware unfortunately distorts my view of her gorgeous sleeping form, but at least I'm safe from any critters.

We part ways the next morning. Lacy has the morning shift. All suited up in her red and khakis, she says good-bye to Lana and carries me to her car. I don't know what's stranger -- that I spent an entire night tiny or that I'm literally in the palm of a stunning woman's hand.

I sit within an empty cup holder during the ride. It's shaky, but I'm not likely to go flying too far in the event of any sudden stops. I gaze up at Lacy, towering above me even while seated, and we chat logistics.

"One question is where to hold you until I can set you into position. I won't have my purse on the sales floor, and someone might notice me carrying something in my hand. A pocket's probably the best option. The hip pocket seems riskier -- I might bump into something or brush against someone. Since I'll be standing up the whole time, the back pocket might be more secure. Normally, I wouldn't let a guy take such liberties, but given our size difference, I can't imagine it will be pleasurable for you at all."

I can't exactly promise that. The gentlemanly thing to do would be to suggest some alternative that doesn't put me in such close contact with her.

Lacy continues, "It'll only be a few minutes, in any case. Then I'll discreetly fish you out and set you on the floor near Claire. What do you think?"
15111112211121122212212121211.title: Quality time with Lacy

choices: Head off on my own to find Claire
Jump off to sneak aboard another employee, to spy
Jump off to find and talk with another woman
Cause a distraction by shouting something
151111122111211222122121212111.content:
"The one problem with that," I say, "is that someone could bump into you, and I don;t much fancy being crushed between your ass and a hard place."

"Better idea, big boy?"

"Look, you've got turn-ups on your khakis, yeah?"

"I like the bagy look; sue me."

"So, I can sit there and you give me a signal - just some ordinary phrase, right - and I'll jump on out and over to Claire. That where, there's no supicion caused by you bending down all of a sudden."

Lacy smiles as she pulls into the employee car park. "Not bad. I promise I'll try to walk calmly. And the code-phrase will be: 'Hi, Claire'."

Simple enough. As she removes her seatbelt and clasps me gently in her mighty hand, Lacy swings her legs out to lie across the passenger seat. I am secreted in the cuff of her trousers and brace myself as she stands upright, walking from the car and toward the Target.

True to her word, she does walk slowly, and I'm barely battered at all by her shin as it swings back and forth, and I keep down, out of sight while I wait for my moment.

I can hear everything she says, as she greets the other employees, and I brace myself for Claire's name to come up. The suspense is too much, and I can't resist popping my eyes up to see where we are.

There are other legs about, all dressed the same, no manner of determining who is who. Looks something like a team meeting, prior to opening up to the public.

"Where's Claire?" Lacy asks, and some teenager grunts in reply. "Out back, getting changed."

Here's my chance. Sure I could wiat for Lacy to meet Claire, but if I jump off here and go seek her out, there'll definitely be no suspicion on her part! Then again, I could hang with one of these other workers, see if Claire has any accomplices...

Having a purpose beyond chatting up chicks has got me all energised! Of course, there are a few girls here at the store, and I could try to pick them up while I'm here!
151111122111211222122121212111.title: Inside Man

151111122112.content:
As I dive out of the way of her enormous sneaker a third time, I start wondering if I’ll even be able to make it to the closet. Lana’s angry, and she’s determined to take it out on this bug, which is strangely appropriate, because the bug is actually the guy she’s mad at.

Dammit. I really didn’t want to do this until I’m bigger, but...

She lifts her foot into the air again, but stops when she hears my voice: “Hey, Lana! It’s me!”

Lana retracts her foot--whew!--and she partially turns toward my room to respond, “Not now, Billy! I just don’t want to deal with you now!”

Oh, she’s assuming my voice was coming from my room, rather than from her foot, which I suppose is more logical, but not helpful to me.

I continue, “Lana, please listen...”

“No, you want me to listen to you, you come on out here like a man and talk face to face!”

And with that, before I can react, she unleashes her frustrations into one last quick, powerful stomp.

And then I’m pretty much just dead.
151111122112.title: Bad idea

1511111222.content:
Lana steps out. I'm a mighty half-inch tall now, but still the tread of that mighty foot shudders down with an impact that strikes me dumb with terror. But no! I've got to pull myself together and contact her again; I can't let that witch win.

So, I could shout up at her, since my voice carries that far thanks to the magic. But how can I guarantee that she won't react instinctively and just smoosh me like a bug?

My phone could contact hers earlier, so maybe I should try that instead. Ah! But the witch said that she'll remember being pissed off at me - who's to say Lana'll even take my call?

A second step brings me closer to the sole of my room-mate's foot, so I'd better choose soon!
1511111222.title: Talk?  To THAT?

choices: Take a chance on going out.
15111112221.content:
There’s no way this is going well. I’m about to talk to a giant young woman who’s pissed at me, and she doesn’t remember...Wait, wait, wait...That’s it! She doesn’t remember I’m shrunk. She’s never seen a shrunken person in her whole life! (I think, anyway.)

Lana walks toward the kitchen area, but I stop her in her tracks with a “Hey!”

She sighs and turns back around toward my general direction. “Billy, I‘m not ready to--” And then she doesn’t see me. “Billy?”

“Down here. All the way down,” I say.

She finds me, and she replays that dumbfounded look she had earlier in the clothing store. “Billy? You’re--you’re little?”

She can multi-task well enough to accept this strange new reality without going deaf. So I talk.

“Yeah, little, tiny, itsy-bitsy. Now listen, Lana,” I say. “Yes, I started to develop feelings for you, but they were as much a surprise to me as they were to you. This hasn’t been some long-term master plan of mine. I’m sorry I didn’t handle it better. I’ve always cared about you as a friend, and you’re a great friend. Couldn’t ask for better. I know that’s all you see me as, and I accept that. As you can see, I’ve been having something of a bad day.”

“I’m a little more concerned about your height right now. Or lack of it.”

I tell all. Again. The whole truth. As she listens, Lana lies down on her stomach in order to, as best as possible, align her face with mine. She rests her chin on her crossed arms and looks on me, and she begins to appear guilty.

She says, “You mean you were tiny when I exploded like that? I can’t believe I would be so insensitive to your, your situation. But if you’re half an inch tall, I suppose anything’s possible. But really, how could I? Thinking of myself when your whole life is on the line right now.”

“Hey, I threw a bombshell at you. It’s only natural you’d explode,” I say as I walk up to her and place a consoling hand on her arm. Technically, I’m barely touching her, but the thought has to count for something, right? But damn, weird how her face is so big... “So are we good? Let’s just chalk this up to crazy circumstances, and I’d be perfectly happy just being friends with you.”

“Yeah, we’re good. But now we’ve got to figure out how to make you better. We’ve got to get you meeting some nice young ladies.” She winces. “But oh, it’s starting to get dark out. You know how dangerous this area is after dark. Do you think you could handle spending the night small, and then in the morning we’ll go out and get you fixed? I promise I’ll stay with you all night, won’t let anything happen to you. We’ll just hang out. So what do you say?”

So I guess this has gone fairly well, all things considered. Huh.
15111112221.title: Here we go...

choices: Our hero breaks the connection quickly
Lana jerks away from the contact
151111122211.content:
Lana's hand appears, palm-up, beside me. To say that I'm intimidated would be something of an understatement. I approach it tenderly, the top just above my half-inch high head.

The witch grabbed me in her hand to place me on the floor here, but that experience was over before I realised it had begun; I didn't have the luxury of exploring the sensation at my own pace. Now, as I reach out my own hands to tug at gaps in my room-mate's skin to pull myself up into her warm palm, it lasts an eternity. The strain as I climb reminds me how much I need to get exercise, but I'm almost there, and the triumph will be so sweet...

Lana's hand rises effortlessly into the air, my legs dangling in space for a second before she nudges me all the way up with a fingernail. As I roll to a halt on her flesh, I look up at her smirking face and grimace. I just hope she can't make out that much detail in my expression.

"Let's get you something to eat," she says, and imeediately all thought of athletic emasculation are gone from my head: I'm starving!

I remain in Lana's hand as she opens cupboards and fridges, revealing titanic food that could feed a person like me for months!

Biting into a succulent green apple with dautning teeth larger than me, Lana allows the juice to dribble down her chin before offering some to the shrunken guy in her hand. Eagerly I rush at the fruit, tearing at its surface with my hands and mouth. It hurts.

At this size I'm just too small to damage an apple! I'd never be able to chew it, even if I managed to get a piece small enough to place in my mouth! Looks like the witch added another clause to my curse - if I don't get bigger soon, I'll just plain starve.

Lana has finished crushing and swallowing her building-sized bite by the time I inform her of this, but thankfully hasn't wiped away that trickle of juice. In a moment of quick-thinking, she lowers her chin to me, allowing me to drink deep of the delicious liquid.

Soon I'm done with the juice, and find that my tongue has met her skin...
151111122211.title: Acquiesce

1511111222111.content:
Agh! What the hell am I doing? Too intimate! Too! Intimate!

I pull away and stumble backward, falling flat on my back into her palm.

She chuckles, apparently oblivious to the fact that she was just in direct contact with my tongue. If I’m a half-inch tall, though, how small does that make my tongue? Really, she was barely in contact with me, barely...

“You okay?” she asks, as she finishes up a bite.

“Yeah, just not used to a surface like this,” I say, climbing back to my feet. “Feels like I’m on a magic flying carpet or something.”

“And I feel like I’ve become a giant,” she says with a short laugh.

“As far as I’m concerned, that’s precisely what you are.”

“It’s weird, but an interesting change of pace. I don’t usually get to be the tall one. Could get used to this.”

That smile is so beautiful...Stop! It’s so hard to stop looking at a smile that’s bigger than my entire body and is right there in front of me.

She’s gorgeous...

I need to control these feelings. I need to focus on something else.

“Hey,” Lana says, her mouth full from another bite. “Just thought of something.”

She swallows, which reminds me that I could fit inside of that throat. If only I had a cool submarine-type thing, I could do my own Fantastic Voyage...which would be disgusting. Who the hell would want to do that?

Lana continues, “My friend Felicia lives a few doors down. You remember meeting her, right?”

“Yeah...She’s the one with the cat, right?”

“Right. I was thinking, we could see if she’s home, and maybe you could grow at least a tiny bit bigger before bed. She’s a cool person.”

“With a cat.”

“I’d call her over here. So what do you say?”
1511111222111.title: Pull back!

choices: Felicia brought her cat with her
The witch has come to the door
15111112221111.content:
"It'll be fine," I say, hoping that I can fake the optimism well enough. But why shouldn't I be happy? If Lana could merely audition a series of women here, in her apartment, then I'll be back to normal in no time! I just hope that that witch isn't still hanging around, a fly on the wall...

"Great!" says Lana, placing me down upon the table and drawing out her 'phone. She's chatting away in seconds, and I can only imagine how confused Felicia will be at being invited up here at such a late hour. Still, Lana's smiling as she skips back over to me.

Then comes a knock at the door.
15111112221111.title: Felicia, Come On Over!

151111122211111.content:
“You stay right there,” Lana tells me, as if I have a choice. She opens the door, which I don’t have a clear line of sight to. “Hey, Felicia!” she says. “Thanks for coming o--Oh, no, no...”

What’s with the no?

Agh! Giant cat just pounced onto the table, right in front of me! And I don’t like how it’s staring at me!

Before I can even contemplate any course of action, the day is saved by Giant Lana. She swoops in and scoops up the cat into her mighty arms.

“I’m sorry, Felicia,” she says. “Really can’t have this cat here...”

“Why not?” Felicia says, walking into view. My God, she’s a lovely vision--gigantic like Lana, of course, but I never noticed how pretty this young lady is. She’s much taller than Lana, and she has such long white hair. There‘s just something really sexy about her, and cute at the same time. Maybe she can take my mind off Lana...

Lana hands her the cat. “Because I’m, uh, allergic. Yeah.”

“Then why’d you pick up the cat?” She’s smart, too. Well, Lana’s excuse was lame, doesn’t take a genius...

“Okay, I’m lying. I’ll explain as we take your friend here back to your place.”

Lana and Felicia exit, with that evil monstrous cat, thank goodness. I’m safe. And I’m stuck on a table. Lana was kind of my ride for getting around. At my size, though, I’ve got a lot of room to walk here...

I turn around to take a step, and...

Giant spider! Agh! It’s right there, and it’s coming right for me!

I run away, but it doesn’t take too long before I run out of table. But I haven’t run out of spider. It’s still coming.

The cushioned chair seat is right below, and below that is a pile of Lana’s clothes that I told her to clean up that never she did. I might have to thank her, if I’m brave enough to take this jump....
151111122211111.title: Felicia and her monster

1511111222111111.content:
No time to over think it....Jump!

AAAAAHHH!!!!

I hit the cushion, and as I hoped, I bounce off. I aim myself toward the clothes, enjoy this brief flying-like sensation, and...

Safe!

And I don’t want Lana to walk back in and find my swimming in her clothes, so I stumble my way to the floor. I accidentally trip into a bra, but I swear it was an accident.

I’m on the floor. Whew. Mission accomplished. And that spider is...It’s crawling down the table leg. Damn!

The door opens. Lana and Felicia walk in (yeah, she really is a tall girl, and those shorts she’s wearing really show off her perfect legs).

Felicia says, “I still don’t believe you. Your roommate’s tiny?”

Lana says, “You’ll just have to trust me for another second until you can see for yourself. He‘s on the table.”

I’m about to call up to her, but then I see that spider speeding toward me.

“On the table you say?” comes Felicia’s skeptical voice. “Riiight. Is he so teeny he’s invisible? Is that it?”

“He was right here,” Lana says, as her foot touches down right beside me.

I don’t have time to shout up to her. I need to hide! I need to hide...under her pants leg.
1511111222111111.title: Jump!

15111112221111111.content:
I climb up Lana’s foot and grab hold of her jeans leg. Luckily, this area isn’t too tight, so I have room to climb up the inside without actually touching her.

I hang there, between her clothing and her ankle, safely hidden away from the monster spider...I hope.

From outside, I hear Lana’s concerned voice, “Billy? Where are you? This isn’t funny...And don’t you dare make me look like an idiot here...” So concerned for both of us, perhaps.

Why did I crawl in here? I really should’ve just called up and had her squash the spider, because she’s a freakin' GIANT and can do such things with ease.

A revelation strikes me: I’m especially attracted to her at this size. Hanging out with Giant Lana is just kind of hot, really. I seem to have a giantess fetish, and I’m actually living it out for as long as this witch’s curse lasts. I actually want to prolong this. I'm suddenly in no hurry to grow.

But I can’t have her worrying about me like this. And if Felicia can cause me to grow just a little bit, I’ll still be pretty damn tiny, but maybe bigger than bug-food. That would be good. So time to c--

Whoa! Lana’s shifting her leg...must be getting down onto the floor to find me. I collide with her skin and lose my grip. I roll down onto the carpet. I really hope neither of them saw me...
15111112221111111.title: Revelation

151111122211111111.content:
I look up, and I see Felicia looking down at me, totally astonished.

“No way,” she says, as she lowers her head closer to my level. Her giant face fills my world, her very pretty giant face... “That is not real.”

To my side is Lana’s foot, with the heel pointing up. She’s on her knees trying to find little ol’ me. She turns her head and finds her friend staring down at her foot. “You’re staring at my foot? Does that mean--?” Adjusting her glance a little lower, she finds me. “Oh, Billy!” she says, spinning around into a sitting position, facing me. Weird to see something so large move so swiftly, and the force of her butt dropping onto the floor sends a tremor my way that nearly topples me. “There you are! I was about ready to kill you. What was up with the silent treatment?”

Yeah, what was up with it? Nothing I want to tell you. “I was, uh, dealing with a spider.”

“And you couldn’t bring yourself to ask for help?” Lana says with a quick laugh. “You shoot up to a whole half-inch tall, and suddenly you don’t need me anymore? Typical guy.”

Felicia’s still bent in half at the waist, and her head still hangs right over me. So I say, “Uh, hi, Felicia.”

“How’d you do it, Lana?” she asks.

“I didn’t do it. Some witch did.”

“Right. A witch. You’re doing some illusion, or you have some really sophisticated toy. Or something."

“You do see the tiny boy with your own eyes, right?” Did she just call me a boy?

“Yeah, and I saw him tumble out of your jeans. Dropped right out of your ankles.”

“That’s...What?” Lana looks at me, confused. “Dropped from where?”

Ever-skeptical Felicia says, “He was in your pants. Or it. Whatever this thing is. That’s where you planted it for your trick, right?”

“He’s not a thing, and I didn’t plant him anywhere,” Lana said, still staring at me, as her tone becomes far less playful. “Billy? Were you in my pants?”
151111122211111111.title: Spotted

1511111222111111111.content:
Well, the good news is that my talking to Felicia and her seeing my caused me to shoot up to something like two inches tall. So that’s progress. Two down, eight to go. Thanks, Giant Felicia.

But the way Lana is bending over me and staring at me with total judgment, that’s making me feel like I’ve shrunk all the way back down to ant size, or smaller.

I can’t entirely avoid this, can I?

“Okay, yes, I was hiding at the very bottom of your pant leg so I could avoid a spider,” I say. “I needed to get away from the thing. Just imagine seeing a spider from my perspective...”

She‘s not smiling. “Imagine seeing ME from your perspective. But you don’t have to, do you?”

“No, no, I don’t...”

“Why didn’t you call for help? And why in the world did you think it was a good idea to get down on the floor at your size? I could’ve stepped on you.”

“You don’t need to remind me about that...”

“Now be honest with me...When you climbed into my pants, how high were you planning to go?”

“Not any higher!” I quickly say, and I think it’s the truth. “I was seeking cover, and I found it. That’s all!”

Felicia speaks up. I suppose the two of us must be a sight. “Um, I have no idea what is going on here, but maybe I should leave...”

She starts toward the door...
1511111222111111111.title: Feeling small

choices: Run to the kitchen, luring the spider after
All plans go out of the window as the spider speaks!
15111112221111111111.content:
"No, no, don't go, Felicia," I say. "I should thank you for helping me make it to two inches, and apologise for having you brought up here just for that. Stay, we can have some food, some drinks, I can repay you for everything you've done."

I glance up at Lana. "Uh, that is, if Lana doesn't mind doing all the cooking,,?"

She rolls her eyes, but does relent. "I guess it would be rude to turn you out so soon. But now you do see why we couldn't have your cat around, huh?"

"Oh, I get it, all right. Petey won;t mind sitting this one out, I'm sure. Now, let me help you out..."

Both giantesses walk into the kitchen, leaving me alone and out of the hot water for the moment. No need to explain about the reason I was in Lana's pants anymore!

The twitching legs of the spider in the corner of my eye make me stumble. Sure, I'm two inches now, but that spider is still a dangerous predator! It stalks closer, utterly silent and implacable. I could shout to the girls, bring them running, show that I wasn't lying! Of course, they may not get in here quick enough, and the beast may be on me.

I could run to the kitchen myself, with the spider chasing me, and prove my story thusly. So long as it follows me.

But I'm a big boy, now! I could slay the spider myself, and drag its corpse around as proof of victory!

It is a living creature though, and it's not its fault there's a tiny human for it to prey upon. I could just evade it until it gives up, and let it live on to go back to hunting flies.
15111112221111111111.title: Aplogies All Around

choices: ...Lana can no longer see or hear you.
151111122211112.content:
Lana heads over to the door, which is out of my sight, unfortunately. But in a second, I’ll have two lovely women giving me plenty of attention--however large they may be at the moment--so I can wait.

Lana says, “Hey, Fe--Oh, sorry. You’re not who I was expecting.”

“And I wasn’t expecting you to interfere.” Oh, dammit. I know that voice.

Lana says, “I’m not following...”

I shout out, “Lana! That’s the witch! Get away!”

“No, not yet,” the witch says. “I have to make the game just a tiny bit more challenging first.”

I hear the witch snap her fingers, and suddenly...
151111122211112.title: Surprise visitor

choices: I stand where I am and shout up to Felicia
I tell Lana to run, save herself
I grab Lana and drag her behind as we try to outrun the cat
I push Lana between Felicia's legs, so the woman is between us and the cat
I shout, trying to scare the cat off
1511111222111121.content:
I wante to be able to stand on even ground with Lana, but this is not how I wanted it to play out. She's freaking out as she looks up as the gigantic witch, who stands with hands on hips as she cackles. Genuinely cackles. I guess some of the steretypes are true.

"Toodles," she says before walking off, leaving the door to our apartment wide open.

I'm holding Lana in my arms in moments, patting at her hair as she just shakes in shock. "We'll get through this Lana. You're stronger than me, after all."

She doesn't get a chance to reply, as a large creature approaches up the stairs. It's Felicia, her long, white hair a dead giveaway. I would spend more time internally commenting on her sexiness were I not distracted by the beast in her arms. Her pet cat, which she's brought up to visit us!

Shit.

Before either of us wee folk can speak up, the giantess is gasping, no doubt shocked by the open door. She shouts our names, dropping her pet as she steps over the treshold. That monster will be on us in moments.
1511111222111121.title: Cat Food

15111112221112.content:
