It’s a tempting proposal, and I could certainly use the height, but I really want to hang out with just Lana for a while. What if Felicia came over and didn’t want to leave anytime soon? And anyway, I’m at least already not as tiny as I was.

“You know what?” I say. “Might be better just to wait until tomorrow, when we can find some total strangers for me to meet.”

“I gotcha,” Lana says. “You want to embarrass yourself in front of random people you’ll probably never see again.”

“Yeah, pretty much. So let’s just hang out for now, and for the love of God, watch where you step at all times.”

Lana chuckles. “Sure, as long you behave yourself.” Her gorgeous face lights up with an idea. “Oh! Here’s one way you can take advantage of your new size...” She carries me over to the den area and sets me on the coffee table, in front of my now-massive television set. “Your home entertainment system just got a whole lot bigger,” she says.

“Excellent idea. As long as you’re willing to, you know, operate everything.”

“Yeah, you’re just gonna have to put up with my choice of DVDs this time,” she says, and I must confess (to myself, never to her) that I derive far too much pleasure watching her crouch down to put that DVD in.

She plops down on the couch behind me, and we begin watching my jumbo-screen television.

...But it’s getting late, and after much viewing and teasing me about my lack of height, Lana eventually drifts off to sleep on the couch.

I turn away from the television and just stare at her giant, sleeping form for a moment. Absolutely gorgeous.

A dangerous thought occurs to me...I can probably hop onto the couch and go hiking across her body--on top of her clothes, that is, not any actual skin, just kind of roam from the surface of her pants up to her hair and hop off. That wouldn’t be too terrible a thing, would it? It would be like I’m just getting exercise on a unique surface.

But if she caught me, she might just kill me. And maybe it is the wrong thing to do anyway...

Should I be a gentleman and turn away, or should I indulge in a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity?
15111112221112.title: Temptation

151111122211121.content:
No, I have to do the right thing. So I simply turn toward my “big screen” TV, and I watch the rest of the movie. I let Lana sleep in peace.

As the credits roll, I feel somewhat strange, and I abruptly shoot up in height. I feel huge, until I look at my surroundings and see that everything else is still huge. But nothing is as huge as it was.

I estimate I’m about two inches tall now. But how? I didn’t talk to anyone...

I hear the witch’s voice in my head: “I decided to give you a little time off for good behavior. Consider that two down, eight to go.”

Wow, is she actually merciful?

“No, I’m not.” Damn, she’s reading my mind. I don’t really like that. “Too bad.” Uhh... “You’re lucky it’s time for me to go. But I’ll be back later to check in. But remember, that last boost in size is contingent upon your continued good behavior.”

I’ll have to keep that in my mind.

Behind me, Lana moans. I turn and find her waking up and rising to a sitting position.

“Hey there, tiny roomie,” she says, still groggy. “Sorry I fell asleep. Hope there weren’t any bugs or anything you needed my help with...” Then she wakes up, and leans in for a closer look. She looks smaller than before, but her face still fills my entire field of vision. “Wait, you’re not as tiny,” she says, tapping my head with a single finger. “Is this wearing off?”

“Um...” I remember the witch’s warning about good behavior. “I wouldn’t take that for granted.”

“I have to admit, I’d be just a little disappointed if it was. It’s kind of fun having a pocket-sized roommate. Oh, maybe that’s where they get ‘fun-sized’ from...”

I’m trying very hard to forget how beautiful she is, but her apparent giant size makes her kind of hard to miss. I find I’m actually hoping to stay small for a while longer, just so I have an excuse to spend lots of time with her. After all, if I’m this little and vulnerable, she has to watch out for me constantly, right?

Should I try to draw this out for a couple of days, or start trying to grow again first thing in the morning by meeting new girls?
151111122211121.title: Reward

choices: The witch merely undoes your last growth spurt
The witch shrinks you even further than last time
1511111222111211.content:
Yes, I can spin this out for a little while longer... There's no rush. Lana will look after me, we can get to know each other better, we'll fall in love...

Before my eyes, the woman begins to grow again.

"I said," the witch's voice rocks my skull, "that your new size depended on your good behaviour! That includes your thoughts, you selfish prick! Did you really think I'd not be watching you constantly? Enjoy your insecthood!"

Lana swells in size, and gasps at what must be incredibly freaky from her perspective. The blast of air batters you from your feet.
1511111222111211.title: Bad Thoughts

choices: No one can hear you scream.
15111112221112112.content:
I dwindle down to my previous height, and then...I’m still shrinking?

Lana serves as my frame of reference. As her huge head hovers right in front of me, it keeps getting more and more massive. A side-effect is that she also seems to grow increasingly distant.

It takes all of a second for me to hit my original ant size. Then...oh, dammit!

I panic as I become smaller than ever. “Lana! I’m still shrinking!”

My perspective is all out of whack now. I see a mass of color and unusual texture before me, and I know intellectually that it’s still Lana, but she might as well have evolved beyond my universe.

“Billy!” she calls out. Her concern is genuine, and the action is pure reflex. Unfortunately, not only is her voice now migraine-inducing, but her breath is akin to a tornado.

Her air sweeps me off the coffee table. I’m flying through a space that I simply cannot believe is my apartment. The one positive is that my severely diminished weight allows me to survive this fall. I don’t want to even think about what the relative distance is.

I crash onto the strangest tree I’ve ever seen. Stupid me. It’s not a tree. It’s a tiny piece of carpet -- my thin, cheap carpet.

And I don’t think I want to know what that unearthly noise is, but my survival may well require me to find out.

Oh, my.

I have to remind myself it’s not a monster. It’s -- I think it’s just an ant, but it’s Godzilla-sized to me, and it’s not far away at all.

Now I really panic. “Lana! Help me! Help meeeeeee!!!!! Lanaaaaaa!!!!!”

I really hope she can hear me. If that witch got rid of my voice, too, I’m not even screwed. I’m just dead.
15111112221112112.title: Ant sized squared

choices: Lana has eureka moment and remembers she has a magnifying glass that may help...
Lana continues searching, concentrating, and maybe...
151111122211121121.content:
"Lana!" I scream at the top of my lungs, screeching as loud as physically possible.

A noise suddenly fills the air all around me. A deep, loud, booming sound that I immediately recognize is Lana's voice.

"Billy? Where are you?"

I see the ant moving towards me at a stuttering, halting pace that only further accentuates it's alien nature, it's long antennae furiously rubbing up against the carpet fibers and producing an unholy scraping noise that itself is comparable to some infernal industrial machine.

"There's an ant on the carpet, Lana, you have to kill the ant on the carpet!" I yell towards the heavens, looking feverishly out of the corner of my eyes at the approaching ant all the while.

"There's an ant...?"

It sounds like a warzone. Lana must be moving. The world of the small had been full of strange noises before, it's true. Even such a simple act as Lana crossing her legs or scratching an itch filled my soundscape with the loud din of shifting fabric and lord knows that it would be impossible for anything that large to move in silence to a being of my size. Yet at this height (whatever it may be, is beyond my comprehension) the simple act of Lana moving from the couch to the carpet in front of the couch sounds to me like what I imagine those G.I. must've heard storming the beaches of Normandy.

Meanwhile, the ant is getting perilously close. "Lana..! The ant!" I manage to yelp out, impatiently.

"I'm looking for it, it must be really small I'm having a hard time...oh wait!" She stops in the middle of the sentence.

I cannot believe the sound of her voice, but luckily whatever magic keeps my loud voice (which strangely doesn't sound that loud to me) from making me go deaf also stops other sounds from doing the same, although their volume is still immense. Then suddenly, I see it. It would be an exaggeration to say that Lana's index finger is now larger than her entire body was at my prior height, but it's definitely tough to tell. That same finger falls upon the ant and immediately pin it into the carpet as she begins grinding it into dust.

"Lana, careful, I'm right next to it!" I wasn't, really, at least to me. On my scale I must've been over 200 yards from the ant, but who knows how small 200 yards was to Lana.

As her finger pulls away my eyes follow it upwards. It's hard to tell what I'm supposed to be looking at. If Lana's near me, at my scale she's so far away it's hard to tell, until her face starts to descend.

"Where are you Billy? I can't see you..."

Her words release hurricane force winds. Luckily at my size the tiniest imperfections in the fiber allow me to hold on tightly. I look up to see her eyes gazing directly at my minuscule form.

"Don't talk so much, please! You're blowing me all around with your breath!"

I wait a few seconds to compose myself.

"You're looking right at me, Lana. Please, Lana, you have to be able to see me. If you can't even see me anymore...then..."

Then...
151111122211121121.title: You still have your voice.

choices: I somehow end up under Lana's magnifying glass
I end up before another pair of ants
A breeze from an open window catches me
Lana crouches down RIGHT ON TOP OF ME
1511111222111211211.content:
Lana snaps her fingers, even that motion blasting me off my feet. Then she pushes herself from the ground, her hands impacting heavily as she heaves herself upright.

"Don't go anywhere!" she shouts, "I'll be right back!"

I wouldn't move, but for her. Each step displaces air and dust, and me along with 'em. I'm battered back and forth, utterly unable to prevent myself from being abused by the simple laws of physics. Suppose I should be grateful I can still somehow breathe, but as I'm battered and bruised I can't bring myself to think that. I can't bring myself to think much of anything.

Pain and obliviousness are my sole companions, even as Lana's voice returns, and her steps smash the world into new shapes again and again. When will things stop moving? Where will I be once they do? Will I ever be free again?
1511111222111211211.title: At the Mercy of the Elements

choices: Someone else saw and heard you...
15113.content:
So there's gigantic Lana bent over me, staring right at me -- and I mean directly at my puny self -- so I'm thinking she's about to reach down and give me a big ol' hand up...but then she glances somewhere else in the store, as if suddenly self-conscious about how her inexplicable fascination with the floor would look to the workers and couple of shoppers here.

Embarrassed, she mutters something about being exhausted and overworked lately...which admittedly, she has been...and she straightens up to her full height and glances back down for a final confirmation.

I hold my ground as her eyes fall upon me again. I wave up at her. Don't know how visible my hand is from way up there, but I wave.

Lana's foot rises. She's walking off! Did her brain reinterpret me as a bug? I mean, yeah, that would make so much more sense, but...insulting!

The colossal foot lands on the other side of me, creating a tremor to all folks of insectly proportions -- namely, me. Pulling myself back up off my back, I watch my giant female friend beginning to walk away, and I'm thinking the only course of action here is to leap and try to grab onto the back of her ankle before she's out of range. Yeah, I'll hitch a ride home, and then maybe in the privacy of our apartment, she'll be more receptive to this crazy notion of her shrunken roommate...
15113.title: Cognitive dissonance

choices: ...the face of a giant teenaged girl.
1513.content:
Yep, just gotta wait for Lana to come in and lend me a helping hand. Oh, bizarre thought. She can now hold me in the palm of her hand. There’s no way this day is going to end without a ton of humiliation.

What’s that squeaky noise? Like something is being rolled over this way.

Seconds later, something huge blocks my path out from under this shelf. What the hell is that? I can’t see its top, but I do see a pair of would-otherwise-be-dainty shoes standing beside it.

Ohhhhh. I think it’s a vacuum cleaner. One of those teen titans is going to vacuum the carpet. Need to get out from here so I can hop to higher ground--

VROOOOM!

Too late! Damn, that’s deafening! My only hope is to grab onto the carpet fibers, cling for dear life, and hope to God that she doesn’t push that thing under here.

My phone rings. What the hell? It’s Lana.

“Yeah, Lana?” I shout over the vacuum.

“Good Lord, what’s that noise?” she says.

“Don’t worry about it. Are you coming?”

“Actually, I hate to do this to you, but--” No, no, no! “--I’ve really got to stay here and work on this paper.”

“But--!”

“But I do want to know...Who’s this girl you’re trying to impress? You never mentioned anything about a girl. You can‘t have a girl and not tell me about it. Against the rules.”

Behind me, the “wind” picks up.

Frantically, I say, “Lana, the truth is, I’ve been shrunk to the size of an ant, and a giant teenaged girl is about to vacuum me up, so I really need you rush over here and save me!”

“Okay, fine, don’t tell me.”

“Lana, I--”

“I can barely even hear you. I think you’re breaking up. See you when you get home.” She hangs up.

Noooo!!!!!!

I look behind me, and the front of the vacuum is right there, moving closer toward me. Its pull becomes stronger...and stronger...

I clutch the carpet with both hands, tight as could be.

That’s all I remember before blacking out...

When I wake up, I see...
1513.title: This sucks

choices: Hitch a ride with the missing object
15132.content:
I'm covered in dust as I splutter awake, and it's horrifying. At my size, the clusters of the disgusting grey-brown matter are huge, almost as big as me, and cling tight with a disgusting filmy layer, as if wishing to make me one with them. A small mercy is that I'm too small to breathe any of the gunk in.

But I can see. Enough light penetrates this dank, dismal place for me to make out my bedding companions, so is this some new design of open-topped vacuum cleaner?

No. It's open, and those two twin terror teens are looking down at me. Each head is humungous, their eyes alone larger than a full moon in the sky. Both are quite pretty, I have to admit, one dark and smiling, the other paler, glance wandering in a panic.

"Are you sure you dropped it?" the first says, raising a hand as if ready to plunge it downwards into my sea of filth.

"Yes! I couldn't find it anywhere, so it must have gotten sucked up!" She too is ready to dig in, and I'm smaller than her fingernail.

So, a piece of jewelry? I could find it by scrabbling around myself, and let these two helpful girls take me out of here surreptitiously, hoping that I don't get crushed in the process. Or I could use my special loud voice to call out to them. Neither qualifies to break the witch's curse, but they more than qualify to save me from this place, if I can trust them.
15132.title: Ring

151321.content:
If I can trust them. Yeah, right. Teenagers don’t exactly have a reputation for being the most responsible good citizens.

So I think I’ll just latch onto that ring (wherever it is) and hitch a ride out of this dusty joint. Then I’ll get back out on the sales floor, where I’m bound to meet some age-appropriate young women before long.

Come to think of it...I don’t actually know for a fact that these girls are under 18. At least one might be barely old enough...

A-ha! There it is. It’s about the only reflective surface in here, so that made it easy to spot. And even those giant eyes above should be able to find it pretty soon, so I better get over there.

I swim through the dust and gunk and grab hold of that over-sized life preserver right as enormous fingers pinch down on it. As the girl pulls it--and me--up toward the light of day, I realize something: Smooth metal is not the easiest surface to hang onto.

“I got it!” I hear the girl say.

It’s the Hispanic girl who’s got me. I get a glimpse of her gargantuan face, right there in front of me, and I consider saying something. Then my luck kicks in.

As she shows the ring to her friend, she makes the tiniest little wave with her hand, and it’s more than enough to fling me off.

I begin my plummet, which has the potential to last thousands of feet. To my side, I notice a seemingly infinite stretch of khaki. It’s one of the girl’s pants, but given all the motion, I’m not sure if it’s the Hispanic girl’s or the blonde one‘s.

I could angle myself to grab a hold of the fabric before I hit the floor, or I could attempt shouting up for some assistance and trust these girls aren’t as irresponsible as many of their peers.
151321.title: Life preserver

1513211.content:
The fibres that make up this denim wall are thicker than my arms. Presumably, somewhere beyond this tremendously daunting surface lies the skin and muscle of this teenager, currently standing still but capable of deadly movement at a moment's notice. A single step for her would be... would be... I can't calculate how far that would seem to me.

I've arrested my fall, I'm out of the vacuum cleaner and these girls can't help me. Time to go. If I look over my shoulder, I can just about see the surface of a chair. A leap to there, and then the floor, and I'm back to my quest.

Although, a few feet above me are the threads forming the bottom of this girl's pocket. If I could climb up there, I could allow her to do the heavy lifting. Maybe she has an older sister..?
1513211.title: Hold Tight

15132111.content:
You know what? In the off-chance I get spotted on this girl’s pants, the last thing I’d want is anyone to accuse me of inappropriate contact with a minor, so yeah, I’m bailing.

I push off her leg and aim myself at that seat cushion, and I land successfully on the soft surface. Now to--

“Hey, Jenny,” a new, feminine voice booms, “the jeans are a mess. Can you straighten that up, please?”

Oh. Wow. WOW.

A mid-20s woman walks over to the girl, and she is absolutely my perfect physical type, aside from making the Statue of Liberty seem like a dwarf, but that’s hopefully temporary. Wow. Look at how she wears those pants, and that shirt, and look at that hair and face...

She’s one of the most naturally beautiful women I’ve ever seen, like a modern Helen of Troy, or at least my own personal version.

I definitely want her to be one of the ten women I talk to, but then it occurs to me...I have no idea what kind of person she is. I assume she’s this store’s manager on duty, but that’s not a whole lot to go on.

Of course, my question could be answered simply by talking to her, but then again, how would she react to an ant-sized man? Maybe I should follow her around a bit, but isn’t that kind of creepy? Ugh.

At least I know that witch who shrank me is certainly not a pleasant person. But how do I find out about this even more beautiful woman right here?
15132111.title: The beautiful manager

151321111.content:
My plan is immediately derailed as the manager maneuvres herself to sit in the very chair upon which I'm standing. Not wanting to die quite yet, my attempted compliment quickly becomes a stammered "Please don't sit on me!"

Thankfully, she pauses, and straightens up. "Was that you, Jenny?" A negatory from the teenager causes the woman to look in your direction. I'm the size of an ant, so it's not surprising when she disregards my form against the black cushion of the seat and scans across the vast room, looking for the source of the voice.

"No, really! I'm down here on the chair!" I try again, and now the woman and both girls are crowding near, confusion writ larger than large across their faces. "Some sort of hidden camera?" Jenny ventures.

"No! I'm a tiny man, standing on the chair in front of you! Look closer!"

Jenny's theory seems to be accepted as the truth, and the nearest to anyone paying attention to me comes when her fingers hold tight onto the edge of the chair ahead of me while she cranes her head underneath to look for the microphone.

Just great. I'm literally standing right of front of three pairs of eyes and not a single one will acknowledge me. I should probably quit while I'm ahead. While I can't quite make out much of the room beyond these towering females, the exit from this room must be on the other side of them, so a hop to the ground and then between their legs should get me clear to find some people willing to use their imaginations a little bit.

The floor is an easy spot to get to, landing beside Jenny's left foot. Seems she's just about to stand up, and clearly her eyes have swept across me when she squeals and backs away quickly. "A bug," she replies to the manager's wordless query, and I prepare for the worst.

"You two get back out to the store," the woman says. "I'll put this thing out the window."

The tremors I feel in the floor are caused by this radiant goddess sinking to her knees before me, one hand reaching out. Gut-wrenchingly terrifying and yet pants-soakingly sexy at the same time, she almost stuns me to silence.

Almost. "It's good to see a person that doesn't just leap straight to crushing bugs, lady."

Recognising her respect for life has the desired effect, and the world shrinks around me, the fingers reaching for me now only the size of trains. The woman gasps at my magical increase in size, and this is a moment I can take advantage of to get away and look for other kind souls.

Or, I could stay with this beautiful thing...
151321111.title: Incoming!

1513211112.content:
I’d have to be a fool to run away from a woman this gorgeous. Even if it means I stay small a little bit longer, I’d say it’s worth it.

“You’re a person?” the beautiful manager says, in understandable disbelief. “How--?”

I recount my epic tale of the bitter witch, her sinister shrinking and the corresponding quest, and how one of those teen girls vacuumed me up and brought me into this office area.

After intently listening, the woman finally speaks again: “I am so sorry this has been done to you. I simply can’t imagine...I never thought such a thing was possible...” But then a different sort of expression spreads across her gorgeous face. “So wait...I almost sat my humongous, giant bubble butt right on top of you? Oh, I am so, so sorry. That had to be traumatic.”

What the hell do I say to that? Did she miss the part where her good nature allowed me to grow? “Don’t worry about anything--”

“It’s fat enough for regular people, but for you...“ With a self-deprecating smile, she half-jokes, “Thanks for reminding me that I need to hit the gym.”

Odd...As stunning as this woman is, she’s actually insecure about her body. Such a thought seems even less likely than my being shrunk down to my present half-inch or so, but there it is. Somehow, this woman doesn’t have nearly as much confidence as she should.

How can I help her feel better about herself?
1513211112.title: The insecure manager

15132111122.content:
This gorgeous woman needs a confidence boost, and I need help. Let's see if we can put the two together, shall we?

"Hey, what's your name?" I ask.

"Diana."

"Well, Diana, I was trying to get back to my apartment, to my roommate. My plan was that she could take care of me while I'm, well, little, and she could also vet some nice girls for me to meet so I can get my size back. But right now, I'm far too little to get there on my own. I could really use--" Don't call her a big person! All the wrong adjectives are running through my head -- massive, gargantuan, humongous. Stop that! But there's just so much of her right there in front of me! Stop! She's a perfectly normally-proportioned young woman who thinks she's fat, so no big adjectives! "--You seem so nice and trustworthy. Could I trouble you for a small lift?" Yes. Small. That's it.

"Of course. There's just one thing..."

Of course there is.

She continues, "As the only manager on duty, I'm not allowed to leave the store. But if you're okay waiting a few more hours, then I'd be happy to take you wherever you need to go. Is that okay?"
15132111122.title: She could be a big help

choices: A spider has made its web up here
Jenny wants something on the shelf
151321111221.content:
"Of course, Diana!" I reply swiftly, smiling even if she can't see the detail of my teeth. "I would have to be crazy to" - don't call her a gift horse! - "turn down such generosity in my state! So, are you going to keep me in your pocket, or..?"

Confusion migrates over that plain of a face. "My pocket? No, there's too much risk of you being squashed! I'll just keep you here, out back, until I get off work. Just stay where I put you and I'll be back before you know it!"

Seems she'll brook no argument, just the sort of take-charge attitude a store would want in a manager! Diana paces over to a wall, her hand rising to a shelf where some ancient-looking canned foods stand, and waits for me to jump off before withdrawing herself. "It will only be a few hours," she whispers. "Try to get some sleep, maybe? And don't let Jenny or the others see you!"

From here, high above, it's not so strange watching that humungous form leave my sight, as she seems so much smaller. Stuck up here, though perfectly safe, is also perfectly boring. I'm sure not going to risk jumping so far down to the ground, either. So now I play the waiting game...
151321111221.title: Shelved

1513211112211.content:
After an adventurous start, being half an inch tall has become rather...dull. There's this whole giant world out there, and I'm killing time lounging around on a high shelf, with nothing to do. Even my phone has died -- even though the magic allowed it to work like this, it apparently places quite a strain on the battery. So I'm left alone with my thoughts...

Wait, did something move down there...?

Oh, dammit. On the far side of the shelf is the beginning of a spider web, and its owner is right next to it. Has it seen me? I've got a few hours left waiting here, so it's only a matter of time.

The office door swings open, and thunderous footsteps alert me to the presence of a giant. I hope it's Diana, but no, it's the blonde girl, Jenny. A girl her size could preemptively take care of my potential spider problem...assuming she's not afraid of spiders, which would be an absolutely ridiculous notion from my present perspective.

I would just have to reveal myself. But I see a few pins lying nearby. They're light enough that I could wield one like a spear.

Jenny reaches for a tin container in the middle of the shelf, in the wide gulf between me and the spider. She hasn't noticed me, but that's easily remedied...if such a situation would indeed be a remedy. I don't know how much I can trust a giant teenage girl. But she's no doubt preferable to getting caught in a spider's web.

So do I pick up a "spear" and handle my problem like a man? Or do I reveal myself as an insect before this towering girl?
1513211112211.title: Man or insect?

15132111122111.content:
Jenny pulls out a set of keys from the tin, and I watch her walk toward the door. As her steps get slightly less thunderous, I worry I might have made a very foolish decision.

Okay. The giant girl is gone. Just me and the spider, which might not even notice me...

Oh, great. Here it comes. Oh! Dammit! It's coming! And it's the most hideously ugly, monstrous thing I've ever seen! No wonder people are afraid of spiders!

I pick up the shiniest of the pins and steel myself.

"All right, Senor Spider. This shelf isn't big enough for the two of us!"

I'm trying really hard not to throw myself off the shelf and hope I land on something soft. No! I'm settling this like a man!

As the spider scurries toward me, I charge at it, shouting an adrenaline-fueled, unintelligible battle cry. Focus: The spear can not miss the spider, can not miss...

We draw closer. This is it. It's him or me...

*SQUISH*

The pin enters the spider, and putrid gunk squirts out of the beast. Its legs continue to wriggle. How is it not dead? Even if this wound is mortal, it might still kill me before it succumbs.

I've still got a grip on the pin, and the pin still has a grip on the spider. And we're close enough to the ledge. So I swing the pin overboard, and the spider plummets to the unforgiving floor way below.

Whew. Okay. Now I'm ready for a nice boring wait.

I'm relieved that that winds up being the case. The next couple of hours prove uneventful. I get lost in thought and almost forget my predicament. My nerves finally settle down, and in walks Diana, still larger than life.

"Hey, little guy!" she says, flashing a pretty smile at me. "Oh, is that insulting? I don't mean to be rude..."

"No problem at all. For now, I'm little. It's accurate."

"Well, sorry anyway. But you ready to go home?"
15132111122111.title: Only one can survive

151321111221111.content:
Diana's purse serves as my car as she drives me home in her actual car. She insists it's the safest place for me -- even in a cupholder, I might get thrown to my doom if she has to stop short. Seat belts don't take half-inch guys into account. So it's hard to carry on a conversation, though she is nice enough to check on me every few minutes.

Thankfully, it's not a long ride. Diana cups me in the palm of her hand, holding me close against her abdomen while she knocks on my apartment door.

No response.

She looks down at me. The sun backlights her face and gives her a sort of halo, making her appear even more majestic.

"Do you have a Plan B?" she asks, softly.

"Check if the door is unlocked. She's taking a grad school course with one of our neighbors. She sometimes studies with her, and she never locks the door when she does that."

Sure enough, the door is unlocked.

"Hello?" Diana calls out, very hesitant to enter someone's home without a full-sized resident accompanying her. "Lana? Are you here?"

Still no response. Diana lifts me closer to her face, and there's no hiding her discomfort at her scale.

"You don't have to stick around," I say. "Just set me down and close the door, and I'll catch up with you when I'm big again."

"It would be nice to see all of you," she says, and instantly blushes. "I mean normal-sized you, not--"

"I got it."

"But are you sure?"

"Yeah, she might be a while, and I can occupy myself by exploring my now-giant apartment."

Diana chuckles softly. "I suppose if there's one bright side to being shrunk, it really increases your square footage."

"I know! I'm getting quite the bargain. All the space a guy could want!"

"Okay, if you're comfortable, it's your call. But where should I leave you?"
151321111221111.title: Anyone home?

1513211112211111.content:
Diana crouches down to the set me on the floor, as requested. I figure if Lana might be a while, I don't want to be stuck on some tabletop for hours on end. The shelf was a nice break, post-spider anyway, but I don't want to be trapped somewhere for long again.

I look up at my home, now magnified to epic proportions. It barely registers as the apartment I'm used to. It's like an alien landscape full of weird, towering structures.

"Last chance -- you're sure about this?" Diana asks.

"Absolutely." Well, not really, but I want to respect the fact that she seems uncomfortable ... and she probably has better things to do anyway. Remember -- I need to not be thinking just about me. "Thank you so much for getting me here."

"My pleasure." Diana rises to her feet. Dang, she looks amazing. "I'll be seeing you when we can look each other in the eye."

"Absolutely." I've said absolutely twice. How unoriginal. But at least I meant it that time.

She walks away, and I enjoy watching her a bit too much. Really need to work on that self-control thing.

But okay, alone in my super-sized apartment until Lana gets home. I hope it's not too eventful...
1513211112211111.title: Bye for now

15132111122111111.content:
The floor quakes with the now-familiar footsteps of gia- uh, regular-sized people, and I look back to the door. Has Diana decided to return, to take me away with her regardless of my wishes? The sense of powerlessness that that implies on my part is terrifying, but the care that it implies for her counteracts it quickly: someone that beautiful caring so much for me!

But no, it is behind me, the person intruding on my contemplation. Is Lana already home? I turn expectantly, awaiting her entrance as a priest might welcome the physical manifestation of his god.

But it's not Lana. The immense being that pounds slowly into the room from the lounge is certainly familiar, but not as my room mate. Remember that grad school neighbour I mentioned? Well, here she is in the awe-inspiring flesh!

Normally, I'd describe her as perhaps a little on the large side - certainly in comparison with the perfection that is Lana - but now she goes far beyond large. She strides past me in furious motion, rainbow-socked feet smashing down and sending storms of dust into the air from what I had thought to be a clean carpet. I watch with neck craned to take in every detail of the colossus, staying still so as not to invite a stomping. The earphones dangling from her neck explain why she didn't hear Diana's knocking at the door, and presumably she's heading to the kitchen for a little snack in between studying.

Roberta and I - 'Bob' for short - never shared more than a 'hello', as she's more Lana's friend than mine. I don't really have a good idea of what sort of person she is, but she should be able to get me past this one inch height before Lana arrives. Question is, should I follow her into the kitchen and try to grab her attention there, or scurry into the lounge and await her return, hunger sated?
15132111122111111.title: Not Alone

15132111122111112.content:
I linger in my foyer for a few minutes, plotting my expedition across this strange new landscape.

But no expedition quite yet. The door swings open, and my heart skips a beat. This is it. Lana's home, and...

Oh, my.

Her sneaker touches down not too far ahead of me, and I crane my neck back to take in the full spectacle as she closes the door behind her. She's huge! This giant is actually my dear friend Lana! It's one thing seeing giant strangers who I never met at normal size, but this is now someone who's supposed to be a few inches shorter than me. But she's got to be anywhere from five hundred to a thousand feet tall. Lana! A giant!

She's talking on her cell phone. "This class is killing me, and I almost mean that literally. I've barely had a chance to exercise in weeks."

She pulls her shoes off and casually drops them on the floor. They land almost like bombs. Either could have seriously harmed me, if not slain me all together, and Lana would have exerted no effort in doing so. She's not only big -- she's immensely powerful now. I better reveal myself soon...even if she's much more intimidating than I was expecting.

Her conversation continues as she strides over me toward our living room area, each step creating thunder and tremors. "My butt is getting huge. I walked by a mirror in a department store, and I was like, is that gigantic thing mine?"

I wouldn't argue at the moment. Well, I would, but only in the interest of self-preservation rather than honesty. But honestly, in normal terms, she's not getting fat. She may not be at her slimmest, but she's being hard on herself. Although, the few pounds she's gained equal more of her that can accidentally wipe me out of existence. So I better get talking.

Lana plops herself on the couch and wraps up her conversation as I timidly approach. This is very daunting. How is she going to react to seeing me like this?

I get as close as I dare to, and I say, "Hey, Lana."
15132111122111112.title: Hey, Lana is a massive giant now, how about that?

choices: Give in to temptation and ogle.
Get serious and get her help...somehow.
151321111221111121.content:
She doesn't react. She just sits on that massive couch, typing something on her laptop on the coffee table. So I try again, louder.

"Lana!"

Still no reaction. What's wrong?

"Lana! I'm on the floor! I've shrunk! I'm tiny! Lana!"

My voice feels different...squeakier, tinier, even though I don't think I've shrunk any further. I'm still about a half-inch tall or so. But my normal-ish voice has definitely abandoned me. Why? Am I suddenly intimidated at the notion of a giant Lana seeing me pitifully tiny like this?

Actually, that may well be the case. This is embarrassing, and Lana isn't some stranger who I might never see again. She's a friend I'm living with, and let's face it, she's the girl I've kind of had a crush on for a while now. Seeing her, like THAT, all of this has actually begun feeling real.

To further prove my point, Lana stands up and walks toward me -- or more like she intends to walk through where I happen to be standing. I dive away from her foot just in time, and she proceeds forth, oblivious. And all I can do now is just watch her and stare. Staring at her is no chore, but I have to do more than that if I don't want to spend the rest of life being, for all intents and purposes, an insect compared to her.

Though it is very tempting to indulge in some ogling before I figure out a way to draw her attention.
151321111221111121.title: Pitiful

1513211112211111212.content:
No -- keep the ogling to a minimum. That's the right thing to do. Right. Besides, this isn't exactly the safest size to be, so that's decent incentive to get my act together and come up with a plan.

My first thought is that I need to get to higher ground, where she might be able to hear me. But that's crazy. I'm no mountain climber. No, I've got a better idea.

See, the carpet is beige, and I'm wearing a black shirt and dark jeans. At my size, I'm easy to miss, but I'm not invisible. I just need to stand in the middle of an open field of carpet, and Lana will eventually notice an unusual spot. She'll probably think I'm a ball of lint or something first, but she'll crouch down for a better look at see that it's me! Boom! I get the results without all the hard labor! I am pretty smart when I put my mind to it.

I stake out my patch of carpet while Lana finishes taking a drink of water in our kitchen. I've positioned myself so if her eyes angle downward at all, she should notice something. Here's the test.

It takes effort to hold my ground as Lana's footsteps send minor quakes through the floor and up my spine, but remember -- it's time to man up.

She's coming ... Damn, she's enormous.

Man up! No fear!

Lana flinches and stops. Yeah, she's looking right at me. Whew. I mean -- exactly how I planned it, right?

"Oh, shit!" And she hurries back toward the kitchen.

Wait, why is she running away from me?

And she's back. With bug spray.

Um, yeah...flaw in my plan. Lana thinks insects are nasty. She will spray first and ask questions later. And at first glance, I do kind of resemble a bug, don't I?

Damn. I have no idea what bug spray would do to me. I'm guessing the fumes would at least choke me or produce some health issues.

Lana leans over to begin spraying, but her head is turned away -- she does not want to get a good look at the ugly bug, not until it's dead.

Time for a tactical retreat. But to where? Her bedroom door is right over there, and I'm small enough to slip underneath. Or I could hustle over to the couch and coffee table where her schoolwork is situated.
1513211112211111212.title: Brilliant

choices: Find somewhere for Lana to pick you up
15132111122111112121.content:
The couch would do no more than delay the inevitable, with me still stuck on the floor with an angry Lana eager to gas me. In her room, I'll have a chance to put together a better presentation without the constant fear of her killing me.

I sprint away, hearing the terrifying hiss of the bug-spray like a hundred angry snakes. It goes on for a good few seconds, and I can comfortably say I wouldn't have survived the torrent. No looking back as I scoot beneath the shadow of the door, but I can hear Lana grunt behind me - confusion at my absence?

No matter. I dust myself down in the once-familiar environment of my friend's room, and have a look around at the exotic new forms that now-giant items have taken on. A simple arm exerciser is massive to me: Lana could easily do dozens of pulls on that a day, and here I could barely hope to even climb atop its coiled mass! A towering office chair, devastation tracked through the carpet fibres where it has moved regularly, may be even taller, but could prove to be of use.

I need height. To pull myself up to somewhere away from Lana's feet may get me the chance to be more recognisable in her eyes. That chair is an intimidating prospect for sure, but if I put my mind to it I'm sure I could get to the top in... a few days? Not with that attitude!

What other options do I have? If I stick around here on the ground, then the same thing is going to happen with the spray!

Oh! I could always sidle up to one of the discarded items on the floor - like that arm exerciser, or some other more distant artefact - and wait for Lana to pick it up, saving me the effort of exerting myself! Of course, that poses its own risk that I may get caught up and crushed inadvertently at such close quarters!

Why are all my choices recently so dangerous?
15132111122111112121.title: Into her room!

choices: Wait and see what happens next.
No, dammit, it's time to DO SOMETHING!
151321111221111121212.content:
I feel semi-confident about the arm exerciser. She'd look at it before picking it up, right? And she likes to use it while procrastinating on school work, so odds are good she'll use it before too much longer today.

Solid plan.

But then the door swings open, and I barely duck in time to spare my head from getting taken off. Apparently, when you're half an inch tall, it's very difficult to come up with plans -- your say in your own fate is significantly reduced.

I look up and see Lana looming above me, bug spray in one hand, a plastic cup in the other, her eyes scanning the floor. She must've seen me scurry in here, and she's out for blood.

"All right, bug," she says. "No escape for you. Fe fi fo freakin' fum."

Lana really despises bugs. Apparently, they even drive her to talking to herself.

She steps over me and crouches down, to better survey the floor. She won't see me, though, because I'm behind her, and damn, I cannot get over how huge her ass is. Of all the times for her not to be at her slimmest...oh, who am I kidding? She still looks great. Hell, the additional curviness suits her splendidly. I could stare all day.

But dammit, that's what I'm trying to avoid. This is the problem -- my problem. Even before I shrank, I enlarged Lana into a giant, like a monument to be admired and revered, rather than a complex person to look in the eye and get to know without trying to get something out of the interaction.

That's over now. Time to be a real man.

I run toward her, shouting, "Lana! It's me! I'm down here! A crazy girl shrank me! Lana! Help me, I've shrunk! Lana! Help! Lana! Lana!"

Could've been more masculine, but oh, well. She gives no reaction anyway.

I finally approach her front, and an overturned cup immediately slams over me, trapping me.

So yeah...we tiny people are pretty much at fate's mercy. The giant Lana has me...now what is she going to do to me? Or maybe I'm not totally at her mercy?
151321111221111121212.title: Fe fi fo fum

choices: Lana is going to crush the insect, slowly
Lana intends to burn the bug with a magnifying glass
1513211112211111212121.content:
No no, if the last few minutes have proven anything, it's that trying to solve my own problems only lead to me making things worse. Let's let Lana have a try, I tell myself. She can hardly make a worse decision. And if she does kill me? I can hardly say that I don't deserve it. After my slimy behaviour, maybe I'd be getting off lightly.

The thick white walls of the cup move, one ramming into my side and knocking me from my feet. My breath leaves me as I impact against carpet fibres, my legs splayed in the air. Then the cup tilts, the wall seeking to pry me loose from the floor, and catching my legs against its lip. I'm flipped onto a rapidly verticalising wall, sliding down to the cup's bottom as Lana lifts it from the ground.

"No getting away this time, you little fucker," she sneers, showing a side of her I've never seen. Such hatred, focused from a face of fury, dominating my circular view of the outside world. Those vast eyes narrow into slits, and that heavenly upper lip peels back to display crushing teeth. Insects must be brave indeed not to run in terror every time they see a human!

I stand up, dusting myself unconsciously and preparing to state my case. But the world quakes, as Lana shakes the cup in her hand, a few casual shakes of her wrist catapulting me back and forth, smacking into the walls with horrible force.

"Like that, huh? Think you can go running away from me, and even worse, into my bedroom? Oh boy, you're in trouble, mister."

Would it be too late for me to apologise?

"Bet you thought you'd get me to spray you to death right here, fill my room with this stink. Well, I'm not giving you the satisfaction. I don't need this -" The bug spray is briefly in my view before Lana tosses it aside. "-no, you're getting something special. Since you went to oh so much trouble to get my attention..."

Oh God she's going to kill me...

Lana's lips purse, and she blows a small breath down into the cup. It's enough to capsize me, send me spinning about within the depths of my prison, and she laughs. Whatever does she have planned?
1513211112211111212121.title: The Passive Partner

15132111122111112121211.content:
Lana turns the cup over, and I tumble out onto...OW!...concrete. At least she held it close to the ground when she emptied me.

We're outside, on the hard walkway outside our apartment and our neighbors'. I get a brief moment to enjoy the fresh air, but no time to enjoy the sun -- because Lana is blotting it out.

She stands at her full height and lifts her sneaker-clad foot over me, ready to bear down. Is this how I die? Death by giant roommate because she mistakes me for an insect?

She's no longer taunting me, I guess because we're outdoors and she doesn't want to look or sound crazy to anyone who might be walking by. But yeah, definitely about to murder me.

I dive away from her mighty stomp, but then her shoe bumps me on the head and lightly pins me to the ground. Well, I wouldn't exactly say lightly, but a lot lighter than she could bear down. I'm stuck beneath her shoe, no wiggle room at all. Not a pleasant environment -- neither the ground nor her heel epitomizes cleanliness. Really unsanitary way to die. Oh, God, I'm about to die. I feel the pressure increasing. Won't take long before she squishes me. A slow squish. Oh, please, no, no, no!

Gotta try one last time:

"Lana! It's me! Don't squish me! Lanaaaaa!"

"Wait!" a familiar voice calls out, but not Lana's. Another girl's, but I can't quite place it. "Don't step on it."

"What? It's a bug," Lana says.

"I, uh, collect exotic insects," the other woman says, sounding embarrassed. Can't see her on account of Lana's oversized shoe pinning me down. "I know it's a weird hobby."

"I don't judge. But, knowing that, you'll have to forgive me if I never come upstairs to your place, ever. I personally can't stand these things."

"Totally understandable. Here, if I can borrow that cup, I'll take the little guy away and you'll never lay eyes on him again."

"Works for me. You have to move quick, though. Slippery little thing."

Lana's foot relents, and WHAM! I'm back to being trapped under the cup.

"I'll see you around, Courtney," Lana says, her voice retreating. "And again -- welcome to the building."

"Thanks!"

Sounds so familiar. I don't know any Courtney, though. A new neighbor? Maybe I just overheard her as she was moving in or something.

The cup flies off me, and fingers swoop down and pinch around the back of my shirt. Her mammoth hand plucks me off the ground and suspends me before her expansive, beautiful face.

Beautiful on the outside, anyway, but not on the inside. Because now I do recognize her -- the witch who shrank me in the first place!

I do not like that amused look on her...
15132111122111112121211.title: Small world

151321111221111121212111.content:
I'm held pinched in the witch's fingers the whole walk up to her apartment, dangling precariously from my pinched shirt, sure every second that its fibres will fray and drop me screaming to my death. I'm too petrified of the drop to look down, and so watch as stairs pass by Courtney, room number running alongside as she crosses each one.

The door opens, and she steps into a room that I would not describe as belonging to a witch.

Oh, it's new-agey in ways, with a few crystals hanging from the ceiling and numerous plants crowding every available surface, but there's no cauldron, no cat and no gingerbread.

Courtney brings me back before her face again, that ambiguous expression upon her face; she either wants to kiss me or kill me.

"You have the worst luck with women," she says. "That's what you're thinking, isn't it? But what if I told you it wasn't luck, huh? That's it's all directly your fault."

I prepare an answer, realise that it would be futile with my tiny voice, and instead wait as the witch walks over to a pillow-loaded couch and fairly throws herself into it. She lets go of me at the same moment, and I find myself rolling to a stop atop a soft, fabric mountain, level with her knee.

"I'm not big on lectures, so you need to be able to talk back to me. Would you like to have your loud voice back again? Or perhaps you'd just like to whisper your delicious thoughts into my ear; I could give you back your jumps, and you can hop on up yourself!"

Courtney wriggles in her seat as she gives me the choices, and the cushion beneath me lurches.

"Raise your left arm for a voice, or the right for a jump!" she laughs, waggling the fingers of her hands.
151321111221111121212111.title: To Courtney's Apartment...

1513211112211111212121111.content:
I raise my left arm, and Courtney bellows out a monstrous laugh. It probably wouldn't actually sound monstrous to most people, but combining the amplification with my entire "ground" quaking so violently that I barely grip the fabric in time to prevent falling off...yeah, pretty monstrous to me. What's so funny? I'm scared to ask.

"You never lost your voice! Not to everyone," Courtney says, still giggling. "You just choked up around your friend...who you clearly want to be more than a friend. You muted yourself, boy. Go ahead and say something."

"Um..."

"Hear you loud and clear."

Well...damn.

Courtney continues, "But you really can't jump as great as before because you are a bit heavier. That's not me -- that's just physics."

This girl is crazy. But she is a crazy girl who stopped Lana from squishing me.

I speak up. "Can I ask you a question?"
1513211112211111212121111.title: Be Able to be Heard

15132111122111112121211111.content:
"Okay, okay," I say, pacing up and down a little. "That all makes sense for a given definition of 'sense', but I don't get why you saved me from getting crushed. You ant to punish me, don't you?"

Courtney subjects me to another of her roaring laughs. "If I wanted to punish you, I'd have killed you flat-out myself! It would've been so easy to casually squish you into the paving slabs..."

I don't care for that wistful look crawling across her face as she thinks about it.

"I shrank you so that you would learn. So that you'd become a better person. You're no good to me dead, yeah? Waste of magic to shrink you down all tiny and then just have you squished by your room-mate."

Makes sense.

"But I think you've learned a different lesson there, haven't you? Don't try and get in touch with anyone you know. Stick to strangers. Wasn't that your plan when you tried hitting on me in the middle of a public street?"

"It was," I confess, standing up as straight as I can manage at half an inch tall. "I'd have bothered a lot of innocent women if you hadn't stepped in. I want to thank you for giving me this chance to improve myself, to grow as a person."

Yeah, I couldn't help throwing in a little pun at the end, but it's had the desired effect. One little compliment to easy-on-the-eyes hard-on-the-height Courtney and I'm swelling up to double my size! A whole mighty inch!

"Huh. Well played, sir," the witch smiles down from above. "There's your freebie. Time to release you back into the wild. I expect to see you full-size - no smaller - running back to Lana in no time."

She picks me up between finger and thumb, gently but with enough pressure to lave me in no doubt that she's in control. A twitch of those enclosing digits and I'd be snapped in half.

"Back outside for you, boyo," Courtney continues. "And since I'm feeling generous, I'm open to suggestions. You wanna go back where this all started, or have you got a better place in mind?"
15132111122111112121211111.title: "Why did you save me?"

choices: Allow Courtney to close her fist and be carried there in darkness
Ride on Courtney's shoulder, seeing the destination coming
151321111221111121212111112.content:
"Well," I begin, enjoying somewhat being the captive dictator, "the street's no good. People are in too much of a hurry, no real chance for me to make a connection. I need someplace where the women are more relaxed. And plentiful. No guys at all, ideally. If... if that's not too much trouble."

Courtney narrows her eyes, a thin-lipped smile creeping across her face. "I know just such a place. And I can take you there. Do you want it to be a complete surprise, or would you prefer to see it coming, and build a little suspense?"

A follow-up choice? I'm waiting for the other shoe to drop from this treacherous witch, but I should be grateful I have any power at all...
151321111221111121212111112.title: Somewhere better

1513211112211111212121111121.content:
"No, no," I say, shaking my head. "Don't do me any favours. Just take me there, and leave me. You've helped me enough just by saving my life."

Courtney's grin widens. "It must kill you to be thanking the person that shrank you, huh?"

"Just a smidge," I admit, before her fist closes around my inch-tall form, trapping me in pitch darkness, surrounded by the barely-restrained power of her hand, life pulsing through her blood and exciting my body. The female musk of her sweat is getting me excited, but I need to resist that urge.

Lana is the woman for me, and I just have to get to know eight other women before I can embrace her as a true equal.

Try telling that to my dick, loving this unconventional embrace from Courtney. Seems like I have a lot yet to learn.

Perhaps I should have been more specific about where I wanted to go; I just asked for somewhere full of women, and who knows how Courtney will iunterpret that...

When her hand opens, I find myself in:
1513211112211111212121111121.title: Delivered From Darkness

choices: Look for an opportunity to bail from the pocket.
Wait it out. She's got to return the key soon, right?
1513211112212.content:
I endure a very long five minutes of doing nothing on this big ol' shelf, and in the relieve my boredom comes Jenny the Giant.

The same big blonde who vacuumed me up is now approaching the same shelf on which I stand! I haven't found a girl her age this terrifying since...since I was her age, I guess.

I duck behind the old can as those pounding footsteps grow louder. Then massive fingers snap around one side of the can while a thumb clasps the other, and the can rises from the shelf. Oh, God! Is she looking for me? Did she already see me? I am quite a bit a bigger than last time she "saw" me, if still shorter than 1/12th of a ruler.

Split-second decision! Needing a new place to hide, I take a gamble. I heard that can jingle, so it's probably not sealed with food. So I hop up and hop in. (Nice to know I've still got some "leap" in me, even with my new heft.)

I land on something hard. Just enough light to reveal...a keychain with a big number holding a single key? Mailbox key? To keep myself steady, I clutch the ring while surveying the other junk -- it really is a junkyard in a tin can, isn't it?

But then those giant fingers reach in and snatch the key -- with me along for the ride, because in my panic, I neglected the simple task of letting go.

To my partial relief, I don't find myself staring into Jenny the Giant's curious eyes. No, seems she just wanted the key, so I'm now in her hip pocket.

Didn't Diana say there was a risk of getting squashed while in a pocket?
1513211112212.title: Jenny the Giant

choices: Call out to Jenny - scream, really...
Wriggle free and take a chance on the ground
15132111122122.content:
I cling to the cold, unfeeling metal as the fabric around us contorts with the movements of the titanic girl carrying me away in her pocket. It's not just her that's terrifying, of course, it's all women now. Any one of them could end me if they so wished it. Is this the lesson that the witch is trying to teach me?

Rather than focus on those grim ponderings, or the motion of the potent muscle at my back, I put my mind to task on planning. What could these keys unlock? In a shop, perhaps they give access to the storeroom, or perhaps the rear exit? There's no time to develop contingencies for either possibility as Jenny's giant fingers are back before I can breathe, forcing their way into the slim pocket and snatching me up alongside the keys.

The girl doesn't look down, finding the key she wants by touch, and so she doesn't see the pained look on my face as her casual handling of this keychain is pressing me between the harsh angles of the metal and the inexorable, irresistible strength of her pinky finger. It's grinding me horrifically even with just the gentlest, most casual movements!

I should call out, get the girl's attention, but that might lead to more intentional pain. If I struggle enough though, I reckon I can push myself free, although it could be a long fall to the ground...
15132111122122.title: She's Got the Secret

choices: Wait for her to say or do something.
151321111221221.content:
Pain wins out.

"Stop! You're hurting me!" I shout.

Jenny glances down and sees the little man she's pinning to the key with a single finger...and she freaks, dropping the keys -- and me -- all the way down to the floor.

I have the sense to not try to hang on to the key. I freefall the length of this girl's pants, which takes longer than I would've thought. It takes time to fall, apparently. No life flashing before my eyes. All I can think is, damn, that floor is going to be hard.

The keys crash first, and the cacophony of cheap metal on hard floor shouts up to greet me, teasing the pain the come...

Not long after -- "OWW!"

I'm still alive. Conscious, even. But I'm pretty sure I broke my leg. "OWWWW! AGHH!" Yeah, that's broken. I'm lightweight, but not featherweight. Owww...It really hurts and I really don't think I can move from this spot. Oh, God. I can't run away from the giant girl that's crouching down over me, lowering her eyes for a better look. She's so huge, so much bigger than me...

And I thought she was terrifying before...What the hell is she going to do to me now that she's seen me? What am I going to do? What can I do against this teenage monstrosity?
151321111221221.title: OUCH!

choices: Jenny shows Diana what she found
1513211112212211.content:
"Please don't hurt me any more!" I scream up at the girl, and since I have a regular-sized voice, that means I shouted loud enough for the rest of the store to hear, no doubt.

To my left, Jenny's foot presses seeming acres of carpet down harder as she falls to one knee, the hand that had held the keys abandoning them in favour of me. "You've got quite the lungs, haven't you?" she whispers, her touch gentler now as she scoops me up into her palm.

Of course, she's not taking into account my injury, each movement agitating my broken leg even more.

"Quiet!" she says, firmly. Then "Shut up!" as I prove unable to quit my whining. It's through tears of pain that I make out the annoyance on her massive face; I'm not quite the agreeable pet that she'd been hoping for.

Fingers coil around me as she closes her fist, perhaps hoping that the weight of her flesh will muffle my noise a little. Before light and sound is fully blocked by the skin and muscle of this teenager, I can hear Diana's voice, trailing off: "What's happening..."

She's come back, to see if I'm okay! I try to shout something in response, but nothing can be heard in this sweaty, boiler-room prison. Strangely though, I'm held more steady and somewhat padded, so I can break though the agony to order my thoughts a little. There's nothing I can do now but catch my breath and hop that fate is kind...
1513211112212211.title: Shouting Defiance Into the Storm

choices: I see girl begin to open the pocket wide and insert an object.
15132112.content:
I decide to make my ascent to the pocket, and the thick cable-like fibers of the denim make it easier than I would have thought. Luckily I landed very close to my destination, because at my current size if I had landed even mid-thigh the climb would have been impossibly long.

When I reach the lip of the pocket, I realize that at my current minuscule size I can easily stand upon it. While I take a load off I look down behind me and find that it probably wouldn't be too hard to get into her pocket. I stick one leg into it, then the other, and start to lower myself down. I'm so tiny, so unbelievably small, that even the most skin-tight of jeans cannot deny me access to my safe haven. Even so, it's not exactly roomy in here, either. I decide to use my back and my feet to bridge the gap and slow my descent, sliding down slowly enough that I don't injure myself.

I'm starting to reach the bottom of the pocket, when...
15132112.title: Climb to the pocket

151321122.content:
The walls shift, mangling and distorting in a most alarming way. I can't keep myself up as the pocket contracts around me, smashing my tiny form downward. I gasp even as the area expands again, but only briefly as the irresistable movements of this girls' hip and thigh grind onward, propelling her forward and me around and around her pocket.

It's far from comfortable, and disoriented doesn't begin to describe my state of mind. With such tight trousers, every slight movement is magnified ridiculously for a mite like me, and I'm battered mercilessly against unforgiving fabric.

I can't even keep myself steadied long enough to begin climbing out, so I'm here for the duration. With absolutely no effort on her part, this humungous teenager has trapped me.

Even in the moments where she stops - talking with a customer, perhaps? - there's not enough time to right myself and pull myself up those tortuous inches to freedom before she's moving again, smashing me back down to square one. Descent was the easy part, getting back out will be a nightmare; I may not even get the chance until she's removing the trousers, several hours in the future!

So, I could wait for that, suffering through the unprecedented torture of my current situation, or I could scream out for help, my outsize voice immediately drawing the attention of anyone nearby.
151321122.title: Controlled Descent

1513212.content:
Subtlety goes out of the window. I'm plummeting thousands of feet to my death, and only these giantesses can help me by arresting my descent quicker. "Hey! You two catch meeeee!" I manage to get out.

No response. The floor is rapidly coming up to meet me, and I close my eyes...

I open my eyes. Barring a mild impact, as if someone punched me, I felt nothing at landing. I check my limbs, finding no broken bones, no bruises, nothing! Luck..?

No. I have to keep reminding myself that that wasn't really so far a fall as I thought. That was about five feet. The world isn't big, I'm small. Like any plucky insect, my miniscule mass means a minimum of damage will be inflicted by accidents like that. There was nothing to worry about.

Craning my head back, I look up at the two 'giant' teenagers again, although I'm so tiny that I can barely see past their sabrinas. "Thanks for nothing, guys," I say, "I managed just fine without your help!"

Realising that two immature creatures could be of little use in getting me back to regular size, I turn my back to them and walk away. I don't get far. It happens so quickly that I can barely grasp it, but I'm suddenly shadowed, and then a crushing weight descends. My voice, at regular speaking volume thanks to the witch's magic, can be heard perfectly fine by the two girls, even if they can't see me. Confused, they'll look about, shifting restlessly in confusion.

It's about his point where I realise that I may be able to survive a fall from my new size, but being stepped upon by the foot of a regular person will crush me dead with no argument. One hundred and thirty-five pounds is enough to end me, and I know no more...
1513212.title: A Cry For Help

choices: I'm taking a chance on a random girl.
I should probabaly do a little research first.
Oh look, someone I already know.
152.content:
My legs are as jelly, wobbling from side to side as they struggle to support my body. Sweat oozes from every orophus on my body, dampening my forehead and the bangs resting on them. The salty drips cruise through my thick eye brows and gives my eyes a buring sensation I could surely do without. Pools of sweat grossly gather just beneath the pits of my arms. The thumping within my chest places my upper body into a near convulsive state, creating the illusion that it is the world that refuses to stand still. My depleted body is sending my brain the message of pacing itself on future journeys.

The common sounds of everyday downtown life are more audible to me now to say the least. The slight clicking of high heels clicking could now be better compared to cannon fire. I am able to catch an occasional word admist the chaotic non-stop thunder raining down upon me from what I would have once considered casual cellular phone conversations far overhead. Car horns honking in the distance remind me very much of light house horns I've heard in the movies, and also much like the movies, I'll take their sounding as a sign of danger and avoid them at all costs.

Okay, I must gather my wits about me and figure something out. This is no time to let my surroundings get the better of me. I have to figure something out. I have to...what is that magnificent auroma? It fills my nostrils with a heated smell of freshness. This is coffee! What luck! I've unwittingly manuevered my way beside Baxter's Coffee House. I've heard that coffee houses are great places to meet girls. Time to make a move.

Thankfully, the door is propped open on this fine Spring evening. The lowering sun lights the exposed doorway as though to point my in the right direction. I have a really good feeling about this.

I stay to the left edge of the small inclination leading from the ground to the slightly erected gateway to hopeful salvation, avoiding most of the heavy traffic coming and going from the coffee house. The quakes created by the various buildingesque feet slamming ever so hard into the cement earth makes keeping my balance somewhat of a difficult task, but I think I can handle it. I am proven wrong, however, as I promptly fall on my backside and tumble all the way to the bottom of the foothill and come face to leather with the gorgeously crafted red Itallian high heeled shoe which landed mere inches from me. That's it, this time I'm crawling up on all fours.

As I finally enter the bustling coffee shop, I begin to forget about the emense pain throbbing through my lower back. Alright, time to get down to business. So, the witch said someone as attractive on the inside as the outside, eh. This could be harder than I originally thought, and that's saying something.
152.title: Difficulties and coffee shops.

choices: Retreat! (Yes, I'm aware of the pun)
1521.content:
The moaning of an alto saxophone complimented by a wailing harmonica and bellowing trombone calm my anxious nerves. The thunderous voices of the outside world have somehow lost their intimidation upon me, sounding more like echos within a deep cave. The deep, rich stench of freshly baked brownies almost takes hold of me and pull me towards them. Spicey cinnamon and the light auroma of newly risen bread outflank my distracted nostrils. The dryness of my mouth of which I was previously unaware has now been remedied by a river of saliva running beneath my tounge, causing slight flooding to escape my lips.

The dimly lit room coincides with the last rays of sunlight to give off the appearance of candle light. The ground beneath me is smooth as ice, yet the dark-finished wood surface is hard as steel as well. Dark purple refracts from the walls surrounding me. A lone bright light from behind a massive fortress of transparent glass protecting various entrees erected far to my left serves as the sun in this relaxing universe. This being my first time in a coffee house, the atmosphere has really taken me aback.

Over to my left stood an elongated pillar of silver reflecting what little light came its way. Pointing my chin skyward, I see that the sky scraping shaft lifts a thick white disc of an unimaginable circumference off of the ground. Beside this impressive structure stood two silk-like columns overlapping each other at their rounded peaks. At their bases, two slightly declining ramps of flesh complete with five well manicured appendages with their tips dressed in bright red each were housed by light brown, curvey bottoms held in place by several straps hugging their tops. The overlapping leg sways to and fro effortlessly yet tauntingly, with the foot hanging above you as would the blade of a pendulum.

Well, this is as good a place to start as any. The question now becomes how do I reach the summit of this great structure before me. I daren't approach the bottom half of the lady in fear that my trek may end prematurely under her soles. Yet, there doesn't seem to be any foot holds on either the pilliar nor the chair across from my target. There is a "slight" breeze entering the room through the gapping entryway. Perhaps I could...

After testing the currents charging through the door, I am ready to enact my plan. I run towards the door counting in my head. Once I reach four, I leap with all the strength my legs posess. At the apex of my jump, a strong gust of wind rises from beneath me, propeling me much higher than I could ever hope to reach on my own. For a moment I feel the indescribable sensation of weightlessness, however this feeling doesn't last long. I soon begin to plummit at an ever accelerating speed. I would like to look downward to see where I am going to land, but the force of the wind counteracting gravity won't let me move.

My free fall was going to last an eternity, or so I thought. However, this dream was soon shattered by the impact of my body against a soft gooey landing pad. That's not to say the landing didn't hurt, though. I scoop a handful of this mysterious substance in my hand and push it into my mouth somewhat greedily. Sweetness and honey stick to my taste buds almost immediately. My fall had been broken by a gigantic honey bun!

Taking in my new environment, I take in a truely lovely vision. Her ocean deep baby blue eyes sucked me in at first. Her well rounded nostrils were the framework of a cutely petite nose. Those gorgeously ruby red lips parted to reveal the sparkling white jewels encased by them. Curly strands of brunnete ran from the top of her head to her strong shoulders. Her bussoms floated just above the table top, threatening to capsize it with their emense weight and perfect form.

The day dreams which I was starting to have are interreupted by her monstrous claw digging into the back end of my support. Now would be a good time to make my move. I open my mouth, yet I am unable to find the words. This could be trouble. Now is not the time for me to lose my nerve, but that's never stopped me before.
1521.title: I'm taking a chance on a random girl.

15211.content:
My elevation is increasing at a frightening rate as I am being drawn into the dark, wet abyss attempting to ingest me. Portions of my shakey platform crumble and crash into a dull white concave dish far below, each collision giving off a shattering echo. My outter layer, drentched in sweet white solidity sticks to itself constantly with great annoyance, though I have maintained a surprising amount of mobility at the same time. If I'm to make a run for it, now would be a good time.

"Hello.", escapes from my lips.

Did I just speak? Hey, all is well with the world. This is going to be much easier than I thought.

A high pitched shriek attacks my ear drums violently. My tasty world begins to tumble southward towards the glimmering surface below. I find myself promptly lifted from my perch on the bun, being passed speedily by boulders of snow covered bread. Starring into the darkened sky, a pinkish billboard wrapped in light brown silk fills my view.

"Who said that?!", the target asks in a slightly frightened tone. "Where are you? Is this some kind of joke? Well, just let me tell you Mr. Whoeveryouare that you aren't very funny."

Perhaps I hadn't made the best selection.

Finding newfound confidence, I am actually able to reply, "I'm here. I'm the one who said hello, and no, I wasn't joking."

The inverted cliff above you shifts from side to side with astounding vinesse and grace.

"Uh, down here.", I respond to what was surely a confused look on the magestic figure's face.

With that, I was quickly met by a hastily swooping tan bust guided by a well rounded nose and an eagle's glare. Recognizing the difficulty my potential friend was having in noticing me, I leap from my position waving my arms as crazily as I am able, despite the fact that they are less than eager to leave my sides thanks to the delicious frosting encasing them.

"Oh my God! Your a...guy?", the woman states in a questioning manner. "How did this happen, and what are you doing on my honey bun. Don't you know that's not a safe place for someone of your stature?"

I now find myself wondering what to do next. I don't recall the witch telling me not to explain my situation to others, but that is usually how these things tend to work, I think. No, the goal was to gain a greater understanding of women in general, so this conversation cannot be focused upon me or my situation.

"So, what's your name?", I ask with an inappropriate casualty.

"I hardly think that's the most important thing right now, but it's Lauraine." she scolds in her answer, "Now what about you?".

"Umm, so, do you come here often?", I ask, unsure of what else to say.

"Wait a minute.", Lauraine commands, "Are you hitting on me?".
15211.title: Making contact.

choices: *says nothing* and gets ready to flick you away
something that catches you off guard
152111.content:
Hearing this you are feeling embarrassed especially looking at the strange look that she is giving you after asking that question to you. You consider lieing to her, but then thinking about your challenge and what you need to get done you in a awkward tone "Ummm.... well you see... I guess I...". Luaraine seems to be getting impatient.

She comes at you with saying "Out with it". In which you just respond with a nod of your head and say "yes I was hitting on you...". Luarine becomes silent and gives you a confused look as she ponders what to say next...

(what does she say next?)
152111.title: Awkward but yes...

choices: Stay put and hope for the best.
Try to jump onto her shoe.
1522.content:
I figure it's best to get the lay of the land and explore my options here.

The closest table has a group of teenage girls sitting there. Absolutely gigantic teenage girls. From this perspective, it's hard to tell whether they're over or under 18. I think they're at least 18. Maybe. Or maybe I should check out the other people here. Besides, they're chattering so loud, it's giving me a headache. At my size, it will be hard enought to get noticed, but absolutely impossible when they're already so preoccupied.

I walk forward in a straight line for several moments. Glancing up again, I learn that my view of the teens has hardly changed. In the time that it would have taken me to walk back and forth across the entire coffee shop at normal size, I managed no more than a few inches.

Dammit! Why did that witch have to start me off so tiny? Did she want to make this impossible?

As I'm beginning to feel insignificant, I hear thunder. No, not thunder. The chairs. They're sliding across the hard floor. The girls are standing up...and walking toward me!

There's five of them, walking in a big, thick clump. I could jump out of the way of one and wind up in the path of another.

THOOM! A huge sneaker crashes down in front of me. Glancing up the khaki-clad leg, I have a fleeting moment to take in the sight of a giant, blonde 18-or-so-year-old girl. She certainly is pretty. But her next step will be a close call...
1522.title: I should probabaly do a little research first.

15221.content:
I've got nowhere to go, and I'm such a minuscule target to these young ladies, so I decide to hold my ground. Besides, it's not like they're trying to squish me. It's not like they even realize I exist.

On second thought...That's a shadow right over me.

I dive to the side, as something enormous crashes down. And it's not a shoe.

At first, I see a skyscraping coliseum before me. Then, as it crashes onto its side, I realize it's merely a coffee cup.

Luckily, it didn't topple onto me, so its contents don't wash me away in a steamy hot river of coffee. Yeah, that would've been unpleasant. Probably would feel like something right out of a volcano. If I even survived, I'd probably be permanently sticky and disgusting. Ew.

Less coffee than I expected poured out, but it certainly made something of a mess. I turn my head up and see that it was the pretty young blonde who dropped the cup.

"Agh! I am so clumsy!" she says, rattling my eardrums with her megaphone of a voice. "I'm gonna clean this up. I'll meet up with you all in just a minute."

One of her friends says, "Oh, come on, Kirsten. It's just a tiny little puddle. Let someone else handle it. Someone who gets paid to handle it."

"No, no, it's my fault. It'll take me two seconds. I've got it."

So...The pretty girl has a sense of responsibility. Suddenly, she seems even prettier. But certainly not any smaller, unless...

Kirsten walks over to a counter and grabs a handful of napkins. She returns, gets on her knees, and leans down to wipe away the minor mess she created.
