With my closer view of her face, I'm reminded of her outer beauty. She had these bright green eyes, and her long hair hangs over her face. And those must be some of the highest cheekbones I've ever seen.

Gorgeous. And, at least a decent human being...

I have to...
15221.title: Stay put and hope for the best.

choices: ...outside, behind the coffee shop, alone with her.
152211.content:
"Um...Hey, there," I call up. There's no way this isn't going to be awkward. "Uh, how are you doing?"

Kirsten heard me, but she doesn't know what she heard. She stops placing down the napkins, and her eyes wander across the floor, perplexed.

As she searches, she starts getting smaller...to me, and only me. Not much smaller, mind you. She remains humongous. Since I did my part by saying hello, my reward was to grow up from ant size to...Well, I'm not really sure. I'm probably still well under an inch tall, though, given the size of that face that just spotted me.

Oh, God. She just spotted me.

She lowers her head down, and holds it right above me. Her eyes are like these two huge UFOs floating in the sky. I'm half-expecting laser beams to start blasting out of them. Sure are pretty, though...Never realized what a fascinating structure an eyeball is. Of course, I never saw a pair magnified to this extent.

"Are you...are you a person?" she asks, whispering. I'm not sure if the whisper is for my benefit or hers. Can't imagine she wants people to see her talking to the floor.

"I am," I answer. "My name's Billy."

"You're sooooo teensy."

Hey. What do you know? She's genuinely fascinated by be. Okay, it's only because the witch shrank me, but still...Let's take advantage of the situation.

I say, "And I can explain why if you're, uh, interested in hearing. Uh, do you mind picking me up off the floor? And maybe we can go talk somewhere."

"Um, yeah," she says, still processing this new development in her day.

She sets her hand flat on the floor. I climb onto the strange, soft surface, and she lifts me up and sets me in her hip pocket. It's dark, but more comfortable than I would have expected...if I ever expected to find myself in a girl's pocket.

There's a gentle swaying sensation as she walks...kind of soothing, I have to admit. When her hand pulls me out, I find myself...
152211.title: Talk to her!

1522111.content:
Kirsten pulls me out of her pocket and cups her hands around me, which protects me from the breeze. I can see a little bit past her face, to the brick wall against which she's leaning. Above, a clear sky.

I tell her my tale of being shrunken and put through this challenge, and how she's the first of ten good girls I have to meet to restore my size.

"That's really intense," she says. "Must be kind of a cool experience for you, seeing the world from such a tiny perspective. I saw 'Honey, I Shrunk the Kids' when I was little, and I always thought it would be so cool to be shrunken for a little while."

"Yeah, well, I've had my little while. But yeah, I get what you're saying. It's an experience." It occurs to me to ask, "Wait a sec...You are at least 18 years old, right?"

"I'm 20," she says with quick laugh.

"Oh, good."

"Not like it's going to do you any good. I can't exactly date you at this height. You're soooo cute and all like this, but I think I'd get tired of all the crouching down and watching my step and making sure I don't accidentally sit my big ol' butt down right on top of you."

By reflex, I say, "You're...You're not that big..."

She laughs again. "Oh, you little liar! You cannot tell me that I'm not big. Not when you're looking out of those itty bitty eyes. My pinky's big next to you."

I lower my head and mutter, "Okay, fair point. Sorry. I just..."

"It's okay. And hey, I'm going to help you out on your little quest here. It would be cruel to just set you down on leave you for someone else to step on."

"You've got a big heart."

"But if you make another pun, I might reconsider."

"Noted." I find my courage again, "But how about this...Once I'm big again, maybe we could start over...maybe have a normal-sized date."

She bites the bottom of her lip, and a smile forms. "I'm impressed you asked, considering your, you know, position."

"Like I've got anything to lose at this point."

"How do I know one of the next nine girls isn't going to steal you away?"

"Well, you are setting a high standard. I can't imagine any of them will be prettier or nicer than you."

She gives that smile again...that adorable smile. "You do have motivation to be nice to me, don't you?" Before I can open my mouth again, she lights up with a new idea: "Hey! I'm with some of my friends. They went right to the bookstore next door. How about you meet them? That should put some inches on you. Maybe even feet."
1522111.title: Tiny talk

15221111.content:
"Yeah, I'm not entirely clear on all the rules of this crazy thing, but let's give it a shot," I tell my giant new friend.

This time, she holds onto me with one hand while it's stuffed in her side pocket. I experience little more than darkness and warmth for a couple of minutes. And then...movement. Being tiny may have many, many downsides, but even the minor motion of a 20-year-old girl becomes the equivalent of a free amusement park ride to me. Not gonna lie--It's kind of fun.

As her hands open, I see only her lips--a very up-close view of them, too. They're very textured. She's wearing lipstick, but not a lot of it.

"We're in the bookstore," Kirsten whispers. "I see my friend Bethany right over there, by herself. So let's start with her."

I lose sight of the lips, but I soon hear her again.

"Hey, Bethany, you are not going to believe who I just met," she says. "Bethany, meet Billy."

She opens up her hand, and I find myself staring up at the face of a brown-eyed brunette, who stands a little shorter than Kirsten (but to me, huge is still huge.) Bethany is also pretty.

And pretty damn astonished. Her mouth hangs open.

"Hi, Bethany. I'm Billy. Nice to meet you."

What's really exciting for me in this moment is the question: Will this encounter cause me to grow at all?
15221111.title: Sure!

152211112.content:
Bethany's gigantic shocked face doesn't shrink--not even a little.

Dammit. I guess the witch doesn't allow any help. Or maybe Bethany's not a good person? But she's Kirsten's friend...

"Billy, you're...you're not growing," Kirsten says.

Yeah. Kind of got that. Thanks.

Bethany finally speaks. "Growing? What? Kirsten--you've got a tiny man in the palm of your hand..."

Kirsten explains the situation. Yadda, yadda, yadda...

"...So I'm trying to help him out, the poor guy," Kirsten says. "He seems really sweet, actually. He--oh, this is funny. He tried to tell me I don't have a big butt. This little guy."

Bethany's eyes travel from Kirsten to little ol' me. "Dude," she says. "If I were your size, and I saw her bubble butt, I'd be frightened."

Kirsten adds, "I would be, too. Hell, it'd probably be enough to get me to swear off ice cream for life."

"Well, I--I was just..."

And then I realize something. Yes, from the glance I got earlier, she has a nice butt. Really, really nice. But it's one body part. It's not her. It certainly reaches out, grabs your attention and refuses to let go, but it's far from being the full story of this person. But so many guys are constantly looking at it whenever she steps out in public--and not just there, but the rest of her. She's being watched non-stop. And judged. And evaluated. If they like what they see, they like her. If they don't like what they see, they don't like her.

Everything she does, someone's probably watching. They're getting so hung up on the specific pieces, they're failing to see the big picture. They reduce her to a fraction of her true self. I reduced her--

Ohhhh. I get it, witch. Very clever. Lesson learned. Can I grow up yet? (Guessing not.)

Anyway...How does Kirsten not go crazy? It's a type of strength I never considered.

She's still only human. She's bound to be at least a little self-conscious of what people are seeing. How could she not be? It's like paparazzi-lite.

"Look, Kirsten" I tell her, "you're a beautiful woman. Inside and out. That's all you need to know." I'm totally sincere, and--despite my pitiful size--it shines through.

"He is sweet," Bethany says, in that "awwww" type of tone.

"Yeah, and we need to get him bigger," Kirsten says, smiling.

And then...
152211112.title: A change?

1522111121.content:
"Ah, here we go," Kirsten says to me. "Let's try it again."

A taller blonde girl enters the aisle between the bookshelves and smiles as she approaches Kirsten and Bethany. "Heyyy, there you are Kirsten. We were starting to think you got lost, like maybe the coffee ate you or..."

Kirsten holds out her palm--the one with me standing on top in all my 1/2 or so-inch glory.

"...something," she finishes.

I might as well speak up, "Hi. I'm Billy. So you're also friends with Kirsten?"

The tall girl...and I'm not just saying this because of my predicament--she truly towers of Kirsten and Bethany, must be like six feet tall in regular people's size...Anyway, the tall girl bends down a little to verify this strange sight. And I am most certainly the strangest sight any of these girls have seen in a long, long time--possibly ever.

"Kirsten, why is there a teeny-tiny little guy in the palm of your hand? Are you shrinking guys? Are you some serial guy shrinker and never told me?"

Kirsten starts, "Well, Lauren..."

She pauses, as the amazing happens. I grow! I grow all the way up to two inches tall, maybe slightly taller, but still. It's progress.

"Hey, it worked that time!" Kirsten says. "Guess there was some kind of fluke last time."

Or maybe it wasn't.

Lauren says, "Kirsten. You have a tiny guy that just became slightly less tiny, but still tiny. I'm used to feeling tall and all, but come on...Is it witchcraft? Are you dabbling in the black arts?" she joked. "We've talked about this..."

As Kirsten recaps the situation to Lauren, I wonder what's wrong with Bethany. The witch wanted me to meet good girls and appreciate them. Kirsten, a genuinely nice and decent human being, allowed me to grow from ant size to half an inch. With Lauren, who so far seems to have this interesting and quirky sense of humor, I at least quadrupled up to a plural number of inches (barely, but still plural.)

So what's the deal with Bethany? Or was it something I said?

Kirsten finishes the review, and Lauren lowers her head back down to my level. "You know, I've always wished to be a little smaller, but after seeing you, I think I'm gonna stop."

A cell phone rings. It hurts my diminutive ears.

"Oh, that's me..." Kirsten says.

Bethany steps forward. "I'll hang onto Billy while you get that..."
1522111121.title: Another friend approaches.

15221111211.content:
"Thanks, Beth!" Kirsten says, handing me over to the giant brunette who may or may not be evil.

Okay, I doubt she's evil. Kirsten wouldn't be friends with an evil person, right? Then again, I still really don't know her all that well, or any of them.

As I step onto Bethany's palm, I glance up at a face that seems almost...Does she look hungry? I think she looks hungry. Hungry...for me? No, that's ridiculous. Who in their right mind would want to bite into a two-inch-tall person? Especially an uncooked one.

Kirsten's already talking on her phone and wandering off. Lauren says, "I'm going to go get Jean and Ashley. They're over by the Young Adult books, of course. They are not going to believe this..."

So...Just me and Bethany. She takes me around a corner, where her friends won't intrude.

"Hey there, little guy," she says with a smirk.

"Uh, hi?"

"Now listen up. I know all guys have only one thing on their mind, and there's no way you'd be any different, not if you grew back. You see, I like you tiny. If you stay tiny, you can be with Kirsten."

"I don't think she wants me tiny..."

"Then you'll just have to work that much harder to win her over, now won't you? The world would be a much better place if all men were as puny as you."

"Umm...I'm sorry if you've had some bad experiences with guys, but--"

"Don't you dare presume to know anything about me."

"You're being unreasonable..."

"No, you're being unreasonable. Here I am, giving you my endorsement to be with my friend. Not something I do often. I just have this one eensy weensy condition. Look, I'll even help you out..."

I hear another voice: "Hey..."
15221111211.title: Kirsten gives you to Bethany.

152211112111.content:
"...I don't allow my little man to have help on his quest."

I know that voice. Oh, dammit...

I turn around, and sure enough, it's her. The witch who shrank me.

Bethany, of course, has no idea of this. "Um, I'm sorry? You know him?"

"Met him earlier today," the witch says. "And I reduced him to...more appropriate proportions. As I'll do to you, as punishment for trying to help this jerk."

I may not like this Bethany girl, but I'm not going to let her suffer my fate. I tell the witch, "Hey! Your problem is with me, not her! And I've been learning! I hate to say it, but this whole crazy thing actually is teaching me--"

"You're lying," the witch says, "because as a man, that's your way. If you had truly learned your lesson, I'd be looking up to you, not squinting down into the palm of a girl's hand."

The witch snaps her fingers, as my surface begins to shrink. I find myself tumbling onto the floor, on top of Bethany. Now, we're both about two inches tall.

Bethany stares up at the giant witch bending over us. She's too scared to do anything.

The witch says, "You wanted to help? Now you have to. You don't grow back unless he grows back. So, get to work."

She walks away. Bethany watches her, stunned.

"She's...She's enormous..." She turns to me and punches my arm. "You got me shrunk! I knew you were no good!"

Oh, God. I'm now a co-shrinkee with a girl who hates me, and her friends don't know which aisle we're in.

"Didn't you like me a moment ago?" I say. "You said I was good enough for your friend."

"Yeah, that's when I was big enough that I could squish you if you hurt her. Now..." She stares up at the towering shelves. The frightening image silences her.

I say, "It won't be too horrible. I started out much, much smaller, and I survived, thanks to Kirsten. So let's find her..."
152211112111.title: The witch returns,

1522111121111.content:
I take the lead and stride down the tremendously long aisle of books. Pretty quickly, I realize Bethany's not following.

"Are you coming?" I ask.

Bethany--the only person in the world who looks normal-sized to me--stands in the middle of the over-sized aisle, shaking her head. She's still scared. Can't blame her.

"Look, Bethany, this size we're at--it's temporary. You already saw me grow a little..."

"I know," she says. "But we're not going to my friends."

"Why not? We're little. They're big..."

"Yeah, that's the point!" She looks down and mutters, "I don't want them seeing me like this..."

"They saw me even smaller..."

"You're not their friend. You're just some guy." She lifts her head as she gets an idea. "Oh! And the witch shrank me because I was helping you. How do you know she's not going to do the same to Kirsten? Do you want to be responsible for your crush getting shrunk?"

"That...Okay, that's a good point. Can't help but notice it was an afterthought, as in after you were concerned about your own humiliation..."

"Still thought of it sooner than you did."

That stings a little. She's right. So what do I do about Kirsten?

Bethany's jaw drops, and her eyes widen. "Oh, my God, she's a giant..."

I turn around to see who she sees. Kirsten has entered the aisle, still talking on her cell phone. Not the largest I've ever seen her, but still a damn impressive sight...in so many, many ways...

Time for a decision.
1522111121111.title: Wait!

choices: Respect Bethany's wishes and tag along incognito
Ignore Bethany and shout for Kirsten's attention
15221111211111.content:
Kirsten will be expecting to see me anyway, so if I run off somewhere, she'll get worried and start looking. Why mess around when lives are on the line?

The giant-sized Kirsten walks toward us, oblivious to our presence and oblivious to the fact that her friend has been shrunk down to my height. She's involved in her phone conversation and not looking down.

"Yes, Mom, I'll drive safely," she says. "Yes, I'll wear my seatbelt. I always wear my seatbelt."

I rush forward, for some reason deciding that waving my hands above my head is a better way of attracting her attention than using my voice. I stand directly before her mighty left foot, looking up her expansive leg.

But she's not looking at me. Something has caught her eye on the shelf opposite the one we're huddled against.

"You know I'll be there, Mommy," Kirsten says. "I'm not going to miss my cousin's wedding."

I'm about to give in and speak up - possibly attracting others! - when I'm yanked from my feet by Bethany. I glare at her, but when Kirsten's shoe smashes down where I had been standing I smile apologetically. Bethany raises her eyebrows.

"I told you I don't want her to see me like this! But did you hear what she's saying? A wedding! What better place for you to meet some girls that will help you grow? Always plenty of desperate bridesmaids! And hey, I wouldn't mind checking out a few giant hunks in formalwear..."

"Fine, yes, we can go to the wedding with Kirsten," I gasp. "So let's get her attention, and se can carry us there!"

"No. Look, she's oblivious to us - we can just grab hold of her fat legs and she can take us there in her car. We can schmooze around the wedding for a bit until I'm normal size, and this'll all be over! No need for her to see me like this..."
15221111211111.title: Going to the Chapel?

15221111211112.content:
The giant-sized Kirsten walks toward us, oblivious to our presence and oblivious to the fact that her friend has been shrunk down to my height. She's involved in her phone conversation and not looking down.

"Yes, Mom, I'll drive safely," she says. "Yes, I'll wear my seatbelt. I always wear my seatbelt."

The stunned look on Bethany's face is priceless, like every facial muscle is paralyzed in the most awkward position. I wonder if that's the face I made? But unlike Bethany, I've yet to see anyone I know from this perspective. It's probably different when you were already close to the person at normal size and then get to see them enlarged to gigantic proportions.

"She must be 200 feet tall," Bethany says, barely audible.

Kirsten is still walking toward us, and Bethany hasn't moved. I grab her shoulders and gently guide her to the bottom edge of the bookshelf. As a delayed reaction, she swats my hands off of her. "Don't touch me!" she snaps, whispering. She's not taking any risk Kirsten will hear her.

"I was saving you from getting stomped on," I say, respecting her desire for discretion. I'm not really doing it for her, though. I don't want to risk Kirsten getting shrunk because she was helping me. Although maybe Bethany would be nicer with her around...

Oh, that's selfish. Stop thinking that.

Well, Kirsten did say she always imagined what it would be like to be tiny...

Stop being selfish!

Kirsten stops. She's standing directly in front of us. I gaze up her long khaki pants and to her head. Something has caught her eye on the shelf opposite the one we're huddled against. And Bethany can't take her own eyes off her mega-sized friend.

"You know I'll be there, Mommy," Kirsten says. "I'm not going to miss my cousin's wedding."

She continues talking into the phone, as she bends over to look at lower shelf.

Bethany hits me and mouths, "Don't you dare do anything!"

I mouth back, "What are you going to do about it, Thumbellina?"

Bethany pounces on me, her hands wrapped around my neck.
15221111211112.title: Don't let her see you.

152211112111121.content:
She catches me off guard, completely off guard. I roll with her assault and fall onto my back. What she lacks in strength, she makes up in aggressiveness.

Despite her hands around my neck, I manage to say, "I'm not going to fight a girl!"

"Sexist pig!" she says, slapping me.

I roll her off of me and hop to my feet. I back up, trying to put some distance between us. I make the mistake of trying to reason with her. "I know you're feeling vulnerable..."

"Shut up!" she says, jumping forward. But whatever attack she had planned, she doesn't follow through. She looks up, and her eyes bulge wide--even wider than when she first got shrunk and saw the giant world. Whatever she sees has filled her with terror.

I look up, and I see Kirsten's tremendous ass coming down--right toward us. Seems she wants to check out the lowest shelf...

I dive at Bethany and shove her away from its path. Kirsten's butt smacks the carpet. We miss it, but if I was a second slower...Certainly would have been an interesting way to go, but I'd rather not go just yet.

We stand a safe distance behind her ass, and we both stare. It truly is magnificent. Nice and full...Big compared to her waist, but not fat...

"That's the biggest goddamn butt I've ever seen," Bethany says. She turns to me, and smacks me again. "Stop looking!"

Right, right, remember what I learned...It's just one part of her, not the whole her...

But it looks so great...

My view is taken away, as Kirsten rises to her feet and walks off. She's probably heading to where she last left Bethany with me. She's going to realize her friend is missing...

"You sure you don't want your friends' help?" I ask.

Bethany makes a threatening fist, and I back off. She says, "Be a man and solve your own problems. I'm not staying tiny forever. Find a girl and talk to her!"
152211112111121.title: Tiny person fight!--interrupted

1522111121111211.content:
“Or fine,” Bethany says, walking briskly down the aisle. “If you want to be a little wimp, I’ll pick out for you.”

I guess I should follow...Wouldn’t be chivalrous to let a tiny girl roam alone...even if I, too, am tiny...

Bethany sticks tight against the base of the bookshelf and slows down as she reaches the end. She creeps around the corner for a peek. Whatever sight she beholds makes her flinch. She’s still not used to this perspective. Can’t say I’m there yet either.

She motions for me and whispers, “Here. She looks about your age. Just say hello so we can grow.”

It’s not quite that simple, but we definitely won’t grow by keeping quiet.

I step around the corner to see who my wing-girl has spotted. First, I see some sneakers and jeans. Casual girl, it seems. My eyes climb up her pretty nice body until--

Oh my God. Oh. My. God. It’s her.

Amy. My biggest crush in high school, and now--no, not going there. Not a huge fan of puns--And there I went anyway, despite myself.

Anyway. Wow. Amy Young. Haven’t seen her in a few years, and now she looks like a giant as I stand two inches tall at her feet. She’s just standing there, flipping through a book she picked off the display, completely unaware that I’m right here.

But she is aware of how I felt about her. I told her junior year. It was not my finest moment, but we remained friendly afterward until the inevitable post-graduation drifting apart.

And here she is, a little over five feet taller than myself. I know I’d close that gap by at least a tiny bit if I talked to her. Gorgeous as she was--and still is, apparently--it was never just about her looks. Though the sight of her does still take my breath away, and not just because she’s relatively 200 feet tall.

Bethany shoves me forward and motions for me to hurry the hell up.

Now I understand her hesitation about not wanting her friends to see her like this. I’m so little next to Amy--Amy, for God’s sake--Amy looks soooo big to me now...This is so much more intimidating than when I first talked to Kirsten. Maybe I could come back to her later, after I’ve reclaimed some more height?
1522111121111211.title: The old high school crush

15221111211112111.content:
“Will you hurry up and say something?” Bethany snaps in a harsh whisper.

I have to. As humiliating as it’s gonna be...

I motion around the corner. “Bethany, do you mind...? I don’t want to feel like I’m being studied as I do this.”

“Do what? It’s not like she’s going to want to make out with a shrimp like you.”

“Please?”

Bethany releases a heavy sigh. “If it’ll speed things along, fine.” With that, she’s out of my sight.

I return my attention to Amy, beautiful Amy, now also giant Amy. What should I say?

Oh, to hell with it... “Um, Amy? Hi. It’s me, Billy.”

Amy lifts her eyes from her book and looks around. She’s confused that she doesn’t see any Billys.

While she figures things out, I grow to twice my size, more or less. Of course, I still don’t think I’m even half a foot tall, maybe four or five inches? A ruler would be nice...No, actually, I don’t think I want confirmation. (So this is, let’s see, one, two, three...Just three? Ugh.)

Whether two inches tall or five, Amy’s still enormous. Her jaw goes slack as she spots me.

“Billy?” She drops to her knees. “Is that you? You’re little, like a doll...”

Not how I pictured this reunion going, and I’ve pictured this reunion a lot. This is so embarrassing being this small in front of her...Makes me feel even smaller.

I almost tell her that I was even smaller, but then I realize--Do I really want to get into the explanation of how this all started? Do I want to tell her that I was roaming around the street looking for girls to hit on?

I simply say, “Um, yeah, it’s me. Believe it or not.”

She lowers her face to my level, and It’s. Just. So. Big. Her head alone is still much taller than I am. Even though I saw plenty of much larger people, I didn’t know any of them.

But oh, how I’ve missed that long, lovely red hair...

She’s stunned, doesn’t know what to say, and neither do I. So I joke. “You wouldn’t, uh, happen to know anyone with a growth ray gun, would you?”

It’s still sinking in. “How did this happen?”

I really don’t know what to say, but I know how to buy time. “Think we can go somewhere more private, so people don’t think you’re talking to an action figure? I wouldn’t mind a change of scenery myself. ”

“Yeah, of course. Good thinking. I certainly don’t want to leave--I mean, it must be so dangerous at your--I mean...I just simply couldn’t leave you here by yourself like this,” Slowly, she reaches her hand toward me, and it’s nice to see that at least I’m taller than a horizontal hand now. “Tell me if I’m squeezing too tightly.”

Amy wraps her fingers around me, and she’s incredibly delicate about it. She lifts me up with the one hand, while holding the other below as a safety net.

Before I can dwell on how weird it is to be carried single-handedly by Amy, I remember Bethany. Did she grow along with me? In any case, she’s still down there...But when am I going to get another shot at being alone with Amy? And it's not like Bethany's a wonderful person.

The real question is...How good of a person am I?
15221111211112111.title: Uh, hi, Amy...

152211112111121112.content:
I’m horrible. I’m a horrible, terrible, despicable person.

But so is Bethany. After all, she wanted me to stay two inches tall forever--she said that. She’s crazy. Her being shrunk, too--she got what’s coming to her. Yeah, I’m not responsible for her. Kirsten can take care of her...

But do I want to give up my chances with Kirsten? She seems great, but then again, she’s not Amy. If I don't seize this opportunity, my inner teenager is never going to let me hear the end of it.

And I’m sure Bethany will be happy to be rid of me. Being in my company only lost her five feet of height, so really, she’s better off without me.

As I mull this over, I ride in Amy’s side pocket. Her jeans are a tight fit, and it doesn’t help that I’m five inches tall this time rather than below one, like I was when Kirsten had me in her pocket.

So I’ve been in a girl’s pants twice in one day. Twice within the hour. It’s kind of awesome when I say it like that. Maybe not the short time span, though...

But yeah--I’m scrunched in here with little room to move. Getting harder to hide me the more I grow...

But should I speak up about Be--Whoa!

Ugh! Oof!

Amy tripped up. Luckily, she fell on her other side and not the side that would have crushed me. I feel her jump right back to her feet, so she’s clearly okay.

She looks down into her pocket to mouth an apology to me. I give her the signal that I’m okay.

Her face is really high up there...

I don’t remember her being a clutz. But hey, we all trip up once in a while. Granted, people tripping up poses a much greater danger to me now that it used to...

Soon, we’re...
152211112111121112.title: Horrible

choices: Find an excuse to leave her.
1522111121111211121.content:
Amy’s fingers pull me free from my transportation and set me on the dashboard of hers.

She sits in her driver’s seat and looks upon my tiny self with awe and wonder...probably because I’m tiny and not because I’m awesome or wonderful. But I can pretend, right?

I’m just thrilled to be alone with the biggest crush I ever had, and with a great view of that gorgeous redheaded face...and a bit below that. I can ignore the ridiculous size difference for now.

“So again, like, wow,” she says. “How are you so tiny?”

Or maybe I can’t.

I don’t want to tell her that I was here to practice pick-up techniques, so I can’t tell her precisely why the witch shrank me. And I will eventually grow back just by meeting girls who are decent human beings, which could be any of her friends...

I’m so horrible... “You see, Amy...I volunteered for an experiment, an experiment at the, uh, well, I’m not allowed to say where. But this is temporary. I don’t know when, but I’ll be big again...at some point.” I’m a horrible liar.

“Oh, okay. That’s a relief.” She bought that? “That’s awfully brave of you.” She’s not going to ask why I was alone in a bookstore, rather than under the supervision of the people running the experiments? “I know I would never agree to become small. That would be, like, I don’t know...I can’t stand icky bugs anyway, I certainly wouldn’t want to be closer to their level. But this is kind of fun being the giant. Sorry about that whole falling thing, though...”

“No harm done...”

“So how big do I look to you?”

“Really, really big. A giant, yeah.”

“Wow,” she says, her mouth hanging open just a little too long. Is that...Do her eyes have a vaguely vacant look about them? “Now this isn’t messing up the experiment, talking to me, is it?”

“Um, no, no, of course not. I’m free to go wherever I like and talk with whoever I want to.”

“Those must be some laid-back scientists.” Is she starting to doubt...? “That’s cool.” Nope, not at all. “So my face must look like it’s on a movie screen or something.” Oh, God...

“Yes, Amy. I’m living in the Land of the Giants right now.”

“Wow. I’m like a movie in 3-D.”

“I suppose so, yeah.”

“So just how big am I compared to you? Like a thousand feet tall? Am I like a mile big?”

Ever hear of math? “Closer to a hundred feet, I think. But still, yeah, big.”

“Wow...”

Oh, God. Oh, God...She’s such a...such an airhead. Amy’s a flighty airheaded ditz. Has she always been this way?

Thinking back...yes. Yes, she always has. But I was a hormonal teenager distracted by her giant chest--which at its current giant size does threaten to reduce me to dumb “wows” as well. Seriously, look at those...I’m tempted to dive right into them...but not quite as tempted as I would have thought. I mean, sure, she was always very nice and sweet and personable, and she still seems to be, but back then, I completely overlooked just how dumb she is. Now, I have to face it: She truly is a total airhead. Not much is going on in there. It’s a buzz kill, frankly. She looks hot, yeah, but little else is attractive.

Oh, God.

I’ve made a huge mistake.
1522111121111211121.title: ...in her car.

choices: Talk to some other women first.
15221111211112111211.content:
I have to go back and find Kirsten. Given that I abandoned her tiny friend in the middle of a huge bookstore, there might be some groveling involved, but since I’m already at foot-level, it wouldn’t be too much of a stretch.

But first, how do I ditch Amy? Well, she’s not that bright, so it shouldn’t be too challenging.

“Amy,” I say, “I just remembered...The scientists did have a rule for me. They didn’t want me spending too much time with any one person, so I should probably be on my way...”

“Oh, okay!” she says, not doubting me in the least. “Are you sure you’re going to be safe?”

“Sure. I’m resourceful. So, um, do you mind setting me on the ground?”

“Hop aboard!” she says, extending her hand for me.

Amy exits the car and bends down so I can step onto the pavement. “Thanks!” I call up to her.

“It was great to see you! When you’re big again, we should definitely get together and catch up.”

“Of course. That would be great.” I have no intention of ever contacting her.

I start walking away. “Don’t get stepped on!” she says, still bent at the knees to see me off.

“That’s my plan. Oh, and please don’t tell anybody about this, okay?”

“It’ll be our secret.”

“Great. Take care.”

“Bye-bye!”

Damn, that girl’s the biggest ditz ever...

So. Now, I can either find my way straight back to the bookstore and hope Kirsten’s still there (and Bethany hasn’t been stepped on, or on second thought...) or I can say hello to some nice ladies so I’m a bit taller when I have to apologize for being such a jerk and running off with my (inexplicable) high school crush.
15221111211112111211.title: Bye-bye!

152211112111121112112.content:
There are plenty of girls on the way, and the more I can shrink down my view of Kirsten when I see her next, the better. An angry girl would be bad enough, but I’d especially like to avoid a giant angry girl...as much as possible, anyway...

I cling to the side of the store facades as I make my way down the street to avoid those giant shoes walking back and forth. Hopefully, the giant shoes’ giant owners have enough self-confidence to look up rather than down toward my level. At five inches tall, I’m not exactly as invisible as before.

The foot traffic dies down a little, and across the sidewalk I spot a potential target pacing near an empty bench, talking on her cell phone. She’s a young woman, early to mid-20s, with full, fantastic breasts. Her butt is huge, and I’m adjusting for inflation here, but it doesn’t quite qualify as fat.

Wait, what am I doing? I come across a girl, and my first thoughts are of her tits and ass. What is wrong with me? Why can’t I learn?

Her face, look at her face...She’s got a good-looking face, kind of girl-next-door rather than drop-dead gorgeous, but certainly pleasant. The long red hair looks great...I abandon one attractive redhead, and here’s another...

And again, what am I doing? I’m evaluating her looks. True, looking at her head is more civilized than ogling the lower regions, but still.

She’s talking on her phone. I should listen.
152211112111121112112.title: Unable to learn

1522111121111211121121.content:
Damn, I can’t stop looking at her ass...It’s just so big compared to her waist. I’d love to jump onto it like it’s a large, comfy, soft mattress...

STOP. Stop looking and listen.

She says into her phone, “Yeah, I’m going to go serve meals at the homeless shelter next weekend...Yeah, I know I’m out of college, but it’s still important to do things like that...We all gotta do our part...Okay, talk to you later.”

So she’s into the volunteerism thing. She’s not just a girl with a great body. She serves her community pro bono. That’s...nice.

I approach her ankles and call up, “Excuse me? Miss?”

She turns around, looking for the source of the sound.

“Down here,” I say.

She finds me, and her mouth drops so wide open that even at five inches I’d have no trouble climbing right in. (Not that I’d ever want to, mind you. Ew.) She bends down for a better look, but she’s no less perplexed.

I continue, as if everything is perfectly normal, “I couldn’t help but overhear your conversation, and I just wanted to say that’s a very nice thing you’re doing.”

I turn around and walk away. As I do, I double in height. I must be about ten inches tall now! Yeah! Four down, six to go! So I am learning after all.

She really did have a great--

GAAAH!
1522111121111211121121.title: Redeemed?

15221111211112111211211.content:
I’m feeling confident, like I’m on a role. Yeah, I can get a little bigger before returning to Kirsten.

Of course, at ten inches tall, I’m not invisible anymore. Any one of my fellow pedestrians here could easily snatch me up, and the person might be nice, but those are odds I don’t want to play.

I duck into a spot between a garbage can and a light pole. It’s not total cover, but it is some cover, and I can still people-watch in search of the next good girl to come along. Ooh, that’s a pretty one right there...

But wait a second...Glancing across the street, I spot a familiar store. Why didn’t I think of this before? I worked there recently, just last summer, and my manager was this gorgeous young woman--older than me, yeah, but still under 30. And she was so cool, probably still is.

If I say hello to her, that’s some guaranteed size back.

Oh, wait. There’s a kink in my plan. I have to cross a moderately busy road with really, really big cars going by at 35 mph (if they’re following the speed limit).

Should I chance it? At my size, there’s danger no matter what I do.
15221111211112111211211.title: What next?

152211112111121112112112.content:
I seriously consider running out into giant traffic, but fortunately, I hesitate long enough to glance back at the sidewalk. And there I spot someone who gives me a better idea.

A policewoman is coming down the sidewalk. She’s young. She’s pretty. And she’s sworn to protect people in peril...people like me.

Plus, there’s something attractive about the notion of a woman willingly choosing such a dangerous line of work, one women generally aren’t expected to go into.

She is kind of intimidating, though. I’m not sure if it’s because she appears 40-50 feet tall, or because she carries a gun and could probably beat the hell out of me on my best day. Just imagine how intimidating she’d appear if I came across her when I was the size of an ant...
152211112111121112112112.title: The long arm of the law

choices: Get away by running into traffic
1522111121111211121121121.content:
"Officer!" I shout, running toward her with my hand raised. The shock on her face is probably a natural human reaction to seeing a ten-inch man, and to my relief she doesn't reach for her sidearm.

Of course, she's not the only person in the street, and I draw the attention of every pedestrian in the area. There are screams and laughs from the various giants, enough to drown out any follow-up comment I may have had simmering.

The police officer takes charge, shouting at people to move along, telling them that there's nothing to see here; I didn't know that they said things like that it real life! Her voice is commanding, exceedingly powerful, and I myself am almost compelled to obey. Instead, I remain rooted to the spot as she strides over, directing her next words at me: "You appear to be causing a disturbance, sir. Kindly come with me, please."

She crouches and extends a hand, expecting me to walk onto it. Hmm. Is she going to help me, or does this 'disturbance' business imply she's thinking of running me in? Perhaps this wasn't such a good idea, but then, resisting arrest would be frowned upon even more...
1522111121111211121121121.title: What's All This, Then?

15221111211112111211211211.content:
I step onto the policewoman’s hand, tentatively. Really, what choice do I have? If I tried to run away, she’d catch up, like, immediately. Her legs are a bit longer. If she were still standing, I’d be looking up to her knees.

But then, as I stand fully on her hand, she reassures me. “No need to look alarmed, sir. I just want to find out what’s going on with you and see if there’s any way we can help you.”

Supporting me with both hands, she begins lifting me up, and I start growing. I wobble, and she catches me. I don’t double in size this time, but I’m probably 15 or 16 inches, somewhere in that neighborhood. Wait, is this the halfway point? Yeah, Kirsten, Lauren, Amy, that random curvy girl, and the policewoman is the fifth. Now, I’d probably look straight ahead at her knees, not up. It's something. It's progress.

She brings me to her police car and sets me on the front passenger’s seat while she sits behind the wheel. But we’re not going anywhere yet.

“Just wanted to get away from the commotion,” she says. “Now would you like to tell me about your present condition?”

I open my mouth, but before I can talk, there’s a knock on her window. It’s...
15221111211112111211211211.title: Growing with the law

choices: Go and track down the other two women
152211112111121112112112111.content:
"You've got to help us!" the man shouts, and I can see the desperation writ large on his face. "She's in the bookstore and, oh God, she's..."

The policewoman is already leaving her car by this point, closing the door behind her and following the citizen as he points back to the bookstore. The bookstore where I left Bethany and Kirsten. Whatever trouble's occurring, they're right at ground zero!

The door proves resistant to the attempts of a one and a half foot tall man to open it. Climbing to the dashboard I resort to banging on the glass, but no one is paying attention to me. They are all held rapt by the weird lights glowing from atop the bookstore. The bookstore where I last saw the witch.

What could she be up to now? Nothing good, that's for sure. She has Kirsten, Bethany and soon the police officer! Everyone I talk to seems to -

Could that be it? It did seem rather petty that such a powerful being would place such a curse for such a slight as mine, but if each woman that restsored my size was also of value to the witch... I was helping her gather victims for whatever fate she had planned! Now I'm banging on the glass with the intent of breaking it, but it's never going to give.

I turn back to the door, and while the handle may be too strong for me to pry open alone, I can certainly manage to lower the window! Why didn't I think of this earlier? The button is simplicity itself to operate, and while it's quite a drop to the ground, I manage to avoid breaking anything.

How up to facing down a witch am I? Probably not very. But I've got to try, for Kirsten's sake!

Then again, there are still two women unaccounted for, Amy and that random girl. Should I seek them out first, to try and spare them the witch's wrath?
152211112111121112112112111.title: Magical Rampage

choices: The witch picks up the car
The witch drops a now-relatively-giant Bethany beside the car
152211112111121112112112112.content:
Tap, tap, tap, and there she is at the window, the bane of my existence: taht blonde witch.

"Now now, involving the law isn't really fair," she smiles.

"Nothing in the rules about it!" I snap, too aware already that for a woman that already broke the rules to shrink Bethany, it isn't much of an argument.

"Not fair on the officer here, I mean," the witch says, stepping away from the vehicle.

"Ma'am?" the officer finally says, but before she can take action it's too late.

Past the immensity of the cop's body I can see the witch's fingers, waving goodbye before flying upwards into the heavens. But as they ascend, they also grow, and the sickness in my stomach is a reminder of that time I got shrunk...

It's happening again, any the cop and the car are shrinking too, while remaining proportionate to me. Great. As the shadow of the curb looms over the vehicle, it seems that it and its driver have been reduced to matchbox size, myself perhaps smaller than I've ever been.

The powerful, imposing face of the cop looks down at me, eyes wide in shock. "What the Hell just happened?"

She's still intimidating, but now only she me, nothing but a doll at the wheel of a toy car at the feet of a seemingly omnipotent witch.
152211112111121112112112112.title: Pray She Doesn't Alter It Any Further

1522111121111211121122.content:
So what does she have to say for herself?

“Screw you! Yeah, you heard me: Screw you! I don’t owe you anything. Why don’t you go and--”

That’s a lot of expletives. A very extensive vocabulary of expletives. Wow. Um, yeah, maybe she isn’t such a nice girl. At the very least, now’s not the time to talk to her. Remember, the objective is to avoid giant angry girls...

A spider crawls toward the redhead’s foot. She notices, lifts her sneaker, and slams it down with a BAM! No mercy for the spider. She probably imagined the spider was whoever she’s talking to.

Yeah, I want to keep my distance from her...

But then...

“Oh. My. God,” she says, lowering her phone to her side, as she gazes across the sidewalk, her head tilted downward.

She’s looking at me. Right at me. She’s seen me, no question about it. Looks like I’m going to have a confrontation with an angry giant whether I want it or not, unless...
1522111121111211121122.title: Angry giant girl

choices: "No one's ever going to see you again."
15221111211112111211221.content:
That woman’s scary. I’m out of here.

As I race down the sidewalk, I hear powerful feet stomping the pavement...and they’re getting louder...

Huge fingers reach in under my arms, wrap around my body, and lift me into the air.

“Hey! Let go!” I shout, reflexively. But as the ground recedes, I realize that her letting go wouldn’t be the best thing.

She brings me to her over-sized face, as her great green eyes probe me. She walks us into the empty path between two of the stores, away from prying eyes and nosy eavesdroppers.

I demand, “Put me down!”

“No,” she says, with a sinister gleam. “Men have been pissing me off all day, and here I find one shrunken down to a very manageable size. Lucky me. I wish you were all this small.” She notices that my eyes have drifted down to her large, lovely chest. Of all the times for a lapse in self-control... “Hey! Eyes up here, pervert!”

“Put me down, you giant-assed--”

“Excuse me, tiny? What’s that about my giant ass?”

I’m not in the mood for nonsense, not with this crazy girl. “You know you have a big butt, and I’m five inches tall, so everything is huge to me, especially big butts, you fat-assed giant.”

She tightens her grip. It kind of hurts. “Someone needs to teach you some manners, tiny.”

I need an ally, another giant, but one on my side. I need Kirsten. And I need a good lie.

“Look,” I say, “I’ve done nothing to you. I’m not one of the guys you’re mad at. I was just on my way to the bookstore to visit my girlfriend Kirsten, and then I got shrunk, and now...Well, I’m kind of scared of her seeing me like this. We just had this huge fight...”

My captor smirks and says...
15221111211112111211221.title: Caught

152211112111121112112212.content:
“No one’s ever going to see you again.”

Damn. I don’t like the sound of that.

She bends down and sets me on the ground, knowing I can’t outrun her, not when her legs are much longer than my entire body. She lifts a foot into the air.

“I’m soooo tempted just to put you out of your misery...”

“I’m not in misery! That’s really not necessary!”

BAM! She stomps down right beside me, as I dive out of the way. I can tell she wasn’t aiming to actually squash me, just trying to scare me. And she’s succeeding.

I gaze up that long, long leg and see that wicked smirk peeking over her massive chest.

“Look at that. I missed,” she says. “I’ll have to try again.”

This is so not my day.

“Aww, you found him!” says a new voice, but one I recognize. It’s her--the witch who shrank me in the first place. She strolls into the alley, still larger than life.

So yeah, really not my day. Now I’ve got two evil giants to deal with. But hey, maybe she’ll shrink down this one, too, like she did with Bethany...

“You know him?” the redhead asks the witch.

“I shrank him down a little while ago. And I’ve been keeping tabs ever since, seeing if he’s learned his lesson.” She crouches over me. “But you haven’t, have you, big guy?”

“Yes, I have!” I shout.

“Then why is poor Bethany struggling in a giant world all by her lonesome?”

“I...” She’s got me there. That was horrible of me to leave her. “I’m only human!”

“No, you’re less than human. You’ve proven yourself as such.” The witch smiles, savoring the moment. “I gave you a chance at redemption. And you failed my challenge. Game over, loser.”

“What?”

She waves her hand over me, and I watch as both she and the redhead grow--meaning that I’m shrinking again.

The witch says, “You’re now one inch tall, but this time, there is no way to grow back.” She stands up, and the two wicked giants stare down at me. She says to the redhead, “I have no use for him. Would you like a new pet?”

I yell, “Hey! I’m no one’s pet!” And I realize something’s wrong with my voice. It’s actually a tiny person’s voice this time. They can’t hear me.

The redhead bends down slowly, her hand reaching toward me...
152211112111121112112212.title: Loser

1522111121111211121122121.content:
No way I’m letting that fat-assed giant woman snatch me up again. I bolt between her feet underneath her and toward the sidewalk.

I hear the witch say, “Let him go. He’s still learning his lesson.”

Whatever. I’m still so very much out of here--

Um, this sidewalk is a whole lot bigger than it just was, and it was pretty big. At least she didn’t shrink me all the way back down to ant size again. But good Lord, those giants seem even scarier than before, especially since I can’t talk to them anymore...

Again, I cling to the edge of the buildings, which is about the only place that those huge feet aren’t crashing down.

The bookstore isn’t far. Can I make it there and find Kirsten...and somehow get her attention?
1522111121111211121122121.title: Escape!

15221111211112111211221211.content:
That took longer than I thought, but I’m here, and no one stepped on me. Always a plus.

I slip inside the moment someone opens the door. Once there’s a gap in the foot traffic, I dash across the carpet beneath a table display. I figure no one’s going to look or step under the table, so I can take a moment to scan the area and look for familiar faces. Or ankles, anyway--specifically, khaki-clad ankles. Or tiny angry brunettes.

Now that’s a question...How big or small is Bethany right now? Did she grow when I talked to Amy, and did she shrink back down when I did?

I don’t see her anywhere, so I don’t know.

But then I hear a voice, and my heart quickens. “I don’t know what happened, Lauren. I gave Billy to Bethany, and I haven’t seen them since.”

Two beautiful giants stand right beside my table. Kirsten’s with her friend, the tall one--also a nice one. I did grow after I met her, unlike with Bethany. But I seem to have lost ground since then. Possibly permanently, if that witch is to be believed. But why would I believe her? There’s a way out of this. I’m not yet resigning to life as Bug-Guy.

That Lauren girl really is tall, especially next to Kirsten, like she’s a natural giant. And she’s got some great, long legs, soooo very long...I’m so glad she’s wearing shorts...

There I go again. Stop ogling and act, damn me...

I run out from under the table and shout up at the mammoth Kirsten, “KIRSTEN! I’M DOWN HERE! I GOT SHRUNK! AGAIN!”

Kirsten continues her conversation with Lauren, oblivious to my presence. “Do you think something happened? And what if she lost him? He’s so tiny and helpless...”

I try for louder. “KIRSTEN!” And I am indeed louder, but still ineffectual. “KIRSTEEEEENNNNN!!!!”

Lauren says, “So what do you want to do, Kirst? Crawl around the store on our hands and knees, and when someone asks why we’re acting crazy, we just say, ‘Oh, we’re just looking for a tiny dude, that’s all?’”

“Let’s just keep looking for Bethany. She should be easier to spot. I’ll try her cell again...”

Kirsten pulls out her phone and takes a step--a step toward me. I dive away from her colossal sneaker in the knick of time. This girl is going to be the death of me. First she almost sits on me, and now she almost steps on me. But she’s also my best hope for getting some giant-sized help.

But she can’t hear me. Bethany probably could, if she’s still small.

Should I continue trying to get Kirsten’s attention, or should I scour the store for Bethany?
15221111211112111211221211.title: Shouting at giants

152211112111121112112212111.content:
I have to keep trying with Kirsten, if for no other reason than she’s the single nicest person I’ve met this whole crazy day. But it also doesn’t hurt that she’s big enough to keep me safe until we can figure a way to undo this whole shrinking thing.

I’ve ducked back underneath the table, as she continues pacing back and forth in front of me, her footsteps thundering much louder than ever before. Let’s see...The shouting didn’t work, but maybe I can appeal to a different one of the five senses...

Turning around, I find something lucky. A thumbtack. It’s not much shorter than I am, but...yes, yes, it’s light enough to pick up.

This is weird. A simple thumbtack is like some strange kind of spear to me now.

Okay, so I’ll charge at Kirsten, climb up a shoe, and poke her ankle. I hate to cause her any pain, but it should only feel like a tiny prick, which is all it is anyway.

I creep forward and pause at the edge of the table’s shadow. Kirsten has stopped pacing. I stare up at this humungous giant of a girl, and I feel a little nervous about my plan. What if I trip up and get squished in the process?

Don’t have much time to dwell. She’s sticking her phone back in her pocket. Guess Bethany didn’t answer. I feel so horrible about ditching her...but again, can’t dwell. Kirsten won’t linger for long...

“Hey! You’re not going to stick that thing in my friend, are you?”

I recognize that angry voice. I turn around, and there’s Bethany, and she’s...
152211112111121112112212111.title: New plan

1522111121111211121122121112.content:
“Bethany?” I say, finding her basically the same size as myself. “Thank God you’re okay. I was worried--”

She slaps me, and I admit...It is deserved.

“You left me all alone. You’re the only reason I got shrunk in the first place, and you abandoned me for that big bimbo. And yeah, I grew a little when you spoke to her, but then I shrank back down smaller than ever, and would you like to tell me why that is?”

“I saw the witch again. She wasn’t happy with me.”

“She’s not alone.”

Should I tell her everything? Not really something I can keep from her, and I’ve done wrong by her enough as it is. “She decided I hadn’t learned my lesson, so she shrunk me back down, shrunk my voice, too, so I can’t talk to any giants--er, regular people. And there’s one more thing...”

She scowls at me. “What?”

“She said this time, there’s no way to grow back.”

“What?” Still with that scowl...

“Unless we can somehow find that witch and convince her to change us back, we’re stuck like this.”

I glance off to the side. Kirsten’s shoes are still in view...for now...

Bethany goes into a rant. “You don’t realize the hell I’ve been through while you were out flirting, and now you’re telling me I’m going to be this tiny the rest of my life, and it’s all because Kirsten was nice enough to try to help out a hopeless case like you?”

“Um, I guess, pretty much. But speaking of Kirsten...we need her help...”

“No. No way. I’ve been humiliated enough. My friends are not seeing me like this.”

“Would you rather a stranger find us? Or maybe just the bottom of a stranger’s shoe? Look, we need to find the witch, and we can’t do it on our own. So, unless you’d like to spend the rest of your life in a giant bookstore with me as your only company, we need to somehow get Kirsten’s attention.”

Bethany looks away, exhaling heavily. She knows I’m right, but is having a hell of a time admitting it.

“Fine,” she says, finally.

I turn back toward Kirsten and find...
1522111121111211121122121112.title: 1-inch Bethany

15221111211112111211221211121.content:
Oh, dammit. Kirsten's no longer standing there.

"Where'd she go?" I say, my eyes scanning the floor for those huge sneakers that were *right here* a second ago!

"You lost her?" Bethany says, joining the search from beneath the table. "But she's gigantic! How do you lose a giant?"

"If she walks behind other giant things. You lost her, too. Hell, you wanted to hide from her!"

"Whatever. Let's just find her. She's got to still be in the store."

Bethany marches out from under the table, rather boldly for one so tiny. Perhaps she's in denial about how vulnerable she is. In any case, I'm more cautious, much to her benefit.

I grab her and pull her back under the table. She yells at me to get my hands off her ... until she sees a giant sneaker step down right in front of us. Even though I had seen it coming, I'm still taken aback by its size and potentially life-ending power.

Standing before the table is a young lady, probably college age, just as gigantic as everyone else. Well, maybe a little less so. She's rather thin, and I suspect she's rather cute up there, though it's hard to confirm with this steep, low angle.. The lanyard hanging around her neck suggests she's an employee of this store, and she appears to be straightening the books on the table above us.

"Don't rush to thank me or anything," I tell Bethany, who immediately acquires a look of horror and yanks me back.

"Watch out!"

An enormous, fat paperback book crashes on the carpet with a frightening thud. The spine says "War and Peace" -- so yeah, that definitely would have squashed us. I never realized how deadly Russian literature could be.

The employee squats down to retrieve the book. I have a better view of her face, and she is indeed very pretty, with her raven-black hair and captivating green eyes.

Those eyes spot something of interest on the floor, something highly unusual.

The giant young lady is staring right at us.
15221111211112111211221211121.title: ...she's gone.

choices: I should wait here and talk to the woman
I should try and get out of here
I should work out issues with Beth first and foremost
I should find somewhere to hide in the bag
152211112111121112112212111211.content:
Smoothing down my hair, I flash a grin at the giantess, and try a line:

"Hey, good-looking! Good to see you're brushing up on the classics, not afraid of a challenge!"

She makes no reaction, staring at me through her round glasses. I jerk a thumb over at War and Peace to emphasise my point.

"Is that your idea of flirting?" Bethany laughs. "Loser."

I turn to reprimand her, when I remember that my voice is at small volume now. That woman can;t hear me! She can see me though, and as I turn back to look, I see her palm rapidly approaching.

The mass of fleshcollides heavily with me, with what I presume are her fingers wrapping around my body. Bethany is here too, both of us pressed up against each other under the immense power of this woman, lifted from our feet without an effort. In the heat and dark, I feel Bethany's breath on my face, her breats pushed against my chest. I hope she doesn;t feel my growing erection.

"Gawd, you'd better not even think of kissing me!" she screams in my ear.

"Kiss you?" I return. "I'd rather kiss a cockroach!"

An awkward moment passes between us, then we fall apart as the fingers uncurl, and we roll onto our backs in the palm of this woman's hand. Her face looks down at us from heaven, growing smile on her face. Dazed, I still try to come up with a line, but she speaks first, over me. Literally.

"Borrowers! Don't worry, little people, you'll be safe with me! You'll have somewhere to live, I'll feed you and keep you out of danger. You're. So. Cute."

She grins, and although I shout, she clearly doesn't hear. Instead, her hand tips, and the two of us fall into the darkness of her bag.

"Another fine mess..." Bethany is muttering, but while she complains, I look over the items surrounding us, desperateky thinking of the next step...
152211112111121112112212111211.title: Owned

choices: Might as well just hang out in the purse and wait.
Attempt to reach the opening and take a peek at what's outside.
1522111121111211121122121112112.content:
A ray of light peeks through the zipper up above. The girl left us an opening, most likely due to carelessness. Or maybe it didn't occur to her that we'd actually want to escape her "protection."

"Does that giant chick actually believe we're Borrowers?" Bethany says, venting at our predicament. "How crazy does she have to be?"

"How is that any less likely than two normal people being shrunk down to one inch high?"

Bethany goes silent, no doubt wanting to argue but failing to find a suitable counterargument.

I consider attempting to scale the "wall" of fabric in here, though first I check my surroundings to see if there might be an easier way ... what I can see of my surroundings, anyway. The ray of light is shining on a vial of prescription medicine that's far bigger than we are, but I doubt its cylindrical form is going to be of much use. It does provide our captor's name, though. Nikki Green.

Wait, what's this medicine? An antipsychotic?

Bethany notices right as I do. She continues to curse her misfortune. "She really is crazy."

I almost echo those sentiments, but a sudden pang stops me.

"She's not crazy. This girl, this young woman, Nikki, she's sick," I say. "She could be suffering from bipolar or some serious depressive disorder. But finding us made her happy. Maybe we've given her some hope that there's more to life than she previously thought."

"Two little people gave her hope?"

"Yeah. Think about it. We're pretty amazing, aren't we? We're two human beings who are actually the size of bugs. Did you ever think such a thing was possible?"

"No. But I'd rather it happened to someone else."

"Agreed, but like it or not, it happened to us, and maybe it happened so we can help this person. And when we figure out how to communicate with her, maybe she can help us in return."

Bethany thinks about it for a long moment, and when she finally speaks, her voice is softer, gentler than before. "That ... makes sense. And it's surprisingly compassionate." Her own words seem to surprise her, too. "So what do we do while we wait for her shift to end? However long that might be."
1522111121111211121122121112112.title: Escape vial

choices: Stay with Beth, help her look for food
Leave the bag to look for food
Leave the bag to get back to the main shop floor
Leave the bag to contact another staff member
Throw Beth out of the bag for being useless
15221111211112111211221211121122.content:
"I can't just sit here and wait," I say, hoping to sound suitably dramatic and heroic. "I'm gonna take a look outside, get a lay of the land."

Beth's totally going to tell me to be careful, or not to do anything stupid, some encouraging comment to buoy me along.

"Suit yourself," is what actually escapes her mouth, and my shoulders slump as I poull myself up the inside of the bag.

The light-giving gap in the mouth of the bag is big enough for me to stick my head out, and I can see that this must be the staff area, not the main bookshop. In place of bookshelves, chairs and a small table, looming above me from where the bag sits, on the floor. If we wanted, we could easily climb out and get away from here, although there's no real cover and anyone walking in would see us easily, standing out against the cream floor colouring. Risky.

Climbing back down, I relay my findings to Beth, and she just shrugs again. "I say we stay here. We can talk to Nikki when we get the chance, and she might get us back to Kirsten. Easy. Don't suppose you saw any food out there, did you? I'm famished."

"Sorry," I say. "Wasn't looking. Feel free to pop out yourself, your highness."

"Is there anything in here that isn't brain medicine?"

While Beth pokes around the immense artifacts dominating the area, I ponder my future options. Waiting here does make sense, like Beth says, but Nikki's mental state is still a concern. Can you really risk trusting her? Were you to get out into the staff room, you could try to contact someone else, who doesn't need to pop pills to function. They could be even worse, of course!
15221111211112111211221211121122.title: Knowledge Is Power

152211112111121112112212111211221.content:
The thought of being captured by someone else is rather terrifying. At least Nikki is pretty -- not that that should be my top priority, but I really want to be able to trust her despite the obvious concern. I hope my optimism isn't the death of us.

So I stay in the bag and help my involuntary compatriot poke around for any snacks the giant may keep handy. Can't see much, so I'm blindly groping around and find what might be a pen. Hardly useful to us.

"Oh my God!" Bethany shouts from across the bag. "Come here!"

I rush over, tripping over (I think) a key on the way. And then a bright light assaults my eyes and slices through the darkness.

"Her cell phone!" Bethany says. "We can send a text to Kirsten! Then she'll come and rescue us!"

We might just be able to manage it, especially if it has a touch screen and not buttons. It'll be awkward, but what have we got to lose? Part of me feels guilty about disappointing Nikki if we disappear on her, but I'm not sure why. Any chance of getting Kirsten here ASAP is our best bet. The thought of her holding me safely in her hand again is weirdly comforting. She's so nice and gentle. I really want to get to know her better when I can look her in the eye ... if I'll ever be able to look her in the eye.

"Okay, great," I say. "But there's potentially one hiccup -- do you have her number memorized?"
152211112111121112112212111211221.title: Hope!

1522111121111211121122121112112213.content:
Beth can't answer as the bag rocks to one side, then the other, gravity rebelling slightly as the whole structure is lifted. The two of us cling tight atop the phone while the zipper roof peels apart, and Nikki's voice can be heard booming above, reciting a well-practiced litany.

"Pills, pills, pills..." she mutters, and her fingers descend into the bag.

I hold Beth tighter, your inch-tall self terrified beyond measure as those great digits prowl around, tapping and toppling other items before settling on the vial, gripping it tight and tearing it out of my world. The two of us stumble upright, and Beth whispers: "I totally know Kirsten's number."

The phone screen is lit below me, ready to accept a number. From beyond the bag, I can hear Nikki's muttering. "You didn't see anything. Look back inside, there'll be nothing there."

Has she taken the pills yet? She's clearing psyching herself up to seeing her pet borrowers again, so hopefully Beth has enough time to call Kirsten. Maybe not, though. Perhaps a simple emergency call would be a better bet.

Of course, either way we won't have long to talk before Nikki notices. Perhaps the phone should be discarded as an idea - why not just stand here, in the open, and greet her as she looks in, prove our reality. If I trust her, which I'm still not certain of. We could hide in this bag, easily, and let her think she imagined us completely. Cruel maybe, but safer for us.

I could split the difference, hide Beth while standing here myself. That way, if Nikki is dangerous, only one of us need suffer, and if she is safe, I can get Beth to reveal herself later - or she could even call Kirsten while I distract the giant.
1522111121111211121122121112112213.title: Believe It

choices: "...I'm going to keep you safe in my pocket for the rest of my shift!"
"...We're all going to your new home!"
15221111211112111211221211121122131.content:
"Call her, text her, whatever you can manage," I say in my bravest tone. "I'll confront the giant." I deepen my voice more than intended.

"Be careful," Bethany says, with unexpected sincerity. "And get over yourself. She's just a girl." That's more like her.

The bag rocks as Nikki peers inside, searching us out. It's now or never. I scurry up toward the light, right under her magnificent, titanic eyes, and I wave frantically. Her eyes get even bigger.

Next thing I know, I've been scooped up, both of her hands cupping me (as if I even need all this surface area). The bag is back in position on the floor, and I can only hope Bethany wasn't jostled around too much during all this. I have to trust her to do her part and establish contact with our hero while I hang out with our captor.

"You scared me for a second there, short stuff!" Nikki says. She checks to make sure no one is entering the break room; we're alone. "Where's your friend? Is she still in the bag? Is she okay?"

I give the thumb's-up sign and smile as big as I can. Tiny though my thumb is, the gesture does its job.

"Oh good! I'm so glad!"

She pulls me close to her sternum. For a second, I fear I'm about to be crushed by her affection, but even as she hugs me close, her hands soften, becoming appropriately gentle, as if she truly does care about my well being. Her hands and body are very warm, but all things considered, there are worse situations I could find myself in, in my present condition.

After a long hug, Nikki holds me up to her face. "Here's what we're going to do now..."

Yeah, I guess I have no say in the matter, do I?
15221111211112111211221211121122131.title: Taking one for the team

choices: It's Kirsten!  Did the message get through?
