152211112111121112112212111211221311.content:
Nikki's hands pour me into her chest pocket, and I have to fight not to think of the immense heart beating away at my back, behind the mass of flesh that is her breast, nudging me back and forward with every breath that she takes.

That's all I have to entertain me throughout the work day. As much as I try to think of Beth's desperate mission to contact Kirsten, the close proximity of this massive female keeps distracting me. There's nothing else, and Nikki becomes my world. Had I not recently become an enlightened male I might be thinking that I'm falling in love, or that she's keeping me close because she has feelings for me -

But I know better now. Thoise are my hormones talking, the underused organ between my legs leaping at any opportunity. Even now it's perking up, and I scowl down at it, as if my annoyance can calm my sexual desire..

Sound cuts through my self-important navel-gazing. Nothing new, since Nikki has been talking with customers throughout her shift, another jostling distraction. This is different: I recognise the voice! Recognise it enough that I consider climbing up from this pocket, right up to where Nikki's employee name badge sits, to get a look!
152211112111121112112212111211221311.title: Book Shops Can Be Boring

choices: Bethany comes up with a convincing excuse.
Bethany comes up with a lame excuse.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114.content:
How the hell did Bethany get big again? She's gigantic! Not as large as when I met her, but what's a few hundred feet between reluctant allies?

How long have I been hanging out in Nikki's pocket? What on Earth has been going on? And for God's sake, where's Kirsten?

"So this is going to sound like a very weird question," Bethany says, "but have you, by chance, spotted a tiny little boy running around here? And by tiny, I mean literally tiny, like an inch high or so."

Little boy? Ugh!

Nikki speaks cautiously, as if unsure how to respond, "A tiny boy?"

"Yes, see, he's my pet..." Ugh again! "...and I lost him in this store. I can only hope he's found some nice, compassionate person to take care of him until I can find him again. I'm very worried."

That strikes the right chord. Next thing I know, Nikki has fished me out of her pocket and is displaying me to Bethany. From Nikki's flat palm, I sheepishly wave hello at Bethany's enormous face. And it's even more unsettling seeing her as a giant after I had gotten used to her as a size-peer.

"Yep, that's him! Thank you so much! You're the best!"

Bethany starts reaching toward me, but Nikki pulls back slightly.

"What about the little girl?" Nikki asks.

Ha! Take that, Big Beth! Oh, wait, this could be trouble...

"Oh!" I see her big ol' face thinking away at top speed. "I already found her. She's a very brave, er, little person, and she, well, she found her way back to me."

"Can I see her?" Nikki asks. "I'd really like to say good-bye."

Let's see how fast on her feet Bethany is ... and then I'd love to know why she's hundreds of feet tall! (Relatively speaking, of course.)
1522111121111211121122121112112213114.title: Big Bethany

choices: Nikki heads to the back room to collect her bag and Beth
Nikki contonues her day as normal, so 'they' won't know she knows
Nikki runs out of the shop, hops the first bus out of town
Nikki heads home to pack a few things
Nikki calls her psychiatrist for advice
15221111211112111211221211121122131142.content:
"Welllll," Bethany says, and I already know that Nikki's not going to accept the reason. "She's very shy, and doesn't like being around big people."

"Right." Nikki drops the syllable like a guillotine, already pulling her hand back, fingers beginning to close around me. "And they're both your 'pets'. What, you bought them at a store? I think you're cruel to be taking advantage of these poor Borrowers, and should get out of here before I call the cops."

I want to speak up, to show that I'd like to stick with the devil I know, but I have no voice, nad alread the hand closes around me in a warm, yet firm embrace. The mass muffles most of the rest of the conversation, but there's no shouting, so Bethany must have given up without a fight. Great.

Nikki's fingers open up to reveal her hunched over me, both hands cupped. We're in shadow behind a bookcase, and worry is writ large on her face. "Looks like there's some people out to get you," she says. "But don't panic, you're safe while you're with me. I don't know how they found you, but they must be watching us all the time! They could be watching even now!"

As if to emphasise this, her eyes dart side to side.

"They told me it was all in my head. That the pills would allow it to all make sense. But I took my pills today. And they are following me. I was right. I was GODDAMN RIGHT!"

She shouts, and I recoil. She smiles and shushes, apologising with a kiss to the forehead. Her lips mash me down into her comfotable palm, and she speaks her plans out loud.

"They know we're here. We have to get out. Should I go back for my bag? Your friend's in there, but they may not know where she is, and I might just be leading them back to her. I should get out of here, somewhere they'd never look. Just the two of us, yeah?" Her eyes widen, focus on me. "Together."

Well, this isn'g going swimmingly. I wonder what plan she'll eventually settle on?
15221111211112111211221211121122131142.title: Not Buying It

choices: Nikki's worried manager comes to check up on her.
152211112111121112112212111211221311421.content:
Nikki tells me it would be cruel to leave the "little girl" all alone in such a big world, and besides, Nikki is sensible enough to know she needs to have some cash on her if she's going to take us on the run.

Peering between the prison bars of her enclosed fingers, I see we're back in the break room. No one's around -- especially not in the bag. Nikki crouches down over it and sets me on the floor beside her, freeing her hands to rummage through her belongings and confirm that my "friend" is okay. It truly does not occur to her that I might want to escape her possession.

"Little girl? Borrower?" Nikki speaks in such a sweet, soothing voice. It really is pleasant and full of genuine concern. "It's okay. It's just me. You can come out. Hello? Little girl? Oh, no..."

Her rummaging becomes more aggressive as she can't find her little person. Soon, she drops the bag back onto the floor, and she drops backward, her skinny butt crashing onto the hard floor, triggering mild tremors beneath my tiny feet. She's tearing up.

"What if she wasn't real? What if I really am imagining all of this, this whole thing, even that woman?"

There's a wide expanse of clear floor before me and an exit. Can I escape before Nikki notices my movement? Should I leave her like this? Not like I can console her or anything. She's too big to hug.
152211112111121112112212111211221311421.title: Giant tears

choices: I prod Nikki in her ankle
I walk under Nikki's legs, directly below her eyes, to get seen
I climb up Nikki's back to get to her face
I climb the table to get closer to her height
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I can't talk to her from here, and I'm going to have to get very close for her to see or feel me. I sprint across the floor, eager to get to her before another concerned staff member shows their face. At an inch tall, it takes a fair while to jog around her immense, planted buttocks.

Then, her legs. Nikki's wrapped her arms about her knees, head down as she weeps. Attracting her attention is going to require a plan of attack. I can worry about whatever happened to Bethany later, after I help this poor, kind-hearted girl.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: There, There

choices: Nikki lowers her ear toward me.
Nikki has a microphone at home.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I just don't have the heart to leave her like this. She's having a mental breakdown, and I'm partly to blame. I suppose I could blame the witch for shrinking me in the first place -- hardly justified punishment for the crime of wanting to meet women, even if I wasn't the greatest guy in the world. But here we are. I've stumbled across the path of this troubled young woman and challenged her entire conception of reality.

If I can't make this right, I deserve my size.

The way she's all curled up, her pant legs are higher than usual, exposing some ankle above her low socks. With a little climbing, I reach the top of a sock, ignore the stench of a day of retail, and scratch her ankle as vigorously as I can. I scurry down before she reacts.

Her reaction is sluggish, as she slowly removes the veil of her hands. She reaches to scratch her itch, but she stops, perhaps wondering if that was a mere itch.

I jump up and down, waving at her. She sees me.

In a rush of motion -- alarming in its swiftness, given her incredible mass -- she's on elbows and knees and leaning her gigantic face all the way down to my level. I'm closer to her eyes than ever. Her great size magnifies her sadness, which remains even as she delights in finding me.

I can't help but care about her. I'm not thinking of her as a potential romantic partner or anything. Rather, I'm seeing what a tragic figure she is, trying desperately to function despite her illness. The fact that she can hold down a job suggests tremendous fortitude (and no doubt excellent medical and psychiatric care). I never would have noticed at regular size -- I might have just smiled politely at the nice young store associate and carried on with my day, oblivious to her pain. But now I see her in a fuller glory, and there's still so much I don't know. Just as she knows so little about me.

"You are real," she says, as much to herself as to me. "And you're probably not a Borrower, are you? Maybe it's time I figured out a way to listen to you."

I'm not thinking of her as a potential romantic partner. Really, I'm not.

Forget that for now. How are we going to solve the communication problem?
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Beautiful sadness

choices: I tell Nikki about Kirsten, ask to see her
I tell Nikki about Bethany, ask to see her
I tell Nikki about my room-mate Lana, ask to see her
I tell Nikki about the witch, warn her to stay away
I tell Nikki that I'll stay with her as long as she wants, to help cope
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
Ever so slowly, presumably not to startle me, Nikki shifts her position, great hands pressing down as her elbows and knees manoeuvre. Her face turns away, yet her head closes, one hand reaching out not to grab me but to brush black strands away from her ear.

The whorled cave of skin looms before me, and I tenderly step forward, my inch-tall form just able to stretch on tip-toe to reach its top. I resist the urge, instead pacing up to the giant woman and clearing my throat.

"Can you... can you hear me?" I ask cautiously, not shouting just yet.

"Yes," Nikki whispers, and I rejoice.

"Thank you for all the care you've taken," I begin. "You wouldn't belive how dangerous it is down here at ankle-level! Um, but the important thing is, I'm real. You're not seeing things. I'm sorry that you began to doubt yourself. No matter what I've been through these last few hours, you've been coping with worse your entire life."

She doesn't answer immediately, no doubt taken aback by my words. That gives me a moment to decide where I wish to direct this conversation...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Communication Breakthrough

A customer barrages Nikki with questions the moment we're on the sales floor.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I come clean with my weird situation -- not every last detail, since sooner or later someone's going to walk in on us and wonder why Nikki is listening to voices through the floor. Have to keep this quick.

After telling Nikki about the witch, the challenge, and the witch's ultimate decision to permanently shrink me to this height, I tell her about Bethany and how she got caught up in all this.

"...She was that tiny woman you saw, and she was also that giant--I mean, that normal-sized woman who was asking about me. I have no idea how she got her size back, but that's the only lead I've got as far as fixing myself. Plus, she's friends with another young woman, Kirsten, who was helping me out right after I shrank the first time."

"Oh," Nikki says softly, and I can't mistake the disappointment in her voice. Is it because I mentioned these other women, or is it because of the slimmest possibility that I might not always be tiny? "Okay. This Bethany might still be in the store. Let's go find her."

Disappointed or not, Nikki's still willing to help. What a great young lady.

She extends her flat hand on the floor. I board, and she gently lifts me up to a towering altitude. Her hand has never felt safer.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: The sole lead

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
Cupped in Nikki's hand, I feel hundreds of feet tall as I see the giant world pass by with each of her strides. Funny that this isn't even as high an altitude as I'd achieve were I normal size! Strange how quickly one can become accustomed to a new situation.

Nikki's other hand casually brushes open the immense door, and she steps through to a wall of noise.

"Thank God you're back, Nik," says some giant wearing a shirt the same colour as hers, "things went a bit manic the moment you went out back!"

And he's not wrong - the bookstore is packed with customers, giants picking books off shelves and besieging the sole other employee behind the counter. At the sight of another possible helper, a sizeable portion of the crowd drifts in Nikki's direction, and the approaching giants have me cringing back in her palm.

Nikki babbles above me, not sure whether to concentrate on customer service or to see to my safety. As a thunder of questions deluge her, I decide to help by taking myself out of the equation. I stomp on her skin, getting a brief glance from her. I give a thumbs-up and jump from her hand, allowing her more options when directing these book-buyers to where they want to go.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Who's Always Right?

I attempt to climb up to her shirt pocket.

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
Well, I was aiming for her shirt pocket. After all, it was rather comfy there last time. But I overestimate my leaping ability, which seems have to diminished along with my voice. I plunge down her shirt and barely manage to grab on just above her belt.

Once I get my bearings, I crawl around to her side pocket and slide in. It's rather snug against her bony hip, not to mention warm, but I'll take it over the unforgiving floor any day.

I feel her large hand gently brushing against the pocket, positioning itself to protect me should the need arise. Even while dealing with customers, she's able to keep track of my whereabouts -- and I'm an easy one to lose! I suppose this means I haven't entirely freed her hand, but at least she doesn't have to worry about accidentally squeezing too hard.

Nikki steps cautiously as she needs to, and she takes care not to bend or crouch unnecessarily. The fabric muffles the chatter above -- it's all just a din -- but I don't hear any voices of anger, nothing that sounds unpleasant or out of the ordinary.

To my own surprise, I'm content to hang out here for a few minutes.

But maybe I shouldn't get too comfortable. Idle hands are the devil's tools, and all that.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Pocketing Oneself

I ask to be placed on the floor, and plan to leave the store alone
Nikki's colleague notices her talking to 'herself'
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I rest in my warm hammock, the gentle movements of the gentle giantess above me almost lulling me to sleep. While being an inch-tall should be a terrifying experience, having found such helpful women today has strangely made it end up as more relaxing and easy-going than my ordinary life. Is this shrunken Stockholm syndrome? Do I really want to get too used to this? It's not natural, I tell myself, I should want to return to normal.

But what is normal, after all? Some might say that Nikki isn't, given that she has to rely upon medication to conform to society's demands. But who doesn't have to make concessions of some sort? From what I've seen of the woman, she is an ideal that more should strive for.

There's a tap from outside, and I poke my head out. Nikki, ever considerate, merely made one motion with her finger to alert me of her readiness. The whorled surface rises, and I swing myself out of the pocket and onto her waiting digit. I cling to it like a fallen tree, and the woman raises me up to her face.

"Thank you for your patience," she whispers, "but I gotta say, having to deal with so many people at once has really tired me."

Looking into her huge eyes, I can see the hurt there.

"Not sure that I'm up for a hunt for a complete stranger right now, buddy. I'm so sorry, but I have the day off tomorrow, so we can try then. You can stay with me tonight and then we'll find this Bethany together. Cool? I got a couple more hours of shift left, so what do you want to do while you wait?"

She raises me to her ear, and I can make my wishes known.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Damaging Her Calm

choices: ...with a girl she went to college with.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I can't help but sympathize, and I can't argue when she's done nothing but try to keep me safe.

"I totally understand!" I shout into her cavernous ear. "Can you just put me in your shirt pocket like before? That was pretty secure."

And part of me likes the idea of going back in there ... which is just plain weird. I also have to wonder if I acquiesced so quickly because I actually want the excuse to spend all this extra time with her.

Nikki gently slips me into her warm shirt pocket, and I settle in and get comfortable. And boy, is it comfortable. With all this time just to lounge and think, I can't escape the conclusion -- I'm developing a crush on her.

I'm still rather fond of Kirsten, too, of course, but I also may have been idealizing her to some extent, which admittedly is rather easy to do when I've only ever seen her as an immense, all-powerful giant. But with Nikki, I'm seeing a broader picture, the good and the bad, and her lack of perfection adds to her charm. I want to learn even more.

Damn, I really am falling for her, but she might as well be four hundred feet tall to me. How would we make that work if I can't grow back?

No, no, no -- I need to figure out a way to grow back. This can't be permanent.

As Nikki's shift finally ends, she informs me that she lives...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Crushing, Figuratively

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
"Alice is nice," Nikki explains as she sits on her bus seat. "It's good to have someone around that I can rely on, but is content to give me space when I need it. And I need it a lot. People just... They're so intense, y'know? Not like you. I can talk to you, without feeling crowded. I..."

She blushes, looking down at me for the first time in minutes. "I'm doing it myself, aren't I? Talking too much, crowding you just by being here, by being so massive! I'm sorry. Of all people, I should be the one to be more considerate!"

She closes her mouth to chew on some strands of her hair, and I speak up. "Hey, don't worry. You saved my life today, and I owe you for that. If you need to unburden, just think of me as a sounding board."

A cute smile on her massive face, and then she places me back in her ear. "So you don't have to shout," she says, her voice echoing so weirdly in this skull-cave.

Silence passes after that, each of us content to bask in the other's presence (some of us more than others, it must be said). Only when she stands to get off at her stop do I ask Nikki more about Alice. What sort of a person is she? Were she to describe her in eighty characters or les, what would she say?
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Twice the Trouble

choices: We can call them in the morning.
We can call them now, but set up a time for tomorrow.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I cling to Nikki's ear as she walks down the sidewalk to her apartment building, and people probably assume she's talking into a Bluetooth or something like that.

"We're quite the pair, Alice and me," Nikki says. "She's got a social anxiety disorder, which she's trying to overcome, but she spends a lot of time working at home as a freelance editor. And then there's me with my issues. We really look out for each other. That reminds me, I should call her, let her know I'm bringing company. She'll appreciate the notice, however short--oh, I'm sorry, that was a really bad choice of words."

"Hey now, there are quite a few species of insects who would consider me tall!"

Nikki giggles, and the sound is adorable, casting a soothing vibration around me. She positions herself against a brick building, presumably one of the neighboring apartment buildings, and she turns on her phone.

"Huh, I've got a voice message. Don't recognize the number. Probably a telemarketer, but let's see..."

She listens in her other ear. I can't make out all the exact words from over on my side, but I recognize the voice.

The voice is Kirsten's. Bethany must have succeeded in dialing her, before her mysterious enlargement. And now Kirsten's reaching out! But will this mean less time with Nikki? I feel suddenly torn.

After listening to the message, Nikki pulls me from her ear and sets me on her palm before her vast, pretty face. She looks almost disappointed, but she's forcing a smile.

"That was your friend Kirsten. She ... sounds very nice. She and Bethany would like to meet up with us tonight. They're worried about you and want to see you. I ... I suppose we could do that. I certainly don't want to hold you hostage or anything."
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Who leaves voicemail?

choices: Alice comes out to meet me, and likes me
Alice comes out to meet me, and doesn't like me

Alice refuses to meet me, and demands I not stay

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
"Firstly," I say slowly, maintaining eye contact with Nikki throughout. "I don't want to abandon you. I'll be here for you, whenever you need me. The only reason - the only one - I want to see Kirsten and Bethany is to find out how they got Beth's size restored."

As the words leave my mouth, I am astounded to realise that I mean them. I lick my dry lips; I was obsessed with Kirsten only hours ago, and bethany after her. Yet now it seems like I've been parted from them for weeks, and Nikki has filled the gap they left, becoming my world.

Am I that shallow? Am I just easily swayed by whichever woman shows me a little bit of care and attention? I need to find out. If I can get these three women together in one room, I can finally lay to rest my conflict.

But I definitely don't want to abandon Nikki. She's utterly blameless in this, and has already suffered so much just because of me. I hope that she understands that.

"I... understand," she says. "I'll call back, let them know where to meet us-"

"Tomorrow," I say.

"Tomorrow?"

"Tomorrow. I'll spend the night here, and we can all meet up tomorrow, at Baxter's Coffee House. Is that all right?"

"Yes. Yes, that's great!" Nikki gushes, and I look away as she begins calling Kirsten.

Once again, I cannot hear Kirsten's side of the chat, but Nikki gives her name, confirms my safety and sets up the meet. As she hangs up and looks back to me, there are tears forming in her eyes.

"What's wrong?"

"She... She told me that I'd better not have hurt you. She was very firm, very aggressive."

No, that can't be right! She's just being protective, surely? "She's just a bit worried, that's all," I assure Nikki. "Once we meet, you'll see she's not so bad."

"How well do you know this Kirsten, Borrower? You've been around her for what, an hour tops? Be careful you're not holding her up on the pedestal of your first impression. People are deeper than that, you know."

We proceed to her home with silence between us after that, me having lots to think over and Nikki calling ahead to talk with Alice. She gives me a thumbs-up at the conclusion, and soon after we're passing the immense portal into their home.

I would say it's cosy, but given the dimensions it would be impossible for me to do so. Instead, I have to say that it's utilitarian. Decoration is at a minimum, and even then what cosmetics there are are kept tiday and distance from the practical features.

Nikki drops her keys into a tray on a small table, then allows me to step off her hand next to them. The giant, jagged metal is terrifying in its own way, so I keep my eyes elsewhere.

"I'll just check on Alice myself, first, okay? Won't be long, Borrower."

"Do you... Do you have to call me that?"

"I just thought it would be best to call you that, so you don't get used to being like that. We'll save your real name for when we manage to get you back to full size again."

When. She said 'when', not 'if'. There's some optimism. and should all go well, tomorrow we'll be able to get started on that! I wave goodbye as she walks off.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Keep Everyone Happy

choices: Maybe it won't be too bad. I stay on the pillow.
Maybe I should try to get to the nightstand and spend the night there.
I abandon the bed and explore the giant apartment.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
Nikki soon returns, alone.

"Okay, so Alice is totally fine with you staying here, but she prefers to stay alone in her room for the evening. She can be a bit shy sometimes, and I think she's a little self-conscious about appearing so huge to someone, like you'll think she's fat or something. I told her that wouldn't be the case, but I don't want to push her. I'm sure you'll meet her in the morning."

I've met so many giant women today, I think I can handle not meeting one right away. Besides, I am looking forward to the one-on-one time with Nikki.

It is getting late, so we're preparing for bed before long. And here I come to some of the practical difficulties of life at one inch high. I have no way to brush my teeth! My mouth feels disgusting, but one fluoride-free night won't kill me. I'm also wearing the only clothes on the planet that are perfectly sized for me. It's a relief to kick my shoes off after such a long day. I leave them on the nightstand beside Nikki's bed, and I hope no stray gust from the bed sheets blows them away.

As for where I get to sleep, Nikki tells me I can lie on the pillow beside her's. And let me tell you, you have never known comfort and softness until you've lain on a gigantic pillow. The pillowcase smells nice and clean, too.

I am a little concerned about Nikki tossing and turning in the middle of the night, but she assures me she's a light sleeper--and that's on the nights she's even able to fall asleep for any length of time.

So I lie on the most pillowy pillow there ever was, and Nikki's head is lying close by, close enough that we're able to converse into the wee hours of the early morning. I have to yell, and she has to whisper, but it works.

She enjoys my harrowing tales of avoiding giant footsteps and leaping (relatively) tremendous heights when I was ant-size. I sympathize with her retail stories--having worked such jobs myself, I've encountered more than a few nightmare customers. We swap stories, trying to one-up each other.

We also have some similar pop-culture tastes, particularly a fondness for Doctor Who and Marvel movies. We simultaneously come to the conclusion that I'm the closest thing to a real-life Ant-Man, just a little taller, a lot less strong, and sorely lacking in any of that Paul Rudd charm. She begs to differ on that last point, though.

There's quite a bit of laughter throughout the night. Nikki keeps needing to hush herself so as not to disturb Alice. We're having a grand time, just enjoying each other's company, without any possibility of anything physical happening between us. The fact that I likely wouldn't survive any such activity certainly takes that off the table.

Eventually, though, Nikki nods off. She seems so peaceful and contented.

Wait, she's moving. She's rolling over. Toward me.

Maybe she's not such a light sleeper after all.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Pillow Talk

choices: Climb up the table in front of Alice
Attempt to get some sleep on the floor outside Nikki's room
See if Alice's room has anywhere suitable
Slope off to sleep on the couch
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I jump back as Nikki's colossal head annexes utterly the small space I had set aside on the pillow, depressing the soft surface under its weight. Well, that's just selfish.

Her lips twitch back, her chest inflates, and a grinding roar of breath churns from within her, echoed a moment later. Great; she's a snorer. There's no way I could sleep in this room even were I able to dodge her rolling mass!

Plodding along with background music courtesy of Nikki's ragged breathing, I swing over the edge, neatly climbing down the covers of the bed to the floor. It's a short journey of a few minutes to the door, and I can just about wriggle my inch-tall form under and into the greater apartment. Once that solid slab is between me and the sleeping woman, the sound of her snoring is almost inperceptible. Good.

Flexing my toes on the rough strands of carpet, I look immediately ahead to see a much more impressive pair of bare feet, each big toe capable of smothering me entirely beneath them.

This wold be Alice, then.

Besides her feet, it's difficult to get a grasp on her shape, as she is clothed in oversized, striped male pajamas, so I can neither confirm nor deny her fear of being found fat. She is certainly taller than her flat-mate though, I'm guessing somewhere on the taller end of the spectrum of female heights.

She walks slowly, considerately trying to remain quiet at this time of night, and her feet rise and descend with almost hypnotic precision, soaring slowly through the air before crushing down onto carpet fibres that flatten beneath her. It's certainly slow enough that I can follow, cautiously.

Even at her pace, she pulls ahead of my tiny strides, and as we enter the kitchen area I stop trying, just watching as she walks up to the sink, creating a waterfall with a gesture.

With a tall glass of water in her hand, Alice pulls a chair up at the table and sits.

Okay, she may be here for a while. I could get up close to her while she is, and with her bare feet it should be easy to get her attention even if I do lack my voice.

If I didn;t mind another climb, I could always try to scale up to the tabletop for a more subtle approach, if she sits there long enough to let me finish (maybe she'll check her phone?).

But I'm going to meet her tomorrow anyway, why try and get a sneak peak now? I need sleep, and could always go back to Nikki's doorway and curl up there like a loyal puppy.

Not too comfortable, that. While Alice is here, I could check her room, se if I can at least find some small, comfy corner to call my own. Or if that's too imposing, I could sneak past her in the kitchen toward the living area and couch.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Letting a Sleeping Giantess Lie

choices: I dive toward the back of the couch.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
There's only one appropriate place for a male guest to sleep--the couch.

It's a small hike to that dominant piece of furniture, but since this is a relatively small apartment, it's doable. Before long, I'm scaling up the side of the old, fraying couch, which isn't as hard as I expected. I think that has more to do with my lack of weight rather than my having any measurable upper-body strength.

Soon, I'm atop a well-worn couch cushion. It's not as luxurious as Nikki's pillow, but I don't have to worry about a giant steamrolling me in my sleep, so I'll take it.

I doze off, wake up, doze off, wake up, rinse and repeat, for I don't know how long. The distant storm of Alice's titanic movements is enough to keep jolting me awake. I'm not sure what time it is, but Alice doesn't seem to be going back to sleep. Once I hear the shower water, I deduce that she must be an early riser, awakening at the crack of dawn to get a jump on the day.

Good for her, but I never truly got to end yesterday, it feels like.

I pass out once again, only to awaken to the sound of footsteps--and no ordinary footsteps at that. No sign of Nikki, but Hurricane Alice is approaching.

Finally, I get my first good view of Alice, dressed and ready for the day, and the un-evolved part of my animal brain goes straight to the objectification, sizing her up, so to speak.

She's not as pretty as Nikki, but not bad-looking by any means, though a slight hunch suggests some insecurity. She's a little thick around the hips, but her waist looks normal for someone of her impressive height. Many guys would prefer her body type over Nikki's skinny frame any day, but I still say Nikki has the most enchanting face I've seen in some time.

But I have to keep reminding myself--this isn't what matters. They're people, with their own problems and their own strengths.

I glance out across the gulf between the couch and coffee table. On the latter, straight ahead, is a laptop computer. Alice steps into this vast gulf, like it's nothing, and she maneuvers to sit down. Apparently, I've taken her cushion of choice.

Suddenly, the size of her hips seems very relevant after all. I really hope no one accuses me of trying to cop a feel. I've got just a second before she sits on me...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: A Gentleman Takes the Couch

choices: Climb up Alice to talk with her
Walk into the open on the couch to see Nikki when she enters
Climb to the floor to head toward Nikki's room
Remain where I am and see what develops
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I could dive to one side, but that incoming ass is wide enough to cover more space than I could leap across. Instead, I'll go back; since Alice is going to be using her laptop, she'll be leaning forward and won;t be pressed fully into the couch.

So I run directly away from the Promethean mass of female flesh that descends, and find myself catapulted as it touches down, slammed against the cushions of the backrest. Yet, as much as the woman looms above me, blocking the light, she doesn't approach any further, leaving enough space for inch-tall me to walk in comfort.

I consider her immensity, unable to crane my head back far enough to see as far as her hunched shoulders. Why should someone like this have social anxiety? She has nothing to fear, from where I stand! Has anyone ever told her that?

Now, maybe I'm getting ideas above my station, but I do think that I did a good job of helping Nikki out, even if I do say so myself. Perhaps, if I help women out in this manner, the witch will see my good deeds and return me to normal?

Ah, but now that I've had that thought, I'll be doing it for myself rather than out of altruism! Damn it. And thinking about that reminds me that Nikki still expects to wake up next to me - if she doesn't, she may think that she imagined me again, or that she rolled over and crushed me!

Oh man, what should I do?
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Out Of Sight

choices: There's a knock on the door.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I think of Nikki waking up and not finding me beside her, and I know there's only one course of action for me. I've got to rush back to her room right now. Of course, what should take several steps is instead going to require a potentially epic journey. What was I thinking coming out here? I wasn't thinking--I was exhausted and desperate for some sleep.

Maneuvering around the seated Alice, I realize something--if I were shrunk in different circumstances, and I had the opportunity to ogle women without their knowing, I might be tempted to indulge all day long. But as I turn the corner around Alice's mighty hip, now I find myself feeling something else: staring, especially as an unknown voyeur, would just be creepy.

It's definitely time to get back to Nikki, and then get my life on track.

Climbing down the couch is a little harder than climbing up, but I manage, and soon I'm on the carpet, which could use a good vacuuming, I can't help but notice.

And then I hear a panicked voice from the bedroom: "Alice! He's gone! I can't find him!"

Alice springs into action. Her huge feet narrowly miss squashing me as she hurries into Nikki's room.

I'm definitely running into that room as fast as my tiny legs will carry me--and nothing will stop me!
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Too Late

choices: Run up to Alice's toe, to get her to look down and see me
Climb the bed to get directly to Nikki
Head to the most open area of floor and jump around, waving arms
Head up Alice's leg, to get higher before contacting her
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
Of course, it takes me a moment to recover from the shock of nearly having my inch-tall form crushed beneath Alice's stampeding foot; all my self-reflection would be for nothing were my life to be ended in such a casual way. I may have been discovered, but I still need to play things safe!

So while I dash as quickly as I can, but keep to the skirting boards as I do so. A small diversion, but to help Nikki I do need to live.

Alice has left the bedroom door open, and I stride in boldly, looking up at the pair of giant women. Alice sits on the bed, bare feet planted diredtly ahead of me as she throws an arm around Nikki's shoulder, her thunderous voice lowered in comforting tones. "Hey, you did remember to take your medication, yeah?"

Nikki, for her part, is withdrawn into herself, knees drawn up and hugged belown her chin, mumbling in reply: "Yes, I told you. I'm sure he's real! So sure..."

My heart reaches out to her, but I am far from able to comfort her. Every second I spend away from her is another she spends in self-doubt, a torment I would not wish upon anyone. I must alert her to my presence as soon as possible!

But how? I can't reach her directly just yet... Should I go through the medium of Alice, as quick yet dangerous as possible, or try for a more roundabout and assured route? The longer I leave it, the more time Nikki has to convince herself that she imagined everything, and will stop even trying to see me!
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: If Only I Could Hold and Comfort You

choices: I accept my fate -- I'm a Borrower now.
No! I'm going to talk to Nikki!
No! I'm going to leave this apartment and find Kirsten!
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
The direct approach is always best! I scurry up the dangling bed sheets, in a race against Nikki's towering doubts.

I'm halfway up when I hear, "Maybe...Maybe I did just imagine it all. I guess I just liked the idea of having a tiny little friend all to myself. What does that say about me?"

"It's nothing to be ashamed of," Alice says, with sincere compassion. "Let's go eat some breakfast and start the day fresh."

"Yeah, okay."

Nikki's thin but mighty legs swing down, knocking me off the sheets. I crash on the floor, the softness of the carpet saving me from serious injury. On my back, I gaze straight up and see Nikki effortlessly stepping over me, unaware of my presence so far beneath her. This steep, low angle accentuates just how massive she is compared to me. As far as I'm concerned, she is a giant. She might only ever be a giant in my eyes.

I watch the two giants depart the bedroom, and I reflect on how much anguish I've caused this poor girl. Sure, I provided some friendship and fun, but on balance, am I doing more harm than good? Plus, there's a good chance I might never grow back. The witch probably just restored Bethany because she didn't want a woman to suffer for my sins, but this might be it for me. What good would I be to Nikki as a one-inch-tall boyfriend? She deserves more than my useless little self.

I could just accept my fate and get used to my new size. I could set up my new home here, live underfoot of these two giants, scavenging their kitchen for food as needed, without them ever noticing me. As far as giants go, these two seem pretty tame, and I doubt they have much company over. I'd be as safe here as anywhere.

I could be...an actual Borrower.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Doubts

choices: Head to the kitchen for some food
Look around for something to cut through the carpet
Explore the apartment to discover its layout
Climb higher - maybe I'll see more from there
Head for the window to see if I can learn where in the city I am
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I've tried, and tried and tried. Every time, failure. Facts must be faced, and the punishment the witch imposed upon me is my life now.

I must live as a borrower.

They live under the floorboards - beneath the very feet of the big folk. Well, that's where I shall begin.

A few seconds of attempting to tear at the carpet ends in exhaustion. No, I'm not going to manage that. I'm tiny even by borrower standards - to Arrietty I'd be little more than a doll!

Maybe I can find something else to use to cut my way down there, to my rightful abode...

Then again, the women did mention 'breakfast', and it's been hours since I last ate. All the nerves from wanting to talk to women meant I couldn't keep anything down, y'know? I could head to this kitchen of the gods, grab some grub and maybe build up my strength.

An inch tall in the home of two women, I'd better plan my first steps carefully...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Borrower 4 Life

choices: Go straight to the women in the kitchen
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
What? After all this effort, all this suffering, just give up? So close to a giant, gorgeous girl?

Never!

I began this process wanting to pick up chicks, not to indulge in some tiny survival fantasy! Nikki is just in the next room, and hasn't totally forgotten me just yet. I'll not let the witch win by frustrating my destiny!

It would be simple to just walk out there and confront both Nikki and Alice. But I'm an inch tall and they're making breakfast, so perhaps that's less than a guaranteed success...

I had almost scaled the bed before Nikki's leg knocked me off - I could go back, complete the climb and wait up there. Against the bedclothes, I should be much easier to spot!

Then again, Alice was at her patop near the couch - if I were to get near that, she'd spot me, and I'd have two witnesses to my existence!

But is there any rush? I could stop from giving Nikki too many surprises so quickly, and play the long game. I could secrete myself on her work clothes, reveal myself when she's back at the book shop.

Finally, now that she's doubting herself Nikki will want her medication. If I hang out by her pills, she'll pick me up and realise I'm real!
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Don't Give Up On Giant Nikki

choices: Wait for someone to open the door
Climb onto someone to be carried out
Climb up to try a window
Get thrown out with the trash
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
It's been fun, but Kirsten's out there. First to see me, first to care... She's the one for me! I'll have to escape from this giant domicile, find a way to locate another giant in a gargantuan city, all while an inch tall.

A pretty impossible task, but one step at a time it may be manageable. Step one: get out of this gigantic home.

Well, how's that to be done? I certainly can't crack the door open myself. Maybe I should just hang out there, wait for one of the women to open it and scurry out? Or I could stash myself away as a passenger on one of them, and get carried out in secret. Bad times if I got discovered, but I'd be taken further into the world.

Maybe I could climb up to a window, get out that way?

I could get thrown out with the trash! That would get me pretty far pretty quickly!

Or maybe there's another way... Could I cut my way out, or find a ready-made hole somewhere here at ankle level?
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: To Escape the Giants' Castle

choices: Nikki calls Kirsten, wanting to meet at the coffee shop ASAP.
Nikki invites Kirsten and Bethany to the apartment, so as not to risk losing me.
Nikki asks why I left the bed last night.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
My best bet is to position myself nearest to her line of sight. Unfortunately, the way Nikki has scrunched herself up, she's mostly looking at her own feet up on the bed. But occasionally, she glances across the floor, almost hopeful.

There's a wide open patch of bare carpet in the middle of the room -- thank goodness she's not a total slob! I rush to this spot and begin making myself as "big" as possible. I jump, I wave, I even shout and scream, for all the good that might do. I keep it up for several seconds, then a full minute, then even longer as Alice continues to console Nikki. I doubt Alice ever believed her -- she was probably just humoring her last night with that excuse about not wanting to see me.

I'm just about ready to give up when Nikki's eyes land on the carpet, and her eyes grow huge -- the widest, happiest I've yet seen them.

In a second, she's on the floor and gently scooping me up into her hand, and my entire view consists of her gorgeous, relieved face.

"I thought I lost you!" she says. "I thought--"

I expect her to start crying, but then she moves in closer to me, her lips puckering up.

She kisses me, her lips covering much of my body. I fall back onto her hand, but then I pull myself right back up and start kissing back. We're making out, despite our extreme size difference, and it's surreal and wonderful, unlike anything I ever expected to experience. Her giant lips are pretty much everything to me as I lose myself in this moment, and I have zero fear of her getting too aggressive or forceful. She's rather perfect at the moment.

We finally pull apart and gaze into each other's eyes, and a shocked Alice leans down to look at me.

"Oh my God. He is real."

"He sure is," Nikki says. "And I am not losing you again."
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Perfect

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
"I..." The truth will hurt her. But a lie would hurt her more. Standing tall in the palm of Nikki's hand, I look directly up at her.

"I was scared you'd roll over and crush me in your sleep."

"What? I'd never -"

She blushes, pulling her head back away from me, but then Alice looms in over her shoulder, and I get my first good look at Nikki's room-mate. A wide, kind face, mouth pursed in curiosity.

"He's pretty cute," she asserts. "But he does look pretty fragile. I certainly wouldn't have him sleep in my bed with me, the delicate little thing!"

Her pinky finger darts in to knock me on my ass, and the giggle she lets out at my pratfall diffuses the tension. Even Nikki cracks a smile, struggling to suppress it as she moves back in.

"I'm sorry. Of course, I'm a terrifying thing to someone so small. I shoulda thought of that. All that time I spent reading 'The Borrowers' as a kid, imagining myself so tiny and able to hide away - I never imagined how scary I'd be as a great, ugly giantess."

"No, no, it's not you..." And I'm kicking myself for the cliche halfway through the saying of it. "...it's me. I've never been so close to a woman before, let alone one so massive as you, so overflowing with beauty..."

"I would say 'get a room'." Alice interjects, "but you already have one. Let me know when you want breakfast."

The door clicks shut behind her as she leaves, and Nikki and I are left alone, staring intently at each other, one marvelling at the delicateness, the other at the vastness.

One of us will have to speak soon, to decide where to take this...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Love and Fear Hand In Hand

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
"That was, uh, some kiss," I say, less manly than I intended.

"Yeah. You're not such a bad kisser...for a little guy!" she says with an adorable giggle.

We're both blushing, and before long, we're kissing again.

Since a gentleman doesn't kiss and tell, let's just say that, despite being a measly one inch tall, this is possibly the best morning of my life. I've never felt so close, so comfortable, with anyone.

Later, Nikki and I arrive at the coffee shop. She does all the work of arriving, of course, while I hang out in her shirt pocket, snuggling against her warm chest as my mind replays the morning on a loop.

Nikki takes a seat at a table near the door. Kirsten and Bethany, it turns out...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Don't Kiss and Tell

choices: I walk back to Nikki, and explain that I want to stay with her
I consent to go alone with Bethany to the witch
I demand that all four of us confront the witch
While they're distracted, I leave all three to go my own way
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
You make small talk. Nikki fidgets. The moment of truth doesn't drag on, and two familiar giantesses stomp through the door right on time. Bethany is somehow even more terrifying now; having seen her on your scale, having her now as a towering monster reinforces the power she holds over you. Her face even sports a wicked smirk, her eyes narrowed as she casts her gaze around.

By contrast, the backlit Kirsten is like an angel from Heaven. As perfect in appearance as I can remember, shame strikes me as I can't help but compare Nikki to this effigy of femininity.

I can pull my eyes away as she strides past, not knowing my ride by sight. So, I scramble up from my place, slapping against Nikki's exposed skin until she looks down. I point, her head turns, and she speaks:

"Kirsten? Bethany?"

Thus is the ice broken, both Kirsten and Bethany looking down at you as they sit. The former smiles brightly, the latter widens a grin that is unsettling.

Nikki gently plucks me up between finger and thumb, and I am placed on the table, overshadowed by cups and condiments, turning in place constantly to keep track of which of three goddesses is talking.

Kirsten lays her palm on the table beside me, but I am hesitant to leap aboard. Before I met Nikki, this would be my dream come true; but now I am in a situation I could never have dreamed of! I began trying to hit on women until one would like me, and now I'm torn between two gorgeous examples!

"See?" Bethany says, seeing my hesitation. "You can't trust this little prick, Kirsten. For all his cries of being naive and vulnerable, he's just taking advantage of every woman he meets. No doubt he's tried the same routine on you, Nikki?"

"No, he's not like that! He was so small and scared, and needed me help..."

"Mmm-hm. Well girls, I tell you all that I need to take the guy for myself; like I already told Kirsten, I need to take him back to the witch otherwise I'm going back to being just his size. I promise I'll take good care of him."

Her grin somehow manages to get wider, hungrier, and scarier in the moment after that as she looks down at me. Did our experience together mean nothing to her? Or is it merely the witch putting her up to this - it would be useful to find out how she got back to normal size, and going with her would be the only way to accomplish that...

As three thunderous voices talk above my head, treating me more like an object than a person, I am reminded once more of how poorly I've treated women in the past. But still, I must show them a sign, make a decision for myself to drive this argument toward a conclusion.

Or, being as pathetic as I am, I could climb down from here, leave them to it. They're all better off without a man like me around.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Four's A Crowd

choices: ...an office I used to work at.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I'm not sure I believe Bethany about the witch. Maybe she wants to dispose of me herself--get me out of her friend's life for good, then use the "witch" as a scapegoat.

I'll play along for now--but I'll do it my way.

As I wave up to signal my intent to speak, all three huge faces lean closer to me. People are probably wondering what these three young ladies are looking at, but most would probably assume a phone screen or something like that.

"How about we all go to the witch?" I shout up. "All four of us. That way, if the witch pulls anything, at least someone might be able to run and get help!"

Kirsten is the first to agree with me. "Yes. That's smart. And to be honest, I've been wanting to give this witch a piece of my mind. Who does she think she is, shrinking innocent people down like this?"

She's so protective and strong-willed--I'm reminded why I became so fond of her so quickly.

"I'm in, too," Nikki says, affectionately stroking me with her finger, and I'm reminded how fond I am of her, too. "Like I said, I'm not losing you again."

I spot a curious look on Kirsten's face, no doubt wondering what the relationship is here, but she quickly gets back to business. "That's a majority. We're going. Now, Bethany, I think it's time you told us where exactly the witch wanted to meet you."

I'm surprised that Bethany gives in without argument. She reveals the location, and I recognize it. It's...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Safety in Numbers

choices: The apartment is filled with shrunken people, imprisoned
The apartment is a scientific laboratory
The witch's body lies dead on the floor
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
Bethany give sup the location easily enough, but insists on being the one to carry me to the witch. "We don't want her to be suspicious immediately," she reasons, and I guess we have to agree.

So it is that I ride in her palm through the familar is grotesquely outsize corridors of my apartment building. Nikki and Kirsten walk right behind, so I now she won't try anything, yet still I look up at the towering arrangement of fingers shielding me from passers-by - she could clench and crush me in an instant.

I briefly consider getting the women to stop by and contact Lana since we're here, but I don't want to drag my room-mate into this as well. Walking into the den of a mistress of the dark arts with two women I care for and Bethany is risk enough. No, all going well the next time I see Lana it'll be eye-to-eye, to tell her that I finally met a woman!

Which woman though? Nikki and Kirsten being here together is giving my heart all sorts of funny feelings, and they barely spoke with each other on the car ride over. How can I be trapped at one inch height and yet not have my physical danger be the scariest thing in my mind?

"You ready, little guy?" Bethany grins down at me as she stands before the door of the apartment. "I don't think you are. I don't think anyone could be. I certainly wasn't. Just remember: you asked for this."

She raps the knuckles of her free hand on the door. In reply, it opens on its own - as if by magic. Within, the witch's mysteries laid bare...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Is It All Connected?

choices: Courtney shrinks Nikki, Kirsten, and Bethany to three inches tall.
Courtney pulls a "Jedi mind trick" on them.
Before she can act, I make a bold, desperate play.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I peer through Bethany's fingers to scope out the witch's fortress -- and it's just a normal apartment, with the exact layout of mine, just different furniture and decorations, but nothing out of the ordinary. How did I never recognize the witch was a neighbor? Surely, I would've noticed someone as hot as her around the building!

But that's not even the most surprising thing. Lana is in this apartment! She rises from the couch and approaches -- and she's enormous! This is only the second time I've seen someone I already knew from this perspective. But whereas I hadn't seen my old crush Amy in years, I see Lana virtually every day. And I normally have to look down at her!

Now, like everyone else, Lana appears to be around four hundred feet tall, which has the odd effect of only amplifying her natural attractiveness. Her green eyes and pretty face are all the more vibrant, and her feminine curves are all the curvier. Forget that -- she's strictly a friend, and I bizarrely have enough on my plate at the moment.

Lana maintains some distance as she bends slightly and peers at Bethany's hand, in utter disbelief.

"Billy? Is that you? You're so...tiny!"

I wave sheepishly. "Uh, hi, Lana!" I doubt she can hear me from over there.

"What's going on?" Bethany asks. "Who is this? This wasn't what we talked about."

The witch approaches and places a comforting hand on Lana's shoulder. "I told you I could get them to bring him back, Lana. Here they are -- the witches who shrank your roommate!"

Maybe it's my skewed perspective, but the way the witch is looking at Lana ... I think she has a crush on my roommate! But Lana's straight! And wait, is that what this whole thing has been about? Am I just a pawn in the witch's attempt to woo Lana?

Kirsten marches forward. "That's a lie! We didn't shrink him -- you did! Admit it!"

Nikki also steps forward, less confidently. "Yeah, change my boyfriend back to the right size!"

Boyfriend? This is escalating fast. I'm not sure I mind, though.

"Boyfriend?" Lana says. She's in as much disbelief about that as my size. "Billy doesn't have a girlfriend! As his roommate, I think I would know. That proves it, Courtney -- I don't know what these girls are up to, but this has to end!"

"Don't worry, Lana," the witch, Courtney apparently, says. "It will take some time, maybe days or weeks, but I might eventually figure out how to undo their spell. But I think I know how to deal with these three now..."
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Just a Pawn

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
While the other four shout back and forth, Bethany has remained quiet, seemingly dumbfounded by this betrayal. Looking up at her, I wave to get her attention, and as her face turns downward, I see a loneliness that I had mistaken for cruelty. She's at a loss, her world turned upside down. I'm in much the same situation, but I've had worse today.

"Bethany!" I shout. "Snap out of it! Don't let this bitch get Kirsten!"

Like a magic word, Bethany's brow lowers as she thinks of her friend. Frowning, she nods to me and looks upward and beyond my eyeline, where I guess Courtney stands. Action!

Fingers close down around me and I quail for a moment, fearing the fate of a car in a crusher. Yet Bethany's hold is tender, strength cushioned by her warm, soft skin. In the dark, I have no idea what's going on out there, and I hardly move as the hand shifts position, held tight and safe.

There's movement, gravity shifting ever so slightly, and then a quaking noise that shudders through the entire world as far as I can tell - I'm yelling in response, sure that the witch has cast some spell or other, that death is coming for me, and I'm being held tight by Bethany rather than Nikki or Kirsten.

But I live, and I blink as the hand peels open, light falling again upon me. The palm's not entirely flat, and I lash out to grab the thumb to keep steady, looking down to see Courtney on the floor, a bruise already forming on her face.

"No spell protects from my right hook," Bethany laughs from above, and I remember all too well her ferocity in our shrunken fight. Then I double take.

"You punched her with me in your hand? What were you thinking? You could have crushed me!"

Righting her hand and raising it before her triumphant face, Bethany explains it to me patiently, her expression stern and - once again - terrifying. "I was thinking that maybe you'd want to give her a punch yourself, and would appreciate me acting as your proxy. You're welcome, jerk."

"Uh, yes, thank you, that did feel good, yes. Now, uh, take me over to Lana, please?"

No need to head there, as giant Lana is stomping close, shouting. "Oh, you want to throw down, huh? I'll take all three of you, right now!"

She could, too. She's always been proud of her martial arts classes. So I shout and wave, getting her attention again, and close enough for her to hear me.

"Lana! It's okay! These three are trying to help me, and Courtney was the witch that did this to me! I don't know why she's trying to set us against each other, but she must have a way of turning me back to normal!"

Lana drops into a chair, sighing heavily. "Okay, Billy, this is a lot to take in..."

"Maybe she has a spellbook or something?" Kirsten says. "Let's search this place!"

"Yeah!" Nikki agrees. "We're so close now! Come here Billy, we can search together!"

Best not play favourites right now - best to sort the emotional mess out once I'm the tallest person in the room again. "No, it's best if we all split up to find it. Bethany - put me on the floor, I'll be able to find it if she's hidden it somewhere low!"

Nikki's face falls, and Kirsten looks quickly between the two of us for a moment. Lana stands again. "We got off to a bad start. I'm Lana, Billy's room-mate. Pleased to meet you."

While the others shake hands and apologise, Bethany lowers me to the ground, and I step off her hand. As she stands again, I'm intimidated all over again by the four giantesses.

"We'll watch where we step, tiny," Bethany laughs, stepping deliberately close to me as she walks away. Her foot's impact topples me to the side, and I hurriedly scurry under a couch, wondering if Courtney hid her spellbook under there.

So, the five of us tear the apartment apart between us, but which of us will find the book first? Whoever it is might have the temptation to make use of it for more than restoring my size...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Pawn Takes Queen

choices: Bethany's spell reduces all men to my size
Bethany's spell makes her a giant so all men seem small to her
The spell backfires, shrinking Bethany out of sight
Bethany was only kidding, and restores me
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
"Hey, Billy?" Bethany trills, her taunting tone carrying easily to my space beneath the couch. I cease digging futilely at the floor to scurry out. Something about the wya she's talking fills me with dread...

She's standing in the centre of the room, and as I crane my neck upward she bends over, her towering form holding a massive book between crushing fingertips. "Ah, there you are. So, remember when I told you that the world would be much better if all men were as puny as you? Well, now I can make that dream a reality..."

I start forward, not sure what I can do at an inch tall but determined to make a stand. A hand slams down, pressing me to the ground, and I see that Courtney has come around, still lying on the floor but more than capable of restraining little old me.

"Let her be," she whispers. "Let's see what power she can unleash..."

With no option but to do so, I look around to see the other women still searching in far corners of the apartment, what seemed like shouting to me only a whisper of Bethany's that was inaudible to giantesses. They won't be coming to my aid any time soon. Bethany's voice rises as she finds her place, and begins chanting a spell in a language that man was not meant to hear...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: Men Become As Bugs

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
"I think this is it!" Lana says, pulling a book out from behind a bookshelf.

I'm relieved that Lana's the one to find it. As the only one I've known longer than a day, she's the only one I can completely trust to look out for me. This bodes well.

I emerge from under the couch, and Lana spots me. She sits crisscross in front of me as she thumbs through the book. Kirsten and Nikki crouch beside us while Bethany keeps an eye on the witch.

"Here we go," Lana says. "This page has spells for shrinking, and...aha! A restoration spell! Looks like I just read these words and this will all be over! Then I want to hear all about your tiny little adventures, Billy. I still can't believe how this day is turning out."

Lana reads the spell out loud, and a light washes over me. I feel a surge of energy flowing through me. Yes!

Wait, no. The light fades, and I'm still looking at giant Lana. Everyone and everything else are still huge, too.

"Maybe I mispronounced something?" Lana says, squinting at the text.

The witch laughs. "I told you," Courtney says, massaging her bruise. "When I shrank you the second time, it was permanent. You never had any chance of growing back."

"What?" I call out. "You mean I'm stuck like this for the rest of my life?"

Nikki's eyes pop wide open. "Your voice -- it's louder! I heard you perfectly."

I test my voice again, and sure enough, everyone can hear me clear as day.

"That part wasn't permanent," Courtney says. "I can sometimes be merciful."

Lana, Kirsten, and Nikki all object on my behalf, but Courtney speaks over them.

"None of you are looking on the bright side. This guy was in a rut when I found him, trying to pick up random women on the street. He was so desperate. Such a loser. But thanks to me, he's had adventure. He's made new friends. He's met a girl he likes and who likes him."

Courtney looks at Nikki, who blushes as all other eyes fall on her.

"All thanks to me," Courtney says. She, and her spellbook, begin to fade in a surreal glow. "You're welcome."

The witch vanishes. Deep down, I know I'll never see her again. I really am stuck like this.

Lana is the first to lower her head down to my level. "Billy, I am soooo sorry. Don't worry, I'll take care of you, and maybe someday we can find a science-based or medical solution to this."

"Thanks, Lana. I guess I'm going to have to rely on you quite a bit." I turn to Kirsten, who also descends to the carpet. "And thank you, Kirsten. You were the first friendly giant I met. If not for you, I would have been squished long ago."

"I certainly couldn't leave you alone in your condition! But I really do hope we can stay friends. I'd be happy to fill in whenever Lana isn't able to watch you."

"I may take you up on that. And, Bethany--"

Bethany doesn't advance. She keeps her distance and mutters, half-smiling, "I guess any friend of Kirsten is a friend of mine."

Lastly, I turn to Nikki, who's sitting against the base of the couch and looking away, sad.

"Nikki? I would completely understand if you have no interest in dating a one-inch-tall guy."

"And I'd understand if you don't want to date some big huge giant woman."

Our eyes connect, and we realize what we both want.

"Let's just take it slow," I say. "I do have a lot of adjusting to do, and a lot of things to figure out, but I really would like to keep getting to know you."

Nikki smiles brightly. "Yeah. Yeah! I'd like that, too. I don't care what your size is. You're bigger on the inside."

I definitely wasn't yesterday. But if I keep working at it, maybe I will be.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: A New Beginning

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I've been rooting along the floor, peeking under the furniture and checking to see if there are any hidden trapdoors, when a tremendous earthquake indicates that one of the girls has just jumped up and down.

Crawling to my feet, I see three of the immense women stomping toward the gigantic sneakers of Nikki, and crane my neck back just in time to get a face full of:

"SQUEEE! Sorry, sorry, maybe I'm a little behind on my medication today. But I found it! Here it is! Let me just find the page..."

We all wait as she pages through the comically-large tome in her hands. Lana slumps onto the couch while Kirsten nervously shifts from foot to foot. For her part, Bethany sits on the prone Courtney, keeping her from interfering.

"Ah-ha!" Nikki exclaims. "Here it is! The cure for such a curse is... Oh. That can't be right."

"How come?" Kirsten asks.

"It says 'true love's kiss' can break the spell. But Billy and I kissed, well, more than once and he's still small!"

Kirsten blushes and looks away, and Nikki shrugs as she looks down at me. Only one person in the room is more than morose, her witch-like cackle drawing all attention back to her.

"You think knowing someone for a day is enough to qualify as true love?" Courtney grins. "Had Billy spent the night with Kirsten, who's to say she wouldn't feel like you do now? You girls, mistaking an instant attraction as a destined romance! Ha!

"Look at Lana there! How long have you and Billy lived together? You know each other intimately, as fully as two people can without actually coming together. Is there no hint of love in that relationship?

"And finally, this lovely lady sitting on top of me. Have you never seen a movie? The couple that are antagonistic toward each other from the start always end up getting together at the end. Don't tell me there's no attraction there..."

"As if!" Bethany snorts, catching my eye for a second before blushing and looking aside.

"You see, Billy?" Courtney taunts, staring across at me almost at my level. "Four women here, each of which has at least some claim to being your one, true love. Yet you'd have to spend a lot more time with them to determine if it truly is a love for the rest of your life."

"You're wrong," I tell her, stepping forward as the standing women step back to give me room and safety.

"No tiny, you can't just fixate on someone as your love so quickly. That's just lust."

"Oh, I agree with that. I mean that you're wrong about how many women here could be in love with me. There are five."

Now it's her turn to blush, as I pace back and forward before her face, close enough that her breath gusts my hair. "You've lived here, above my apartment, for how long? And I've never noticed you. But did you notice me? See me around, but never draw up the courage to talk to me? And when, not so long ago, I actually spoke to you, you cursed me on instinct. You regretted it later, came up with this crazy, convoluted plan, and it ended with you being sat on while someone else paws through your spellbook."

"Regardless," Nikki interrupts, "you're going to have to find your true love if you want to get back to normal, Billy. We might have to, I don't know, take it in turns to get to know you a little better, develop our feelings. When you do find your true love, you'll know. And I know it'll be me."

Oh, boy. I started off hitting on random women on the theory that I was bound to find someone compatible eventually, and now I have a choice of five gorgeous giantesses.

Well, not choice, really. It's the same theory: one of these five has to be my true love, the woman I'll spend my life with. Yet I'll have to work to discover which one, to offer more than a pick-up line. How long will it take? With whom will I end up? Let's find out...
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: The Greatest Cliche of All

1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.content:
I shout up, confident that the sound of a man's voice will halt Alice's destructive descent. When it doesn't, and her ass fills my vision entirely, I realise my mistake:

When I went to sleep, did I forget that the witch took away my louder-than-inch-tall voice away? Now I just let out a squeak that the woman has no chance of hearing above her own breath, and she presses me into the couch unknowingly.

At first I'm merely squashed down into the giving fabric by the bigger person, both surfaces pliant enough to leave me space to call my own, but then Alice shifts her weight from one buttock to another, grinding herself into a more comfortable position.

As she does so, she grinds me apart, rending my limbs and smearing me like a bug.
1522111121111211121122121112112213114212.title: A Crushing Reminder

152211112111121112112212112.content:
Not that I want to see Bethany or anything, but in my current position, I figure it’s best to be pragmatic.

But how do I, as a tiny guy, find a tiny girl in this gigantic bookstore? I remember which bookshelf I left her at when I was a total bastard and abandoned her, and she clearly didn’t seek out Kirsten for help, and she’s awfully insecure about being shrunk...

A humongous sneaker crashes down outside my table shelter, which suggests another fate for Bethany. Did someone step on her?

Hold on...Those shoes look familiar...And this person is beginning to crouch down...

Ah!

It’s Bethany! And she’s a giant again! Well, a giant to me. And she’s looking right at me!

“I thought I saw a little traitor scurrying around,” she says, snatching me up into her hand before I can even think of fleeing.

She carries me off to a more secluded spot, completely deaf to my tiny protests.

She says, “So until a minute ago, I was stuck at like five inches tall surrounded by a bunch of really big people. It was so humiliating. You’re lucky no one saw me. Though there were some close calls. But now you’re somehow even smaller, and here I am...much, much bigger.”

“Bethany, I’m sorry. You have every right to be angry--”

“I can’t hear a word you’re saying, little dude.”

Another voice calls out, “Bethany! There you are!” It’s Kirsten! A sensible giant! Oh, thank God!

(I’ve really got to stop thinking of people as giants. But I guess it feels better to pretend they’re the ones with the weird size and not me.)

Bethany flashes me a vaguely sinister smile before she...
152211112111121112112212112.title: She's back

1522111121111211121122122.content:
So since I’ve been living in a hamster cage for the past day, I have to admit: That didn’t go so well.

I wasn’t able to escape her in that alley. Her reach was just too long. She scooped me up and shoved me into her back pocket. Every time I tried to crawl out, she’d jab me with her fingers and knock me back into my prison.

If only I was faster...But if I was, so what? How much longer would I have survived at my puny size? At least I’m safe locked in here--my karmic punishment for objectifying women.

Giant Ass has been treating me like a favorite pet all day. I’ve yet to even learn her name. But my cage on the dresser here is at hip-level, so I’ve been seeing her giant ass walk back and forth over and over. So Giant Ass it is, until I hear otherwise.

Every now and then, she’d bend down to look straight at me, and she’d tap on the clear plastic to see my reaction. At least I get an excellent view of her chest when she does that...Really, I could stare at those things all day...And there’s not much else to do for entertainment around here. Enjoying the sight of her giant body is all I’ve got.

But it’s not enough. I need to get out of here. If only I still had my voice and I could reason with her...She had a bad day, sure, but she’s not necessarily evil. She has to realize how wrong this is. I just have to get to know her somehow...

I’m definitely not going to get anywhere from inside here. There’s got to be some exit route, some hole too small for Giant Ass to notice, but big enough for little ol’ me.

But even if I get out, I’m one inch tall in some strange bitter woman’s home that I don’t even know where it’s located. I don’t even know if she has any actual pets.

What to do?
1522111121111211121122122.title: Life as a pet

15221111211112111211221221.content:
Giant Ass went out for a jog, leaving me plenty of time to comb this damn hamster cage for cracks to exploit.

And I find one. Where the clear plastic connects to the bottom, there’s a tiny piece that’s been broken off. At least, it’s tiny to Giant Ass, not easily noticeable. But to me, well, it’s still not large, but I might be able to squeeze through.

Oh, this is going to hurt...

In I go...

Urgh...Agh...Push!...Ow!

Ow! Damn! I don’t know if I’m quite small enough...I think I’m about to have a Winnie the Pooh moment here...which would be the height of all absurdities in an already absolutely absurd 24 hours I’ve had.

Arrrrgh!

I’m out. Whew. My side’s bleeding, but I’m out. I’m out, and I’m standing on Giant Ass’s giant dresser. I might as well be stuck on the roof of a 20-story building. What are my options down?

Her bed’s flush against the dresser. It’s quite a fall for me, but it would be a soft enough landing. The hard part would be climbing down the sheets to the floor, which would be followed my several even harder parts.

That huge lamp has a cord that goes all the way down to the floor. I could wrap my arms around it and slide down like it’s a pole.

I have to admit: Either way would be fun. But I have to act fast. She could return any minute...
15221111211112111211221221.title: Tight squeeze

152211112111121112112212212.content:
I’ll take the cord. More of a straight shot. Plus, I might bounce off the bed, and there’d be no coming back from that landing.

I grab the cord, and I inch my way down. I’ll slide when I’m closer to the ground. I feel like a damn bug.

If I didn’t abandon Bethany to run off with Amy, I could be with Kirsten right now. Quite a few girls I’ve met today, and what do I have to show for it? I always make the wrong choices. If I wasn’t already an inch tall, I’d certainly feel like I was. Always the wrong choices...

Oh, God...Slipping...Too high to slip, don’t--!

Ahhhhhhhhh...!

OW! ARGH!

Not dead...how am I not dead? But not well, either...Hurts to move...ow...

I’m on the carpet, right behind that towering dresser, and I start hearing thunder...No, not thunder: Giant Ass’s footsteps. She’s home. And I’m in no shape to escape. Where would I even escape to?

Thoom...Thoom...THOOM...THOOM...!

“Hey! Where’s my pet?”

I push past the pain and crawl under the dresser, and through the other side I see her sneakers pointed at me.

Then I see her knees lowering onto the floor, and her head follows. She angles her face sideways to get a good look under the dresser, and of course, she sees me.

“There you are!” she shouts, reaching her hand toward me.

But she can’t reach. She’s too damn big. For once, being tiny works to my advantage.

I know she can’t hear me, but I have to gloat. “Ha! Shame you can’t fit your giant ass down here, huh, Giant Ass? You can’t get me, nyah, nyah, nyah--”

Her face disappears, and her shoes take its place in my view. She walks to the side.

I think I see where this is going...but no...She couldn’t possibly lift this huge thing...even though she herself is humungous...I mean...Isn’t it too heavy for her?

Apparently not. The dresser moves, and I’m treated to a worm’s-eye view of my gigantic captor. She definitely has the height advantage. And I’m too wounded to get away.

As she bends down to snatch me up, I have to confess: She looks really hot in those exercise tights.
152211112111121112112212212.title: Ouch

1522111121111211121122122121.content:
So I’m back in my newly-fortified hamster cage. My exit route has been blocked by a heavy book, and another book has been set on the top cover. I’ve really got nothing. I’m trapped, with no one to help me.

Giant Ass leans down for a one-way chat. “Look, little dude, you’re stuck with me, and any time a guy pisses me off, I’m taking it out on you.
