And at your puny size, there’s not a damn thing you can do about it. I’m the one with the power here, not you. Face it: You’ve just lost the battle of the sexes.”

I did lose. I almost got on the right track with Kirsten, but then what happened? I was selfish, and it all snowballed from there. I cared about myself, not her. I failed to be a better person, and now I’ve got life in prison.

I never even got to see Kirsten at normal size. She was only ever a giant to me. I wonder if she and I would have worked out...? She truly was as close to perfect as anyone I’ve ever met...

I suppose I’ve got plenty of time to fantasize about her now.

Also on the bright side, Giant Ass is rather hot. There are worse views to be stuck with.
1522111121111211121122122121.title: A life sentence

15221111211112111211221222.content:
I’m exhausted, and I’ve got all the time in the world now, so I figure I might as well recharge with a nap.

The hay isn’t too uncomfortable, and I am really tired...Zzzzz....

“Hey. Wake up.”

Who the hell?

“Agh!” I shout, as I find the witch leaning over me. She shrunk herself down to fit in this cage with me, but of course, she only shrank to about twice my current height. She just has to tower over me, doesn’t me? “What do you want now?”

“It’s just that you’re so damn amusing, I figured I’m not done having fun with you yet.”

Having nothing to lose, I lose all fear. I march right up to her waist and look up, pointing a stern finger. “Unless you’re going to bust me out of here, I don’t want to hear it. I’m through with your games.”

“I am going to bust you out of here.”

I lower my stern finger. “Oh. Alright then.”

“And I’m even going to give you one last opportunity to grow back. It all depends on you, and how well you perform in my new challenge.”

“What’s the challenge this time?”

She smiles and shakes her head. “How fun would it be if I told you? You’ll have to figure it out for yourself. If you succeed, I’ll make you a big person again.”

“Hey, that’s not fair--”

There’s a flash of light, and I’m somewhere else. The good news is I’m not in a hamster cage. The bad news is I’m still about an inch tall.

Looks like I’m in someone’s kitchen. I’m standing on the seat of a chair, and a massive table looms overhead.

Whoa! Or it did loom overhead. Someone just pulled out the chair, probably about to--oh, dammit--probably about to sit down.

I look up, and...It’s her! It’s...
15221111211112111211221222.title: A new challenge

152211112111121112112212221.content:
It’s Bethany! And she’s a giant again!

And she’s about to sit her big skinny butt down right on top of me!

Luckily she is a thin young woman, which leaves plenty of chair space for the both of us. I get out of harm’s way in plenty of time as her jeans slowly touch down onto the smooth wooden surface.

Then I hear her talking, her voice booming: “Have you learned your lesson yet?”

Who the hell is she talking to? I didn’t--and still don’t--see any other legs under the table. Maybe she’s on a speaker phone or something...

But someone responds, and it’s someone physically present.

It’s Kirsten’s voice. “Bethany! I’ve had enough of this! Okay, yesterday I thought it would be fun to take the shrinking pill for a little while, but I thought I could trust you to give me the other one.”

Kirsten’s shrunk? She must be on the table. I can’t see her...Is she my size? Bigger? Smaller?

Bethany says, “Yes, that woman gave me the growing pill, too, and I am going to give it to you. But after you’ve learned your lesson. No more boys for you. Ever. They only lead to misery.”

“Beth, don’t be crazy!” Kirsten says. “I can’t give up boys, and I also can’t stay tiny forever!”

“You can stay tiny for as long as it takes. I’m being a true friend here. I’m doing this for your own good. Don’t worry. I’ll take good care of you in the meantime.”

So let’s see here...That witch must have restored Bethany while I was Giant Ass’s prisoner, and apparently she gave her a shrinking pill and a growing pill (hopefully a really tiny growing pill). Bethany convinced Kirsten to shrink and won’t grow her back, which means...

It’s up to me. I have to save Kirsten and help her get back to normal size.

But I wonder...That pill would probably restore me, too, wouldn’t it? Really, only one of us needs to grow back, and then we can track down that witch to restore the other...

First thing’s first...Bethany’s chair of choice is no place for a person my size to be hanging out on. I’ve got to either climb down or climb up...something.
152211112111121112112212221.title: Kirsten's peril

1522111121111211121122122212.content:
The only way up is to climb Bethany herself...but look how damn huge she is! I’d be lucky if I even made it to her waist.

But going down...that should be easier, right? I’d be going along the flow of gravity, and there’s much less to climb down than climb up. So down it is, via Bethany’s jeans.

The conversation continues above me as I stride toward the front of the chair seat.

Kristen says, “If this is for my own good, then why did you also shrink Lauren and Ashley? And where are they? What have you done with them?”

What? Bethany’s turned into some kind of serial shrinker now?

I grab her jeans and begin my descent, carefully grabbing the grooves in the fabric. I make the mistake of looking down from knee-height. It would be a long fall to that hard floor.

“They’re safe in another room,” Bethany says. “And they need to learn the same lesson you do. So does Jean, but she left by the time that woman returned me to normal size. But I’ve got one more shrinking pill with her name on it. She’s coming over in a little bit.”

My downward climb continues as I learn more about what happened during my time in the hamster cage. I knew Bethany wasn’t pleasant, but to shrink all her best friends...and to teach them what lesson? To stay away from boys? The crazy lady’s actually teaching them to stay away from herself. I don’t know who’s more insane -- Bethany or the witch who started all this in the first place.

Kirsten pleads for her friend. “No, Bethany! Don’t shrink Jean! I can’t believe I actually need to say this -- on a number of levels -- but you don’t shrink people against their will. Can’t we just talk? Like normal people? At normal size?”

Almost there. My arms are beginning to feel the strain. Climbing’s tough work -- even climbing down. But I can’t get tired yet.

Bethany says, “You never learned at normal size. I thought a new perspective might be helpful."

“How? You think you have to be a giant for me to listen to you?”

Oh, God. My arms are slipping...Just a little more...Dammit, that’s not happening...

I slip off her ankles and bounce off her socked foot onto the hard floor. Her foot saves me from serious injury, but the final impact is still far from pleasant.

“Agh!” I shout, unfortunately.

Bethany slides the chair back and stands. I stare up at the crazy giant woman, looking even more damn huge than before, and her eyes lock right onto me.

“You! How’d you get here?”
1522111121111211121122122212.title: Going down...

15221111211112111211221222121.content:
Bethany bends down and reaches her gargantuan hand toward me. “Look how tiny you are! You’re even smaller than the girls!”

I dash, naturally. I race across this large kitchen area, which probably merely qualifies as a quaint little kitchen nook to normal people.

The refrigerator is right there, and there’s a gap between it and the counter -- a gap that’s just right for little ol’ me.

I leap into that dark alleyway, feeling a gust from Bethany’s attempt to snatch me.

She crouches down, trying to stick her hand in here. Her fingers fit, just barely. I watch those massive digits flail about like creepy tentacles, out of reach.

“Come on out, shorty!”

“You return Kirsten and the others to their normal size, and then I’ll come out. How about that?”

She doesn’t say anything. Did she even hear me? Can she hear me?

She hears the knock on the door. How could anyone not hear it?

Bethany smirks. “You’re lucky, shorty. I’ve got one more friend to shrink, and then I’m coming for -- Oh, never mind. What can you possibly accomplish at your size? Do whatever you want. Live of my crumbs like the bug you are. Just don’t expect me to watch my step.”

She rises, grabs Kirsten, gently places her in her pocket, and she goes to the door, determined to trick Jean into taking that shrinking pill.
15221111211112111211221222121.title: The fridge of safety

152211112111121112112212221211.content:
Bethany's legs are much longer than mine, so by the time I follow her into the living room area of this apartment or condo, she's already let Jean in and begun chatting and...

Wow. That's Jean? Damn, I thought Kirsten was beautiful, and she is, but Jean's this perfectly curvy redhead with quite possibly the prettiest damn face I've ever seen. And she's also about 400 feet tall, relatively. No one can be perfect, I suppose.

"Wait here," Bethany says, keeping a hand in her pocket, no doubt muffling the protests of poor tiny Kirsten. "There's something I have to show you. It's amazing. You won't believe it until you experience it."

"That's some hype," Jean says with an adorable smirk. "I'll be expecting this to deliver."

"It will." Bethany walks off, almost stepping on me in the process. She really meant she wasn't going to watch her step, didn't she?

So now I'm alone with giant Jean here. Drop-dead gorgeous Jean. Thing is, I'm not sure how audible my voice is. Did Bethany hear my groans earlier, or did she just happen to spot me?

Don't know, but as Jean plops her huge self down on the couch, I shout up, "Hey, Jean! Look down here!"
152211112111121112112212221211.title: Beautiful Jean

152211112111121112112212222.content:
Kirsten’s about to sit down on me! And she’s twice as big as the last time she almost sat on me! (This is my life now? Really? Sigh.)

I rush to the back of the chair as her titanic ass crashes down. The impact sends me flying into a thick column of wood, which knocks the wind out of me as my stomach smashes into it. Better that than the unforgiving kitchen floor way down there. I turn around...

Wow. Her butt really does look twice as big as before. More than twice in those yoga pants.

Wow. That’s an image I could get used to. She’s a very shapely girl...

Words soon register from above. She’s talking to...Bethany? Ugh. Why her?

“On the bright side,” Kirsten says, “you’re not getting any smaller.”

“Kirsten! I’m only five inches tall! I’ve been five inches for how long now? I have a life I need to get back to!”

I’m kind of amused by the thought of Bethany spending all this time small, though I do also feel guilty about it. And she’s still five times my pitiful size, and I’m the only person smaller than her, and she hates me, so I really don’t want her getting her hands on me.

But Kirsten’s much, much bigger. She’ll protect me.

“Kirsten! Kirsten! Hey! I’ve shrunk again! I’m on your chair!”

Still no voice. Great view. No voice. At least, no voice that’s audible to a giant like Kirsten. Bethany might be another matter, if I was closer.

Oh, God.

“Yes,” the witch’s voice rings in my ear. “Sorry, couldn’t resist, but yes, that is your new challenge. Touch Bethany’s hand, and you’ll both return to normal size. That’s all you have to do. Touch Bethany’s hand, and this whole ordeal will end. Oh, and one more thing, you’re slowly, very slowly, getting smaller again. So, you might want to reach her first, before you’re nothing more than a speck of dust. The clock’s running. Don’t waste it ogling. Bye-bye.”

Oh, God, I think, staring at Kirsten. That big butt is going to get a lot bigger before this is all done.
152211112111121112112212222.title: Plus-size yoga pants

1522111121111211121122122221.content:
I give one good try, but no; I no longer have my super jumping potential. If I'm to get out of this spot, I'm going to have to haul ass up Kirsten's ass.

Um, that sounded wrong. I'm going to have to climb her yoga pants.

I'm an inch tall, so that normally smooth fabric is riddled with regular handholds. This will be simple, I tell myself. Just so long as the woman doesn't move at all...

I'm so out of shape I conclude, after five minutes of climbing but three inches up Kirsten's thigh. The upperside is almost in sight, but it's shielded from the view of both the woman herself and her tiny giant Bethany, so it won't help much in my ongoing quest. It's but step one before I attempt the woman's midriff...

The conversation above me turns to a series of demands from Bethany, and eventually the far too big-hearted Kirsten accedes to her pet's request for food. "Stay there," she says, "and I'll get us a little snack!"

Yikes! Should I cling tight to Kirsten as she launches herself and walks off? I might slip and fall, but I'd be out and about. The other option is to jump back to the chair again, where I'd be alone with Bethany, but completely out of her sight and hearing.
1522111121111211121122122221.title: Destination Unknown

choices: Too late! She's already moving again.
15221111211112111211221222211.content:
All this progress I made took a lot of effort. No way I’m wasting it. Especially not when I’m still shrinking, slowly but surely.

I’m just above her pants, at the bottom of her t-shirt, when Kirsten leans against the kitchen counter to reach up into a cabinet. Thank God I wasn’t a little slower with my climb, or holy permanent press, Batman!

Hmm...If I get off here, I might be able to catch her eye when she sits down again...or maybe even Bethany’s. I don’t mind catching Bethany’s eye so long as there’s this vast, impassible gulf between us. In any case, the counter’s a step up from sharing a chair with a gigantic and slowly growing ass.

Here we go...just have to step off...
15221111211112111211221222211.title: Cling on

choices: Back off and look for some other manner of communication.
152211112111121112112212222111.content:
Right! A good, flat surface with no giants. Sure, Kirsten looms ahead of me as she reaches for food, but she's in no imminent danger of crushing me right now. From this platform, I can plan a means of contacting Bethany and ending this nightmare!

"How about a sandwich?" Kirsten says, and it's all I can manage to roll aside as a huge ceramic plate impacts on the counter. Huh. There's a way to get close to Bethany, if I don't mind risking my life alongside food.
152211112111121112112212222111.title: Onto the counter...

1522111121111211121122122221111.content:
Maybe. Maybe...

Kirsten sure is pretty, even while doing something as mundane as gathering materials for a sandwich. Then again, how can anything she does be mundane when she’s hugely enormous?

Okay, stop staring at the nice giant lady and act.

The edge of the plate curves up a bit. It’s tall, but if I jump and grab...

Oof! There we go. Now pull up...up...I really need to be better at pull-ups...

I swing my leg up and climb on, then slip and slide onto the wide expanse of whiteness. For a second, I fool myself into thinking that even as small as I am, and even as insanely humongous as she is, surely my form must pop out against the white plate, right? She has to see me here.

Unless, of course, she immediately slaps a slice of bread down right on top of me, knocking me flat on my face against the cold, hard plate.

Okay, hardly the worst setback. I can either try to slide out sideways or burrow my way up through the slice and maybe catch her eye before the nice giant lady slaps anything else down on me.
1522111121111211121122122221111.title: De plate! De plate!

15221111211112111211221222212.content:
Maybe I'm just scared of falling onto a hard kitchen floor from this height, but a hunch tells me to hop back onto the chair. I abandon my little patch of Kirsten's not-so little clothes, and down I go to the chair from whence I came.

I'm just small and light enough that the impact only stings a little, but hey, a good hard impact will toughen me up, right? I guess. Damn, this seat is warm, and vast. Okay, stop dwelling on why and let's try out my hunch. No one's talking right now, and Bethany's ears might be just small enough to pick up my voice.

"Bethany!" I shout up. "I'm down here! On the chair! Bethany!"

After a nerve-wracking few moments, I see a head appear over the edge of the tabletop. The five-inch giant Bethany looks down at my puny form on this big ol' chair...and she is not looking happy.

"You," she says, not too loud. She glances to make sure Kirsten is still on the far side of the kitchen gathering snack materials. "How the hell did you get here? Did that giant redheaded bimbo get sick of you?"

"Look, I'm sorry. That was a big--"

"The last thing I want to hear about is big things."

"It was a mistake! I can't apologize enough. I admit I'm not the greatest person there ever was, but I'm going to try to be better. I can fix this. All I have to do is--"

"Fix? You'd just make it worse."

"I just have to touch your hand, and we both grow back to normal."

"It can't be that easy. You're lying."

"Not lying! But it's not too easy. I can't get up there myself, and my voice has shrunk too this time. Kirsten can't hear me, but if you tell her, she'll give me a lift right to you, and this nightmare is over for both of us."

Bethany stares down at me, skeptical. "You look smaller than last time."

"Yes, I'm shrinking again. Still shrinking. If you don't help me soon, I'm going to be the size of a dust mote, and then you'll never get big again. You want to be Kirsten's pet for the rest of your life? C'mon, Bethany. Let's grow together."

Bethany looks up, and tremors shake my chair as Kirsten returns. I see those massive pants about to move into position to sit back down.

"Bethany! It's now or never!"
15221111211112111211221222212.title: back to the chair

choices: Kirsten keeps talking, not getting what you're doing.
152211112111121112112212222122.content:
I brace myself, afraid that Kirsten is about to sit on me again...but she doesn't.

"Were you talking to someone?" Kirsten asks her tiny friend on the table.

"Just muttering to myself," Bethany lies. "Being little is driving me crazy." That part probably isn't a lie.

I don't have a great view of Kirsten's face. I'm gazing up the side of her pants, where her arm returns to after she sets a plate on the table. But she hasn't taken a seat yet. I start backing up, just in case.

Those yoga pants shuffle, increasing my sense of urgency.

Kirsten drops down, but she doesn't sit down. She kneels beside the chair, and her eyes pop wide open as she spots me on the seat.

Now I have an excellent view of her face -- so beautiful, so full of warmth and concern, so incredibly huge.

"Billy! Oh my, God, you're even tinier than last time!"

"Kirsten! I'm still shrinking! I need to--"

"You poor thing! What you must have gone through..."

She can't hear me. Maybe if she lifts me to her ear. I vigorously point to my own ear to try to communicate that fact.
152211112111121112112212222122.title: That face

152211112111122.content:
She catches me off guard, completely off guard. I roll with her assault and fall onto my back. What she lacks in strength, she makes up in aggressiveness.

Despite her hands around my neck, I manage to say, "I'm not going to fight a girl!"

"Sexist pig!" she says, slapping me.

Quite a day I've been having, isn't it?

Bethany rants on: "This is all your fault--!"

And I tune her out, as my view improves. Yeah, I still see Bethany's pissed-off face above me, but behind her--and overwhelming her--I see the giant, gorgeous face of Kirsten.

Clearly, Kirsten heard us. She's on her hands and knees as she lowers her head closer to our diminutive battle.

"Bethany," I say, still choking a bit, "you might want to turn around. And note that this is not my fault..."

Slowly, Bethany rotates her head around, until she sees her giant, stunned friend.

"Bethany?" Kirsten whispers.
152211112111122.title: Spotted

1522111121111222.content:
Bethany’s mortified. Seeing her friend’s face up close like this, looking gigantic--Now, she truly feels tiny.

Can’t say the notion troubles me. The girl could stand to be humbled. And Mega-Kirsten is doing the trick.

“You’re tiny, too?” Kirsten whispers. “How--” She turns to me. “Billy, you’re not contagious, are you?”

“No, no, no,” I say, stepping forward.

Ohhhh, her eyes are so beautiful...Her whole face is so beautiful. If there’s one good thing about being shrunk, it’s that it magnifies all pleasant stimuli. I could stare at her movie screen-sized faced all day and lose myself as I take in each and every detail. Even that little mole she has adds to her charm.

But now’s not the time for staring. “The witch who shrank me returned and--”

“Don’t listen to him!” Bethany snaps. “He shrank me. It was all him. In fact--He shrank himself as some crazy scheme to get close to you. It’s all an act. He’s been lying to you this entire time. You can’t trust a word he says.”

Kirsten’s confused eyes focus on me. I defend myself. “She just made all of that up. I don’t know why, but I’ve been honest with you.”

“C’mon, Kirsten,” Bethany says. “You’re going to take the word of some random guy over me?”
1522111121111222.title: Betrayed.

15221111211112221.content:
Please believe me, please, please, please...

“Bethany,” Kirsten says, giving her a look that clearly makes the shrunken young woman feel even tinier, “I know how you get with guys I like. Now be honest with me.”

Staring at her own feet, Bethany says, “Billy’s right. That witch shrank me, too. Thought I was helping him or something.”

Ooh! Opportunity to look noble! “Yeah, Kirsten, if that witch sees you helping us, she might shrink you down, too.”

She flashes that giant pretty smile at me. “I’ll take that risk.”

I can’t help myself. “Oh, and what was that about guys you like?”

Kirsten glances to the side, turning slightly red. She then avoids the question entirely. “You haven’t met my other friends here, Jean and Ashley. That should get you at least a little bigger.”

She sets her hand down, palm-up, for us to climb aboard. I climb on, but Bethany has backed herself against the bottom of the bookshelf, paralyzed with fright.

“C’mon, Beth,” Kirsten says. “I’m not going to drop you.”

“Her hand’s very steady,” I say.

Kirsten sighs. “Quickly. Before someone sees you guys or asks what I’m doing down on the floor here.”

Bethany hesitates, and then...
15221111211112221.title: Kirsten believes you

152211112111122211.content:
“All right, fine,” Bethany says, stepping onto her friend’s over-sized hand. “This is just too weird.”

“If it helps, you’re really adorable at this size,” Kirsten says with a little laugh.

“Please don’t,” Bethany says, as we rise into the air on Kirsten’s palm.

“But you’re soooo cute.”

“Kirsten, if you don’t stop, I don’t care how little I am, I will kick your giant-sized ass.” Seems Bethany is beginning to regain her confidence, which means she might get annoying again pretty soon.

Kirsten laughs. “I would love to see you try,” she whispers, trying not to call attention to us as we travel deeper into the bookstore. She even thinks to shield us her with other hand so others are less likely to catch a glimpse of us. So considerate, this girl. “Oh, here’s Ashley right up ahead,” she says.

If this Ashley is anything like Kirsten or Lauren or even--I begrudgingly have to admit--Bethany, then she should be pretty easy on the eyes.

And the verdict is...

Ew.

Well, not ew. No, she’s not hideous. Her face is alright. She’s just...Maybe it’s my current perspective, but she seems just a little on the heavy side. Not a lot. If she dropped like 15 pounds, she’d probably be nice and curvy. But as she is...She’s just too heavy for my tastes.

And that would normally be fine, since I already know I like Kirsten, but there’s the whole issue of this spell. Girls who are attractive inside and out will make me grow, but what if I don’t find one attractive on the outside, even if she is a decent person? What if I say hello to this girl and I don’t grow? Will Kirsten be offended that I don’t find her slightly chubby friend attractive?

As we approach her, Ashley is sitting on a comfy chair, lost in a book. Her face is lit up in the wonder of whatever world she’s caught up in.

Kirsten asks, “Hey, Ashley, has Lauren caught you up to speed on the weirdness going on today?”

“There’s weirdness?” Ashley says, not looking up from the book.

“I guess not. I’ll just show you then.”

Kirsten lifts the veil (meaning, her hand) from us, giving Ashley a clear view of us two tiny folks--that is, if she’d look up from the book, which she hasn’t yet.

Bethany nudges me and whispers, “Say something so we’ll grow!”

I guess she has nice hair.

This is going to be embarrassing if I don’t grow...
152211112111122211.title: On the hand

1522111121111222112.content:
I can’t. I don’t want to hurt this girl’s feelings. Actually, no, she has no idea what’s going on.

Suppose I should be honest with myself. I don’t want Kirsten thinking I don’t like her friends. She already thinks it was just a fluke when meeting Bethany didn’t cause me to grow. This would start a pattern.

Bethany nudges me again, but harder. "Talk!"

I open my mouth, and I pretend to have gone mute.

I point and flail my arms a bit to signify what’s going on, but the look on Bethany’s face is clear. She’s not buying this act. Can’t blame her, really.

“Talk!” she whispers again.

Ashley still hasn’t looked up from her book. Thank goodness.

Kirsten looks down into her palm and asks us, “What’s going on?”

“He claims to have lost his voice,” Bethany says.

“Then let’s get him some water,” Kirsten says. “Ashley, we’ll be right back.”

“Okay, sure,” Ashley says, reading. “Huh? We?”

Kirsten heads over to the café area and sets us on the edge of a table. “Be right back,” she says, turning around toward a counter of napkins, cup, straws, and what she’s really looking for: a pitcher of water.

I keep up my mute act, and Bethany makes me feel guiltier and guiltier. I can’t imagine how unbearable she’d be if she was still a giant.

Bethany shakes her head and sighs. “What is your problem? Do you like being tiny? I sure don’t. And I’ll prove you’re faking this.”

She shoves me right off the table. Whoa! The crazy--! I’m falling!

But I don’t fall for long. I crash onto the chair below, right in the middle of the cushion.

I cannot believe that crazy Bethany. Why is Kirsten friends with her?

This seat is huge. People must have some really big butts...

The chair jolts. I look up and see Kirsten getting ready to sit down -- right on top of little ol’ me. She’s just going to plop right down now and ask questions later. Considering how much larger she is than me, I can’t let that happen.

I can yell up and stop her right now, but then I’d have to come clean on why I don’t want to talk to Ashley. But Kirsten’s merely curvy, not fat, and I’m really small, so there’s room for the both of us. I can outrun her, right?
1522111121111222112.title: Faker

15221111211112221121.content:
As the huge mass of khaki-covered flesh plummets, I sprint.

But I trip on a small tear in the cushion, and that costs me all the time in the world -- or rather, all the time left in my world.

I get a quick glance up as the ceiling of khaki smashes down upon me.

I’d only need to survive a couple of seconds before she would notice my absence and stand up, but at her size, relative to my present puny two-inch-tall size, I’m no match for her. She crushes me instantly.

Two semi-coherent thoughts dance across my brain in my last half-second of existence:

One: Why does her damn butt have to be so damn big?

And two: It’s only this big because I didn’t work hard enough to stop being so damn small.
15221111211112221121.title: What a trip

152211112111122212.content:
The sight of her giant friend is clearly so intimidating that Bethany just bolts on out there. That girl’s a fast little runner. She sprints around the corner and out of view before Kirsten and I have a chance to react.

Kirsten sighs. “She always gets like that. Well, not small, but...”

“Excuse me,” another woman says. “What are you doing on the floor?”

Oh, dammit. It’s her. Again. The giant hot witchy witch. And she’s smirking. I hate it when she smirks.

I warn Kirsten at once. “Kirsten! That’s her! The witch who shrank me and Bethany!”

“Yes,” the witch says, softly, kneeling beside crouching Kirsten and tiny me. “And as I said before, I don’t want this guy having help.”

“Kirsten, get out of here!” I say. “Just go!”

But it’s too late. The witch snaps her fingers, and...
152211112111122212.title: Bethany bolts

1522111121111222121.content:
Here we go again...

Kirsten swiftly shrinks down, stopping at a size proportional to mine. Her stunned face stares up at the giant witch, who chuckles as she walks away.

From behind, I gently put a hand on Kirsten’s shoulder. It’s weird how short she seems now, especially after how impossible huge she was when I first met her. “Kirsten, I’m sorry...”

Kirsten spins around, and she smiles at me. “Sorry? This is great!”

“Did you say great?”

She gestures to the towering bookshelves. “Look at how amazing everything looks! We’ve got a whole giant world to explore. How cool is this?”

“Kirsten, you’re about two inches high. You’re taking this a lot better than Bethany did...Better than I did...”

“I know it’s not permanent. But it’s a fantastic way to spend an afternoon. And unique! How many people get an opportunity like this?”

This girl keeps more getting more and more beautiful. “Not many, I would guess.”

“Exactly, so we might as well enjoy it. I assume the same rules apply, so let’s start scouting out some nice girls for you to meet, and we’ll gradually work our way back up to full size. Let’s just make sure we don’t linger around anyone for too long. I don’t mind being small, but we don’t know about other people. And let’s keep an eye out for Bethany. She shouldn’t be alone, and I probably look a lot less scary to her right now.” She starts walking forward, gazing up at all the sights. “C’mon! Let’s get started!”

I think I’m in love.
1522111121111222121.title: Kirsten positively shrinks

15221111211112221211.content:
I enjoy watching Kirsten enjoy the sights of the giant world, but I get concerned as we approach a particular giant person: Kirsten’s friend, Lauren. I remember how uncomfortable Bethany was around a giant Kirsten...And Lauren’s much, much taller.

I gently grab Kirsten’s shoulder. “Maybe we should...”

“Hey, Lauren!” Kirsten calls up, wearing a bright smile.

Her giant friend was text messaging, but she now looks up from her phone, trying to spot Kirsten.

“Down here!”

Lauren looks down and finds us both. She squats down. “Kirsten! You’re little, too, now? Is that guy contagious? No offense, little dude.”

“It’s not his fault,” Kirsten says, though it kind of is. “And Bethany’s shrunk, too, but she ran off.”

“Who else is shrunk? Am I going to shrink? I’ve really grown accustomed to being tall...”

“Don’t worry. We’re not staying long, so you should be fine. Just keep an eye out for Bethany, will you? And try not to step on her. Or us.”

“Yeah, I’ll keep that as a goal.”

“Oh, and you look really cool as a giant.”

“Um, thanks? And you make a really cute tiny person? I’m really not going to shrink, am I?”

Kirsten smiles. “We’re going. Thanks, Lauren!”

We start to walk off, but then huge fingers snatch the back of my shirt and lift me up. Next thing I know, I’m gazing into Lauren’s colossal face.

“You let anything happen to her, and I might just forget to watch my step,” she says. “Understand?”

“Yes, ma’am,” I say.

Lauren sets me down, and Kirsten thinks of something: “Oh, hey, where are Jean and Ashley? Billy hasn’t met them yet.

“Ashley’s in the Teen section, and Jean’s at the checkout,” Lauren answers. “Now go on, before someone thinks I’m talking to the carpet. And get bigger, will you? Having tiny friends is weird.”

“That’s the plan.“ Kirsten asks me, “So who do you want to meet first? Ashley or Jean?”
15221111211112221211.title: Hey, Lauren

152211112111122212111.content:
I don’t recall which is which. From the fleeting glimpse I got in the coffee shop, one of them was very pretty and the other was so-so. But I can’t tell Kirsten that.

Really, I’m choosing between the teen section and the checkout. I’ll go with the adults.

“Uh...I don’t know...Jean, I guess.”

Kirsten grabs my hand. “Then off we go! It’ll be like a little adventure getting all the way over there.”

She is just so excited about being small. The whole time we’re jogging across the store, she keeps staring up at the bookshelves like a tourist in New York, and she slows down whenever there’s an opportunity for giant-people-watching.

The fun part for me, however, is having her hand in mine. It’s nice that it fits. Come to think of it, I am probably the only person in the whole world who is the right size for her. It’s like a strange kind of intimacy -- we’re the only people who see the world this way. Maybe this shrinking thing isn’t all that bad. I’m almost thankful the witch shrank us. As long as it’s temporary, of course.

We come across a guy using an embarrassing pick-up line on some pretty girl. Even though her face is all the way up there, we can tell she’s not into him. So Kirsten decides to help her out.

“Dude! Behind you!” Kirsten says in a silly voice.

The guy turns around, and the girl seizes the opportunity to get away. Kirsten and I laugh as we resume our trek to the checkout line.

“There she is,” Kirsten said, her eyes widening at the sight of another over-sized friend. "The redhead. That’s Jean."

Oh. My. God. I see the young woman standing in the checkout line carrying a small stack of books, and she is the most physically perfect woman I have ever seen. The face, the long hair, the waist-to-hips ratio, the legs...Perfection. And she seems to be a smart, well-read girl, too.

So what happens if I get a crush on Kirsten’s friend?
152211112111122212111.title: Frolicking across the bookstore

15221112.content:
That's a fine plan, and I'm about to give the okay, but apparently I'm not allowed to have too much go right today.

A powerful gust hits us. To Kirsten, it's just enough to mess up her hair. But to me, at my pitiful size, well...

The wind scoops me out of her hands and carries me through the air. I hear Kirsten shout, "Billy!" and then I lose all sense of direction. I'm flying through the air, spinning out of control, and I have no idea how far below the ground is. It's all out of my hands. I'm just a helpless victim of air, which is an embarrassing thing to be, let me tell you. I'll just pretend I got caught in a tornado, because really, to me, it might as well be.

Something comes into view...something denim...?

I crash into...
15221112.title: The wind picks up...

15222.content:
I figure it’s better to be on a shoe than under it. At least, that’s what makes sense in the split-second I have to consider the matter. So I hop onto Blondie’s gargantuan sneaker and hold tight to part of the lacing.

I expect an insane roller coaster ride to follow, but the girl stops for some reason.

And then I hear a lighter thunderclap. I look out and see some massive structure toppling over, and soon realize it’s a mere coffee cup she dropped.

“Agh! I am so clumsy!" the blonde girl says, rattling my eardrums in the process. Ow. "I'm gonna clean this up. I'll meet up with you all in just a minute."

One of her friends says, "Oh, come on, Kirsten. It's just a tiny little puddle. Let someone else handle it. Someone who gets paid to handle it."

"No, no, it's my fault. It'll take me two seconds. I've got it."

So...The pretty girl has a sense of--Whoa!

Now the roller coaster has begun, as this girl is walking...somewhere.

THOOM, THOOM, THOOM, and again and again...

Her footsteps were thunderous before, but now I’m much more up close and personal with them...Ow...Maybe this wasn’t such a hot idea.

Luckily, she doesn’t take too many steps before stopping, so my eardrums are spared too much punishment.

Near as I can figure from my vantage point, she gathered something to wipe this spill with, and now she’s on her knees and wiping it.

Seems I have an opportunity to reconsider my decision to hitch a ride on her shoe. Maybe I should seek higher ground on this responsible young woman while she’s mostly stationary. Or I could just abandon her altogether. After all, I’m not 100 percent positive she’s 18, and there are plenty of options in this coffee shop.
15222.title: Shoe ride

152221.content:
Something occurs to me as I stand on that shoe. Down here, lots of really, really big people can easily step on me, but the way this really, really big Kirsten girl is crouched down to clean up that spill, I can probably get myself very far away from all the giant shoes with relatively little work on my part.

So here goes. I hop onto her khaki pants and from there, I throw myself up onto her horizontal back. I’ve got time for maybe one more hop before she stands up, so I launch myself toward her shoulder, and there I cling as she rises to her full height.

Hanging on just below her shoulder, I glance straight down, and I see her rather curvy butt sticking out, blocking some of my view of the hard floor over a thousand feet below me (relatively speaking, of course).

As she starts walking, it’s an infinitely smoother ride than her shoe was. Yeah, I made the right call here.

I perch my little ant-sized self on top of her shoulder as she catches up with her friends right outside the coffee shop on their way to the book store.

I listen to their conversation, and no one notices me. (At this size, they’d have to be actively looking for me to notice me.) I pick up some useful tidbits along the way. The big one is that these are all college girls, ranging from sophomore to senior, so that’s good. (It’s hard enough telling how old some girls are at normal size, but just try figuring it all out from this crazy new perspective.)

Also, I pick up on everyone’s name and get a general first impression:

I’m on Kirsten, of course, a pretty blonde who’s clearly demonstrated some sense of responsibility.

Then there’s Bethany, a petite (you know what I mean) pretty brunette who seems to smile the least out of all them. Don’t know why.

Lauren is a giant among giants. I’m guessing in real people measurements, she must be six feet tall, easily. And she’s got a quirky sense of humor. She’s also nice looking.

Ashley’s just kind of eh. She seems nice enough, I guess, but she’s got just a few extra pounds on her, and she’s just not really my type. Not hideous, no, just not for me.

And then there’s...Wow. There’s Jean, an absolutely stunning redhead with a classically beautiful face, and I just love the way she wears those high boots and miniskirt. Always a great combo. I haven’t heard her say as much as the others, though, but in terms of looks, she’s got the rest beat, hands-down, and that’s saying a lot in this group.

As I’ve completed my assessment, this quintet is in the bookstore, browsing some shelves. They’re browsing in a line, more or less, with Kirsten (and me) checking out one end and Jean all the way down on the other. I think they might be about to break off into smaller groups for a little bit.

I might be able to leap from girl to girl and eventually latch myself onto gorgeous Jean. But sticking with Kirsten is certainly no bad thing.

Do I want to accept the Door Number One prize or take a shot at Door Number Two?
152221.title: Scouting the field

1522211.content:
Now that I’m thinking about it, Jean seems really far away. That would be a lot of work to get to her, and who knows what sort of trouble I’d get myself into?

Nah, I’ll just stick with Kirsten. She’s a pretty girl with a fantastic butt. For now, that’s good enough for me.

So I cling to her shoulder as she browses the bookshelves. I cling a little more tightly when she bends down to look at the lower shelves.

She soon drifts away from her friends, just enough to present the perfect opportunity for me to start talking to her. The only problem is...What on earth do you say to a two-thousand-foot-tall girl?

I mean, she’ll take one look at my puny self and she’ll probably just start laughing. What can she see in me when there’s not really very much of me?

I want to say something while I have the chance, but nothing’s coming out. Words are failing me. I’m just sitting on this girl’s shoulder like a mute fool, and...

You know...She smells really good. It’s kind of distracting.

But then I’m faced with a new distraction, as her enormous hand rises up in front of me like some great beast. And those fingernails are targeting my shoulder -- well, it’s her shoulder, but it’s my ride. She doesn’t realize it, but she’s gonna scratch me right out of existence!

Giant girls can be really oblivious, can’t they?
1522211.title: Clinging to Kirsten

choices: Bethany smacks Kirsten to kill the "bug."
15222112.content:
As the largest fingernail I’ve ever seen flies toward me, my instincts tell me to hop straight up.

The problem is, I intended to hop straight up and land right back down on her nail-free shoulder. But it turns out my hop was on a slight angle, so I’m not hopping on her shoulder. I’m hopping over the back of her shoulder.

Now, at my size, I’m pretty damn light, and I fall slowly. But I’m starting a couple-thousand feet in the air. Can I survive that fall? I’m not feeling like a betting man today.

Plan A is to reach for her shirt and grab on, but I’m already too far away.

So I look down and see Plan B approaching. That’s B for her butt, which sticks out like a curved airport runway to me. It’s a crude strategy, but my life is legitimately on the line here. My only hope is that I don’t stray too far from it, which my trajectory suggests is a possibility.

By the time I intercept, I’ve almost blown it entirely. I have to reach out to grab the very end of her rear end. Just barely, I latch onto the fabric of her khaki pants and pull myself in. I give myself a moment to catch my breath, realizing that I might have died if Kirsten was just a little skinnier. Hooray for love handles.

Anyway. This is interesting, hanging out on a giant young woman’s ass. Not how I thought my day would go, but there you have it. Each direction I look, north, south, east and west, nothing but a vast expanse of curved khaki. Acres and acres of the stuff.

Then I look behind me, and I see the “petite” girl, Bethany, staring straight at me.

Wait, is she checking out her friend’s butt? Her female friend’s? Is Bethany a lesbian?

Judging from that look on her face, Bethany is either really surprised by Kirsten’s shape, or she’s seen me. But does she truly see me, or does she see a bug?
15222112.title: Acres of khaki

1522212.content:
Part of me realizes I’m taking a stupid chance...but that Jean is really, really hot. I have to try.

Step one is launching myself from Kirsten’s shoulder to Bethany’s, so here I go. I sprint across the fabric of the blonde’s pink shirt and push off before I can get a good look at that floor way down there.

I’m flying through the air, more or less, and I can’t lie -- It’s fun! I’m tempted to hoot and holler, but I remember that my voice is still very much audible, so that would’ve been stupid. See? I’m not so stupid after all!

I’m coming in for a landing on Mount Bethany here. Yeah, this will be a perfect dismount--

Whoa!

Some colossal vessel smashes against me, throwing me off-course. I soon realize: it’s Bethany’s hand. Seems she’s swatting gnats. Seems I am something of a gnat (but better looking, of course).

The impact stung a little, but her skin is soft enough not to inflict any permanent damage -- at least not directly. Still have the fall to get through...

She swatted with a somewhat upwards gesture, which sent me flying higher up into the air. How do I know this? Because I find myself looking down at the tops of some very huge heads.

Gotta think quick here...There’s the redhead, so that’s Jean, my ultimate destination, and the highest point there is Lauren, the super-tall one of the group. So that means directly below me in the middle is Ashley, the one I don’t care for.

I can try to steer my descent toward Jean, but Lauren’s great height would make her the safest landing point. And there’s always the chance I might miss.

I’m falling, so time’s up. I’m trying for...
1522212.title: Gnat

15222121.content:
Jean’s the one I want, so Jean’s the one I’m going for.

I strike a Superman pose as I soar through the air. So what if I can only soar in a downward way? It’s still soaring, especially since my minuscule weight slows down my fall. And if I had time to dwell -- or maybe just a parachute -- I’m sure I’d be loving this.

Right as I clear Ashley, something occurs to me: Jean may actually be too far away.

And yes, yes she is, as that striking red hair starts rising above me, which means...

Oh, dammit, I’m falling toward the floor, right in-between these two girls. I’ve got nothing to latch onto. Suddenly I’m not feeling so much like Superman anymore...

But then ... SPLAT.

I survive the crash, not without some pain, but I’m intact. And on an open book, apparently.

But where are the words? I’d expect a sea of huge letters sprawling out in every direction, but no, there’s just these big islands of color. Some kind of art book, I think, and it’s held by Ashley.

Ashley says, “Hey, Jean, take a look at this...”

I look to the sky as the enormous face of beautiful Jean comes into view, staring right down at me, smiling brightly. I love those green eyes. Seeing a beautiful woman at this scale just seems to magnify her beauty. Maybe being shrunk isn't all bad. It just means that when I encounter pleasant stimuli, there's a lot more of it.

“Wow,” she says. “That is impressive.” My thoughts exactly.

It would be nice if she was looking at me like that. What I wouldn’t give for that...But she’s not. She’s admiring the artwork that’s all around me. At my size, I must blend in as some kind of ink smudge or something. Not even sure if this is a painting or a photo. I’m so close, I can’t see the forest from the trees.

But I can see Jean. I’ve got a hell of a view of that face. That face...

That face is turning away, and the ground is shifting...

Oh, no...Ashley’s closing the book. She’s gonna squish me unless I...
15222121.title: That face

152221212.content:
Enormous pages threaten to devour me, and I have only one shot at stopping them:

"No! Ashley! Don’t close this book! Don’t!" I shout, maybe a little too loud, but hey -- my little life is at stake here.

Ashley stops, thankfully before the pages collapse on top of me. She pulls her face closer toward the open book as she says, “Oh, my God...”

I feel a warm breath from the other direction. I turn around and find that beautiful Jean has spotted me as well. She starts, "Is that a--?"

Then Lauren, Bethany and Kirsten converge to find out what’s happening. Their eyes all gravitate toward the book and lock into orbit around me.

Five huge heads and ten gigantic eyes loom above me. They all see me. Should I say something? The witch wasn’t clear on what would happen if I spoke to five girls at once. The thought of talking to one giant girl at this size is scary enough, but five?

If I were to just dive off the book, they’d probably lose track of me pretty quickly. I could latch onto one of their shirts and hop off at the first opportunity.
152221212.title: Those faces

1522212121.content:
I’m not sure exactly what it is that motivates me, but I find my mouth opening up, and words coming out.

“Uh, hi, ladies,” I say to gargantuan faces surrounding me. “I just wanted to say hello. You seem like a nice group of girls.” They’re all still staring, not saying a word. “That’s really all I’ve got.”

And then I feel strange. I sprout up from this pitiful ant size to something like half an inch (just an estimate; I might be way off).

And it happens again, this time leaving me at more or less two inches tall.

Then I burst up to five inches. And then...that’s it.

Three shots of growth, but there are five young women present. It takes me a second to piece it all together, and I have the time, because their mouths are all agape in shock and awe at the incredible growing shrunken man.

I saw earlier how pretty Kirsten is a genuinely nice and conscientious person. Lauren has a sort of quirky charm to her that has nothing to do with her good looks. Jean’s interest in beautiful art augments her own beauty.

But Bethany, though pretty, hasn’t seemed as nice or fun as the others so far. Ashley seems as nice as any of them, but I can’t get past her mediocre looks.

So I’ve stopped at five inches tall. These girls are still huge, but a hell of a lot smaller than a moment ago.

Three down in one fell swoop, and seven to go. But maybe two more down soon if I can figure out these last two girls.

I can’t leap off this book and flee, because I’m no longer a super-light-weight flea-sized guy.

But do I have to tell these girls the truth about my situation, or should I make something up? One advantage of being shrunken is that any far-fetched tale will seem believable.
1522212121.title: Growth spurt

choices: Stay on Lauren and shout to Jean
Jump to Jean to talk to her up close and personal
15222122.content:
Yeah, Lauren. It's less of a fall, and her hair looks mildly more comfortable for a landing zone. Also, from that vantage point I can look down at Jean's face rather than her scalp, which is much better!

The hairs are each as thick as my wrist, and despite their flexible nature they graze me upon impact like wire wool. No permanent damage, but as I dig myself out from the trapping branches, I wonder how I'm ever going to get down.

"This place sucks," Lauren says, her voice carrying through her skull to vibrate the ground beneath my feet! Clearly not an intellectual.

"Oh, come on," Jean says, turning to look back at her giant friend, her eyes sparkling. "A book shop is one of the greatest places on Earth! A hive of information and imagination! Everything under one roof!"

She's filled with a clear joy just at living, totally at ease. Maybe I could clean the phrasing up a little before I inform her of her goodness, but that's what I'm about to do.

I pause as I open my mouth, however. Should I successfully score a compliment and receive the requisite size increase, Lauren is sure to feel me. And while a slap in mid-air is non-fatal,prolonged nail-scratching is sure to kill me, right? Perhaps I should jump down from here first - ideally toward Jean herself? I may just be asking for another slap though, and this time be thrown further from my targets...
15222122.title: ...Lauren.

152221221.content:
What was it the witch said? 'Flirt with ten women', 'get their attention, at least'. Cool. From this spot atop Lauren's head, I stand as tall as I can, looking out and down at the beautiful redhead, Jean. She's currently looking across at her friend, and my interjection should be enough to drag those gorgeous eyes up just a few inches...

"Hey Jean," I begin, delighted to see that she does glance at Lauren's scalp; at me. "Maybe you and I could read a boom together sometime, huh?"

Lame, I know, but as the world shrinks around me, it seems that it was good enough. Jean gasps gently, a perfect hand raised to her mouth in surprise: how adorable! Lauren, on the other hand, sweeps her head from side to side, looking for the source of the voice coming from right on top of her.

I've already grown beyond the hair strands I was clinging to at ant-size, and so I'm thrown clear by the simple movements of the tall girl. A bookshelf hits me hard, but my lack of mass means I skid only a short distance, before I can crawl to my feet, rubbing at my head. Not too hurt, I can still see straight...

Lauren's great form dominates my view, and although I'm bigger - half an inch, maybe? - she remains a mobile skyscraper, dozens of storeys of purple fabric covering a torso of taut muscle and heaving flesh, a much-magnified Amazon, powerful and awesome.

"Where did that voice come from?" She asks, finally settling her tremendous hands on her hips as she confronts Jean.

" I thought you-" Jean sighs, and while she's blocked from my view by Lauren's mass, I can imagine all too well her cute expression. "Never mind. One of the others must be pranking us!"

"Yeah? That sounded a lot like a guy's voice... I'm not sure we should stick around here if some creep is stalking you, Jean..."

Oh, so Lauren's protective of her friends! Makes sense for such a tall woman! An admirable quality to go along with her sexy stature! That's something I can compliment her on.

Of course, she's already tagged the owner of the voice as a 'creep' - if I draw more attention to myself, she might not look too kindly on me! I could just creep away and find a different female to talk with...
152221221.title: Flirting With the Redhead: Growth #1

choices: Hitch a ride to somewhere private
1523.content:
I take a look around the coffee shop and take in the marvels around me. Atleast a dozen gigantic customers occupied the shop, seated at their tables, or waiting in line to place their order. There was definetly no shortage of attractive women here, but as I survey the area, I find myself catching a glimpse of a familar ass of a woman standing in line. She is partially blocked off from my view by an older woman standing behind her, but I can still see the left side of her body. I had a feeling I knew who this was, and my feeling was proven to be right when she stepped into full view and picked up her order from the counter.

"Oh shit... Miriam?"

Miriam, my ex girlfriend. A gorgeous 24 year old french woman with curly shoulder length brown hair, blue eyes and olive skin. Her towering form was dressed in a loose low cut blue tanktop that was tucked into her dark faded grey jeans. A black studded belt surrounded her waist through the loops of her jeans. She wore a short necklace with a ring pendant that rested on her collarbone and her left wrist had a bead bracelet and watch with a brown leather strap. Finally, a pair of dark brown sandals on her feet.

She looked beautiful as always.Your relationship ended a few months back because of... well... because of what got me in this mess in the first place. Some would say it ended on a sour note, but I never knew Miriam to be the kind of girl to hold a grudge.

I watch and listen while Miriam talks to the young employee on the other side of the counter as she fetches her order, all the while thinking if I should approach her for help. Though she may think of me as nothing more than pig at the moment ( or insect once she sees me like this), I still do have alot of trust for her and though its hard to admit to myself... perhaps still some lingering feelings. Her stunning body made that easy.

I come to my decision and make my move towards her, being careful not to stray into the path of stomping feet. Once I arrived at her gigantic right foot I...
1523.title: Meeting up with Miriam

choices: Billy says goodbye to Miriam, and goes back to pick-up lines
Billy leaves Miriam to go and think about his life alone
Billy heads off to find the witch
Billy tries to track down each of the ten other women
15231.content:
Of all the world-dominating beings around here, Miriam is at least one that is familiar to me. Soooo... One percent less terrifying?

I swallow down my trepidation as I gaze up past the heady heights of my ex's ankle. We didn't part on good terms, and at the time I blamed her for the break-up - it was her that abandoned me at my time of emotional need, I said, but now it's time to embrace the truth in my heart.

"Hey, Miriam. It's me, Billy. I just wanted to say, I'm sorry for everything I put you through. It's my fault, my selfishness, that drove you away, and I'm so sorry for that. More than sorry; I'm thankful for how long you stayed with me despite me being an asshole. Your patience is far more than I deserve, and you deserve better than me. Best of luck with the rest of your life."

She must have heard me, as that vast foot shifts, shrinking before me as I swell in size to - what, half an inch? I'm about as tall as the sole of sandal now, and still easily crushed underfoot by her! Looks like that's where things are headed, as that sandal, that street-sized carrier of tonnes of woman-weight, rises, my ex looking to turn and see where my voice came from, unthinkingly preparing to flatten me to death.

But the crushing force exerted on me smashes from either side rather than above. And, rather than end me, the opposing powers lift me from my feet, and I am dragged to the heavens sandwiched between a pair of warm, powerful walls of skin. Turning my head - the only part of my body free to move here - I can see the complex maze of skin on the surfaces, a pattern that can only be fingertips...

"Well, look at you!" The voice is not Miriam's and as I am brought up before the face of its owner, I see that it is the person that was standing behind her in the queue, the one that I had dismissively referred to as 'an older woman'. And as I behold her visage, I am forced to reconsider my previous assertion that a woman stops beimng attractive past the age of thirty.

This woman must be past forty, but beyond the wrinkles at the edges of her astonished eyes, one could hardly tell. Her caramel skin and dark, curly hair are enchanting enhancements to that beaming smile.

"Thanks for saving me," I gasp, only just able to draw breath against her curushing grasp.

I grow again, doubling up to an inch, and the woman lets me drop into the palm of her other hand, where I am all too aware of the height at which I stand. Fine, I just won't look down. Instead, I look up at this woman.

"Billy, was it? Hi, I'm Yolanda, and I can't wait to hear your story!"

I give a rushed explanation, too surprised to go into too much detail, but Yolanda nods her understanding and turns, facing the next person in line.

She's someone I would never have thought to approach with my pick-up techniques; unapproachable settled on her as comfortably as those severe glasses and smart business suit. She quirks an eyebrow and lowers her phone at Yolanda's wave.

"Hi! Do you have a moment to help my friend here?"

The business lady looks down at me, and I smile nervously. "Thank you for your time. I know your time is precious."

Once more I'm growing, almost two inches tall? I stagger against Yolanda's thumb for balance as she turns again: I want to thank my carrier, but she's already on to the next person. Miriam have moved and it's her turn to be served. She's finishing giving her order as she raises her hand before the barista's face.

She's young, her jaw going slack as she sees a shrunken man. "Do... do you want to order anything?" she manages.

"No, thank you, but thank you for seeing me as a person and not a curiosity!"

Yolanda is claiming a table halfway between the counter and the door as I grab my third inch of height, and her hand rests unpon the surface, allowing me to clamber off unsteadily. "Thanks for all this," I say as she sits, a looming mountain even at that reduced capacity.

She grins and looks over me. I turn, hoping for the next woman, but see instead the outstretched hand of a young boy, poweful fingers splayed ready to crush me with his unthinking strength. "Cool toy!"

"No, Luke! That's not a toy, it's a person!"

I look beyond the terrifying giant to the tired woman holding his other hand, and nod my appreciation. "You're doing a wonderful job with your son, ma'am," I manage. Luke withdraws not just at my deep, manly voice, but also at my spurt of growth doubling me to six inches!

I totter at the table edge until Yolanda grabs my collar and pulls me toward safety. The boy and his mother move on, and I watch the epic display that is a cup of coffee being handed between giants before Yolanda turns to the next table. "Hey, girls, wanna help my little friend here?"

And so, two young girls stoop before me, brushing hair over their ears as they clammer close for a look-see. At this scale I can see the crudity of the make-up, sense the fakness of the perfume: these two have, in an effort to improve their attractiveness, hidden their true beauty behind these modern fads.

"Hello, girls! Thank you, both of you, for taking an interest! I wish you both the best of luck today!"

They giggle and stand, and I jump in height in two distinct bursts, sending me dancing back and forth across the tabland nearly knocking over Yolanda's coffee. When it's over with, I'm two feet in height and Yolanda claps in appreciation. "Shall we take this outside?"

With her assistance I climb to the ground, holding tight to her trouser leg as she strides through the milling press of customers. I get many stares from a variety of giants more than twice my height, but what fear I may have known is washed away by the reassuring presence of the giantess guiding me.

Outside, the air of Seventh Street smells almost pleasant, the thinned numbers of titans easing my mind. Yolanda picks a direction and we walk off, like a mother and her very precocious child. More than likely, most of the people we pass see us as just that, not looking closely enough to notice my adult proportions. Probably for the best.

One figure does stop before me. Walking with a stick, hunched and gnarled, the old lady peers at me from behind thick glasses, rolling teeth in her mouth before speaking. "Well now! How did you get so small, young man?"

"Uh, you've a good eye, young miss! I assure you, it's temporary, and you needn't worry for my safety!"

Who'd ever have thought that a grandmother would be one of the ten giving me my height?Yet here I am, growing to three feet in height thanks to her! I step to one side to allow her to pass, then almost jump as Yolanda's hand intrudes into my vision.

"Hold tight as we cross the road," she says, and I allow her to grasp my miniscule mitt in her great grasp. Now, tall enough to be guided by her in this way, the illusion of mother and child is complete!

We cross, and the next generous woman almost knocks me over. Of course she's taller than me, but so much bigger in every way that I almost goggle my eyes. She's obese, and I know that she'll somehow blame me - me! the child-sized guy! - for our collision, take offence and get angry.

"Oh, sorry there," she says, stepping back and raising her hands. "I didn't see you! Are you alright?"

"I'm getting there," I tell her, as I creep up to over four feet tall. "You're so very considerate."

If she's shocked by my growth, she doesn't show it. Yolanda squeezes my now bigger hand, her strength still considerably greater than my own."One more to go!" she squeals with glee.

"Quite a change you're undergoing there," says a voice from behind me. Pulling free from Yolanda, I turn to actually look down at someone for the first time in forever. That's because she's cradled in a wheelchair, her head tilted to one side and what looks like her only working hand tapping at a joystick controlling her pathing.

"It feels good to see someone else able to push beyond their limits," she says, and as I look over her twisted face, no sexual desire at all in me, I feel for this woman. Trapped as she is, and yet she can still find some care and consideration for other people.

"Thank you," I tell her, the simple phrase all that's needed to convey my emotion. No fancy wordplay, nothing like that. Just honest, human empathy.

And just like that, I'm my regular height again. "Can I help -" I begin, but wheelchair-lady turns and leaves. She doesn't want my charity. But there is someone that I must thank for extending to me theirs.

On a more even footing, I can see why I was so quick to look past Yolanda at first glance. But she's undeniably an attractive woman, and the care she's shown me today is worth even more than that. I step forward, taking her hand and feeling so, so secure at knowing that mine is greater.

"So, I really need to thank you for all your help. Do you fancy another cup of coffee, maybe?" Is this a winning smile, I wonder?

She smiles back, but raises her free hand, waggling the fingers to show the ring she wears. "Sorry, taken. No need to thank me - I just thought to help someone in trouble. Just do the same for me if it happens, okay?"

"You got it!" I laugh, and then she waggles her fingers again in a farewell wave, turning and walking out of my life.

Hands on hips, I breathe in what feels like a new life. My shrunken adventure seemed like days, but must have been over in an hour or two at most. I hate to think what may have happened had I not been so bold as to approach Miriam...

"Billy?"

Miriam stands before me as crowds part.

"That was you earlier, wasn't it, Billy? What was going on? No, never mind. I just... I never stopped thinking about you, you know? Wondering what it was that I did wrong in our relationship. To hear you confess..."
15231.title: Super-Easy

choices: Leap onto a passing woman's pants.
A giant shoe steps on the ant.
153.content:
Ah! It's a monster--!

No, not a monster! It's an ant that merely looks like a monster because I'm so puny!

Agh, I'm pitiful! That witch made me pathetic!

But in any event, that's definitely an ant running right toward me. And there are lots of giant people walk all around me...like that curvy girl right there...Those are nice curves. Really nice. Being this tiny truly emphasizes--

Focus on the incoming ant!

I'm going to have to do something...
153.title: Here comes...an ant!

1532.content:
I can take it. It's only an ant--not like it's a spider or anything, right? What kind of man would I be if I couldn't take down a simple ant? What woman would want such a man? Granted, what woman would want an ant-sized man in the first place?

All right...Here it comes...Make my day, anty.

Ugly sucker. Maybe this wasn't such a good--

Hey! It's changed course! It's running away from me!

"Yeah! You're scared, anty! You know you can't take me down!" See? Just had to be confident.

Boom...Boom...

Thunder? But it's such a clear sky...

Boom...BOOM...BOOM...BOOM!

I turn around and see young blonde woman jogging--right toward me--almost on top of me...
1532.title: Confront the ant.

15322.content:
She's too fast, and I'm too tiny. Her titanic sneaker rises up and immediately comes crashing back to earth...

BOOM!

Everything goes to slo-mo as her well-worn sneaker slams the pavement, missing me by inches-- and that's in my adjusted scale. The resulting earthquake sends me flying up into the air, as her shoelace whips toward me. My instincts tell me to grab the lace, so I do.

Not really the greatest decision I ever made. But given that I'm an eighth of an inch tall (if I'm being optimistic) clearly I haven't been making great decisions lately.

Fortunately, at my size, the lace has become incredibly textured. It's easy to find grooves to dig my hands into and hang on. Doesn't make it any more comfortable, as the lace lashes around in every direction--up, down, right, left, and everything in between.

Ugh! Ugh! Ugh! Ugh! Ugh! It's like riding a really old roller coaster.

I'm not going to last forever. I'll probably be flung off before she decides to stop running. Or I'll get some kind of head injury. So, a plan: If I can climb onto the top of her shoe...

Ugh! Ugh! Ugh! Ugh! Almost there... Ugh! Ugh! Ugh! So glad I didn't just eat...

Made it! I latch onto the knot of the lace and continue to cling for dear life. Her footfalls still give me headaches, but it's relatively stable. But now to enact my master plan. To save myself, I must--untie her shoelace!

It's not the easiest thing to do at my size, but I can at least tug at the rope and loosen it. And I better do it quick, because really, her thunderous feet are giving me the worst migraine ever.

It takes several moments, but eventually, success!

The giant jogger notices her loose shoelace flapping around, so she slows to a stop. As she bends down to tie it, I look her in the huge eye and say, "Hey there, good looking. What's a nice girl like you doing out here today?"

My hair's probably a mess, isn't it?
15322.title: Attack of the Giant Jogger!

153221.content:
Big Blondie’s big eyes become even bigger. She cannot believe what she’s seeing. But neither can I, because I’m seeing a giant woman who looks like she’s two-thousand feet tall bending over me, as I stand on her shoe.

“Your eyes are very pretty,” I say.

It’s the last straw. She can’t handle a tiny talking man. “Get off, bug!” So she convinces herself that I’m an insect, and she shakes her leg to rid herself of my pesky presence.

I never had a chance, really. Her first little kick sends me flying high through the sky.

Is this the end? Am I going to crash to my death because some giant jogger girl couldn’t accept reality, as absurd as it is? Is her shoe going to be the last surface I ever stood upo--

SPLAT!

Ow. I’m alive, but ow.

I’ve collided with some hard surface...My vision clears up, and I realize I can see through the surface, like it’s glass. And on the other side...a humongous eyeball blinks at me.

I’m like a bug on a windshield, only I’m even tinier than many bugs and the windshield actually appears to be eye glasses. Or an eye glass, I suppose.

That eye looks feminine. But does she see me?
153221.title: Denied

choices: Comnpliment this woman on her eyes
1532212.content:
I've never really paid much attention to eyes, I'll admit it now. Even when I was complimenting the jogger, I had no real clue if I could consider her eyes to be especially attractive. Now,clinging for dear life to a glass wall and gazing deep into an orb that completely dwarfs me, I'm forced to think about them.

It doesn't move as it focuses and looks about, suddenly changing orientation without passing through intervening space. The eyelids crash down very briefly every now and then, and it's humbling to think how a single bat could probably break every bone in my fragile body.

I'm probably too close to her to be registered, I guess, as I take in every line of that dark brown iris, shaded magnificently by the light. If she'd spotted me, I wouldn't still be here, clinging to a glass wall whose smooth appearance is belied at my size, where there are adequate handholds and more.

So, what now? I could shout out to the giantess, but how would she react if she were to hear a voice emanating from her spectacles? Perhaps I should climb over to comewhere else before I risk disturbing her and getting thrown off somewhere else yet again...
1532212.title: Smooth

15322121.content:
I’m starting to slip. If I’m gonna act, gotta do it now...

“That’s a beautiful eye you have,” I say to the giant eyeball. I really hope the rest of her is beautiful, too. I’ve got no clue what the not-so-little lady looks like beyond that eye. For that matter, I don’t even know if she has another eye.

I feel my surface shift from left to right to left...She’s trying to figure out where the strange voice is coming from. Her pupil becomes especially large. I’ve got her attention. So that’s good. But that witch made me so damn tiny I’m nearly invisible, especially at this close range.

And I’m still slipping...Can’t hold on much longer...

I begin, “I’m on--” And I never finish. I slide down the smooth glass and plummet hundreds and hundreds feet toward...toward...(I’m certainly falling slower than I would’ve expected)...

...toward a nice, soft lap. Wasn’t so bad. Good thing she’s sitting down...

But then my surface rises. She’s standing up. I don’t want to be thrown down onto the pavement, and after my experience with the jogger’s shoes, I’m hesitant to cling to any articles of clothing. So I abandon ship and hop onto the wooden bench.

I glance up at the bespectacled woman and confirm that, yes, she does indeed have an excellent body. And there the nice body goes.

But, hey. I spoke to her. And the jogger. And I didn’t grow a millimeter. And I would’ve noticed if I had, given that a millimeter is a substantial percentage of my current size. What gives?

Look at how textured this wood is. Feels like I’m looking at it through a microscope. I’m not liking the massive chasms between each plank, though...

BAM!

What the hell was that? Something huge crashed down nearby me. Something pink. It’s...Is that a purse?

Yes, it is, because that’s a gigantic girl bending over to reach into it. She’s young, probably in college, but a beautiful redhead, and I cannot stop looking at those humongous breasts. Hard to tell if they’re actually large or if it’s just the perspective, but I hope it takes her a while to find whatever it is she’s fishing for in that purse.

Wow. Suddenly, being teeny tiny is a great thing. I can indulge in a good long stare without looking like a creep.

Someone just tapped me on my shoulder. Who’s small enough to tap me on my shoulder?

I turn around and find...
15322121.title: Slipping

choices: Come up with The Best Line Ever.
153221211.content:
Ah! Something's touching me. What's touching...

AH! Monster!

No, it's another ant, but I'm much closer to this one than the last, and now I realize it's actually bigger than I am. Its height looks to be about seven or eight feet tall compared to me. Oh, God. I think my previous estimate of my new size was too generous. I must be even smaller than an eighth of an inch high. That is really pitiful. Especially since I've spoken to two girls, and neither one made me grow, dammit!

And I'm not really up on my entomology, so I have no idea if this ant would consider me prey or if it would be like that nice "Honey, I Shrunk the Kids" ant. But it really does look like a monster, so it's not getting the benefit of the doubt, especially the way those mandibles are chomping.

I back up slowly, and the ant stays in its place, looking right at me. That's it, pal, just stay right there, go do your own thing, and...

...Why are we suddenly cast in shadow?

Oh, that's why. The giant redheaded girl is sitting down. A vast expanse of jeans stretches across the sky, giving new meaning to the term "broad," and it's coming down fast.

I dive out of the way, and I turn around just in time to see her coming down right on top of the ant. The impact shakes the bench and knocks me flat on my back, but I pull myself up, and I see massive denim where once there was a monstrous ant. There's no way it could have survived being crushed by what might as well be a mountain, albeit a soft one.

The redhead saved me! I don't know if I was actually in trouble, but she's given me peace of mind, anyway. I have never been so appreciative of a woman's ass. But that's probably not something I can compliment her on.

I look up, indulging in another look at her stunning beauty. Damn, she is gigantic, but still hot. So not used to this yet. She has her cell phone to her ear, but she's not talking yet, must have just dialed.

I can eavesdrop and find something to talk about, or I could take a minute and come up with a great opening line.
153221211.title: Smaller than an ant

153221212.content:
"You just...don't...get it, do you? You don't. It's like casting spells on a mule. Honestly."

"Hey," I protest. "I talked to them."

"Hey," she spits back, mockingly, "you talked to them about superficial nothing. Don't you realize eyes are part of a body? Aphrodite preserve me, it's like talking to a stone."

"Well what am I supposed to talk about, then? It's not like I know these women."

"Hmm...you've got a point. All right, so you need to get to know the women before you start talking. Fair enough. Why don't you take a day to get to know this one? She's pretty...but you need to find out something more about her before you talk to her. Which is why I'm silencing that voice of yours for a few hours. After that...you need to introduce yourself...and come up with something better than 'nice eyes.'"

I try to come up with a response, but as promised, your voice doesn't respond. The witch is gone.

I turn around, and stare back up at the redhead, who's rummaging through her purse. I need to get to know her a bit. Okay, but how?
153221212.title: All That Effort

1532212121.content:
The redhead pulls out some chapstick from her purse, which means she’s probably gone as soon as she’s done applying it.

So, into the purse I go. I hop up (which, I must admit, is actually kind of fun, as long as I don’t think too much about the fact that my “super-hop” carries me only about a foot or so) and I drop into the massive chasm between zipper sides, and I do it just in the nick of time. The chapstick drops in with me, and the zipper seals us both in right away.

I’m not even sure what I land on. It’s hard, so it’s probably not part of the purse itself. Before I can explore, gravity shoves me straight down, face-first, onto this very solid material. Miss Pretty Giant Redhead seems to have gotten on her way, walking to somewhere, not that I can see her anymore right now, sadly, or anything.

My plan is to try to stick to this object, whatever it is, for as long as possible. Last thing I want is to stumble into some makeup item she left open or something like that. Feels like I’m riding a boat over some seriously rough waters...

But then...Light! Bright, blinding light, coming from below. But how...? Are miniature aliens about to abduct me? From below? Are they aliens from hell?

And then...Deafening cacophony that I soon realize is a ringtone.

I’m standing on a cell phone, a ringing cell, much to regret of my eyes and ears.

The darkness above is ripped apart, and a giant hand reaches toward me...well, toward the phone. But will I be along for the ride?
1532212121.title: Into the purse

15322121211.content:
Curse these modern 'phones, so smooth, so few places for a tiny man to cling on to. Yet somehow I manage, not tumbling towards the immense pads of the woman's fingers even as she brings my floor up ninety degrees. My muscles are bursting, and a peek over my shoulder reveals a tremendous view of her ear, a cavern with scathing lines of red hair dangling before it.

Should I head that way? It would probably be more reliable than my present location, but I've heard that insects can get caught up in earwax...
15322121211.title: Not So Loud

15322122.content:
Okay, I need to get off the glass pane. Easily thought, harder accomplished. Where is there to go? Below - looking from the corner of my eye only, that's quite a drop, after all - is the mass of this chick's cheek, smooth skin sloping away to a mouth somewhere down there.

Another way could be a simple shimmy along to the arm of the glasses. Out of her direct line of sight, I could easily walk across to her ear, which must be much safer!
15322122.title: Flesh?

choices: ...a passer-by asks her who she's talking to.
...a passer-by smacks her on her ass.
153222.content:
My words startle the giant jogger. She blinks several times and, without bending her knees, she lowers her head closer down to my level. How very flexible of her. Her mammoth face hovers above me, and she asks, “Are you a person?”

“I am,” I say, trying to sound as natural as a possible, despite the fact that I’m tiny and standing on her shoe. “And I have to say, you are incredibly cute.”

“Um...I can barely even see you,” she says, squinting.

“I don’t have any trouble seeing you, and I certainly like what I see.”

“Are you hitting on me? You’re teeny tiny, and you’re hitting on me?”

“Why wouldn’t I?” This isn’t going so well, is it?
