“You’re not concerned that you’re, well, like you are? And how did you get on my shoe?”

“Hey now. Don’t judge me for being vertically challenged. I just wanted to meet you is all. Do you have a problem with that?”

“Excuse me? You really think you’re in a position to be getting defensive, little dude?”

And then...
153222.title: Meeting the giant jogger

choices: The jogger is more interested in the two of us
1532222.content:
My conversation is cut short. Briefly, I register the figure behind the jogger, and hear a sound which may be that of a hand slapping an ass amplified a thousand times, but then I'm swept upwards at speed, forced to cling tight to the laces for safety.

With the same ease she used to bend at the waist, the jogger pivots neatly up, bringing her foot - my tiny body along for the ride - slamming into the head of the man that took advantage of her. I see his face compress in slow motion before the shoe returns to the ground and I'm free to throw up over the side.

Examining the relative positions of the jogger's feet - and just about registering her clenched fists, so far in the sky - I note that she's adopted some form of martial arts pose. Perhaps I should leave this ride before things get more dangerous?

"Crazy bitch!" the man shouts. "You kicked me in the head!"

He gets no further in his protestations, as a familiar figure walks up behind him. My guts freeze.

"Quite the day for perverts, isn't it?" the witch laughs, and soon the man is expanding the membership of my size club to two, as he drops away to the floor at the jogger's feet.

"Who..?" she stutters.

"Oh, I'm just a friendly public servant," the witch says, walking off.
1532222.title: Victim Number Two

15322222.content:
Seems I have a partner in shrinking.

The newly shrunken guy stares up at the newly giant world, specifically the newly giant jogger whose newly giant ass he just slapped. That look on his face...I don’t think he’s taking this well. He might even scream.

I leap off the jogger’s shoe and land right in front of him and cover his mouth just in time to reduce his shout to a muffled, “Mmffmff!”

“Hey, man, relax,” I say.

As I release my hand, he says, “Did you just fly?”

“No, I hopped. I guess it would look like flying, but no, we can hop really far for our size, which is really something we should--”

I was going to say “do right now,” but the giant jogger interrupts me by crashing down closer to our pitiful level. She gets on her arms and knees, extending one flat hand beside us and holding the other in a tight fist.

“Get on board, tiny dudes,” she says in a hushed tone, “or you’re getting squished into something even tinier.”
15322222.title: Wingman

choices: Tell the jogger everything, and hope to confront the witch
Stick to the basics, and just seek a growth spurt from the jogger
153222221.content:
Who's going to say no to the request of a several thousand foot tall woman? I hop onto her waiting palm immediately, and my comrade is only slightly behind, stumbling a bit after his first landing. As I help him to his feet on the warm, skin plain, the woman rises to her full height. Looking down is a terrifying prospect, but so is gazing up at her frowning face, hanging in judgement above us.

"Whatever am I to do with you?" she mumbles, probably half to herself.

"Well," I say, "as I mentioned earlier -"

"Oh!" she gasps, silencing me. "You can talk rather loudly for a bug. Um, I'd better head somewhere more private, right? Hold on!"

The woman resumes her jogging route, our hand held out before her. I sink down to sit, mainly spared the vagaries of her rolling motion. My companion leans over to me, and now I can see the pure, unadulterated terror in his eyes. He hasn't had the speech from the witch yet. To him, this is a terrible, random nightmare.

The man is perhaps only slightly older than me, and much luckier with the facial hair. Judging by his rumpled attire, he's not some high-flying business executive. Probably someone that won't be missed by anyone, just like me. Two victims of a mad witch,who's still out there with untold power at her disposal. That can't be allowed to continue.

But is it wise to pull the tiger's tail? If I just leap through these hoops I'll get my size back. She promised.

As the sunlight above is smothered by the shadow of whatever building our ride is entering, I come to a decision.
153222221.title: Cannot Refuse

choices: Below is a vessel for my capture
1532222212.content:
"Anyway," I say, "it's very kind of you to take pity on two defenceless specimens such as ourselves. Most kind, indeed!"

The expected growth comes right on time, and my companion shares in it. Swelling in dimension until I must stand almost a whole centimetre tall, I'm disappointed at how massive everything still seems. This palm alone will still take some time to navigate.

"Kind?" the jogger responds. "That's a way of looking at it. Maybe I'm just rather attached to the idea of owning two unique animal specimens." Her grin is monstrous. "You two have to stick with me."

"She's crazy, man!" my companion whispers. "First she shrinks us, now she kidnaps us? We gotta get outta here, now! Show me how you do that jump thing..."

Well, I have gotten my fill and broken the first seal of the witch's curse. With a partner in crime, the rest should be a cinch!

We two walk to the edge of the woman's hand, fighting turbulence the whole way, but when we look down we see that it's too late. The destination has been reached, and jumping now would just land us in certain danger.
1532222212.title: Better Late Than Never

15322222121.content:
The giant jogger deposits us in a glass cup. I guess she’s not jogging at the moment, but I don’t know what else to call her.

Anyway, we fall into an impossibly tall (and thankfully empty) glass. It’s completely vertical, making a climb impossible. The opaque curvature blurs our view of our surroundings.

But we have a clear view of above, as an enormous eye descends toward us.

“Hang tight there,” she says. “I need a quick shower, and then we’ve got some things to talk about.”

I wonder what kind of things.

“I don’t know how you managed to grow that little bit, but you better hope you don’t grow more. I take a quick shower. I find you full-sized in my apartment, I’m calling the cops. Remember -- quick shower.”

She moves out of view, and she doesn’t return with a lid.

My terrified companion turns to me. “So, that jumping thing?”

Right. She didn’t see me jump. She thinks we’re helpless captives in here. Thing is, I haven’t tried jumping at this new, bigger size yet. I’m not certain about the dynamics, or where we’d land.

However, it is our only chance. I’m not getting a good vibe off this jogger girl. Then again, if we were able to grow, she can’t be all that bad, can she? Maybe there’s a kind person hiding in that hard shell, and we might find it with work.

Or we could just get the hell out of here.

“We just jump,” I tell him. “That’s all there is to it. We just have to do it."

He stares up the towering glass, slightly more nervous than myself. But neither of us wants to look like a wimp, so we both leap up.

We barely clear the lip of the cup, but we veer off in slightly different directions. For my part, I land...
15322222121.title: Glass prison

choices: Try to get down from the couch.
153222221212.content:
As I hang in the air for a micro-second, just over the rim, I see this table butting up against some massive, fabric-covered construct.

I realize what it is as I crash onto it -- the armrest of a couch. My momentum carries me over the edge, and I tumble down the biggest pillow I’ve ever encountered. It might be fun, in another set of circumstances. In a moment, I’m in the middle of a massive plane of soft couch that reminds just how big people have become.

“Aaaahhh!!!” my new buddy screams from some other direction -- screams foolishly, I might add. Doesn’t he realize we have normal voices? Facepalm.

He doesn’t land anywhere near me. Before I can figure out where, the ground rumbles rhythmically, with increasing intensity, as our hostess returns, still in her exercise tights.

“All right, what are you little guys pulling?”

She goes straight to the glass and peers in. Not finding us, she scans that table beside the couch.

“Looks like you boys want to play hide-and-seek. I always was great at that game."
153222221212.title: Facepalm

1532222212121.content:
"Man, how did she hear that?" my friend exclaims, again at a regularly-volumed voice. Even as I sidle out of sight, I can imagine the woman casually zeroing in on his position and looming over him.

Confirmation. "So, is that Captain Shoelace or the Buttslapper?" she laughs. The terrified scream belongs to a man. I met him only a few minutes ago, and owe him nothing. I could just jump away while she's preoccupied. But what right do I have to condemn this fellow human to tortures at the hands of a giant woman?
1532222212121.title: Just Shut Up, Dude

15322222121212.content:
If becoming a better person is the key to undoing this spell, abandoning people to danger is hardly the way to go about it.

"Really?" I ask, hopping across to the table again and standing in plain sight. "Those are the best names you could come up with? I'm embarrassed for you."

The woman rears up again before me, effortlessly rising several dozen storeys. It's a relief to see that she holds no tiny figure in her fingers, my jibe enraging her enough to get her to forget her primary target. I can only pray that he has the sense to get out of here before I have to spend much longer taunting a woman large enough to get me stuck between her teeth.

She growls, a deep roar that unsettles the base of my diaphragm as she turns slowly, eyes instantly alighting on the source of the voice. It take all my will to stand facing her as she crouches over me, her expression a storm of unpleasant possibilities. I've got to distract her only a little longer...
15322222121212.title: No Man Left Behind

choices: Follow your buddy's lead and try to escape
153222221212122.content:
Now she's looming. Looming like a great and terrible god above me. I don't want to test her. Sure, I want to save my new best friend, my sole shared-size buddy, but that's no good if I get crushed by an irate jogger.

"Hi there," I manage, waving as she places hands on hips.

"I was being kind with the glass, wise guy," she says. "I'll have to be a bit more careful since it seems that the two of you can jump like damn fleas..."

"Yeah, sorry about not fully explaining things. And, and thanks again for saving us. This is still new to us, so don't go getting angry at us for being stupid. We're scared."

That last part is not a lie. That is not a pleased expression on that goddess' face, it certainly is not. And she must know it, as she bends lower, bringing that face a finger's breadth from mine. "Good. Maybe that will encourage you to stay put. You want my help, you play by my rules. Stay here - get your pal up here as well - and we'll talk properly once I'm ready. If you're not standing right in this spot when I get back, you're nothing but bugs to be crushed."

Her hands lean gently on the table at that last word, their subtle impact still vibrating through the ground beneath me. When she adds "Got it?", I nod. I've got it.

She rises again, turning quickly enough to spin me in her wake, sliding across the table surface. I look up in time to see her massive ass exiting through the door to the shower room.

"So," your friend whispers, clearly having learned quickly, "are we gonna stay here like that psycho bitch wants?"
153222221212122.title: Have Mercy..?

choices: Tell Claire the nature of your challende
Tell Claire you just need a place to spend the night
1532222212121221.content:
I turn on my tiny companion, finally snapping. "Listen, Randy, that 'giant bitch' has been nice enough to bring us home, and being a decent human being is likely to help us out! Leave if you want, but good luck finding someone even a tenth as tolerant as her to help you out! I mean, geez, what sort of person thinks it's okay to slap a woman's ass in a public street anyway!"

He rubs at the back of his head. "It's... endearing, ain't it? And the name's not Randy, buddy, it's Clive. Tell me, tell me to my face, that that giant ass that just walked out on us isn't one of the best you've ever seen! Athletic women, man, they get the best asses, yeah? Slap enough of 'em and you'll find one that likes it - then it'll be worth all those slapped faces."

Seriously? This guy is just like me, only instead of pick-up lines he's trolling women with butt-slaps! Makes me feel like I'm not the lowest of the low...

"Keep tellin' yourself that. And do try to remember your manners, okay? You're half an inch tall, so a slap to the face is going to hurt a lot more than you remember."

"Whatever. I'll stay if you're staying, but when she starts all the psycho shit, don't say I didn't warn ya."

We pass a little small talk, me giving my name, competing to see which of us can jump highest as a pissing contest (me, natch) and so on. The shower ceases and the woman re-enters, towelling her hair down and smiling as she sees us still on the table.

"Nice to see you can do what you're told, boys. For that, I think you deserve a reward. You like pop tarts?"

Without waiting for an answer, she crosses to the kitchen area, fishing a box from a cabinet and popping a pair of gigantic snacks into the toaster. Turning back to us, she leans against a counter. "The name's Claire, by the way. I don't meet a lot of shrunken men, so what's your deal?"
1532222212121221.title: Names

choices: Beat the shit out of Clive
Ignore Clive and sit to wait out your punishment
15322222121212211.content:
Claire folds her arms and waits for me to begin, and with such a titanic audience is it any wonder that I have trouble mustering the nerve to speak? I glance across at Clive, but he just shrugs. Fine.

"A witch shrunk us. She cursed us because she randomly took a dislike to us, but there is a cure. We just need to compliment nine more women, each one of them restoring a little of our height. Uh, also we have voices as loud as a normal person, and can jump super-high for how small we are."

Claire's expression doesn't change as she watches and listens to the tiny man on her table. I jump at the sudden noise as the toaster disgorges its cooked goods, and involuntarily step back as the woman paces closer with a plate of pop tarts in hand. She crashes down onto the sofa, yet still looms over us, her voice almost bored as she tells us to "look out below."

The plate, no doubt placed gently by the giant woman, impacts strongly enough to rock both Clive and myself, and with trepidation we bring our half-inch tall selves closer it. A simple hop brings us up onto the surface, and then there's just the heap of steaming food. Not only is it hot to the touch, but the shell is too tough for my puny teeth - even a punch or two - to break the surface!

It's Clive that shows me the way, jumping atop the pop tart and digging into the gooey sugar coating up there. Soft and sweet, and full of the energy we'll need to get through this day.

No sooner have I dug into my meal than I'm shaken as the second pop tart, its upper surface area bigger than a house, is lifted into the air by Claire. She does so with one hand, and a speed that takes my breath away. Then she tears into it with teeth the size of Clive, wrenching the tart apart and destroying it with noisome chomps of her powerful jaw. And as she effortlessly destroys a monument that I can only lick at, it's all too real how much easier she would find it to crush my fragile body. It would take but a moment, at her merest whim.

"So," she says, mid-mouthful, spraying head-size chunks of toast across the room. "You want me to believe that you got shrunk through bad luck? Yeah... I know for a fact that you -" a truck-sized finger points to Clive "- are a sleazebag who treated me like a piece of meat, and got what you deserved. I think you're the same, buddy. In this case, I think you're guilty until you can prove yourself innocent."

"What? But I never touched anyone! I just said hello to a girl -!"

"Yeah," Claire cuts me off, pausing only to crunch through the remains of the pop tart before continuing. "I'm going to take your protests with a pinch of salt."

I step forward to plead again, but Claire's hand moves in, upending a glass silo and pouring a pyramid of white rocks down onto the remaining pop tart. Clive, who hasn't paused in his feast, recoils from it after a touch. "Eugh, she's just poured a whole salt shaker onto it! Crazy bitch!"

I swear that I'm in the process of reprimanding him when Claire strikes. Clive and I are mashed uncomfortably together as a huge finger and thumb squeeze us, lifting us into the air with rough, roaring ridges of skin at our backs. We're at the edge of consciousness as she ever so gently releases us to crash down onto solid glass.

As she screws the lid on, it's clear where we are: inside the now-empty salt shaker. Claire shakes it side to side as she lifts it before her humungous eye, smiling gently as we tumble about.

"Now," she tells us, "since I can't trust you not to jump away when my back's turned, you're going to stay in there for the time being. You've got air, but you're going nowhere. Maybe, if you prove yourselves to be decent people after all, I'll let you out of there, and maybe we'll see about breaking that curse. For now though, I gotta get dressed, and you're sure as Hell not getting to see that."

The shaker is placed up on a high kitchen shelf, and Claire winks and blows a kiss before striding away toward her bedroom.

"I'm sure she's just kidding," Clive says.

"Really? Or did your 'crazy bitch' line really piss her off?" I shout, turning on the guy whose contribution to my life since meeting him has solely been making it more difficult. "When will you learn to keep your mouth shut?"

"She's just a bitch, man. Who knows what set her off? Probably just that time of the month, yeah? Lighten up! She'll come around."
15322222121212211.title: Trust Must be Earned

153222221212122111.content:
Everything turns red to me.

This is all his fault, isn't it? It's because of assholes like him that women are suspicious of decent guys like me. They see me and worry I might be one of his kind. The witch wasn't trying to teach me a lesson -- she was trying to teach him.

I'll do the teaching now. Rather, my fists will.

I punch Clive in the face, over and over. He's caught completely off guard, but he manages to get a couple of licks in. I barely feel it, I'm so mad.

I slam him against the side of our container, and the impact of his skull is so satisfying. I punch harder, cursing him out the entire time. Soon, his face and my fists are covered in blood, and Clive is no longer moving.

Oh, God. What did I just do?

I feel for a pulse. Nothing.

I killed him.

I didn't mean to! I ... I...

The top of the salt shaker opens, revealing Claire's giant eye.

"Whatever you two are doing, cut it out." The eye squints curiously, then widens. "What happened?"
153222221212122111.title: Battle Inside a Salt Shaker

1532222212121221111.content:
"I... I killed him."

No sooner has my confession begun than Claire's eye widens, and then falls upwards and away. As she drops the salt shaker, I'm in zero gravity, and Clive's corpse bounces off the wall with a sickening splat. I raise my arms, covering my face as I see what's about to follow -

CRASH!

Somehow I'm alive, amidst the shattered glass of the shaker, on Claire's kitchen floor. Blood drips from my forehead into my eye, so I guess I didn't get away unscathed.

Looking around, giant pieces of glittering glass abound, and beyond them I can just about focus enough to see Claire's bare feet, standing still and close as their owner no doubt wonders about what to do. with the glass she won't want to step forward immediately, so I have time to take the initiative.

I've gotten my growth from the jogger - all the half-inch of it - so there's no reason to stick around, especially since I murdered a dude in her home. When she snaps out of her shock, I can't imagine she'll look too favourably upon me!

Of course, she can still be a big help in my quest, and if I wait things out I can explain things fully, and we can work through this...
1532222212121221111.title: At Her Feet

choices: I land in a bush outside
I land in a moving vehicle
I land on a passing pedestrian
15322222121212211111.content:
No time to explain, and Claire's not the nicest of people anyway. So, with Clive's blood on my hands, I bound my half-inch tall self away across the kitchen floor while the giantess jogger stares in shock at the corpse amidst the glass shards.

The front door is closed, so no luck there. Windows in the main living room are all shut, and I have to jump directly upwards several times to confirm that: very tiring!

"Where did you go?"

The bellow of the goddess raises hairs on the back of my neck, and I don't even turn to look at her: I can feel tremors through the ground as she begins stomping closer. I have only moments before she spots me, and so I hop-dash through the nearest doorway.

It's the bathroom, the last traces of shower steam still present as they coil out the open window.

A double-take, and I'm hopping up to a laundry basket, clambering upward toward the sink.

"There you are!"

The enraged woman looms behind me, but I don't pay her any mind. I spring upward, winds rushing through my hair as her hand clutches tight in frustration, fingers crushing together less than an inch shy of catching me.

No time to recover atop the sink as she reaches with the other hand, and I leap for the windowframe.

This time, her flailing arm catches me a glancing blow, but with the power of that gigantic woman behind me, it sends me spinning off course, out of the window undirected, to land who knows where...
15322222121212211111.title: Murderer on the Run

choices: Tell Claire that she's killed Clive
Urge Claire to take you both to a doctor
1532222212121221112.content:
"The fucker attacked me!" I squeal. "I had to defend myself, but he fell and, and stopped moving..."

At half an inch tall, we're too tiny for Claire to make out details of the situation - I hope - and my cover story should pass. "Get us out of here, get him some help!"

The woman acts quickly, to her credit. Tipping the salt shaker would bash Clive around badly, and while I know that won't do him any more harm, that's a worry for her. Instead, thick, rope-like strands of hair descend as she brushes some of her not-quite-dry locks down at me. "Tie him up!" she urges me. "I'll pull him out when you're done!"

Okay, No problem. I step closer to the corpse, and gingerly lift its limp form high enough to me to wrap a couple of these strong, cable-like hairs around it. I grip tight to Claire's hair myself, and give it a tug as I shout up to her: "Pull us up!"

The glass floor drops away from me as a couple of strands of human hair fully take my weight, and once more I'm blown away by just how insignificant I am. I dangle in front of Claire's mountainous, beautiful face, but she has eyes only for Clive.

Her warm palm comes up beneath us - me and the corpse, that is - and she babbles as I untie my victim. "Should I get a doctor? Is he breathing? I don't want to touch him, I might make it worse!"

I step over and release Clive's body, kneeling close to his ruined face. Here's another chance to look innocent - admit that he's dead, but tell Claire that she must have done in it picking him up. Sure, she may feel real bad, but that just allows me to get in closer with her...

Or maybe I should agree with her suggestion of a doctor? If nothing else, perhaps a medical professional could aid with my condition!
1532222212121221112.title: Getting Away With Murder

choices: Jump away and leave this scene behind to find another woman
Jump to the nurse and ask for help against the monstrous Claire
15322222121212211122.content:
"Yeah, I don't know what to do here," I admit. "But if you could get him to a doctor, maybe there's something they could do..."

I need say no more as she whizzes into action, shrugging on a coat and popping shoes onto her feet, her other arm grabbing her handbag as she's out the front door.

"Hold on tight, little guys," she advises.

And so I'm rocked back and forth in Claire's palm, Clive's corpse cradled in my lap, eyes open and accusing. Whatever. He can't hurt me now. The narrative is mine again, and once this giant jogging bimbo gets me to a hospital I can move on up in this world...

Twenty minutes maybe, and Claire is opening her fingers up, exposing my half-inch form to the world, and allowing bright lights and her babble to burst the bubble of my privacy.

"Sorry ma'am, but who's injured? I don't see anyone with you..."

Okay, the medical professionals are clearing a little confused by this situation, and I get the chance to take advantage and move things forward in the way of my choosing!
15322222121212211122.title: Doctors and Nurses

choices: "Can you tell me what's wrong with me?"
153222221212122111221.content:
"Down here, ma'am!" I shout, and the nurse's eyes flick down to Claire's palm, to me and Clive's corpse. She's an attractive young thing, but she looks very tired, no doubt at the tail-end of a long shift. Her dark-rooted blonde hair falls unevenly from its ponytail, and there are bags beneath her eyes larger than my head. Yet there is care in the eyes themselves, dark depths of compassion I have never known...

Her mouth hangs open, and my next words will be very important:
153222221212122111221.title: Shrunken Man, Stat!

choices: She has a jewelry chain to ankle-tie you both together and weigh you down
She has elastic bands to gag you both with
She plans to begin training you
153222221212122112.content:
He moans and whines, and uses quite a few words that you wouldn't repeat in polite company, so you pride yourself on Saint-like patience not to punch his teeth into the back of his skull.

Claire returns, her presence immediately filling the room and drawing all attention. Dressed casually in sweatpants and a t-shirt, she strides over and lifts the salt shaker with no effort, bringing both you and Clive tumbling around beneath her gaze.

"Now," she intones, "I've given our situation some thought, and come to a conclusion about how to define our relationship. I think..."

She screws her face up in thought, then smiles widely and gabbles out her next words. "Nah, let's say it as it is: you are going to be my pets."

Clive is on his feet immediately, banging his fists against the glass and shouting out more insults, bringing Claire's eye in close, focusing directly upon him.

"Well, if that's how you feel, buddy, perhaps you'd like to take another slap at my ass, huh? See how well that goes for you this time, now you're nothing but a pimple to be squashed."

Clive shuts up.

"Yeah, you'd better learn to behave. Now, let's get you out of there and start things off."

The lid unscrews, the glass tilts, and the two of you tumble into the bowl of her palm, with her smiling face the sky. The first stage of her pet plan?
153222221212122112.title: An End to the Quest

choices: Drag Clive along with you to Claire's waiting hand
Go along with Clive's escape attempt
Ask Claire to chain you each separately
1532222212121221121.content:
Looking up at Claire's immense, amused expression, I am so filled with terror that I temporarily went second-person there. This is the most powerful creature I've ever seen, I'm absolutely at her mercy, and I wish that anyone else was here rather than me.

Clive, at my side, must be feeling the same. His eyes dart about wildly, and for a moment I fear that he's going to jump for it, off this gigantic hand and to certain doom. "Be cool, dude," I whisper to him with a shake of my head.

"Now, be careful now," the goddess announces, as her hand tilts, the both of her pets sliding down her roughly-ridged palm to a thick, heavy blue fabric. "Who wants to go first?"

I could easily shove that tool Clive forward, but since I'm going to be the better man I boldly raise a hand.

"Hold still," is all the warning I get before a thumb bigger than a truck pins me down, unstoppable weight and pressure sheathed in impenetrable skin. I can see nothing beyond it, and my arms can do nothing to relieve the indignity, but my legs are able to kick freely out in the air, a small show of protest.

My legs remaining out from under her thumb turns out not to be accidental; a second colossal force exerts itself on my right leg, and I fear it will snap. My scream is swallowed by the skin above me, the only reply the thundering beat of Claire's pulse.

In moments I am released, looking down to see my leg intact, albeit with a weighty metal chain clamped around the ankle. It's strong-looking, some old-school medieval manacle, yet knowing that I'm only half an inch tall, my heart sinks when I realise that it's probably just some petite jewellery chain re-purposed. That's all it takes.

To my right, I can see from outside the whole process: Clive is engulfed beneath Claire's mass, and her free hand crudely snaps the other end of chain around his left ankle with a single, powerful motion. He's turning the air blue with his language as he's released, and in response the giantess swats him with her pinky finger.

Clive tumbles over, and I am carried along, even our combined weight nothing to a regular-sized person. I stand up and ready myself to jump to Clive, only to find the heavy chain too much, holding me down. I may have immense jumping power, but only enough to carry my own body mass; much over that and I'm grounded: Claire's hypothesis confirmed.

"So," she says, folding her arms, "that wasn't so bad, was it? Now I know that you two aren't going to go jumping off, getting underfoot."

"We're your prisoners."

A finger is raised in clarification. "Pets. This is really no different to giving a dog a collar and leash. It may seem strange now, but you'll get used to it, I'm sure. Now, come to momma."

Claire lays her hand flat on the towel I'm standing on, and since jumping is now out of the question I tug on the chain to get Clive to join me in trudging over.

"You're not gonna take this, are you?" he whispers. "What more evidence do you need that this is a bad idea? Look, if we jump together I'm sure we can carry this fucking chain with us. We need to get out of here!"

Does he have a point, I wonder?
1532222212121221121.title: On the Chain Gang

choices: The witch reaches out to pick you up
153222222.content:
I'm turning,hoping the other guy will follow my lead. "Come on!" I shout, when I don't hear him following, but I don't stop. I jump, in hops, toward the bus shelter in the distance. Each can't be more than a few inches, so the jogger will be on me in no time.

If something hasn't distracted her.

"Fair warning," she says. I don't turn, God help me. I abandon my comrade to his fate, but his full-size voice screams in a volume that follows me as I duck under the shadow of the bus shelter seat. Breathe, I remind myself. You're alive. Breathe.

Someone sits on the seat, their feet blocking my view of the victorious, murderous jogger. Hopefully, she won't come looking for me. I didn't slap her ass.

"You're a real piece of work, you know that?" Of course, it's the witch. Everywhere I go, the witch. Her head, upside down, pops into view as her feet sweep upwards. She's smiling, even with her fringe in her eyes. "Someone wanted to help you, and you flee. You just can't accept that someone could care for you, can you? And this time - this is the sweet part - it wasn't just you that was hurt. Someone died. Because of you. How does that feel?"

I've had enough of this bullshit. "Because of me? You're the one that shrunk him. You have these powers that you could use to help people, and instead you go around passing judgement! What gives you that right? And you're a fine one to talk about refusing help. What I did to you? A compliment. Can you not handle that? Or is it that -" Oh God, could it be? And if it is, should I say it? Yes.

"You liked it. You liked me, but you didn't know what to do, and you panicked. You couldn't handle someone liking you."

Looking across at that massive mug, I hope that this hasn't pissed her off too much.
153222222.title: Run!

choices: Go along with the witch's suggestion
Insist on restoring yourself without her help
1532222221.content:
Her fingers reach toward me, and I'm paralysed in fear. I'm the size of an ant, and yet she manages to snap me in her grip almost tenderly, with only the slightest pressure to my sides! Then she pulls me out from under the bench, and not only am I slammed in the face by the speed, but flipped right over. My head's still spinning as the witch releases me into the palm of her other hand, cradling me in her lap as she sits on the bench.

"You're right," she sighs. "You were nice to me, and I panicked. I'm sorry, okay? It's just... The magical world isn't how Harry Potter makes it out. I can barely control this power inside of me, and if I risk getting close to someone well, this kinda shit ensues."

"Can you turn me back? We could get to know each other..."

"No can do. Can't just undo a spell. They've got conditions for a reason. Doesn't mean we can't get to know each other, though..."

Her hand rises, and again I'm looking her in the face. Even at this size, there are no imperfections in it, merely a smooth, smiling expanse like that of an angel. "Come home with me. We can spend a few days together. You get to know me as something other than a body, and I get to see what a man is like, without any of the normal pressures. Once we've hit it off, I'll just take you on a tour of my other witch friends and hocus pocus, we'll get your size back through a few compliments! Whaddaya say?"
1532222221.title: Truth in Magic

choices: Trick question: hide in plain sight!
15322222211.content:
"I say," I say, "that I'd like to know the name of the woman in whose company I'm to spend the next few days."

The witch smiles, and bobs her head. "What a good start! Well, my name is Maud, and I know what you're thinking: what a beautiful name for a beautiful woman! Well, I hate it, so don't waste your breath. How about you?"

I tell her my name, she compliments me on it, and I then ask another probing question:

"So, how are we getting to your home? Do you ride a broomstick, or..?"

"Wow, you really are good with women, aren't you," Maud smirks. "Next you'll be asking to see my warts! We'll be riding the bus, smartass."

I chuckle nervously as Maud approaches the bus stop. I see crowds of giants waiting their turn, and the witch looks down at me again. "I'm not just going to walk on there with you in plain sight: too many questions, and I'm already in big enough trouble for that whole big post office deal...

"Anyway, I'll ask you, and you might want to think of this as another test: where should I put you, to hide you from sight?"

She looks at me expectantly, and I wonder what the correct answer may be. Would she be more offended for me wanting to get too close to her, or for me wanting to be kept too far away, as if I were to try to escape?
15322222211.title: Witch Life

choices: Try to get some size increase by complimenting a nearby woman
Try to stir up a witch-hunt on this bus
153222222113.content:
"Trick question," you state boldly, looking up at Maud's cynical face. "Part of magic tricks is distraction, right? I'll sit out here in the open, but no-one will even look at me!"

"Oh yes?" Maud smiles, raising an eyebrow. "Well, looking past the fact that this is more than just a 'trick'" - her hand jiggling to remind you of the gravity of your situation - "what exactly do I do to distract a bus-load of people from a half-inch tall man?"

"Nothing. Who could look anywhere but your enchanting eyes?"

Her smile widens, but then those immense eyes close on you, narrowing to focus and illustrate her emotion: "For a moment, I had thought you'd changed, but you're still throwing out those creepy pick-up lines huh?"

Should you reply to that? You freeze in place, and Maud's tongue slithers raspily across her lips. Then she winks and withdraws her face from your personal space.

"One, please," she says to the bus driver, striding into the vehicle, and a world packed with the chatter of giants.

The noise, and heaving shapes all around, are overwhelming. Monsters of all shapes and sizes - well, all different degrees of gigantic - and ages, from the elderly to children. You cling tighter to Maud's skin, eager for her protection. But there are other people out there, and perhaps they could help you. If not with breaking the curse, maybe with subduing this witch and putting an end to her wickedness...
153222222113.title: The Art of Distraction

choices: Jump away while Maud is distracted
Speak to the poet, insisting that she recognise you
Stay quiet and watch what unfolds
1532222221132.content:
Maud sits in her seat, her hands palm-up in her lap, with me sitting there in the middle of the top-most one. Beyond the towers of her fingers, I can see the other passengers, both those boarding behind and the ones already seated.

Across the aisle, a gorgeous twenty-something peers through her glasses at the tablet in her hand, biting at her lower lip. "A word that rhymes with 'bridge'..." she mutters just loud enough to carry to where I sit.

A poet, huh? That's an admirable trait! "I'd like to teach you a few words!" I shout, granted boldness by the fact that she probably can;t see where my voice came from. Her head snaps around in response, her mouth opening wider to gasp: "who said that?"

Before I can speak up again, Maud's hands rise, the one with me in moving behind her, while her free hand gently pats the vacant seat beside her. "It was me," purrs the witch. "Why not come sit by me, sweet stuff?"

She smiles for the poet, but her eyes flick down to me, triumphant in having denied me a chance for growth. Then the poet plops into the seat next to the witch, nervously thanking her for speaking.

What should I do now?
1532222221132.title: Playing the Field

choices: Start searching for a nice woman
1532222222.content:
Uh-oh. She does look pissed. But then her frown turns upside-down, which still looks like a frown to me because her face is hanging upside-down.

I really don’t like that smile. It’s more a smirk, really.

“I had just had a brilliant idea,” says the beautiful-on-the-outside, horrible-on-the-inside witch, entirely avoiding my last statement. Denial much?

She snaps her fingers, and I feel strange, a little nauseous, then extremely nauseous.

But the sensation soon passes and I’m...flying? And buzzing? Uh-oh...

“Yes, I turned you into a bee,” the witch says. “You now have a new challenge. Get one woman -- just one -- to realize that you’re a person, and you’ll turn human again. Just like that.”

Human and full size, or human and tiny? I open my mouth to ask, but then I realize...My physiology is entirely different now. I can’t talk. How can I get any woman to notice my personhood when I’m a bee that can’t talk?

The witch continues, “Of course, finding a woman who won’t flee in terror from you might be a teensy challenge. So...Good luck.”

She chuckles as she stands up and starts walking away, leaving my buzzing little self hovering there.

On the bright side, I am larger than I was a moment ago. But that’s small comfort.
1532222222.title: More magic

15322222221.content:
Bitch. She fills my vision, and I apply my stinger at full force. She screams, and there is a tearing sound. Something hurts, but I don't have time for that now. The woman is rearing around to look at me. "You ungrateful little prick!" the witch screams. "I give you best chance at life, and you turn on me!"

Then she begins to shrink, and my vision returns to normal. Seems I'm back to a full-grown human male! Why..? Of course! The witch said a woman had to recognise me, and that must include her! Haha,I beat the system!

Why can't I feel my legs? I look down, to see the bloody mess that remains of my lower body. Oh yeah, when a bee stings it tears off its abdomen, which is why a bee stings only once before dying. Changing back doesn't grow back missing body parts, it would seem. What a way to die...
15322222221.title: Sting the witch!

15322222222.content:
Time passes oddly. I fly, unable to keep my movements linear, and buzz past people at a speed that almost startles me. A face seems female, and I approach, screaming insectoid noises. She recoils, but when her hand moves up to swat me, it's like slow motion, and I almost casually evade it, moving on to solicit more sensible aid.

The next woman screams and runs, and I spin a quick 540 to avoid an angry boyfriend. Jee, life as a bee kinda sucks. And I'm getting tired, whipping these wings back and forth constantly...

One final attempt. A woman sits down on a bench, and it sounds like she's crying. I buzz closer, and she doesn't even look up, merely mumbling "I killed him. Oh God, why did I kill him?"

It takes a while before my human sight and my bee sight synch, but I recognise her. It's the jogger! Having already squished a tiny man, she's probably the person in the world most likely to suspect that I'm a man trapped in a bee's body!

Of course, she's also the woman that's already killed one of the witch's victims...
15322222222.title: Bzz Bzz Bzz

choices: Talk to this woman for a burst of size
Talk to this woman, but hope for a deeper relationship
Leave this woman be and go somewhere else
1533.content:
The ant is gone, annihilated in a second. I have only a moment to notice the smooth, black monolith that crushes it flat before it too is gone, passing over me as if it were never there. But now the smushed remains of the ant are clear before me, pieces of the monster scattered amongst its own ichor. Yet it is incomplete, half of its mass clearly stuck to the bottom of the shoe that is traipsing on its way.

I spin to watch the giant as he walks on, his incredible strides carrying him off at a speed I cannot comprehend. He probably saved my life, but he'll never know.

"Yeah, that's right, just walk on buddy!" Her voice rockets through the silence in the wake of the man's foot impacts, and I spin again, looking in search of the woman, who may be my first possible step to regaining my height!

Smaller than an ant, I can't see much of her beyond battered trainers, topped by what look to be jogging bottoms, loose and billowy. Not much chance to get a view of her figure, let alone her face.

Another man crosses by the woman, and she opens up with a line: "Hey, handsome! Wanna maybe grab a drink?"

He responds with a mere grunt, still a crack of thunder above me. She gives a sigh of her own, and I almost laugh.

She's trying the same thing as me. Holy shit, a woman that's trying pick-up lines on random passers-by! She'd better pray that no man-witch happens across her and curses her to be shrunk down to a minuscule size!

But she's just like me... Oh, if only we'd met each other, and that witch hadn't come between us! This couldn't be more perfect! Who else could I approach for help in this situation?

Waiting for the second man to be on his way, I try another super-hop upward, to get a better look at this chick. I zoom into the air, the rush a distraction as I look upward.

The woman, beyond her baggy jogging clothes, wears a simple t-shirt, blue with some obscure logo. It too hangs loose, her breasts not too big (well, proportional to regular people, anyway!) but extra weight hanging elsewhere on her frame, far from an ideal figure. I'm already falling by the time I think to look up to her face,and can't make out much after sun's glare catches on her large, buggy glasses.

I hit the ground, and scamper backward as the woman takes a single, restless step, her scruffy shoes dangerously close to crashing onto me. Yeah, scruffy all over, she is, I scoff. If she's going to try picking dudes up, she should have made even the minimum of effort!

I can't laugh as I'm putting my hands to my knees to regain breath after that jump. Hands on the tatty jeans I'm wearing. Heh. I'm a fine one to talk about appropriate courting clothes, as I'm hardly dressed to impress, myself!

It's different for women though, right? They can't impress someone with a cutting line - as this girl is demonstrating marvellously! They need to show off their bodies, not just throw on the first things they find on the floor of their bedroom.

Yeah, it's different for them...

This behemoth could be a the first ticket to size increase. You can admire her for her motivation not to be alone, even if you don't think much of her appearance. But is there something more? You share so much, could she be something more than a one-off line?

She utters another line at a rapidly departing male. On the other hand, she does seem rather desperate...

Then again, you could leave her alone entirely, seeing too much of yourself in this broad - you need to grow as a person, and you can't do that if you ask for help from yourself... You could just abandon her!
1533.title: Opposites Attract

15332.content:
"Hey!" I shout up at the colossal pick up artist. "I'll take you up on that drink!"

She must be looking side to side for the source of my voice, as her immense feet smash down this way and that, forcing me to jump and dive away from them as they swoop through my immediate vicinity like angry, mobile streets. Lesson learned: be more specific about my location before speaking up!

"Look down here!" I clarify, taking a hop back so that I am clear of her great, clodhopping shoes. In fact, she takes a step back, and I hear a great inrush of air from her gasp.

"I'm the man of your dreams, baby!" I announce. "You and me, we're not so different!"

"Uh, you're the size of an ant, buddy!" she tells me, stooping down to give me a better look at her gigantic, plain features. Lacking make-up, her too-long nose, chapped lips and bushy eyebrows stand out to me, and I can see why she's had no takers on her approaches.

"And you're no oil painting!" I retort, hoping that honesty really is the best policy. "But neither of us are getting dates asking randos on the street, so how about we pair up?"

She smiles at that, and then her gigantic hand swoops down at me, cracked and bitten nails sporting traces of chipped polish bigger than I am. Yes, bigger; I have gotten no growth from talking to her!

The tip of her forefinger smashes into me, and while winded I grasp onto the ridges of fingerprint tight, to me more like ledges the thickness of my torso. Effortlessly I am borne aloft by the goddess, and her breath washes over me like scalding fog as she speaks.

"Yeah, I'll pass, thanks. Tell you what, I won't crush you, and you shut your mouth. We cool?"

Looking over my shoulder, I see her narrowed eyes, my pathetic form reflected in their sheer surfaces. "We can talk about this, baby!" I say. "I'll accept you for who you are!"

She shakes her head, and scrapes her finger against a surface that knocks me from it, and into a new place.
15332.title: Flock Together, You Birds!

154.content:
So, I need to meet women to get myself cured. Where's a place that I know women gather in great numbers? The hairdresser.

Myself, I get a quick trim every now and then from the local barber, but women - I generalise greatly here, another of my flaws - can spend hours at a time having appointments to get their hair styled, coloured and sculpted. The foot traffic the place sees in an average day is immense!

Of course, as I approach I discover that the feet that are part of that traffic are themselves immense to me now, and I'm hopping continuously to keep from being crushed beneath the virtual stampede of whale-sized shoes coming and going.

Once I'm inside, I tell myself, it'll be a lot safer. There, the women will be sitting down, not stamping every available inch of the ground around me with their weight. They'll also be talking with the attendants as they have their hair done, and that will be enough for me to detect a 'worthy' target for my compliments!

I'm so smart sometimes, I surprise myself!

I lean back against the doorframe to catch my breath after the marathon I just ran, and quietly observe the variety of footwear than strides by, impossible behemoths zooming by at incalculable speeds to a man of my size. But I mustn't let them intimidate me, if I'm to approach and talk with these goddesses.

So, where to? I could approach one of the customers, leaning comfortable back in an elevated chair, listen in on her talk and then strike with a compliment. But since the staff here are such good listeners, perhaps I should instead sneak up on one of them for my first target.

Of course, they will be absorbed with each other, and may prove confused if I jump in on their conversations. I could always go to the waiting area, where women are sitting and flipping through magazines while they count down the time to their own appointment; quieter, more personal...

info.brief_description: A pretty witch shrinks an aspiring pick-up artist to teach him not to objectify women.
info.description:
A young 20-something guy wants to be better with women, so he goes out one day with the intent of flirting with random women he encounters in hopes that one of them will find him attractive.

His first target is a beautiful young woman who's not so beautiful on the inside. This woman is a genuine witch who feels our protagonist sees women as objects rather than people, so she casts a spell that shrinks him down to the size of an ant.

The witch tells him his challenge is this: He must flirt with 10 women that he finds attractive both outside and inside. As each one of these women notices him (even if they don't realize he's a person) he will grow a bit bigger until after the tenth woman, when he will back to full size. If he flirts with a woman who's merely pretty, no growth.

This is a story about learning to appreciate women beyond their physical appearance. Yes, macrophilia is a part of the story, but it is not the entire story. The women he encounters should be characters, not cup sizes, please. Remember, he's learning how not to objectify women.

I encourage everyone to add to the story. Join in on the fun, please. I'd especially love to see a good mix of male and female writers contributing. Feel free to add to any thread; I have no grand master plan here. Challenge your own creativity. Please be consistent with the preceding chapters. You can create any sort of characters you like, but nothing sexual with minors. Also, nothing graphically sexual, please. It's rated 18+, not X.

Thank you to those who have already added!
